location.name: North Al-Arqas Outpost
location.description: Original starter-dungeon location for Al-Arqas, which was destroyed by Martine.

location.name: West Al-Arqas Outpost
location.description: Original starter-dungeon location for Al-Arqas, which was destroyed by Martine.

location.name: Al-Arqas
location.description:
Al-Arqas was at one time an arrival point for new Isparians. However, the outposts and advocate spires were destroyed by Martine long ago. The town is now scarcely populated, as there are few unique NPCs here, and quicker routes have opened up to the Gharu'ndim master mage, such as Xarabydun.
The A'mun Desert is a hostile place, reminiscent of the trackless Naqut on Ispar. The dunes stretch beneath the sweltering sun for mile upon mile, with little water or hope of shelter. Even within such harsh lands, however, there are rare islands of succor: oases where fresh water miraculously bubbles forth, creating motes of greenery amid the wastes. Such a place is Al-Arqas (literally, "The Haven"), which sprang into being only recently, when Gharu'ndim desert-walkers discovered a hitherto unknown spring in the A'mun's southern expanses. Though less than half a year old, the town is already flourishing, as it provides a convenient halfway-point for travelers moving between Yaraq an southern towns like Uziz and Khayyaban.
Points of Interest
The Djubar Amitri, a pool of fresh, surprisingly cool water, forms the heart of the oasis where Al-Arqas has arisen. Though it is small, the spring that feeds it keeps it filled, even during the dry season. Less than a year ago, the pool began to emit clouds of cold mist. The reason for this is unknown, though doomsayers claim it heralds a coming disaster.
In the dunes east of the oasis, a portal leads to an old compound once used by the Empyrean to train their young in the arts of war. The portal was buried beneath the sands intil shortly after the Gharu'ndim first arrived in Dereth, when a storm uncovered it. For a time, bandits dwelt within, but they were driven out when the desert folk settled Al-Arqas. Now, Drudges prowl its empty vaults.

location.name: Unfinished Temple
location.description: Quest(s): Rusted Knife.
location.monsters: Gnawer Shreth, Drudge Skulker, Slinker, Russet Rat

location.name: Desert Ruin
location.description: Ruins, possibly of an Empyrean stronghold. Filled with various Drudges.

location.name: Al-Arqas to Samsur
location.description: Just head out of Al-Arqas and follow the signposts.

location.name: Wandering Archmage
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Archmage tells you, "Welcome! What's your pleasure today?" Archmage tells you, "An excellent purchase." Archmage tells you, "You drive a hard bargain, my friend." Archmage tells you, "Thank you for your business. Please return soon."
- Steve N.

location.name: Rithwic Crypt
location.description:
Quest(s): Sword of Lost Light, Menhir Mana Fields # 3.
The Worn Odd Key that is needed for the Sword of Lost Light Quest is found on a Desert Rat in this dungeon.
location.monsters: Hunter Shreths, Blue Phyntos

location.name: Dungeon Gallery Tower
location.description: This tower has become a haven for drudges. Care should be taken when entering as they tend to gather just inside the entrance and attack those unwitting enough to enter.
location.monsters: Drudge Skulker, Sneaker, Slinker, Prowler, Robber

location.name: Old Warehouse
location.description:
Quest(s): Exploration Society Letters.
An old starter town dungeon, the Rithwic Town Stamp is located here.
At one time used for storage by the folk of Rithwic, this cave has been abandoned and left to the drudges that have now claimed it as their own.
Thank you, GreenEyes.

location.name: A Red Rat Lair
location.description:
Quest(s): Lubziklan al-Luq's Stolen Goods.
A small nest of brown and red rats inside a nearby apple grove. A chest at the end of the dungeon contains lowlevel stuff.
This dungeon contains a shortcut portal to Sea Temple Catacombs, which is a short run straight ahead when you enter the dungeon.
Thanks to Alunor for the update.

location.name: Yaraq Tunnels
location.description:
Quest(s): Sword of Lost Light.
The Worn Strange Key that is needed for the Sword of Lost Light Quest is found on a Drudge Slave in this dungeon.
Thank you, GreenEyes.

location.name: Under Cove Crypt
location.description:
Quest(s): Search for Abmim ibn Ibsar, Mad Star Investigation.
Once part of a great Empyrean shipping port that operated out of the cove, now all that remains are ruins. The entrance to this dungeon is guarded by a strange set of iron doors. However these doors cannot be opened by a simple key, search nearby to find the answer.
Once inside be prepared to fight skeletons, zombies, and undead as you wander the various levels of this dungeon. You may want to have a skilled vagabond in your party to aid in picking the many locks you'll encounter.
Also be on the lookout for any strange keys you may encounter and be wary. Some adventurers have returned with tales of the earth itself rising up, assuming humanoid form, and attacking whoever invades these tunnels.
This dungeon is great for 1-3 level 5 characters but anyone over level 10 will find little challenge here by themselves.
Thank you, GreenEyes.

location.name: Yaraq to Al-Arqas
location.description: This portal goes to the Gharu'ndim town of Al-Arqas in the depths of the A'mun desert. This is a good town for characters over level 10.

location.name: Yaraq to Samsur
location.description: This portal goes to Samsur, a Gharu'ndim town in the hills behind the Yushad Ridge. This is a good town for characters over level 10.

location.name: Lin
location.description: Lin is a quiet Sho town known for it's tranquil forest setting. Although there are many good low level dungeons and quests in the area, the surrounding wilds can be quite dangerous for someone of appropriate level.

location.name: Old Keep (Lin Lich Tower)
location.description:
This point of interest maybe more commonly known as the "Lin Lich Tower" even though it has been updated and no longer contains any Liches.
The Old Keep is a tower lit with green flames that sits on the side of a mountain northwest of the town of Lin. It is only accessible via a nearby portal at 52.8S 69.1E. The tower is guarded by two Obsidian Golems who flank the door. At the Base of the tower are several Sewer Rats. At the top of the tower are a few Dark Revenants who guard two Runed Chests. One chest is unlocked while the other requires lockpick skill to open. To leave the keep you can take a portal outside the tower which will deposit you on the other side of the mountain.

location.name: West Shoushi Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. Unlike most of the other outposts this one was not attacked by Martine and still functions, however, instead of appearing here new arrivals portal directly into Shoushi proper.

location.name: Shoushi
location.description: Last of the three heritage groups to arrive in Dereth, the Sho made their home south of the Blackmire Swamp, where Mosswart raiders had thwarted settlement by the Aluvians to the north. To provide protection from these and other creatures for the fledgling village of Hebian-To, the warlord Ijiku Tambai built a fortress nearby called Yaosai. In time, once the Sho had successfully pushed back the Mosswarts, the need for a fortress disappeared. Parts of Yaosai's walls were torn down and used to build huts. The new town, mockingly called Shoushi or "small place" has since outgrown that moniker and is thriving as a waypoint between Hebian-To and the western Sho holdings.

location.name: Southast Shoushi Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. Unlike most of the other outposts this one was not attacked by Martine and still functions, however, instead of appearing here new arrivals portal directly into Shoushi proper.

location.name: East Yaraq Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. Unlike most of the other outposts this one was not attacked by Martine and still functions, however, instead of appearing here new arrivals portal directly into Yaraq.

location.name: Yaraq
location.description:
Some of the Gharu'ndim who first came to Dereth were lifelong desert-dwellers, and chafed at the idea of building their homes on the Yushad Ridge. Their leader, a wizard named Raqur al-Hayra, led them on a trek acrss the A'mun Desert to a cove along the coast of the Inner Sea. There they found an oasis, an island of green amid the sands. Raqur thrust his staff into the ground, bringing forth fresh water, and declared that all the desert folk would be welcome in this place. Sadly, Raqur was slain in a magic duel with a Mu-miyah archmage before the town, called Yaraq, was completed. Yaraq has since remained apart from much of the rest of Dereth, seperated from the rest of the island by desert, although portal and paths do lead to lands beyond the dunes.
Points of Interest
The Desert Way is the only sure path across the trackless A'mun, whose sands would quickly bury any ordinary road. Its markers, upright hoops hung with cloth, lead from the end of Yaraq's north road to the village of Tufa, and beyond to the towns of the Yushad Ridge.
A series of rocky buttes rise from the peninsula on the southern edge of the Yaraq Cove. A colony of Drudges and other monsters have dug their warrens in the soft stone of one of these mesas. Some who have braved these tunnels claim they have seen evidence that some of them were once inhabited by the Empyrean.

location.name: North Yaraq Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. Unlike most of the other outposts this one was not attacked by Martine and still functions, however, instead of appearing here new arrivals portal directly into Yaraq.

location.name: Samsur
location.description:
Shortly after their arrival on Dereth, the Gharundim people, led by Musansayn, founded Samsur in the desert plains west of the Faranar hills. After his disappearance in the desert wilds several years later, the townsfolk of Samsur erected a fountain to commemorate their missing leader.
Samsur was built in a small, sheltered valley. The bluffs surrounding it help protect it from the harsh winds and with the abundant water provided by the underground river that feeds the fountain, the area is always lush and green.
The Market - Like most Gharundim communities, the town's main market is housed in a large, domed structure. Here you will find Nasruya al-Khanjan the tailor, Sutaiya bit Yil the scribe and storyteller, Ushad al-Fasam the grocer, and Da'hir ibn Khayuzur the towns archmage.
House of Fathlan - Fathlan ibn Nuril buys and sells various jewerly items. You can also find the healer Burah bint Fathlan providing goods and services to those in need. A trophy smith can also often be found on the shops upper balcony watching travellers and crafting axes from the spines of Armoredillos.
The Golden Vine - Samsur's only inn is run by Mishiya al-Abidi. Here you can find rest and relaxation as well as the usual assortment of rumors, food, and drink.
Bows and Goods - Thawasa al-La'ud the bowyer provides for the needs of archers and fletchers. Be forewarned that Thawasa adhere's to the Gharu'ndim tradition forbidding the use of the crossbow and will not deal in these weapons. Also here you'll find Julsama bint Sakim the provisioner with a good supply of items to meet your daily needs.
Bellows Breath - Samsur's premier supplier of arms and armor. Here you'll find the weaponsmith Ayiz ibn Khayt and the armorer Talam ibn Tarish. They keep a good selection of the common weapons and armor of the land in stock at all times of the year.
Collector - Like most collectors, this one will pay coin for all manner of odds and ends. But is especially interested in fine examples of Phyntos Wasp wings.

location.name: Holtburg
location.description: Standing on a hill overlooking the River Prosper as it runs from the heights of Mount Esper into the lowlands, the town of Holtburg was one of the first Aluvian Villages. Settlers Erected it in 2 P.Y. (Portal Year, time dating from the year humans overthrew Olthoi rule), having struck out into the wilderness from the safety of nearby Cragstone to log the vast Tiofor Wood to the west. The town has since become a major waypoint for travelers, as it stands between the villages surrounding Lake Blessed and Glenden Wood, with the Gharu'ndim settlements beyond.

location.name: West Holtburg Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. Unlike most of the other outposts this one was not attacked by Martine and still functions, however, instead of appearing here new arrivals portal directly into Holtburg.

location.name: South Holtburg Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. Unlike most of the other outposts this one was not attacked by Martine and still functions, however, instead of appearing here new arrivals portal directly into Holtburg.

location.name: Holtburg Healer and Peddler
location.description: Along the road from Holtburg to its Western Outpost you will find a small house with a healer and peddler seeing basic supplies.

location.name: Cave of Alabree
location.description:
Quest(s): Brogord's Demise, Exploration Society Letters, Hunter Quests (Blood Shreths).
In the 6th year of our freedom from the Olthoi, the people of Holtburg were besieged and slaughtered here by Tumeroks. Only the children were spared, thanks to the heroism of the mage Celcynd.

location.name: A Rat Nest
location.description:
Low Level Hunting Spot.
Thank you, GreenEyes.
location.monsters: Black, Desert, Grey, Mountain, Red, Russet, Swamp, Tan, White Rat

location.name: Drudge Hideout
location.description:
Quest(s): Alfrin's Stolen Supplies.
Close to Holtburg and just off the road to Glenden Wood lays this small hideout now occupied by drudges.
Now contains a runed chest (thanks Alunor - MT).

location.name: Rithwic
location.description:
Rithwic is an Aluvian town on the southern end of Lake Blessed where the waters of the River Prosper narrow. It is at a major intersection of roads. The road to the southwest leads to Lytelthorpe. The western road leading north goes to Cragstone. The eastern road leading north goes to Eastham. And the eastern road leading south goes to Dryreach. It was one of the original starter towns until Martine destroyed the arrival points at the east and south outposts. Rithwic was the original home of one of the Lugian gem sellers, but he has since moved to Holtburg. Rithwic has portals to Holtburg, Lytelthorpe, and Shoushi. In the center of town there is a portal leading to the once hidden underground town Martine's Retreat.
Asheron's Call Manual Text
First Settled in 7 P.Y., Rithwic is one of the youngest Aluvian towns. Originally a small stonemason's hamlet built near a ford of the River Prosper, just downstream from Lake Blessed, it has grown quickly into a thriving boomtown, as it is the gateway to the Sho communities to the south. It once stood on the edge of the Aluvian lands, but the frontier has since moved south to Dryreach, leaving Rithwic more or less unmolested by the Tumerok raiders that harry the hinterlands. In the past year, a second settlement, dubbed East Rithwic, has arisen on the river's other side.

location.name: South Rithwic Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. It was destroyed by Martine during The First Strike event.

location.name: East Rithwic Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. It was destroyed by Martine during The First Strike event.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Rithwic)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Filos' Doom
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
The Alloy Device that is used in the Undead Mechanic quest spawns at the bottom of this dungeon.
location.monsters: Gnawer Shreth, Drudge Slinker, Drudge Skulker, Young Banderling, White Rat

location.name: Eastham
location.description:
Eastham is an Aluvian town, near the outermost East Coast of Dereth at 17.5N, 63.4E
Eastham was once a very busy town, with new adventurers crowding the beaches to hunt the gromnies and other beasts that lived there. The stronger warrios even made the long run to Arwic, once the trade hub for all of Dereth.
These days, the town is not so busy. However, there are still some reasons to visit. The Aluvian mask maker lives here in the second floor of the smithy. The Aluvian shadow armor smith lives along the north road. A branch of the Title Bestower's Guild is set up here. Also, many shortcut portals for the Gaerlan quest are located here. And more recently, what seems to be a permanent portal to Asheron's Isle is open next to the town's windmill.

location.name: Abandoned Farm
location.description: It`s unknown if the local Drudges or a nearby camp of Banderlings destroyed this small farm that acted as a rest stop between Arwic and Eastham.

location.name: Drudge Tower
location.description: Once the lookout point for a small farming settlement nearby, this tower is now held by a small but determined pack of Drudges.

location.name: Merchant Cellar
location.description: This small shelter is frequented by wandering adventurers and merchants alike. There are also two portals here.

location.name: Merchant Cellar to High Mountain Valley
location.description:
This portal leads to a valley in the Linvak Mountains of Southern Osteth. Very near the Lost Gardens dungeon and the portal to the Desert Ridge Border.
Be careful, this valley is very dangerous for the inexperienced.

location.name: Merchant
location.description: This travelling merchant seems to have set up a temporary shop in a small shelter, just off the road from Eastham to Arwic.

location.name: Arwic
location.description:
Arwic, one of the principal cities on Dereth, is strategically located on the edge of the Aluvian lands near the Olthoi infested north.
In the early days, Arwic was a busteling center of commerce, with people coming from all over to trade and talk. Portal storms were not so much frequent, as nearly constant. This all changed in the shadow wars, when Arwic was destroyed by a Shadow Spire. After the attack the residents of the town moved down the roads to the South and West. The gaping crater remained unoccupied for years, until the town was rebuilt newer and stronger from the ruins, laden with walls. However, some the townspeople didn't not move back into the walled city and remain in the buildings outside the town.
Nuhmudira planned to make a school in Arwic supposedly in the currently empty villas you see on the east side of town. However, her plans apparently never came to fruition because after many years no school has yet to open and the buildings remain empty.

location.name: Arwic to Tou-Tou
location.description: This portal goes to the Sho town of Tou-Tou, perched on the tiop of the Tou-Tou peninsula. This is a good town for chaarcters over level 20.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Tou-Tou)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Tou-Tou Lich Tower
location.description: Be wary of the undead and their minions guarding this stone tower. Azure gromnies frequent the beaches nearby.

location.name: Al-Jalima to Tou-Tou
location.description: This portal goes to the Sho town of Tou-Tou, perched on the tip of the Tou-Tou peninsula. This is a good town for characters over level 20.

location.name: Hebian-to to Cragstone
location.description: This portal is on a hill next to the Hebian-to Library and the Obsidian Enchantress. An occasional drudge or shreth can be found nearby.

location.name: Shoushi to Yanshi
location.description: This portal goes to the Sho town of Yanshi on the edges of the Blackmire swamp. The original town was devastated by the Harbringer, who still lurks deep beneath the surface. This is a good town for characters over level 10. But stay away from the Harbringer.

location.name: Shoushi to Nanto
location.description: This portal goes to Nanto, a sleepy Sho town. This is a good town for characters over level 10.

location.name: Yanshi to Yaraq
location.description: This portal goes to Yaraq, a Gharu'ndim town where many new adventurers enter Dereth. This is a good town for characters of all levels.

location.name: Tou-Tou
location.description:
Tou-Tou is a Sho town at the end of a small peninsula north of Hebian-To.
Featured prominantly to the north-east of town is a very large Empyrean Lighthouse, which is often used as a jumping platform by the brave or foolhardy.

location.name: Khayyaban
location.description: Khayyaban lies on the edge of Gharu'ndim lands, south of Uziz and east of Xarabydun.

location.name: Al-Jalima
location.description: Al-Jalima is a small Gharu'ndim village located just a short ways from Zaikhal. Janda Sulifiya, the Gharu'ndim mask maker makes her home here, as does Jibril ibn Rashid, who can turn Scintillating Gems into Greater Shadowhunter Amuli.

location.name: Zaikhal
location.description: Zaikhal is the Gharu'ndim capital. Along with the usual town amenities and collectors you can also find Kuyiza bint Zayi the Translator who translates certain Empyrian documents, such as the Aerlinthe Recall scroll, and Diyas al-Yat, who has the unique ability to translate Virindi message shards.

location.name: Cragstone
location.description:
Cragstone is the capital city of the Aluvian Realm. It is named after Thorsten Cragstone, a fallen hero of the Olthoi rebellion. Cragstone was the first above-ground settlement of the Isparians, which they settled after moving out of the nearby Underground City on the Isle of Tears on Lake Blessed. Besides the standard vendors, collectors, and quest NPCs, Cragstone is home to the Aluvian Library where the translator of Yalaini text lives. The Arcanum's Aluvian furniture shop is also just outside of town.
During the Shadow Wars, Cragstone was attacked by a Shadow Spire at the same time as Arwic and Tufa. Elysa Strathelar, Asheron, and the advocates were able to destroy the Shadow Spire and save Cragstone, but Arwic and Tufa were not so lucky.

location.name: Hebian-to
location.description: Hebian-To is the Sho capital. Located in the heart of Sho lands, between Shoushi and Nanto, it has for years been a bustling center of commerce and social activity. Hebian-To is the home of the Arcanum's Sho furniture shop and the Sho library, where one can find the translator of Falatacot writings.

location.name: Qalaba'r
location.description: Once a bustling metropolis full of frequent portal storms, Qalaba'r was virtually abandoned when it was invaded by frost elementals and glacial golems. The invaders are long gone, but the town never fully recovered to it's former glory.

location.name: Four Towers Entrance
location.description:
Quest(s): Impious Staff.
The entrance to the Four Towers Keep nearby.

location.name: Four Towers Keep
location.description:
Quest(s): Impious Staff.
The entrance to this gateless keep is through a portal nearby.

location.name: Four Towers Exit
location.description:
Quest(s): Impious Staff.
Placed within the stone walls of Four Towers, this portal allows you to leave the safety of the castle.

location.name: Moss Chamber
location.description:
Quest(s): Singularity Weapons.
Ouch, Yikes! Help!... argh...
- Soulitaire, recently deceased
location.monsters: Gragghk, Creeper Mosswart, Mosswart Fanatic, Idolator, Mir-Witch, Soul Trapper, Zealot

location.name: Glenden Wood
location.description:
Glenden Wood is an Aluvian town nestled in the Tiofor Woods west of Holtburg. It is a center of crafting and many quests can be found in and around town.
Glenden Wood was also selected by the Viamontian King Varicci II as a beachhead for his invasion of the Osteth mainland. Though a truce now exists between Varicci and High Queen Elysa Strathelar, Glenden Wood remains under siege to this day.

location.name: Lytelthorpe
location.description:
Lytelthorpe is one of the original 9 starter towns, and as such is a good place for low level adventurers. Overlooking town is a small keep, which is often used as a meeting place. Original Manual Text
One of Dereth's newest towns, until a few months ago Lytelthorpe was nothing but an abandoned Empyrean Fortress overrun by Banderlings, led by a human warmonger named Wardiel the Mighty. Recently, however, a band of brave warriors and wizards slew Wardiel, drove out the infestation and claimed the keep as their own. Since then, shops and homes have arisen in the fortress's shadow. Wilder and younger than nearby Rithwic, Lytelthorpe has yet to establish itself. Surrounded as it is by rich farmland, however, it promises to come into its own with the passage of time.
Points of Interest
Lytelthorpe Keep was built long ago by the Empyrean. At Present, little is known if its history - not even its original name. Until recently, it was overrun by a clan of Banderlings, and had fallen into disrepair. It has been restored and is now claimed by Lord Aleval, one of the towns' liberators.
An unusual subterranean complex lies beneath the rolling, fertile hills south of town. It appears to be an ancient distillery, constructed by the Empyrean to brew exotic liquors. What drink remains, after the passage of centuries, would be of great value to connoisseurs. In order to retrieve it, however, delvers will have to brave drudges and other beasts who now stalk he halls.

location.name: Yanshi (Old)
location.description:
During the Sho's first days on Dereth, the land just northwest of the Blackmire Swamp was rife with Tumeroks, and many defenseless folk fell beneath their blades. In that time, a master swordsman named Ben Ten roamed the land, giving aid to those who needed it. Ben Ten Vanished into legend soon after the Tumerok menace was thrawted The Last place he was seen was standing atop a large rock near the edge of the swamp, and some of his followers settled there considering the stone to have been blessed by is presence. The village that arose on that spot - called Yanshi or "town of the boulder" - has grown in the past several years into a trading center, with roads leading into both the Gharu'ndim and Aluvian lands as well as deeper into the Sho realm.
Points of Interest
The Sacred Stone, found in the midst of Yanshi, is the last known place where the swordsman Ben Ten was seen. Some folk, however, claim to have sighted him since.
In the time before Ben Ten came, many of those who would one day settle in Yanshi tried to hide from the Tumerok scourge in a subterranean dungeon complex. The dungeon, however, was rife with monsters that slew many of those seeking shelter. The survivors claim that the creatures that drove them out remain in those catacombs. .

location.name: Wilderness Fort
location.description:
The fort may be entered by climbing the crates against the wall. A lifestone as well as portals to both Zaikhal and Hebian-to can be found here.
Lots of mites spawn in the surrounding area as do banderlings and the occasional tuskers and wood golems. Many within sight of the walls.

location.name: Lost Distillery
location.description:
Quest(s): Exploration Society Letters.
An old, starter town dungeon, where the Lytelthorpe Town Stamp is located.

location.name: Folthid Cellar
location.description:
Quest(s): Dagger of Tikola, Asheron's Departure Lower.
Final room contains items for both Dagger of Tikola Quest and Asheron's Departure Lower quests.
location.monsters: Wood Golem, Sandstone Golem, Mucker Mosswart, Barker Mosswart, Mudlurk Mosswart, Mosswart Shaman, Undead, Lich

location.name: North Yanshi Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. It was destroyed by Martine during The First Strike event.

location.name: Nanto
location.description:
Nanto is one of the 9 original starter towns, and remains an area suitable for low level adventurers.
Nanto has but a few shops that offer the basic necessities for travelers heading south to Mayoi, west to Lin or north to other Sho towns. Along with a collector that specializes in the odd items, there is a Rat Killer that will purchase any rat tails, with a fondness for the rarer grey rat tails.
West from Nanto is a beautiful set of waterfalls with a portal to Yanshi and a lifestone a little further west along the road. Deep within the mountain is a Water Temple that holds a special bottle of water. You will need to make your way through many drudges to find the bottle near a refreshing fountain.
Traveling near the road is advisable, for the hills surrounding Nanto are infested with packs of Drudges, Shreths, Wasps and other hideous creatures.
The Northern Outpost of Nanto, nestled within a small wooded area provides a great resting spot for those that are traveling to or from the northern cities.
Nanto's Eastern Outpost is just a short distance from the sea and the ocean breezes. Inuo KunKou the Enchanter had his book stolen by the drudges that hide within the candle lit dungeon overlooking the shoreline east of the outpost.

location.name: East Nanto Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. It was destroyed by Martine during The First Strike event.

location.name: Nanto to Yanshi
location.description: This portal goes to the Sho town of Yanshi on the edges of the Blackmire swamp. The original town was devestated by the Harbinger, who still lurks deep beneath the surface. This is a good town for characters over level 10. But stay away from the Harbinger.

location.name: Roadside Merchant, Healer, Archmage
location.description:
Sells at 135%, buys at 80%.
Set along the road from Nanto to Mayoi, these merchants sell various wares. Most notable of which are good and excellent quality healing kits.

location.name: Mayoi
location.description: Mayoi is a lovely Sho town on the coast south east of Lin. Although it was once taken over by a persistant Diamond Golem Suzerian and it's minions, it has returned to it's usual tranquil pace. Mayoi is perhaps best known as the home of Shoyanen the Master Mage.

location.name: Sawato
location.description:
Sawato has long been one of the more inaccessable towns on Dereth. Though it is located in the middle of Sho lands, it is dominated by the Blackmire Swamp, and until relatively recently, there were no portal connections at all save the meeting hall exit portal.
Naturally, such a remote location should have a plethora of interesting quests in and around it, as well as important NPCs, such as Tsua Kagemata, the Sho mask maker.

location.name: Tou-Tou Lighthouse
location.description: This impressive structure is one of the scattered tributes to the now fallen Empyrean Empire.

location.name: Khayyaban Lifestone
location.description: Thanks to Elegy of Solclaim for an updated picture!

location.name: Roadside Lifestone
location.description: This lifestone is on the road from Yanshi to Sawato.

location.name: Shattered Dryreach Lifestone
location.description: This lifestone appears to have been purposely destroyed by the besieging tumeroks. A tumerok worker can often be seen nearby surveying their handywork.

location.name: Dryreach
location.description:
Dryreach is besieged by Tumeroks, and has been since the launch of the game. When Dark Majesty came out, it was revealed that the Hea Tumeroks loyal to the Virindi use Dryreach as a training ground for Hea that have just left Marae Lassel for the mainland. Nearby are several Tumerok training camps belonging to their various clans. Dryreach is the starting point for a few quests, such as the Overlord's Sword, Dryreach Rescue, and the Tumerok Gladiator killtask. It is also the home of one of the two Tumerok Collectors on Dereth, the other being located in Fort Tethana.
Until recently, the only way to get to Dryreach was to run. Now there is a portal to Dryreach in Holtburg. Be sure to bring a Dryreach Key with you (purchased from the weary looking man in Rithwic or Eastham) unless you know how to pick locks or are able to leap over the town's walls.

location.name: Tufa
location.description:
Tufa is a Gharu'ndim town just northeast of Yaraq. In the Twilight's Gleaming patch Tufa was destroyed by Shadow Spires. The true target was not the town itself but rather the Menhir Ring that the town had been unknowingly built on top of. While the town was drastically altered and all of the actual building were reduced to rubble the townspeople remain in Tufa living in tents around the edge of and inside the crater made by the attack.
While Ferah and Ler Rhan's Thorns attacked Cragstone and Arwic, drawing the attentions of the defenders, the elder Shadows destroyed a long-buried circle of standing stones beneath the oasis of Tufa.
Gondibyr Langarl's sloe-eyes tightened in rage, and he seemed to acquire more than his usual stature. I did not like the way the shadows fell upon his face in the guttering light of his firebrand. He opened his mouth to rebut, but Kei spoke quietly. Sir? She did not move or look up from her meditation. The white mage turned his tired eyes to her. Tufa was also attacked, my lord, she said. It was destroyed.

location.name: Baishi
location.description:
Nestled in a wooded pass in the eastern portion of the Linvak Range, you'll find the quiet town of Baishi. An ideal place for meditation and relaxation. Provided that is that you don't mind the Banderlings, Drudges, and Mosswarts that occupy the surrounding areas. - Jacinth the Loremaster
Baishi's earliest beginnings can be seen in the merchant compound nearby. The compound was built at the foot of an old Empyrean tower (which doubled as a watchtower) to watch over the mountain pass from Shoushi to Qalaba'r. As time passed, a safer route was found through the mountains from Nanto, through Lin and eventually to Qalaba'r. As a result, Baishi's focus changed from commerce to mining and logging.
The woods around Baishi provide abundant resources if you can guard yourself from the many Drudges, Banderlings, and Mosswarts that seem to continually infest the pass. The merchants and craftsmen here manage to supply the basic needs and then some. There are still a few of the old merchants that retain the skills that were so valuable to them in those days as well as the odd collector or two who still desire to fill their need for that missing item, including a collector specializing in wasp wings.

location.name: Banderling Tower
location.description: This tower is not only occupied by Banderlings but the nearby hills are filled with all kinds of dangerous creatures, from wasps and shreths, to more banderlings.

location.name: The Estate of Lady Folthid
location.description:
Quest(s): Dagger Of Tikola.
The Lady Folthid and her servant Felscuda attempt to survive in this remote wilderness but protocol is still followed: Anyone seeking an audience with Lady Folthid must first meet with Felscuda.

location.name: Folthid Lifestone
location.description: This lifestone is on the estate of Lady Folthid.

location.name: Qalaba'r Lifestone
location.description: Sits right next to the portal to Hebian-to.

location.name: Wandering Bowyer (Sawato)
location.description: Sells at 155%, buy at 90%.

location.name: Sho Roadside Weaponsmith and Farmer
location.description: Lou Dou the weaponsmith and the farmer Ri Na share this humble Sho dwelling on the road between Yanshi to Sawato. Many a portal traveller arrives in the area (Sho Roadside Portals).

location.name: South Yanshi Vendors
location.description:
Sells at 135%, buys at 90%.
Archmage Le-Ai Ren, Farmer Ri Na, Lun Dou, and Ru Shaha the Healer have opened a shop together at this rest stop on the road from Yanshi to Sawato.

location.name: Empyrean Ruin
location.description: This stone face lies half sunk in the swamps Northwest of Sawato.

location.name: Swamp Ruin
location.description: A small dungeon full of lower level Mosswarts. Several Stamina Fonts can be found throughout the dungeon.

location.name: Mudlurk Tower
location.description: This tower is currently occupied by a rather nasty party of Mudlurks.

location.name: Recovered Temple
location.description: Undead are known to frequent this ancient Empyrean temple.

location.name: Empyrean Garrison
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
You'll need lockpick to get to the Alloy Apparatus.
location.monsters: Drudge Prowler, Drudge Robber, Black Rat, Drudge Slave, Red Rat, Blood Shreth, Hunter Shreth

location.name: Nanto Rat Lair
location.description: As you would expect from the name, this dungeon is infested with all manner of vermin.

location.name: Water Temple
location.description:
Quest(s): Exploration Society Letters, Water for Ji Ra Ping.
An old, starter-town dungeon that contains the Nanto Town Stamp and a Bottle of Water.
This small cavern holds a temple of unknown origin. Be careful though as a band of drudges has decided to call it home.

location.name: Lytaway Dungeon
location.description:
Quest(s): Magical Lights.
Old starter-quest dungeon still populated with Drudges and is host to Inuo-Kon Kou's Book.
location.monsters: Drudge Skulker, Slinker, Sneaker, Prowler

location.name: North Nanto Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. It was destroyed by Martine during The First Strike event.

location.name: Merchant Compound
location.description:
This compound is situated right next to an ancient Empyrean tower and a mysterious forest shrine. The resident blacksmith carries chain and yoroi while the merchant has a small selection of general supplies.
Beware of Mosswarts.

location.name: Drunken Madman's Tower
location.description: Quite an important location to some...

location.name: Empyrean Mountain Shrine
location.description: Only those that erected this lonely mountain shrine know whom it was dedicated to.

location.name: Rocky Crypt
location.description: A few large caverns are home to some sand golems.

location.name: Golem Burial Ground
location.description:
One the places back in the days to find Pyreal Motes. However, the golems are on a relatively slow respawn. This is mentioned in the text Golem Burial Grounds.
If you're looking for one of the wonders of Dereth, then this site might interest you. In the hills between Lin and Baishi, around 51S-67E, is a portal to an old network of caves. They look like they might have been carved out long ago, perhaps by the Empyrean or Dericost. Mysterious obelisks can be found while walking the caverns. These and the ancient forge room lead some people to believe that the place may have been used to create golems. Whatever the truth is, golems seem to protect the site. Some say they go there to die.
-- Golem Burial Grounds
Interesting note is that this dungeon portal is green.
location.monsters: Granite, Limestone, Sandstone Golem

location.name: Mite House
location.description: A house where three mites have taken up residence. No chests or special items are found here.

location.name: Arwic Mines
location.description:
Quest(s): Diemos Flagging, Crafter Golems.
Just North Of Arwic.

location.name: Trialos
location.description:
This rather small dungeon used to be a good place for a few levels for a lower level character.
It holds a Sturdy Iron Chest, and an unlocked chest with at that time, interesting loot.

location.name: A Ruin (Mayoi)
location.description: There is a portal to Baishi at the bottom.
location.monsters: Barker, Mudlurk Mosswart, Mosswart Shaman, Black, White Rat, Water Wisp

location.name: Golem Shrine
location.description: This structure is surrounded by limestone Golems, Lugians and Banderlings. Oh, did I mention the Lich inside?

location.name: Eotensfang to Bandit Castle
location.description: Be careful of creatures as you arrive and hit the ground running.

location.name: Coastal Pass
location.description: There are three Olthoi Workers (lvl. 55) and one Olthoi Soldier (lvl. 65) guarding this pass. You cannot go around them by walking in the water, since the walkable part puts you within sight of the Olthoi.

location.name: Arwic to Al-Jalima
location.description: A quick exit from the rubble of Arwic.

location.name: West Arwic Lifestone
location.description: Drudges and Shreth's seem to be remain rather close to this lifestone. So be prepared for them.

location.name: East Arwic Lifestone
location.description: On a hill near Arwic. Drudges camp nearby and the occasional Gnawer Shreth will wander close.

location.name: Holtburg Dungeon
location.description:
Quest(s): Sword of Lost Light.
This dungeon filled with various Drudges. Rumor has it that at one time it may have been a prison.

location.name: Obsidian Enchantress (Holtburg)
location.description: Obsidian Enchanters craft items from Obsidian Jewels and Obsidian Spheres. Each NPC gives a different reward.

location.name: Abandoned House
location.description: This old house has long since been abandonded. It is used now only by whatever creature may seek shelter from the weather.

location.name: Hunter's Leap
location.description:
Quest(s): Lilitha's Lost Bow.
Home to Brigands, Highwaymen, Cutthroats and Assassins, this dungeon also holds the famed Lilitha's Bow. For those looking for experience and some moderately good loot this is a great opportunity. Feeling lucky? Then try it against the zombie and the lich. Don't worry - there is only one such pair.
- Zinkyu
location.monsters: Brigands, Highwaymen, Cutthroats and Assassins and a single pair of a Lich and a Lich Lord.

location.name: Farmer
location.description: This old farmer sells various cooking items and foodstuffs. Not much of a selection, but what do you expect so far off the beaten path.

location.name: Banderling Ruin
location.description:
As of December 2002, this dungeon now has a new name (formerly A Ruin) and a bunch of banderlings and three chests.
Bandy Scouts, Guards, Raiders, Ravers, Breeder and a Chief. Entrance is relatively safe. Three chests on the other three platforms.
Thanks to Phergus for this updated information.
location.monsters: Banderling Scout, Banderling Guard, Banderling Raider, Banderling Raver, Banderling Breeder, Banderling Chief

location.name: Golem Mound
location.description:
No one is exactly sure what causes these mud golems to surround the stone spire at this location.
Thanks to Char'Med of Wintersebb for the picture of this location.

location.name: Holtburg Redoubt
location.description:
Quest(s): Worcer's Missing Heirlooms.
In the 6th year of freedom from the Olthoi, the people of Holtburg were besieged and slaughtered here by Tumeroks.
Only the children were spared, thanks to the heroism of the mage Celcynd.

location.name: Peddler
location.description: This strange little man has choosen to live a solitary life selling goods to whomever happens by and caring for his small herd of cattle.

location.name: Festival Stone of Evensong
location.description: This strange relic from the Empyrean Empire still stands proudly, overlooking the River Prosper downstream from Holtburg.

location.name: Dungeon Fern
location.description: Old dungeon full of Undead and a Runed Chest.

location.name: Holtburg to Rithwic
location.description: This portal goes to Rithwic, an Aluvian town on the shores of Lake Blessed. This is a good town for characters over level 10.

location.name: Abandoned Mines
location.description:
This dungeon was the center of spam and trade. Once you're past the locked doors and gate (plus the liches and revenants), the dungeon's basement features portal links to most of Dereths favorite destinations. But beware! A low health and jumping ability will cause you to fall flatter than a pancake.
* Arwic * Cragstone * Glenden Wood * Hebian-To * Holtburg * Mayoi * Qalaba'r * Rithwic * Samsur * Shoushi * Surface * Underground City * Yaraq * Zaikhal
- Vidoskiaskiodias, TD

location.name: Alfreth Dungeon
location.description:
You need to lockpick skill (resistance is 364) or Zalphoos' Key to access any of the deeper parts of the dungeon.
The different creatures have their own sections and seem to be killing each as the body parts of Drudges can be found in the Reedshark area and vice versa. In the Banderling area (need lockpick or key to access) the Captain drops a Worn Key that can be used to access part of the Sylsfear Dungeon.
A Scribbled Note is on the floor of the room with the undead just near the portal drop. You need lockpick to open the door (resistance is only 40).
location.monsters: Undead, Drudge Slinker ,Drudge Prowler ,Reedshark Veteran ,Reedshark Pup ,Banderling Guard, Raider, Breeder, Captain

location.name: Bandit Castle Prison
location.description:
Quest(s): Bandit Shield, Feud of Neydisa and Bandit Castle.
A prison that contains various nasty creatures either locked up or free to roam. This dungeon has various locked doors and chests which can be opened with keys found within. However, everything that is unlocked with the keys can also be picked open, but there are sections that cannot be accessed with just the keys alone. When found and used in the correct order the keys will eventually lead you to the Bandit Shield.
It would also appear that Oswald the assassin was once here to steal the shield for himself.

location.name: Dungeon Binar
location.description: An early dungeon which used to have a 1-12 level restriction, but it is open now to all levels. There is a lifestone not far from the entrance.

location.name: Black Death Catacombs
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Weapons, Aerbax's Citadel, The BDC Quiddity Seed, Aerbax's Prodigal Olthoi.
The dungeon holds several portals to Lower Corridor and a portal to the Deeper Catacombs (Paradox, a Note from a Scout is found on the ground, and home to The BDC Quiddity Seed.

location.name: Bone Lair
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
A relatively small dungeon. You need to have (low) Lockpick skill and pull a few levers to get to the Alloy Instrument.
Thanks to Tao Kidimaru of Leafcull for providing the correct coordinates. Turns out this dungeon is not in the inland sea. Hrm..go figure.
location.monsters: Skeleton Warrior

location.name: Burial Temple
location.description:
Quest(s): Lady Jaera's Tomb, Undead Attack on Al-Jalima.
This is a seasonal quest. While the dungeon is available year round, players can only obtain the Enchanted Bone Fragments during the fall season. In addition, the quest NPC, Trevor Shunderson, is removed from Al-Jalima along with the undead raiders, making it impossible to get the experience and title reward.
WARNING: The spells that Orisis will cast on you are extremely debilitating, often capable of leading to easy death. Heed caution if you are solo, even at higher levels, and be wary if you are running this as a lower-leveled character.
Only Available During The "Halloween" Patch.
location.monsters: Old Bones, Skeleton, Skeleton Warrior, Skeleton Lord

location.name: Colier Mine
location.description:
Quest(s): Baron's Amulet of Life Giving, Diemos Flagging, Crafter Golems, Impious Staff.
Two of the keys needed to traverse this dungeon are located outside in the abandoned town Colier. Look for a two story building with a Banderling Raider inside. He drops the Small Rusted Key. In another single story building are several Drudge Prowlers, one of them drops the Cell Key.

location.name: Crater Caves Dungeon
location.description:
Quest(s): Lady Aerfalle, Undead Mechanic.
The Alloy Fan that is used in the Undead Mechanic and the Pyreal Forge Bellows for Aerlinthe Recall are found in the Magma Golem Section near the bottom of the dungeon by the forges.
location.monsters: Magma Golem, Mist Golem, Fire Elemental

location.name: Daiklos Dungeon
location.description: Be prepared to face Dudges, zombies, liches, and rats to reach the treasures contained in the many chests found here.
location.monsters: Lich, Drudge Lurker, Silver Rat, Skeleton Captain, Horrible Mu-miyah, Skeleton Lord

location.name: Darkened Halls
location.description:
Quest(s): Elysa's Favor.
You need to talk to Dame Tsaya and the Stranger in Town before you are flagged to enter the dungeon.
The Darkened Halls was once just a newbie dungeon but it was taken over by Martine's forces. They used it as a base to lure adventurers in so they could take their skins to make Simulacrums. At the end of the dungeon you will find a level 30 Hollow Minion that drops a Storage Key that opens a nearby chest. Inside the chest is a Human Husk that Tsaya wants.

location.name: Desert Mine
location.description: Skeletons of all sorts serve their skeleton lords and lich masters here.

location.name: Deserted Ruin
location.description:
Quest(s): Exploration Society Letters, The Writings of Jhong Mi.
An old, starter town dungeon that contains the Yanshi Town Stamp and one of the Writings of Jhong Mi.

location.name: Disaster Maze
location.description:
A Slimy Note and Silvery Key can be found in this dungeon.
The rare black drudge and its more common counterparts can be found here serving their virindi masters. Beware of the tuskers and rats that are also found here.
location.monsters: Drudge Lurker, Prowler, Ravener, Sneaker, Stalker, Female, Goldenback, Male Tusker Crimsonback, Guard, Slave, Mountain, Sewaer Rat, Virindi Director, Master, Puppet, Servant

location.name: Swamp Temple (Wai Jhou)
location.description:
Filled with sclavi up from Se and Asta. You will need either a skilled lockpicker or a key from the other Swamp Temple, located in the swamps of Osteth, to get in.
- Lslayer

location.name: Drudge Nest
location.description: A small family of drudges can be found hiding here.

location.name: Dungeon Manor
location.description:
Quest(s): Sword of Lost Light.
The Worn Rusty Key that is needed for the Sword of Lost Light Quest is found on a Drudge Slave in this dungeon.

location.name: Eastham Sewer
location.description:
Quest(s): Eastham Sewer.
Shreths and drudges skulk here living off the waste of Eastham.

location.name: Enkindled Souls
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
The Alloy Utensil that is used in the Undead Mechanic is found after some lever pulling.
location.monsters: Skeleton Wraith, Lich Lord, Revenant

location.name: Forbidden Crypts
location.description:
Quest(s): Rumor: The Forbidden Crypts.
This dungeon used to be, in the old days, the leveling ground especially for Life Mages. With the update, the level requirement changed from 8+ to 15+, and also the creatures inside received an upgrade. The dungeon is usually empty now.
Forbidden Crypts -- The place I speak of is so named to remind those who dare to enter: This tomb is not for them to plunder! The ancient spirits found within do not rest peacefully. The entrance to the crypts is southwest of Al-Jalima, near 6.5N 3E - but I strongly advise both mighty adventurers and lowly thieves to stay far away!
- A "friend" from Al-Jalima.
location.monsters: Lich Lords, Liches, Skeleton Lords, Zombies, Skeleton Warriors, Silver rats, Horrible Mu-miyah, Skeleton Wraiths and the odd Revenant

location.name: Forking Trail
location.description: In the first months of the game this dungeon contained a high-level chest, which was about the only place where you could obtain 100+AL armor. Subsequently the chest was nerfed so people stopped going there.

location.name: Glenden Wood Dungeon
location.description:
Quest(s): Glenden Wood Dungeon, Undead Mechanic.
You need to have Lockpick, or gather the Glenden Wood Dungeon Key 1, Glenden Wood Dungeon Key 2 and Glenden Wood Dungeon Key 3 to get to the Alloy Tool.
location.monsters: Drudge Slave, Banderling Blade, Shore Armoredillo, Banderling Ogre, Silver Rat, Auroch Fire Cow, Auroch Fire Bull, Lich, Granite Golem

location.name: North Glenden Prison
location.description:
This dungeon played a major role in the Live Event of Ashes and Dust in which Antius Blackmoor died.
Since this patch, the restriction is 80+.
The dungeon gives access to the Commander's Quarters (100+), where Commander Kurth was beaten during above mentioned Live Event.
location.monsters: Viamontian Tribunes, Abhorrent Eaters, etc.

location.name: A Mysterious Cave
location.description:
Updated during A Small Victory with Drudges, higher level Golems and a runed chest (difficulty 100). The level restriction was also raised from 8+ to 15+.
Image submitted by Char'Med, WE. Thanks!

location.name: Grievous Vault
location.description:
Quest(s): Silifi of Crimson Stars.
One of the Rubies used to improve the Silifi of Crimson Stars can be found at the end of this dungeon.
The Ruby Mahwan
The fourth Crimson Star Ruby, pulsing with magical energy. When attached to the Silifi of Crimson Stars, this Ruby adds a Defender enchantment to the weapon.

location.name: Halls of the Helm
location.description:
Quest(s): Superior Helmet and Fiery Shield.
Many undead guard this place. Rumor is that a mighty guardian waits for those foolish enough to try and claim the Helm.
location.monsters: Undead, Zombies, Lich, Guardian of the Helm

location.name: Hebian-to Sewers
location.description: Wasps, rats, zombies, and Armoredillos are just a few of the dangers awaiting you in this filthy den.

location.name: Inner Dungeon
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
Lockpick is required to get to the Alloy Motor that is used in the Undead Mechanic quest.
At the bottom, there are 3 portals to Hebian-To, Eastham and Zaikhal.
location.monsters: Unruly Monouga, Terrible Monouga, Guardian Mu-Miyah, Nomad Mu-Miyah

location.name: Knath Lair
location.description:
Quest(s): Fiun Healing Machine, House Plants.
Be prepared for jello...

location.name: Lakeside Lair
location.description: A small dungeon along the edge of the River Prosper. It is populated by low level Mosswarts.

location.name: Tibri`s Cave
location.description:
Quest(s): Tibri's Fire Spear.
This cave, full of Banderlings and Black Rats, is the home to Tibri the Cave Dweller. Her Fire Spear may be found within, as well as news of a mythical sword. Bring her a Note from Iquba for directions to the cave which holds the 7th key.
- Maggie the Jackcat

location.name: Lost Garden Ruin
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
The Alloy Engine that is used in the Undead Mechanic is found at the top of the dungeon.
location.monsters: Pandemonium Shadow, Great Skeleton, Cursed Bones, Paroxysm Shadow

location.name: Lugian Outpost
location.description: As you would expect, this area is filled with Lugians.

location.name: Lugian Post
location.description: As you would expect, this area is filled with Lugians.

location.name: Dungeon Maggreth
location.description:
Old dungeon from the days when Lytelthorpe was a starter town.
Contains drudges, rats, and shreths.

location.name: Mattekar Cave
location.description: Quest(s): Housing Item (Mattekar Hide Sleeves).

location.name: Dungeon Mei
location.description: Contains undead, zombies, rats, drudges, and a lich.

location.name: Mite Maze
location.description: Quest(s): Harlune's Diplomacy, Branith's Stolen Possessions, Water of Mount Lethe.
location.monsters: Mite Digger, Mite Scion, Mite Sentry, Mite Squire, Mite Squib, Mite Matron, Male Tusker, Black Rat, Green Wasp

location.name: Mite Tunnels
location.description: Beware of the mites guarding their matron.

location.name: A Mosswart Nest
location.description: A small area with several Mosswarts inside.

location.name: Mount Lethe Lava Tubes
location.description:
Quest(s): Becoming a Player Killer.
This dangerous place is rumored to be sacred to the demon that plagued Dereth. Be wary of his minions - the virindi, golems, black drudges, and skeletons.

location.name: Mount Naipenset
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
The Alloy Generator that is used in the Undead Mechanic is found after opening doors with a floor plate.
location.monsters: Contains many different types of golems.

location.name: Mountain Halls
location.description: The lifestone near this dungeon will shorten your run back to the many golems, zefirs, black drudges, and rats within.

location.name: Mountain Keep
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
The Alloy Sprocket that is used in the Undead Mechanic is found after either some precision jumping (go left from drop, jump over the pit into the next corridor), or a lot of lever pulling.
location.monsters: Dread Mu-Miyah

location.name: Mountain Sewer
location.description:
Quest(s): Asheron's Departure Lower, Hunter Quests (Kilif Zefirs).
This dungeon has been in-game for a long time and features a small town in the very bottom levels, complete with a lifestone! Full of Zefirs, this is a good place to complete Hunter Quest (Kilif Zefirs) (bring your Magic Defense!). In Cold Tracks the dungeon was updated for Asheron's Departure Lower.
NPCs:
Archmage Peddler Weaponsmith

location.name: Nevius Passage
location.description: Be prepared to fight reedsharks before entering the passage.

location.name: Old Mine
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
You will need lockpick to get to the Alloy Piston that is used in the Undead Mechanic quest.
location.monsters: Gigas Raider, Gotrok Montok, Wasteland Rat, Revenant, Dark Magus

location.name: Old Talisman
location.description:
Quest(s): Becoming a Player Killer.
Those who wish to walk the path of the Hopeslayer, may find an altar to worship at inside.

location.name: Lair of Death
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Weapons.
A portal to the Deeper Catacombs and a Note from a Scout are found at the bottom of this dungeon. The note can be turned into the Royal Guard in Cragstone for 50,000xp. The Deeper Catacombs leads you to the Catacombs of Opposition where the parts and NPCs for the Olthoi Weapons quest are found.

location.name: Olthoi Tunnels
location.description: Original dungeon where early adventurers used to meet to perch Olthoi - it used to be the only place to kill an Olthoi Noble. Now it contains a portal to Deeper Catacombs and has significantly more difficult inhabitants.

location.name: Phyntos Menace
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
In a room at the top of the dungeon is the Alloy Turbine, part of the Undead Mechanic Quest.
Excellent hunting ground for characters 20-60, and prodigious amounts of salvage (ceramic, marble, velvet, linen, wool, red garnet, black garnet, steel, iron, bronze, brass, ivory, porcelain, granite).
location.monsters: Harrower Grievver, White Phyntos Wasp

location.name: The Pit
location.description:
Quest(s): Suzuhara Baijin's Care Package.
There is a large hole that passes through all levels of the dungeon. At the bottom is a portal to Beach Fort and an Exploration Marker.
location.monsters: Pugnacious, Bloodthirsty, Merciless Monouga, Armored Skeleton, Skeletal Hero, Direland Rat, Lich, Phantasm, Revenant

location.name: Reedshark Lair
location.description:
Quest(s): The Writings of Jhong Mi.
This dungeon contains one of the Writings of Jhong Mi. It is also the only dungeon in game that contains a spawn of Spiny Armoredillos, they drop Small Armoredillo Hides which are used to make Armoredillo Hide Bracers - one of the house purchasing items.
Thank you, GreenEyes.

location.name: Saadia`s Retreat
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
The Alloy Implement that is used in the Undead Mechanic is found in a dead end near the pit.
location.monsters: Mosswart Fanatic, Mosswart Idolator, Silver Rat, Mosswart Soul Trapper

location.name: Sclavus Keep
location.description: The strange lizard men - the Sclavus - hold this place. Be wary of the Zefirs that can also be found here.

location.name: Seaside Lair
location.description: Gromnies can be found here.

location.name: Dungeon of Shadows
location.description: This dungeon has two parts. The top part is populated mainly by Mosswarts and Rats. The bottom cave-like area is populated by Shreths and Rats. Near the end of the dungeon you will find 2 Shadow Children (hence why its called the "Dungeon of Shadows") and a Ghost Wisp. .

location.name: Shoushi Grotto
location.description:
Quest(s): Sword of Lost Light.
The Worn Old Key that is needed for the Sword of Lost Light Quest is found on a Drudge Slave in this dungeon.
location.monsters: Drudge Slaves.

location.name: A Ruin
location.description: Contains various mites.
location.monsters: Mite Scamp, Mite Scion, Mite Snippet, Skeleton Warrior

location.name: A Ruin
location.description: Contains drudges and wasps.
location.monsters: Drudge Sneaker

location.name: Smuggler's Hideaway
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
The Alloy Contrivance that is used in the Undead Mechanic can be found after hanging right from drop, and stepping on a trigger plate shaped like a little rock.
location.monsters: Banderling Striker, Banderling Bandit, Opor Niffis

location.name: Sylsfear Dungeon
location.description:
Quest(s): Silifi of Crimson Stars.
There are two keys that open the locked doors (resistance 583) in the this dungeon.
The Worn Key opens a door in the west passage out of drop room. It leads to the area where the Laboratory Supply Chest is found. The Laboratory Key used to open the chest is found on a Revenant at the end of the south passage from the drop room (make a right turn at the Dusty Sign). No key is needed to reach the Revenant.
The Weathered Red Key opens a door in the south passage out of the drop room. It leads to the area where the undead Wari al Sha'im is found. It drops The Ruby Al-Khur used in the Silifi of Crimson Stars Quest.
A Direlands Midland Portal can be found on the lowers level which can be used as a possible shortcut to Candeth Keep. No key is needed to get to it.

location.name: Syliph Tower
location.description: Contains banderlings and armoredillos.

location.name: Dungeon of Tatters
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
The Alloy Cylinder that is used in the Undead Mechanic is found at the end of the dungeon.
location.monsters: Dark Revenant, Dark Leech, Shadow Lieutenant, Mist Golem

location.name: Thasali Dungeon
location.description: Black and desert rats just inside. Skeleton warriors and a skeleton lord deeper inside...

location.name: Colier
location.description: This town has been abandoned since the baron was taken prisoner by the banderlings that now overrun it. Beware of the wood golems, mites, banderlings, and tuskers that swarm the hills nearby.

location.name: Empyrean Power Station
location.description: Shadows guard this Empyrean relic. Who know what purpose it truly serves?

location.name: Mountain Retreat
location.description: A couple vendors and a collector make this castle their home. Its origins are unknown, but it has become a popular stopping place for those preparing to making their way across the mountains of Northern Osteth.

location.name: Portal to Hilltop
location.description: Be careful when exiting this portal. Many Drudges, up to Drudge Prowlers, can often be found waiting for an unsuspecting adventure at the other end of this portal.

location.name: Undead Shrine
location.description: These twin temples are the home to a pair of liches.

location.name: Stonehold
location.description: Stonehold is a small village tucked in the western edge of the Esper Mountain Range in northern Osteth. The town is home to a few useful NPCs: Belinda du Loc, who gives out kill tasks for banished, fallen, and rare game creatures, Zahir who gives out a kill task for elementals, and a lugian student of Nuhmudira who sells portal gems to the distant Knorr Lyceum. Being so far away from any other human settlement, Stonehold's settlement portals also cover a wide area of northwestern Osteth.

location.name: Beach Fort Outpost
location.description: An small, walled outpost located at 76.0N, 49.1W on the western shore of Northern Osteth. The main attraction is Feruza ibn Salaq, the NPC that refines Chorizite and will exchange Pyreal Bars for Ring and Wall spells. There is a large Moarsman Temple just south down the coast. During the Shattered Lines event Moarsmen invaded the fort during a live event.

location.name: Plateau Village
location.description: Plateau village is a settlement atop a large plateau in the northwestern area of Osteth. There is a spice merchant here, and the scroll vendors sell level 5s. Anyone looking to explore the halls of Frore will have to bring their translated Dericost runes here to get a portal summoned. There is also a nearby wedding site.

location.name: Northern Pass Watchtower
location.description: This lonely tower guards this pass between steep ridges on the way to Mt. Esper.

location.name: Thieves` Den
location.description:
Quest(s): Gertarh's Dagger, Undead Mechanic.
The Alloy Cogwheel that is used in the Undead Mechanic quest spawns at the very bottom of this dungeon. Jump into various pits to get to it.
Used to contain the Banderling NPC Gertarh who sold Gertarh's Dagger (now retired because Gertarh was killed by Oswald during the Thorns Of The Hopeslayer Event).
The dagger was also found in the Ancient Lighthouse behind a locked door.
location.monsters: Banderling Rogue, Banderling Bandit, Skeleton Bone Knight, Drudge Stalker

location.name: Trothyr's Rest
location.description:
Quest(s): Trothyr's Rest.
- Bryan G.

location.name: Tumerok Base
location.description: Contains tumeroks, golems, reedsharsk, banderlings, and drudges.

location.name: Tumerok Chamber
location.description: Contains tumeroks and drudges.

location.name: Tumerok Dungeon
location.description: Contains tumeroks, rats, banderlings, and skeletons.

location.name: Tumerok Fortress
location.description:
Quest(s): Overlord's Sword.
The entrance to this dungeon can be found in the NE Tower in the 12.3N, 73.7W - Tumerok Fort.
This dungeon is the base of the Tumerok Overlord who carries the Overlord's Sword and Overlord's Key.
The Gilded Tumerok Key is used to access the Overlord's Lair which can also be found in this dungeon in a chest.

location.name: Cave
location.description: Contains tumeroks and drudges.

location.name: Tumerok Mine
location.description:
Quest(s): Overlord's Sword.
Contains tumeroks, drudges, and a lich or two.

location.name: Tumerok Outpost
location.description: Contains tumeroks, reedsharks, and banderlings.

location.name: Small Complex
location.description:
Quest(s): Renegade Herbal Kits.
Captain Waliknua can be found in this dungeon, he carries one of the Renegade Strong Iron Keys.

location.name: Tumerok Hideout
location.description: Contains tumeroks and rats.

location.name: Underground City
location.description:
Quest(s):Ice Tachi, The Black Death Catacombs Quiddity Seed, Thorsten Cragstone's Armor and Axe.
The Underground City is exactly what it's name says.. a city underground. It is actually a dungeon, access by Sub or the Isle of Tears.
As implicated by some sayings of the NPCs, it was a hiding place for humankind during the Olthoi Reign.
It contains a few shopkeepers, and gives access to the dungeon Hidden Dungeon.
Also in the dungeon the Ice Tachi can be found.
Last but not least, two of the Strange Devices for the The Black Death Catacombs Quiddity Seed are found here.
NPCs:
Archmage Mah bint Dirid Arina of the Arms Gailadu the Scribe Grethoric of all Trades Henrid the Grocer Healer Lithinia of Chiran Shunju Shinjin the Weaponsmith
Portals:
Underground City to Isle of Tears.

location.name: Virindi Fort
location.description: Found near the Black Hill Lich Tower, this place is crawling with Virindi, Tuskers, and Zefirs.

location.name: Web Maze
location.description:
Quest(s): Directions to Web Maze.
This place was once a nest for the Olthoi. It's now overrun by drudges. You can still locate the portals that the Olthoi once used to attack the towns of Hebian-to, Shoushi, and Mayoi.

location.name: Winthura's Garden
location.description:
Contains tumeroks of all kinds as well as a few scattered monougas. While the tumerok workers won't pose much of a challenge for a small, organized force, there are some fighters and even priests deeper in.
There's an exit portal right next to the entrance location in the dungeon. However, to gain access to the dungeon proper, you'll have to jump into a small pit that can't be easily climbed back out of. So make sure you're ready before taking that first step.

location.name: Witshire Dungeon
location.description:
Quest(s): Elysa's Favor.
This is an old AC dungeon that was updated as part of the Elysa's Favor quest. Fort Witshire where the original portal is has been barricaded so the dungeon can now only be reached by using the Underground Passage portals located inside an Advocate Tower in the 3 Starter Towns.
You must be flagged by the NPC near the portal in order to enter.

location.name: Yanshi Tunnels
location.description:
Quest(s): Sword of Lost Light, The Writings of Jhong Mi.
This dungeon is still in its original position despite the destruction of Old Yanshi by Gaerlan and the Harbinger. Therefore it is a slightly longer run to the dungeon from the new Yanshi which is located west of the ruins by the festival grounds.
The Worn Plain Key that is needed for the Sword of Lost Light Quest is found on a Drudge Slave in this dungeon. One of the Writings of Jhong Mi is also found here inside a chest.

location.name: Obsidian Enchanter (Samsur)
location.description: Obsidian Enchanters craft items from Obsidian Jewels and Obsidian Spheres. Each NPC gives a different reward.

location.name: Obsidian Enchantress (Hebian-To)
location.description: Obsidian Enchanters craft items from Obsidian Jewels and Obsidian Spheres. Each NPC gives a different reward.

location.name: Stonehold to Heartland
location.description: Passage from Stonehold to a place near Fort Witshir. One Way only.

location.name: Dungeon Muddy
location.description: Early, low-level dungeon now updated with level 20-ish critters. Some chests and stamina pools inside - not much else.

location.name: Braid Mansion Ruin
location.description:
Quest(s): Lou Ka's Stolen Items, Shoushi Starter Quests.
This is a good adventure for someone who is newly arrived in Dereth.
location.monsters: Red Phyntos Wasps, Gnawer Shreths, Outcast Monoguas

location.name: Green Mire Grave
location.description:
Quest(s): Green Mire Grave.
Resting place of the Green Mire Warrior, a famous Sho Spearman
After collecting and using quite a few keys, the Green Mire Yari and the Green Mire Yoroi Cuirass can be found. Return to Hiro Ishigame in Shoushi to get these items repaired.

location.name: Holtburg Lifestone
location.description: Located off the road, just east of Holtburg.

location.name: Peddler
location.description: Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.

location.name: Mosswart Bunker
location.description: Inside lies a runed chest.

location.name: Banderling Fortress
location.description: Banderlings have overrun this ancient fortress, claiming it as their own. Do not approach this area except in force. Even if you breach the outer forces, be prepared for the tumeroks that wait within.

location.name: Ice Golem Shrine
location.description: Several ice golems surround this standing stone for some unknown reason.

location.name: Abandoned Sho Building
location.description: A completely empty Sho building on the side of the road from Shoushi to Hebian-To. There is a small stretch of road behind the house as well, but it does not connect to the main path.

location.name: Hebian-to Library
location.description: This structure contains a librarian and a translator who specializes in the culture of the Falatacot.

location.name: Incomplete Menhir Ring
location.description:
Quest(s): Menhir Mana Fields # 12.
These stones mark the crossroads near Zaikhal.

location.name: Crypt of Ashen Tears
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
The dungeon is quite complex. To reach the Alloy Mechanism, take the S exit from drop and just hang left.
location.monsters: Lich Lord, Banderling Striker, Gold Phyntos Wasp, Sewer Rat

location.name: Merchant
location.description: This merchant has pitched his tent and offers his goods to those that happen to come by...

location.name: Monouga Stronghold
location.description: A small pack of monougas have laid claim to this dwelling and defend it violently.

location.name: Lilly of Glenden Wood
location.description:
Quest(s): Lady Aerfalle Quest, Sword of Lost Light Quest.
Lilly of Glenden Wood tells you, "I use Auroch horns in the making of my potions. I discovered how to use Mattekar horns to produce health elixirs and Sunflowers to make Sunflower oil."
Lilly of Glenden Wood tells you, "If you give me a horn, I'll give you some of my potion in return. If you give me a Sunflower I'll give you some Sunflower oil."

location.name: Farmer's House
location.description: A farmer has moved into this once abandoned house and sells a variety of items.

location.name: Crater Lair
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Weapons.
A fairly small dungeon populated by mid level olthoi. This was one of the first Olthoi dungeons in game. At the end of the dungeon is a portal to the Deeper Catacombs (Crater Lair) (Restricted to level 30+ characters).
location.monsters: Olthoi, Eviscerator, Noble, Soldier

location.name: Rat Cave
location.description: A small cave that is now the residence of various rats. Black and Silver all living in harmony, gathering seeds and fruit, making little rat homes...

location.name: Sho Spire
location.description: A Sho spire in the hills near Shoushi. Whoever lived here was killed by something, and only their skeletons remain. Now drudges live here. Generic Rumors and parchment can be found here.

location.name: Shreth Cave
location.description: This small cave is home to a pack of shreths. Hunter Shreths and Vorous Shreths are found within and nearby. Be careful because combat will draw other shreths from nearby to come and aid their fellows.

location.name: Golem Cave
location.description: A trio of sandstone golems can usually be found within this cave guarding its small shrine. Be equally careful of the numerous creatures that are usually found around the cave, including drudges, mosswarts and shreths.
location.monsters: Sandstone Golems

location.name: Drudge Houses
location.description: These two Sho dwellings have had their occupants driven out by the drudges who now call it home.

location.name: Rabbit Shrine
location.description: No one is quite sure why the rabbits appear to like this tranquil shrine so much. Is there some yet undiscovered secret about rabbits and their place in the universe? Does rabbit go well with thyme? Many questions remain unanswered...

location.name: Drudge Bunker
location.description: A small group of drudges have made this bunker their home. No cakes and tea here though.

location.name: Cragstone Lifestone
location.description: At least you return to life with sand between your toes and the surf in your ears!

location.name: Walled Fort to Accursed Halls
location.description: Portal located in a Direlands walled fort that will take you outside the Accursed Halls. Notice the convenient ladders!

location.name: Accursed Halls to Walled Fort
location.description: Portal to the walled fort containing portals in the Direlands.

location.name: Wai Jhou to Sho Roadside
location.description: Thanks to BBQ Bob for pointing out an error in this entry which has now been corrected.

location.name: Abandoned House
location.description: An abandoned house near Yanshi that has been taken over by undead and zombies.

location.name: Dungeon Nye
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
The Alloy Dynamo that is used in the Undead Mechanic is found in a secret corridor.
location.monsters: Drudge Ravener, High Mu-Miyah

location.name: Lytelthorpe Lifestone
location.description: Located on a hill just northeast of the castle.

location.name: Ruined Cave Outpost
location.description:
Quest(s): Beltslora's Pretty Shirt.
The first level is infested with shreths, while decending you may find an assortment of drudges.
- Phil S.

location.name: Forgotten Temple
location.description: Quest(s): Ercel's Lost Book.

location.name: West Lytelthorpe Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. It was destroyed by Martine during The First Strike event.

location.name: East Lytelthorpe Outpost
location.description: One of the old starter outposts where new arrivals to Dereth would appear. It was destroyed by Martine during The First Strike event. This outpost has a long row of Empyrean Pillars that lead to the nearby Forgotten Temple.

location.name: Healer
location.description: This lonely healer provides exceptional goods and services.

location.name: Mosswart Shrine
location.description: A band of Mosswarts seem to have decided that this Empyrean Shrine is now theirs.

location.name: Empyrean Lookout
location.description: This partial wall in the wilderness does not appear to serve any real purpose. What it was constructed for is a mystery.

location.name: Stone Circle
location.description: These empyrean stones form a circle. One can only wonder what their purpose once was.

location.name: Westward Portal
location.description: Take care when entering this portal. There are usually creatures on the other side. It's not a far jump though.

location.name: Mosswart Shrine
location.description: A pack of mosswarts (1 shaman, 2 muckers, a couple barkers, and a few feeders and mudlurks) can usually be found making camp at this location.

location.name: Peddler
location.description: He's a pleasant fellow. Doesn't have a lot on stock, but we had some nice chats and watched the dilloes playfully rolling down the snowy slopes... - Soulitaire

location.name: Thieves' Galleries
location.description:
Nearby there lies a cave which was used by a band of thieves with more stealth than strength. They had stolen a large quantity of art, and has stashed it there until they could sell it off. Unfortunately, a group of Banderlings wanted the cave for their own. The paintings may still be found there. Head southeast along the road, past the lifestone. You will see a bend in the road with a tree. Walk outwards in the direction of the point of the road - a series of yellow flower bushes lead into the forest. When you come to a clearing, you should see the portal.
-- Vuo Nin
Contains mostly Banderling Ravers. Total dungeon only has about 15 banderlings and 2 chests.
- Merl the Weak, Leafcull

location.name: Festival Stone of Midsong
location.description:
Can't find this location. Must have been moved elsewhere...
- Soulitaire, CoD cartographer, April 2000

location.name: Mite Bunker
location.description: An underground bunker containing a large number of various mites.

location.name: Advocate Dungeon
location.description: A portal that use to exist around 28.6s 78.1e that was level restricted to 126 before levels seemed remotely possible.

location.name: Festival Stone of Foredawn
location.description:
"The Stone of Foredawn lies east of Shoushi, near 75.5E, 33.9S. This Stone appears to be the only one whose attendant temple facilities have survived the depredations of time."
- Alatar Locke, The Festival Stones of the Empyreans
