Two rows of Empyrean Pillars, each 12 pillars long, stretch across the river from 33.8S, 75.1E to 33.8S, 75.7E to reach the Festival stone, located at 33.8S, 76.2E. Some of the pillars are broken. The ones that are not have an eternal flame burning atop them.
Behind the Festival stone is a Meeting Hall Style Building at 33.8S, 76.4E with a tree growing in the center of it. The four stone pillars in the corners have flowering vines growing up their sides, with flowers on the top of the pillars as well.

location.name: Farmer
location.description: This farmer sells various cooking goods and foodstuffs.

location.name: Underground Bunker
location.description: An empty bunker.

location.name: Archmage
location.description: A rather out of the way Archmage with a limited selection of goods.

location.name: Archmage Lifestone
location.description: Being out alone in the wilderness, the archmage next door might be using this stone a lot...

location.name: Fort Aimaru
location.description: This Sho fortress is now home to a clan of mosswarts. Inside they guard a runed chest.

location.name: Grilhud the Hermit
location.description: Grilhud is an ornery old cuss. But he says that if you bring him a broken sigil he'll open a portal that will put you on the path to becoming a player killer.

location.name: Kara
location.description:
Kara is a remote Sho village in the far southern Linvak Mountain Range. The area consists of lower foothills and a chain of mid-sized lakes.
For many years it was very difficult to reach do to lack of portal access. Recently, however, a portal to Kara has been added to Shoushi as well as Umbral Hall.

location.name: Abandoned Tower and Temples
location.description: An ancient tower, a temple and some shelters that all have been overrun by zefirs, zombies, rats and wisps.

location.name: Abandoned Sho Outpost
location.description: Two abandoned houses with a lifestone and a one way portal to Eastham.

location.name: Renegate Stronghold to Eastham
location.description: A one way portal to the town of Eastham located next to two abandoned houses and a lifestone.

location.name: Ancient Lighthouse
location.description:
Quest(s): Premonitions of the Fourth Sending of Darkness.
A Direlands lighthouse which has been taken over by tumeroks.
Translated History Book (Dusty Volume) can be found in this dungeon on the 9th floor.
Thanks to Falkon for the info and the image.

location.name: Tower
location.description: A tower overrun with banderlings.

location.name: Kara to Sho Roadside
location.description: Arrives on the roadside between Sawato and Shoushi

location.name: Peddler (Sho Roadside)
location.description: Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.

location.name: Small Temple
location.description: A small temple with a strange pool of water.

location.name: Neydisa Castle Lifestone
location.description: This lifestone sits in the inner courtyard of Neydisa Castle.

location.name: Mage Academy
location.description:
Quest(s): Lady Jaera's Tomb Quest.
An academy for mages once run by Lord Rytheran and Lady Jaera. Lord Rytheran has since left and Rytheran's Apprentice now lurks in the Library.
location.monsters: Dark Wisp, Ghost Wisp, Jibrit Zefir, Kilif Zefir, Zofrit Zefir, Swamp Rat, Copper Golem, Iron Golem, Wood Golem, Sandstone Golem, Granite Golem, Ice Golem, Young Banderling, Banderling Scout, Banderling Guard, Banderling Raider, Banderling Raver, Banderling Captain, Skeleton Warrior, Skeleton Captain, Lich Lord, Lord Rytheran, Shadow Child, Shadow, K'nath N'gell, K'nath N'osaj

location.name: Portal to the North Direlands
location.description: Arrival coordinates submitted by Chris T. - Thanks!

location.name: Khayyaban Lifestone
location.description: Location submitted by Hin Lijai. Thanks! Thanks to Elegy of Solclaim for an updated picture!

location.name: Bandit Castle Lifestone
location.description: Location submitted by Ryan Idol. Thanks!

location.name: Rithwic Lifestone
location.description: Submitted by Ryan Idol

location.name: Collector
location.description: Collector tells you, "I'm interested in monster trophies from many of the monsters that plague Dereth. If you give me such items, I will reward you with money or an item. With regret, I don't deal in hides."

location.name: Twin Cabins Lifestone
location.description: This lovely blue lifestone is settled in between two Aluvian cabins.

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: A lifestone located near a small temple and bunker housing a healer and a peddler.

location.name: Healer and Peddler
location.description: A wilderness healer and peddler living in a bunker. Also nearby are a small temple and a lifestone.

location.name: Bandit Castle to Eotensfang
location.description: Location submitted by Ming-ti. Thanks!

location.name: Mountain Shortcut
location.description: An area in the mountains just North of Arwic. The odd name has its origin in the portal from Arwic... The area is home to mattekars, mites, mounougas and occasionally olthoi. Portals to the Mite Maze and the Lair of Death are found nearby.

location.name: Arwic to Mountain Shortcut
location.description: A quick shortcut (as the name implies) to the mountains North of Arwic. A return portal in the area gets you back in no time.

location.name: Fort Tethana
location.description: A large fort with numerous enemies such as Iron, Granite and Copper golems, Tusker Slaves, and Virindi Servants and Puppets. Right next to the fort along the wall you can see Gold wasps. There are also many of the higher level drudges such as Lurkers, Raveners and Stalkers about. Inside the place is a hive of people with everything from a Tumerok collector to a Blacksmith selling plate. To the West of the fort is the mage shop where Suikan Robes can be bought from an old hermit. Many of the prices are insanely high but overall it's a wonderful place. - Juliette A.

location.name: Sawato Swamp Lifestone
location.description: A bit Northwest of Sawato in the swamp. Bring high boots...

location.name: Mosswart Cave
location.description: A cave that has become home to a small group of mosswarts.

location.name: Abandoned House
location.description: An abandoned house that is overrun with drudges.

location.name: Neydisa Castle Ivory Crafter
location.description: The entrance to the tower this crafter lives in can only be opened by entering the center of the nearby stone circle (69.6n, 16.5e). Be wary of the woodgolem that guards the tower door as well as the etheral wisps that occupy the circle.

location.name: Crater Pathway (Lower Entrance)
location.description: This zefir-infested maze winds through the mountain and exists in Crater Lake Village. Beware of the dark wisps that also reside here. If you can escape the zefirs, the wisps might get you instead...

location.name: Twin Cabins
location.description: These twin cabins and their nearby lifestone make a welcome oasis in the northern wilderness.

location.name: Lightless Catacombs
location.description:
Quest(s): Premonitions of the Fourth Sending of Darkness, Staff of the Nomads.
A Dark Note and part of the Staff of the Nomads can be found in this dungeon.

location.name: Fort Tethana Lifestone
location.description: Location corrected by Falkon, Field Surveyor. Thanks!

location.name: Undead Shrine
location.description: Several zombies guard a chest with their unending vigil.

location.name: Empyrean Ruins
location.description: A small site with an Empyrean Three-legged Arch, 2 Empyrean Columns. One of the Aun Golem Hunters has made his camp here.

location.name: A Cave
location.description:
This small cave holds little adventure for the experienced warrior, but it may provide some diversion to those looking to test their novice skills.
This small cave holds little adventure for the experienced warrior, but it may provide some diversion to those looking to test their novice skills.
Note: This entrance leads to the same dungeon as A Cave at 18.4N 58.1E

location.name: Abandoned Cottage
location.description: This empty Cottage may once have been the home of the caretakers of the nearby orchard.

location.name: Empyrean Landmark
location.description: An Empyrean Landmark near Eastham, consisting of a few Pillars and a structure having the looks of a derelict lifestone. During the Who Watches the Virindi? event, an Exploration Marker was added. Nothing particularly interesting nearby.

location.name: Adventurer's Haven
location.description:
This empty dungeon with its lifestone and portals to Samsur, Yanshi, and Lytelthorpe makes for a perfect haven for the weary adventurer. There`s no tavern though... :o(
* Lytelthorpe * Yanshi * Samsur

location.name: Adventurer`s Haven to Town Network
location.description: This portal goes to Town Network Portal Hub

location.name: Adventurer`s Haven to Yanshi
location.description: This portal goes to the Sho town of Yanshi on the edges of the Blackmire swamp. The original town was devestated by the Harbinger, who still lurks deep beneath the surfac. This is a good town for characters over level 10, but stay away from the Harbinger.

location.name: Adventurer`s Haven Lifestone
location.description: This beautiful lifestone greets those that come back the fast way ;o)

location.name: Hidden Valley to Mayoi
location.description: Once you find your way into this hidden valley the portal to Mayoi will give you a quick trip back to civilization. If you find yourself on the ridge overlooking this valley, you can climb down at 54.3n, 4.3w.

location.name: Hidden Valley to Desert Ridge Border
location.description: Once you find your way into this hidden valley the portal to the Desert Ridge Border will give you a quick trip into the Yanshi area. If you find yourself on the ridge overlooking this valley, you can climb down at 54.3n, 4.3w.

location.name: Hidden Valley to Holtburg
location.description: Once you find your way into this hidden valley the portal to Holtburg will give you a quick trip back to shelter, warm food and people. If you find yourself on the ridge overlooking this valley, you can climb down at 54.3n, 4.3w.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Rithwic)
location.description:
Watch her chimney! It belches fire - most strange...
If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Roaming Bowyer
location.description: This roaming vendor has set up camp near Rithwic where she sells various archery supplies along with her speciality, armor piercing arrows.

location.name: Farmer
location.description: This vendor near Yanshi supplies food and basic cooking items.

location.name: Rat Infested House
location.description: This Sho dwelling has been abandoned by its former owners and left to the white rats that now infest it.

location.name: Drudge Cave
location.description:
A pack of drudge skulkers guard a chest in this small cave.
Image submitted by Katie M. Thanks!

location.name: Sho Tower
location.description: What once appears to have been a watch tower is now crawling with drudge skulkers.

location.name: Drudge House
location.description: Yet another Sho dwelling that has been overrun by drudges.

location.name: Mosswart House
location.description: Seems like the Yanshi residents have seen better times. Here's yet another abandoned dwelling, this one overrun by mosswarts.

location.name: Undead Ruins
location.description: Several undead are usually found lurking about these strange ruins.

location.name: Mosswart Bunker
location.description: One of several structures that contain mosswarts in this area.

location.name: Mosswart Bunker
location.description: One of several structures that contain mosswarts in this area.

location.name: Ancient Town to High Mountain Valley
Ancient Town Lifestone
location.description: This and the tattered ruins around it are all that remain of a once proud Empyrean town.

location.name: Ancient Town to Heartland
location.description: Arrives just South of Fort Witshire near Cragstone.

location.name: Mines of Despair
location.description:
Quest(s): Focusing Stone, Diemos Flagging, Crafter Golems.
A written history of the Mines of Despair.
Not long ago, in a time I remember as if it were just yesterday, the mines provided us with wealth and happiness. We were called to the mines in the name of greed and our insatiable desire for a life our ancestors set upon us. It was as if happiness itself was being mined from the rich veins in those tunnels. Every day we picked and cracked those tunnels open forcing them to reveal their wealth. Our wealth.
It was a glorious era. We had estates draped in gold and we wore clothes adorned with glitter and jewels. When we walked our feet fell upon walkways made of precious stone. When we drank it was from goblets of polished silver. The very essence of the mine oozed itself into our living rooms and we welcomed it as a child lost in the night.
Then the day came when we forced the mine to reveal much more than the wealth
It had been hiding from us. Our miners had broken down a wall revealing an ancient tunnel. We assumed the Empyreans erected it long ago, as we had found evidence of their prior existence in the mine before. In the beginning we expected to find chambers filled with ancient Empyrean riches. Perhaps even relics left behind. But when three seasoned miners didn't return from the tunnels we knew something sinister had happened.
Four of our best warriors entered the tunnels with the hope of finding the lost miners. At the very least, we wanted to know what awaited us down there. We still had visions of chambers glittering with treasure and rare relics. The following day we had our answer. Only one warrior emerged from the mine's opening, bruised and battered from a battle so fierce it should have left him dead. He stumbled forward and collapsed before our feet.
It took days before the warrior was well enough to speak. When his fever had finally broke, he told us what had happened in the tunnels below. There were no rooms glittering with treasure. No lost relics from a past civilization. The warrior spoke only of men who death had touched but had not taken. He spoke of rotted and fleshless men who had taken up arms in the name of something unearthly.
The decision soon came down from the town council. We were to abandon the mine and lock the entrance. The very thing that once sustained our town had destroyed us. It placed a pox upon everyone and everything. Our town coffers dried up, our crops died, and over time even the most stubborn person left town. Only I remain to tell this story and to warn others from entering the Mines of Despair.
-- Le-Ai Rea
Location submitted by Arjin of Morningthaw. Thanks!

location.name: Drudge Tower
location.description: A tower surrounded by and filled with drudges.

location.name: Skeleton Tower
location.description: A tower swarming with Skeleton Warriors.

location.name: Drudge Camp
location.description: Just two tents and the remains of a destroyed lifestone, now home to some drudges and rats.

location.name: A Ruin (Samsur)
location.monsters: Drudge Prowler, Drudge Skulker, Drudge Sneaker

location.name: Skeleton Tower
location.description: A tower filled with skeletons, skeleton warriors and Old bones.

location.name: Drudge Nest
location.description: Location and image submitted by Ryan Idol and Circeus. Thanks!

location.name: Hall of Lost Light
location.description:
Quest(s): Sword of Lost Light.
A dungeon full of liches, a granite golem, a few lich lords and the Guardian of Lost Light who drops the Sword of Lost Light (duh..)
- MystWolf

location.name: Underground Forest
location.description:
Banderlings and a water wisp were spotted here.
Lucy M. - Thanks!

location.name: Imuth Maer Doquin
location.description:
Quest(s): Asheron's Departure Lower.
A series of ancient Empyrean buildings populated by low level mosswarts and drudges located near the town of Yanshi.
Later on it was updated to include an alternative portal to the Wai Jhou Halls of Metos.

location.name: Leikotha`s Crypt
location.description: Here lies (uneasily) Leikotha.

location.name: Chapel Blackspire
location.description:
A Dais with a candle holder on it, next to a container of water, with rows of wooden benches, facing a Black Emperyean Spire.
Guinevere Du Avalon TD 11-11-2009

location.name: Le-Ai Rea's House
location.description: This cranky hermit appears to have a great hatred of the liches and undead in the abandoned mining town near the Mines of Despair. Perhaps his mood would be changed if he saw some evidence of the destruction of his enemies?

location.name: Master Shoyanen Kenchu the Archmage
location.description:
Sells at 110%, buys at 80%. Platinum Scarabs 44,000py.
Master Shoyanen Kenchu the Archmage tells you, "Welcome to my lonely tower."
Master Shoyanen Kenchu the Archmage tells you, "Travel with care in this land...Golems are coming in from the west."
Master Shoyanen Kenchu the Archmage tells you, "Good choice, my friend."
Master Shoyanen Kenchu the Archmage tells you, "This purchase favors you, friend.

location.name: Healer
location.description: Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.

location.name: Empty Platform
location.description: *shrug* Beats me. - Allen Grey

location.name: Farmer
location.description: This farmer, tired of the bustles of city life has decided to settle around a little used lifestone. He will sell food and cooking supplies to those that happen by.

location.name: Lugian Tower
location.description: This tower is now in the hands of several Lugians. Be wary when approaching it.

location.name: Banderling Keep
location.description: This small keep has fallen to the banderlings that now guard its walls. Approach with care as lugians come out of the mountains to trade with the banderlings and a captain commands the rag-tag garrison.

location.name: Lugian Roadhouse
location.description:
It can sometimes be tough to get in: Obeloth and Lithos Lugians are found inside as well as Mountain Rats, and more Lithos Lugians guard the entrance.
- Deidre Stormcaster of Solclaim

location.name: Desert Archmage to the Heartland
location.description: Arrives just south of Fort Witshire near Cragstone.

location.name: Revitalizing Fountain
location.description: Casts Revitalization I on whomever uses it.

location.name: Skeleton Cave
location.description: A small group of skeletons (having fallen victim to some unknown mishap) now spend eternity waiting silently in this cave. Approach with caution or you might wake them.

location.name: Abandoned Tower
location.description: One of two empty towers

location.name: Merchant
location.description: The small Aluvian home of a merchant that lives along the Southern ridge next to Holtburg. Limited supplies, but a nice view. -GePS

location.name: Sea Temple Catacombs
location.description:
Quest(s): Lubziklan al-Luq's Stolen Goods, Exploration Society Letters.
Many stolen goods can be found in this dungeon swarming with Drudges and Rats. The Yaraq Town Stamp can also be found just inside the entrance.

location.name: Drudge Tower
location.description:
Akyafi ibn Sumwar, the Translator says of this location:
I am a humble scholar from Zaikhal. Of late, we have heard of the unusually large number of Drudges in the hills around the Yaraq Cove. They seem to gather near the ruin of the Empyrean port on the far side of the cove, where the Mad Star flickers. Perhaps you could investigate, and bring me back something which would explain their presence?

location.name: Small Cave
location.description:
Filled with your garden variety drudges (and the occasional red phyntos wasp that seems to wander in), the name pretty much says it all. This is one cramped cave, even to house the small number of drudges that live here.
- Zinkyu

location.name: Skeleton Tomb
location.description:
Some skeletons and desert rats threaten visitors inside. An empty shrine next to it offers some shelter.
It is rumored that the Skelton Lord who lives deep within carries a ruby that protects the user from Lightning.

location.name: Desert Archmage
location.description: This traveling archmage doesn't have much in the way of components, but he does posses a great selection of mana stones at fair prices as well as a good stock of alchemical supplies.

location.name: Suntik Village
location.description:
To get to the village you have to go right around the mountain ridge on the North side, there you'll find a couple of posts showing the way up. In and around the village there are a lot of Crude Monougas, maybe 10-15 altogether, and a few Outcasts as well as the complementary drudge posse. Other than the Crude Monougas there isn't really anything that dangerous up here. A melee character of level 13+ should be able to solo it up here easily enough so long as you're careful not to get surrounded, the Crude Monougas have a pretty fast run too. Many of the Monougas are actually inside the buildings and on the roof and they seem to have the decency to stay there rather than jump down and swarm you so it's easy enough to pick your fights. Not really much in the way of loot though we were there for a couple of hours and picked up a couple of Acid Axes.
- Xvar, Garabaldi and Jun Tao, Harvestgain

location.name: Banderling Fort
location.description:
The origins of this fortress are a mystery. It appears to be of Isparian Construction but no one is sure who built it. One theory is that some faction of the Aluvians built the structure. However they discovered to their dismay that it was built atop some ancient Empyrean ruins. Shortly after it reached its current stage of construction undead began to appear in the fortress` cellars and harrass the trespassers, eventually driving them out.
At some point after that, a tribe of banderlings took up residence, thus making this one of the few locations where a banderling chief can be found. It`s assumed that while the zombies found here harass the banderling ravers, breeders, and raiders within and scouts and guards without, the banderlings pay them no mind, being content to just leave the cellars of the fort to the undead.

location.name: Wilderness Fort to Zaikhal
location.description: You'll need to find your way inside the walls of this wilderness fort, but once in, you'll find a safe path to Zaikhal and Hebian-To.

location.name: Undead Village
location.description: Numerous undead have overrun what was once a Gharu'ndim community. If you manage to make it this deep into the wilderness, don't plan on resting here. Even the dead don't rest in this place.

location.name: Stone Ring and Fountain
location.description: This stone circle contains a fountain which helps revitalize anyone who drinks from it (Revitalize Other I). Beware of the drudge pack that is known to frequent this location though.

location.name: Wai Jhou
location.description:
The Direlands town of Wai Jhou is little more than a single building wedged between the Black Hills and a rotting swamp. The area is filled with terrible creatures, the most fearsome of which are Virindi, tuskers, golems, and gromnies. The small building houses three shopkeepers, but beware, in this remote outpost prices are very high. All three women are followers of Jojii and are placid and welcoming despite their awful surroundings.
Ximi Nu, the weaponsmith sells a basic assortment of amour and weapons as befits her Sho heritage, as well as whatever odd rag-tag pieces that passing adventurers might sell to her. Be on your guard, though, as hapless customers are all too frequently attacked by creatures as they attempt to do their trading.
The healer, Kan Chi Gai, keeps a small counter here selling basic healing services and a few potions and healing supplies. Her kind words of support and warning will help heal the soul as well.
Dou Ran the mage is an odd zealot selling a limited supply of spell components and alchemical items. She will speak quixotically of the Disaster Maze which lies to the east of town, but one is left with the impression that she has been isolated in this remote wilderness for too long. She does, however, sell scrolls of lifestone recall, claiming to have learned the secrets of the spell while within the maze.
Thanks to Tamera of Frostfell for this location's details!

location.name: Accursed Halls
location.description: Quest(s): Becoming a Player Killer.

location.name: Rat Tower
location.description: A pack of black rats and their mountain rat cousins occupy this tower. Approach with caution as they have been known to swarm when distrubed.

location.name: Al-Arqas Meeting Hall
location.description: Thanks to Fastallia (of Morningthaw). This Meeting Hall was moved into town during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Al-Jalima Meeting Hall
location.description: Moved into town during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Baishi Meeting Hall
location.description:
This Meeting Hall is handy since it's so close to town. Travel to the mountain behind to find the closest lifestone.
Thanks to Steve N. and Kristofer of Morningthaw.

location.name: Cragstone Meeting Hall
location.description: Moved into town during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Eastham Meeting Hall
location.description: Thanks to Kristofer of Morningthaw. This Meeting Hall was moved into town durng the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Hebian-To Meeting Hall
location.description: This Meeting Hall was moved into town during the Mired Hearts event

location.name: Khayyaban Meeting Hall
location.description: This Meeting Hall was moved into town during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Lin Meeting Hall
location.description: Moved into town during the Mired Hearts event

location.name: Lytelthorpe Meeting Hall
location.description: This Meeting Hall was moved into town during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Mayoi Meeting Hall
location.description:
Moved into town during Mired Hearts.
Thanks Uzi-El.

location.name: Nanto Meeting Hall
location.description: Moved into town during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Qalaba'r Meeting Hall
location.description:
Moved into town during Mired Hearts.
Thanks Uzi-El.

location.name: Samsur Meeting Hall
location.description: Moved into town during Mired Hearts, May 2004.

location.name: Sawato Meeting Hall
location.description: This Meeting Hall was moved into town during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Shoushi Meeting Hall
location.description: Moved into town during Mired Hearts, May 2004.

location.name: Tou-Tou Meeting Hall
location.description: Thanks to Kristofer of Morningthaw. This Meeting Hall was moved into town during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Tufa Meeting Hall
location.description: This Meeting Hall was moved into town during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Uziz Meeting Hall
location.description: This Metting Hall was moved into town during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Yanshi Meeting Hall
location.description: This Meeting Hall was moved during the Mired Hearts event. Moved again when Yanshi got rebuilt in the December '05 event.

location.name: Yaraq Meeting Hall
location.description: Moved into down during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Zaikhal Meeting Hall
location.description: The surface portal will take you all the way across town to the Advocate/Sentinel Monument.

location.name: Obsidian Span
location.description: The Obsidian Span is an Empyrean ruin that was previously hidden from sight with a magic ward. During the Sins of the Fathers event, a Gift Box was placed here as part of the Hidden Presents quest. With the quest retired, the item has been removed. During the Shifting Tactics event, an Exploration Marker was placed here as part of the Dereth Exploration quest.

location.name: Silencia the Archmage
location.description:
Quest(s): Hollow, Phantom, Atlan, Isparian, Ravenous, Shadowfire, Weeping Weapons.
This mute archmage carries all the regular supplies but also sells something a bit unique: a strange glyph of unknown origin. It's almost as odd as the tame magma golem she keeps with her.

location.name: Giant Mushroom
location.description: Perhaps this strange mushroom is related to the giant flower near Hebian-to.

location.name: Crater Rim Passage
location.description: Two flaming towers flank this crevice that allows access to the crater. It would provide safe passage if not for the flares and flammas guarding it.

location.name: Crater Pathway (Upper Entrance)
location.description: This zefir-infested maze winds through the mountain and exists in the valley to the South. Beware of the dark wisps that also reside here. If you can escape the zefirs, the wisps might get you instead...

location.name: Crater to Hilltop
location.description: Arrives at a tower South of Holtburg and East of Glenden Wood. Be careful when exiting as reedshark are occasionally there waiting.

location.name: Mountain Fortress
location.description:
Quest(s): Hamud's Pyreal Katar.
This dungeon is where Hamud ibn Rafik dwells. It is full of Shadows and Zefirs. At the bottom is a locked door leading to Hamud's Private Chamber.
The key for the door can be obtained from Devana bint Hamudi, Hamud's daughter, by presenting her with the Introduction to Devana.

location.name: Smuggler's Fort
location.description:
It would seem that the Empyrean also suffered from crime - on an island west of the peninsula can be found an old smugglers' lair, riddled with traps and dead-ends to prevent intrusion. Finding is simplicity itself; walk to the western shore, then south until you can see the island offshore. I've been told the fort's walls are unmarred by any door, but that a way in lies at hand. Banderlings have been seen stalking the walls.
-- Mi Chi

location.name: Zefir Cave
location.description: This small cave is home to ten or so Azael Zefirs guarding a Runed Chest.

location.name: Jahannan Vault (Crater Lake Village)
location.description:
Quest(s): Major Smoldering Stone.
Situated on the rim of the crater this ancient Empyrean vault is now home to various zefirs and fire elementals.
location.monsters: Flamma, Flare, Inferno, Mountain Rat, Zofrit Zefir

location.name: Amperehelion Vault
location.description:
Quest(s): Major Sparking Stone.
This recently unearthed empyrean vault contains the strange electrical elementals as well as the deadly if not more common Ash Gromnies.

location.name: Swamp Cave
location.description:
Quest(s): Minor Atlan Stones.
A most unusual tale has been told to me several times this week. It seems that a lone swordsman, hunting mosswarts in the Blackmire west of Sawato, came across a huge ruined keep inhabited by Sclavus. Nearby, to the northeast, an unusual granite cave thrust up from the ground. In this cave he found a green stone of unusual quality. It is said that a mage of some ability examined the stone, and determined it to have several enchantments upon it. What these were, and how to activate them, he could not discern.
-- Unknown
Minor Stinging Stone.

location.name: Igloo
location.description: Noone is really sure who built this igloo. But ethereal wisps and ice golems now surround it.

location.name: Serac Vault (Original Entrance)
location.description:
Quest(s): Major Shivering Stone.
This ancient Empyrean structure is now infested with undead. Lich Lords, Revenants, and Dark Revenants swarm the dungeon. Perhaps they are the ancient Empyreans who first constructed the place.
location.monsters: Lich Lords, Revenants, Dark Revenants

location.name: Artifex Vault
location.description:
Quest(s): Stone Tool.
This dungeon contains the Stone Tool that is used to remove Atlan Stones from Atlan Weapons and Shadow Armor. It was updated during the Heart of Woe event, when a second portal became available at 24.5N, 8.1E.

location.name: Fiery Cave
location.description: A strange cave with flames at the entrance. The small shrine inside is guarded by several flares.

location.name: Samsur Crater
location.description: Judging by the Empyrean bust that lays in the water at the bottom of this small crater, the place was once very special. Now only a few mud golems muddle about.

location.name: Abandoned Tents
location.description: These tents have been abandonded by their previous owners. Now only the rats and other vermin of the desert visit them.

location.name: Samsur Advocate Tower
location.description: This advocate tower sits on a bluff overlooking Samsur proper. On its roof is a portal to the Northwest Samsur Outpost.

location.name: Empty Lifestone Brackets
location.description: At one point a lifestone might have existed here. Now only the empty brackets are left. What is strange is that someone keep leaving strange notes and rumors on the ground here.

location.name: Empyrean Ruins
location.description: This strange row of columns and statues is left from the days of the Empyrean Empire. Now its only frequent visitor is an undead.

location.name: Apple Grove
location.description: Four Empyrean statues surround this single apple tree. This is the perfect shady spot to rest and relax.

location.name: Incunabula Vault
location.description:
Quest(s): Atlan Weapons, Isparian Weapons, Shadow Armor, Major Stinging Stone.
-Lslayer

location.name: Revitalizing Fountain
location.description: Nestled between the three towers is this magical fountain. Get past the skeleton warrior that is usually guarding it and you can drink from its cool waters

location.name: Portal to Riverbend
location.description: Nestled in a small valley among ancient ruins and other portals. The nearest sanctuary is the relative shelter of the Abandoned Arena nearby.

location.name: Abandoned Arena
location.description: A maze like dungeon that must have been used for combat games at one time. Various creatures can be found trapped in this dungeon along with two lifestones. Banderlings and rats appear to be the most common visitors but usually remain behind their locked doors.

location.name: Portal to Desert Ridge Border
location.description: Just a short hop northeasterly. May as well run ;o)

location.name: North Desert Edge Peddler
location.description:
This vendor deals in misc. odds and ends. Its a fair spot to stop if you're in need of basic supplies but not worth a special trip.
There's also a decent sized population of reedsharks, water and mud golems, and the occasional blue wasps about, making this isolated vendor a fairly safe place to hunt.

location.name: Portal to North Desert Edge
location.description: The most difficult part of this portal is evading the ice golems that are usually found at the standing stone very close by.

location.name: Portal to the North Direlands
location.description: The most difficult part of entering this portal is evading the ice golems that are usually found at the standing stone very close by.

location.name: Statue Circle
location.description: This circle of status sites in the swamp just a bit southeast of Yanshi. There must have been something special about this place as even the toadstools have grown in a circle at its center.

location.name: Pillar Ruins
location.description: Three lone pillars on a hill overlook the road West of Yanshi.

location.name: Yanshi Festival Grounds
location.description: With a peddler and farmer this festival ground provides the ideal location for all sorts of games and gatherings. Perhaps that's why they are so crowded all the times? ;o)

location.name: A Small Ruin
location.description:
This is a small dungeon of three levels, connected by ramps. You'll need to flip a switch to gain access to the lower level, but this is fairly easy to figure out.
You'll encounter various banderlings in this dungeon in groups no more then 3. Its an ideal location for characters level 15-20 looking to burn off a little vitae penalty.
location.monsters: Banderling Young, Scouts, Guards, Ravers, Captain, Breeder

location.name: Ayan Baqur
location.description:
On the far western shore of the Direlands, Ayan Baqur, despite it's isolation, is still one of the principal cities on Dereth. Ayan Baqur, often abbreviated as AB, has seen much turmoil over the years. It has been taken over by Virindi. It has seen countles incursions by ravening monsters from the surrounding Direlands, including visits from the fearsome White Rabbit. And it was camped for quite some time by a persistant Coral Golem Viceroy. It remains important today, being a center of questing and the home of Ulgrim the Unpleasant.
Thanks to Nadan of Morningthaw for the coordinates and image.

location.name: The Nexus
location.description:
Quest(s): Nexus Commander's Helm, Apostate Nexus.
Updated in 2006, this dungeon still has the acid pits, but is now full of Viamontians. The final Nexus Commander drops the Nexus Commander's Helm with major Frost Ward and other goodies. Layout did not change.
A very nasty dungeon with acid pits, revenants and dark revenants, shadows of all kinds and nexus fragments at the bottom, very nasty unless you're an experienced fighter...
- MystWolf
Updated during the Ashes and Dust patch (November 2005)
The Adventurer's warning note is found near the portal drop.
The portal to the Apostate Nexus Gateway can be found in the second acid pit.
location.monsters: Royal Thaumaturge Viamontian Tribune Abhorrent Eaters Nexus Commander

location.name: Home of Devana bint Hamudi
location.description:
Quest(s): Oswald's Dagger.
Its rumored that Devana is the daughter of an Isparian assasin. Fact is that she won`t talk to anyone without an introduction.

location.name: Cursed Swamp
location.description:
This is a great dungeon for 2-4 low level characters or 1-2 10+ characters. The swampy maze of this dungeon reminds one of a sewer system. Perhaps that is what this is...
The second level of this dungeon is riddled with traps. Fortunately it's simply a set of passages leading to the 3rd level. Just be ready to stop and rest if the acid, lighting, and other traps catch you unaware.
The mosswart nest is on the final level. If you can get past the defense, you'll find the heart of the dungeon. A strange sarcophagus that contains unknown treasures. Be careful though, it too is likely to be trapped.
Exits from this dungeon can be found just west of the entrance chamber as well as on the 3rd level near the Mosswart nest.
Take care adventurer.

location.name: Black Spawn Den (Ayan Baqur)
location.description:
Black Spawn Den was one of three leveling dungeons introduced in the Paths of Destruction event. (The others being Olthoi Horde Nest and Lugian Citadel). A leveling dungeon is a dungeon with a large number of relatively easy to kill, often non magic, creatures worth good experience, on a fast spawn cycle. The Black Spawn Dens were popular leveling areas until supplanted by the Marae Lassel Olthoi dungeons in the Oct 2001 Dark Majesty expansion and finally the Aphus Lassel Tusker Dungeons in Nov 2002.
The portal entry requires level 20+. Entry is neither a safe nor hot drop. Tuskers can and do get into the first room, epsecially if dragged into the room by other players. The first area is comprised of Tusker Slaves. As you go back the dungeon divides into a right and left area with the left area being the larger of the two. About half way into the dungeon Tusker Guards appear. In the right area is a virindi puppet in the last room.

location.name: Hills Citadel
location.description: Lugians, and lot`s of them. Prepare to be bludgeoned like you have never been before.

location.name: Olthoi Horde Nest
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Weapons.
This is one of three Olthoi hunting dungeons Turbine added to the game along with the Lugian Citadels and Black Spawn Dens. The other two are Olthoi Horde Nest - Mountain Retreat and Olthoi Horde Nest - Colier.
There are two Sturdy Iron Chests in this dungeon.
At the end of this dungeon is a portal to Deeper Catacombs.
Bring lots of friends or be prepared to stress test a lifestone.
location.monsters: Olthoi Eviscerator, Noble, Worker, Soldier

location.name: Murk Warrens
location.description:
A dungeon filled with Mosswarts and Banderlings.
Image submitted by Circeus, Harvestgain. Thanks!

location.name: Lifestone Tower
location.description: An abandoned tower near Kara surrounded by what appear to be lifestones in various states of growth. There are even three of these crystal formations growing up through the floor of the tower. Magical equipment is all the evidence of the tower's former occupant.

location.name: Fadsahil al-Tashbi
location.description: Fadsahil al-Tashbi the Master Archmage tells you, Greetings. I am glad that you have taken time to visit me here. Yes, I have recently moved to this new area, there have been some odd happenings within my former residence as of late.

location.name: Master Celdiseth the Archmage
location.description:
Sells at 110%, buys at 80%. Platinum Scarabs 44,000py.
Master Celdiseth the Archmage tells you, "You are too kind, my friend."
Master Celdiseth the Archmage tells you, "A wise purchase."
Master Celdiseth the Archmage tells you, "You have traveled far...How can I serve thee?"
Master Celdiseth the Archmage tells you, "Have a safe and rewarding journey."

location.name: Asuger Temple
location.description:
Quest(s): Elysa's Favor.
Kill the minions at the end, one drops a key to retrieve the Glass Spherule in the chest.

location.name: Empyrean Watcher
location.description: Yet another of those strange stone heads that seem fairly common in the southern plains of Osteth.

location.name: Skeleton Bunker
location.description: This underground bunker in the sands west of Tufa is empty except for the animated skeletons which may be all that's left of the original occupants.

location.name: Hedged Platform
location.description:
While we don't know who, someone seems to continue tending the hedges surrounding the base of this Empyrean platform.
Grievver's set up camp here in PY14 during the The Hall of the Tusker King event. They now stand guard over a runed chest which, so they say, contains valuable treasure within.

location.name: Gharu'ndim Outpost Lifestone
location.description: Situated near this Gharu'ndim outpost, this lifestone makes the outpost a welcome stop.

location.name: Ringoshu the Apple Seller
location.description:
Quest(s): Trothyr's Rest Key, Trothyr's Rest Rumor, Apple, Tart Apple. Sells at 135%, buys at 90%.
Ringoshu the Apple Seller tells you, Welcome! What's your pleasure today?.
Tart Apples.

location.name: Gharu'ndim Outpost
location.description: Several tents, a clay forge, and an animal pen with some cattle are about all that makes up this Gharu'ndim outpost. However it is home to a Roaming Bowyer, Weaponsmith, and Blacksmith. While they have little to offer beyond the basic goods, theirs is a welcome place to rest on your travels. Especially with the lifestone situated close by.

location.name: Black Spawn Den (Obsidian Plains)
location.description:
Black Spawn Den was one of three leveling dungeons introduced in the Paths of Destruction event. (The others being Olthoi Horde Nest and Lugian Citadel). A leveling dungeon is a dungeon with a large number of relatively easy to kill, often non magic, creatures worth good experience, on a fast spawn cycle. The Black Spawn Dens were popular leveling areas until supplanted by the Marae Lassel Olthoi dungeons in the Oct 2001 Dark Majesty expansion and finally the Aphus Lassel Tusker Dungeons in Nov 2002.
The portal entry requires level 20+. Entry is neither a safe nor hot drop. Tuskers can and do get into the first room, epsecially if dragged into the room by other players. The first area is comprised of Tusker Slaves. As you go back the dungeon divides into a right and left area with the left area being the larger of the two. About half way into the dungeon Tusker Guards appear. In the right area is a virindi puppet in the last room.

location.name: Olthoi Horde Nest
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Weapons.
This is one of three Olthoi hunting dungeons Turbine added to the game along with the Lugian Citadels and Black Spawn Dens. The other two are Olthoi Horde Nest - Mountain Retreat and Olthoi Horde Nest - Bandit Castle.
There is a Sturdy Iron Chest in this dungeon.
At the bottom of this dungeon is a portal to Deeper Catacombs.
Bring lots of friends or be prepared to stress test a lifestone.

location.name: Ridge Citadel
location.description: Lugians, and lot's of them. Prepare to be bludgeoned like you never have before.
location.monsters: Gotrok Montoks, Extas, Extas Raiders, and Tiatus.

location.name: Abandoned Tent
location.description: A skeleton has taken up residence in this tent. Beware however as his death with bring all the skeletons from the area down upon you.

location.name: Halls of Metos (Tufa)
location.description:
Quest(s): Asheron's Departure, Crafting Golems.
Metos was an Empyrean expert in the construction of Golems, and a friend of Asheron. He maintained three workshops, what we know today as the three Halls of Metos. His heritage is unknown. Since he is a contemporary of Asheron, he is likely Yalain. However, the style of the three halls is strikingly Dericost, and the halls themselves are occupied by Dericost undead.

location.name: Empyrean Platform
location.description:
Yet another of these platforms. These ruins are scattered around Dereth but their purpose is a complete mystery.
A group of mosswarts guards a runed chest here.

location.name: Murk Warrens
location.description:
Contains various mosswarts and banderlings.
Our thanks to Val-Kelbareth of Harvestgain for reporting this location to us.

location.name: Abandoned Tower
location.description: This abandoned tower has a magnificent view of the fjord entering this part of the Linvak Mountain range.

location.name: Skeleton Tower
location.description:
This empyrean ruin is now guarded by the undead remains of the soldiers that once manned it.
If you manage to brave the guardians, you might find some of their treasures in the two chests at this location.
Thanks to Breeanna and crew on Thistledown for reporting this location.

location.name: Setab's Barracks
location.description: Old, starter-town dungeon near Lytelthorpe. Setab's Barracks is a remnant of one of the early settlement of the Lytelthorpe area. The local townsfolk don't talk about the Barracks much and exploration has revealed that it may have been the scene of much bloodshed. Recently Breeanna was kind enough to explore the dungeon for us and found a mixture of various Drudges there. Skulkers, Slinkers, and Sneakers all now call this dreary place home. They cluster together in groups of 2-4 and haunt the halls, living amoung the refuse left by the late human inhabitants. Its obvious by the furnishing that this location was abandoned in a hurry. Maybe someday it will be reclaimed. Until then it remains a tomb. A single adventurer of level 5-10 will have little difficulty with this location. The fact that the drudges stay is seperated packs makes this is dungeon ideal for any sized group of low level characters to explore. Just becareful you don't accidently find yourself in the middle of a pack of 4 or so Slinkers. Thanks to Breeanna for braving the dungeon.

location.name: Halls of Metos (Ayan Baqur)
location.description:
Quest(s): Asheron's Departure, Crafting Golems.
Metos was an Empyrean expert in the construction of Golems, and a friend of Asheron. He maintained three workshops, what we know today as the three Halls of Metos. His heritage is unknown. Since he is a contemporary of Asheron, he is likely Yalain. However, the style of the three halls is strikingly Dericost, and the halls themselves are occupied by Dericost undead.

location.name: Ayn Tayan (Hill of Pines)
location.description:
This point of interest consists of a small hill populated mostly by low level skeletons (mostly Warriors). At the base of the hill lies a statue of Bael'Zharon surrounded by many bones. Traveling up the hill you will find to carpeted with bones and some Skeletons. At the top of the hill you will find more bones and skeletons as well as a large Empyrean style head with a green mist surrounding it.
Lore:
This is actually the Battlefield of Ayn Tayan where the various undead factions banded together to fight Bael'Zharon and give the Asheron and the other Yalaini Mages time to construct their crystal array trap for Bael. The battle raged for three days was a victory for the undead because they were able to hold off Bael long enough for the Yaliani to complete their trap but the undead forces were completely devastated by the battle. During this battle the Sand King Anadil managed to destroy one of the original Shadow Spires.
The four Cairns and the green mist mark where the Sand King Nerash was slain by Leikotha who fought on the shadows side in order to get vengeance against Nerash for turning her into an undead. Another lore figure that died at Ayn Tayan was Jaera who was killed by Bael'Zharon himself and who's tomb is now found at the Mage Academy.
Notable lore figures that fought in the battle were:
Aerfalle Anadil Bael'Zharon Geraine IV Isin Dule Jaera (Killed) Leikotha Nerash (Killed) Rytheran
The best source of lore about the battle at Ayn Tayan is from Aerfalle's Letter.

location.name: Acolyte Towers
location.description:
Quest(s): Skull of High Acolyte.
Also known as The Three Towers, 3 Towers, and Soul Fearing Vestry. The portal only spawns after using the progressive levers and killing the spawns in the three towers.
A mysterious acolyte appears within this set of three towers. After destroying him he opens a portal to a dungeon filled with undead, skeleton captains, liches, and others of that kind.
Thank you, Arkayas.

location.name: Riverbend Tower
location.description: An empty tower with a view of the river, some trees and the hills. Scenic.

location.name: Arena
location.description:
Quest(s): Player Killer.
One of the two Arenas that were introduced in the Taste of Twilight event in response to early requests for a Player Killer arena. The other Arena located nearby was also designed for PK fighting but does not allow non player killers to spectate matches as well.
Each of the two Arenas have a lifestone at the portal drop point along with two corridors leading to the spectating areas and main fighting area. There is also a surface portal and a Judging Station portal which can only be entered by those of PK status in either of the Arenas.
The Judging Station portal drops you at a platform suspended in the air of the main fighting area, the platform has 4 levers which open and close the 4 doors (two entrances with 2 doors each) to let players in and out. It is possible to lock yourself in should you be alone and jump down from the platform before opening the doors.
Many thanks to Neo for reporting this location.

location.name: Dueling Arena Lifestone
location.description: Like most arenas, this one contains a convenient lifestone at the entrance for anyone to use.

location.name: Mu-Miyah Temple
location.description: This temple found in the desert north of Tufa is the site of ancient sacrificial rites. It is populated by lesser, greater, and horrible mu-miyahs who guard a locked chest and a fountain of purple mystical energy. A variety of skeletons guard the outer walls.

location.name: Tou-Tou Bathhouse
location.description: Next to the leather crafter, the lifestone and some hot springs is the Tou-Tou Bathhouse. It caters to those cultivated individuals who can appreciate the two steaming tubs provided here.

location.name: Koga Hideki, Gemstone Armorer
location.description:
Quest(s): Shadow Armor.
I have improved my armor skills, but my craft is not yet perfect. Fortunately, sages have discovered ways to improve my armor during my weakness. Have you read Aliester's Corollary? Bring me fused gems to make armor, and the book will show you how to improve my product.

location.name: High Mountain Valley to Yaraq
location.description: This town portal is protected from the elements by a temple-like structure.

location.name: Ancient Town to Hilltop
location.description: Thanks go to Vertroxix of Thistledown for reporting this portal.

location.name: Zelina's Cottage
location.description: Away from the hustle and bustle of Holtburg, next to a small bayou and a lifestone lies the plundered cottage of Zelina. It offers some shelter for travelers passing through.

location.name: Incomplete Lifestone
location.description: Inside this old temple stands this broken lifestone. Or was it never completed?

location.name: Cabbage Farmer
location.description: Dansha-Ki grows his royal cabbages out here.

location.name: Tumerok Tower
location.description: Some Tumerok workers, scouts and a warrior or two keep their vigil here in the siege of Dryreach.

location.name: Mysterious Tunnels
location.description:
Quest(s): Miyako's Moonstone.
A diverse dungeon with four different paths to four unique-looking areas. The book Reflections of a Portal can be found here in a chest.
Special Properties: Attuned, Bonded
A finely made book, bound in leather, edged in gilt.
swirling purple mist beckons me to roam afar and yet I remain
watch the swan swimming splendid, tranquil floating bird yet all is fleeting
swallow soars o'erhead my prayers ascend to Iiwah longing to follow
-- Miyako of Nanto

location.name: Jibril ibn Rashid, Gemstone Armorer
location.description:
Quest(s): Shadow Armor.
I still have not recovered my old skill with armor. But there is hope... Have you heard about the findings of the Aluvian sage? His corollary has some interesting news... Give me your fused gems and I will make you armor as best I can. Perhaps with the sage's techniques, my armor can attain some semblance of its old power.

location.name: Woodland Peddler
location.description: This peddler has taken up residence in the remote wilderness. No one is sure exactly how much business he might do in this off the beaten path location.

location.name: Standing Stone Outlook
location.description: This lovely location just east of Al-Jalima is the perfect spot to just sit and relax while enjoying the sunrise.

location.name: Linvak Peddler
location.description: All alone in this small vale, this Sho Peddler stands ready to serve your basic equipment needs anytime, day or night.

location.name: Empyrean Tower
location.description: Another empty tower.

location.name: Fallen Suntik Messenger
location.description:
Some know the sad tale of the fall of the Suntik Village. Here is one of the reminders of that sad tragedy. This brave message died attempting to reach Glenden Woods for help. One mystery remains, who shot the arrows? The Monougas aren't normally know for using bows or crossbows. hmm...
Here's the note you can find at this location: Letter of Request
The Naquib of Suntik hereby requests all available mercenaries to assist in the purging our land of the fierce Mnougas. Our stronghold, located 16.2N x 4.4E, is under siege and supplies are low. Monougas are climbing the ridge near 18.5N x 3.6E and following it to our village. We can not hold out for long and our only hope is that this letter is found by a band of mercenaries with the will to help.

location.name: Mosswart Cave
location.description: This cave is now home to a tribe of Mosswarts, led by their chief. Be careful when attacking this location as every mosswart in the surrounding area will come to aid their fellows.

location.name: Gharu'ndim Outpost to North Desert Edge
Peddler (Sawato)
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buy at 90%.
This poor peddler has become completely lost, so she just set up camp and settled in for a bit. While the selection is very limited, you just may find that item you've been missing.

location.name: Healer (Sawato)
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buy at 90%.
This Sho Healer prefers to stay away from the bustle of town life, but still sells limited provisions of good quality.

location.name: Empyrean Pillar
location.description: This empyrean ruin is guarded by several water golems.

location.name: Empyrean Foundry
location.description:
Quest(s): Hamud's Pyreal Katar.
You need the Foundry Key in order to get past the locked door that is right beyond the dungeon drop.
In this dungeon you will find the Ancient Pyreal Dagger which is needed as part of the Hamud's Pyreal Katar Quest.

location.name: Mushroom Ring
location.description: A lone Ghost Wisp guards this location.

location.name: Swamp Rat Bunker
location.description: Take great care at this location. A horde of swamp rats have claimed this. Their lightning attack will quickly strip the flesh from the bones of those that disturb them. However the risk might be worth the reward, the standing stones around this location seem to indicate it has a special significance.

location.name: Rat Cave
location.description: This cave's location high on the ridge would make it an ideal watchpost. If not for the black rats that infest it.

location.name: Archmage
location.description: This lonely archmage obviously thought this would be a trade route at some point. Until then his rather large structure remains empty except for himself. He's set up several large braziers to help attract visitors but unfortunately his shop is woefully understocked to get much use.

location.name: Shadow Spire Geyser
location.description: When the shadow spire appeared in Tou-Tou, this geyser sprang up below it. While the spire has since moved on, the geyser remains, marking where it once stood.

location.name: Jolly Snowman
location.description: This jolly giant snowman sells one thing; Magic Iceballs. A rare and much sought after ingredient in many frosty recipes. But come prepared as the price is a bit steep.

location.name: Planetarium
location.description: Known to many as the observatory, this strange Empyrean planetarium presumably contains a representation of the celestial bodies that make up the galaxy of this world we now call home.

location.name: Paul the Monouga (Babe the Blue Auroch)
location.description: Paul the Monouga and his pal Babe the Blue Auroch stand TALL in the Northern mountains of Dereth. They can not be attacked.

location.name: Cellar
location.description: An empty cellar

location.name: Krau Li's Labyrinth
location.description:
Quest(s): Mi Krau-Li's Improved Jitte.
NPCs:
Mi Krau-Li

location.name: Watcher Monument
location.description: A group of four watcher stones arranged to be facing North, South, East and West with a Menhir-type stone. Nothing is known about what this monument was built for.

location.restrictions: Cannot Summon, Quest Flag: Carrot Soup To Karwin, The Lunatic.
location.name: Small Icecave
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic, Machinist's Gloves, Premonitions of the Fourth Sending of Darkness.
The Alloy Pinion that is used in the Undead Mechanic Quest can be found only with Karwin's Key. To obtain the key hand Carol's Carrot Soup to Karwin, the Lunatic in Bandit Castle (See Map).
A lorebook called An Old Volume is found on the floor near the Alloy Pinion. There is no reward for the book but you can take it to Bretself the Translator in the Cragstone Library to have it translated.
location.monsters: Wasteland Rats, Ebon Gromnie, Nubilous Golem, Risen Lord

location.name: Shendolain Vestibule
location.description:
Quest(s): Shendolain Vestibule.
The Shendolain Vestibule is the entry way to the Shendolain dungeon. A Shendolain key is required to unlock the gate to gain access to the deepest parts of the dungeon.

location.name: Caulnalain Vestibule
location.description:
Quest(s): Caulnalain Vestibule.
The Caulnalain Vestibule is the entry way to the Caulnalain dungeon. A Caulnalain key is required to unlock the gate to gain access to the deepest parts of the dungeon.

location.name: Fenmalain Vestibule
location.description:
Quest(s): Fenmalain Vestibule.
The Fenmalain Vestibule is the entry way to the Fenmalain dungeon. A Fenmalain key is required to unlock the gate to gain access to the deepest parts of the dungeon.

location.name: Caulnalain Menhir Ring (Aun Settlement)
location.description:
Quest(s): Menhir Mana Fields # 18.
Only a menhir ring now remains of the former dungeon.

location.name: Banderling Conquest Dungeon
location.description:
Quest(s): Mace of the Explorer.
This dungeon is rumored to be the last place that Sir Candeth Martine, member of a society of explorers, was heard from. It contains a range of banderlings (young, scouts, guards, raiders, ravers, breeders, and a chieftain). A ceremonial staff is also rumored to exist deep within the bowels of the dungeon.

location.name: Nen Ai's House
location.description: Quest(s): Nen Ai's Pet Drudge.

location.name: Drudge Cave
location.description: A cave directly west of the Shoushi west outpost. Formerly the location of Lou Ka's Yaoji and before that, Lou Ka lived in this cave himself. Now all that remains is a chest with low quality treasure.

location.name: Shreth Hive
location.description:
Quest(s): Four Stones of Jojii, Exploration Society Letters.
This dungeon is one of the more dangerous places for new adventurers with the swarming creatures inside. The Shoushi Town Stamp may be found just inside the dungeon entrance. The dungeon entrance is hot - watch for falling Drudges!

location.name: Stone Cathedral
location.description:
Quest(s): Nen Ai's Pet Drudge.
Updated since Release, this dungeon is now closer to town and contains both quest items for Nen Ai's Pet Drudge.

location.name: Drudge Temple
location.description: A Meeting Hall Style Building where a group drudges have made their home. Previously part of the Shoushi Southeast Outpost Starter Quest, where Bai Den's Gem was located.

location.name: Twin Faces
location.description: These twin faces greet travellers entering Samsur on the road from Uziz.

location.name: Musansayn's Vaults
location.description:
Quest(s): Exploration Society Letters, Musansayn's Library.
Old starter town quest dungeon that contains the Samsur Town Stamp and the book The Hundred Trackless Paths.

location.name: Dry Well
location.description: Quest(s): The Old Dry Well.

location.name: Neydisa Castle
location.description:
Long ago, this was called Foster's Fort, an abandoned Empyrean structure found by a man named Foster in the years of the Olthoi enslavement. Foster, then a new arrival, had been fleeing the Olthoi for days when he glimpsed these spires in the distance. Initially elated, his joy turned to deep disappointment when he found the walls undefended and no one within. He spent years hiding here in the towers until the liberation came, and thereafter vowed to never return to such a forsaken place.
Much later, a small Aluvian faction left the safety of Cragstone to come north (some say they were kicked out of the town). They took up residence within the Bandit Castle, but some disagreement split their ranks, and a number of them trekked down the road and wound up here, at Foster's Fort. A woman called simply Neydisa led their ranks. She saw a grand palace in what looked otherwise like a ruined husk.
Though Neydisa and her followers had few supplies, and Neydisa herself passed on long before the era of the Lifestones, this place was gradually converted into a place where people may rest in peace and safety. People now call it Neydisa Castle. We who live here keep to ourselves. We seek to live in peace and simplicity. We have no need to venture beyond our walls, for we have all that we need within.

location.name: Bandit Castle
location.description: This castle is located in the northeast of Osteth just outside the mountains that surround the Olthoi North. It was originally inhabited by a group that was kicked out of Cragstone and took up residence in the castle. Later a disagreement amongst those in that group led some to go west to Foster's Fort, which they renamed Neydisa Castle after their leader. Bandit Castle is currently the home of a group of Bandits led by MacDugal.

location.name: Mosswart Maze
location.description:
Quest(s): Mace of the Explorer.
The Mosswarts have found a damp cavern to live in far from their beloved swamps. This dungeon is full of Barker and Mudlurk Mosswarts as well as the spellcasting Shamans. A couple of Goldenback Tuskers also take up residence deep within the maze. Sir Candeth Martine is said to have visited this dungeon during one of the Society's explorations. A ceremonial stone of some archealogical value is rumored to have lured him to the spot.

location.name: Xarabydun
location.description:
Xarbydun was an ancient Empyrean ruin which the Arcanum discovered. It used to be completely underground, only accessible via portal by those level 25 and under. In Hidden Vein the Arcanum Consortium was built above ground from Xarabydun, with NPCs there for various interaction in the Nuhmudira's Boon, Isparian Arms, and Bronze Statues quests.
In Festivus Ulgrim the Unpleasant wanted to sample the brew in Xarabydun's bar, so, logically, he destroyed the portal and dug a tunnel down to the town. And thus it's level restriction was removed. With various updates to the Harbinger and other quests the Arcanum Consortium has seen more updates. In Evolution a new vendor arrived selling directions and ingredients for making Alchemical Throwing Phials.

location.name: Aino Lunnan-Shin, Gem Crafter
location.description:
Quest(s): Gem of Impulse.
Aino Lunnan-Shin is a gem crafter. She is only interested in the geodes that lie in the deepest recesses of Xarabydun, which she is willing to craft into the powerful Impulse gems coveted by mages throughout Dereth.

location.name: Mud Cave
location.description:
Quest(s): The Moars.
Like a few other dungeons on the Vesayen Isles, this dungeon is mirrored twice on the islands.

location.name: Treacherous Tunnels
location.description: The maw of these tunnels are guarded by the several Slithis Tendrils and an Eyestalk. Within the tunnels crawl with the foul Rank Moarsmen.

location.name: Rumuba's Hidey Hole
location.description:
Quest(s): Rumuba's Jade Spear Quest.
It is rumored that these caves are the hidey hole of the rogue mosswart Rumuba. Rumors in MacNiall's Freehold suggests that this mosswart may be seeking the help of humans, and he may be willing to reward adventurers that can bring him an item of interest in his studies. The path to find the unusual mossie is not easy though. The tunnels are filled with Mosswart Fanatics, Idolaters, and Soul Trappers.

location.name: Kryst
location.description: This island town was founded by a group of Isparians fleeing from the olthoi before the rise of Elysa Strathler and Thorsten Cragstone and the death of the olthoi queen. During their flight they discovered a portal to an archipelago to the southeast of what is now present day Mayoi. A man named Zenzaburou Hensu founded the town on the basis of Sho religious tenants, which some of the less upright refugees resented. These few left to found their own town, but the community of Kryst thrived in a land far less dangerous than their fellows' chosen location. The town remained isolated from the rest of Dereth until Leafcull, PY 11 (Should the Stars Fall) when new portals opened access to the archipelago once more.

location.name: MacNiall's Freehold
location.description: After an argument with the Bandit Chief MacDougal, during the olthoi occupation of Dereth, the bandit MacNiall led a group of his fellows through a portal to escape an attacking olthoi horde. MacNiall met a group led by Zenzaburou Hensu and the two groups joined one another for a time in the isolated Vensayen Isles. The principles that Zenzaburou wished to form a new township were not to MacNiall and his crew's liking though and thus they travelled into the more dangerous wilds of the archipelago and founded MacNiall's Freehold. The town remained isolated from the rest of Dereth until Leafcull, PY 11 (Should the Stars Fall) when new portals opened access to the archipelago once more.

location.name: Idol Spawning Ground
location.description:
Quest(s): Bandit Hilt.
Before other locations and dungeons got Idols and Dread Idols, this used to be the place to find an Idol Gem for your Bandit Hilt
A mass of twisting tunnels occupied by a variety of banderlings and the pudgy but deadly idols and dread idols.
Thanks to Aldrun of Thisltedown for the creature information.
location.monsters: Mosswart Zealot, Idolator, Soul Trapper, Dread Idol, Idol, Shadow Lieutenant

location.name: Mosswart Nest
location.description: This nest is full of... well... Mosswarts. Their ranks include Fanatics, Idolaters, and Soul Trappers. They are also joined by a few of their plump and deadly Idols.

location.name: Moarsman Muck
location.description: Quest(s): The Moars.

location.name: Desert Northern Edge Portal
location.description: This portal drops you in the Tower Mountains East of Zaikhal.

location.name: A Mosswart Hideout
location.description:
Quest(s): Singularity Weapons.
The Virindi Essence is found in a chest at the bottom opened with a SIK.
This hideout is populated by high level mosswarts of various sorts, including Soul Trappers and Zealots.
Members of the Society, an explorer's group based out of Eastham, say that this dungeon may be the prison of one of their long missing member Sir Martine.

location.name: Moarsmen Hideout
location.description:
Quest(s): The Moars.
This dungeon in the Northern part of the Vesayen Isles is populated with Moarsmen of many varieties.

location.name: Small Ruin
location.description: This ruin in the Northern part of the Vesayen Isles is guarded by Cursed Wisps.

location.name: Cathedral Island Bridge
location.description: This bridge leads to the island of Ithaenc which is home to an ancient Empyrean Cathedral.

location.name: Mosswart Temple
location.description: This temple is populated by Mosswart Clingers.

location.name: Moars
location.description:
Quest(s): The Moars.
These strange tunnels are home to the Moarsmen and a variety of high level Sharks.

location.name: Archmage and Peddler
location.description: These two lonely characters have only a meagre selection of goods. But then again they have the sunshine, the beach and the surf.

location.name: Lugian Excavations
location.description:
Quest(s): Sepulcher of Nightmares, Sanguinary Aegis.
Gigas and Extas Lugians are said to pound adventurers here. Or was it the other way around?

location.name: Strange Landfill
location.description: Two parallel strips of golem-crusted bedrock open to any interpretation of their purpose. Was it a drydock for some giant shipyard? An ancient seaside resort? You tell me...

location.name: Catacombs of the Forgotten
location.description:
Quest(s): Mi Krau-Li's Improved Jitte.
Some forgotten Dericost warriors have been interred here, including Brodor the Brawler. Still, some remain active to watch over the remains of their brethren. It also holds someone's long-lost weapon, an exceptionally well balanced jitte.
Thanks to Roberto the First of Thistledown for providing some of the details on this location.
location.monsters: Skeleton Warrior, Skeleton Captain, Skeleton Lord

location.name: Jungle Shadows
location.description:
A dungeon guarded by Shadows of various sorts. It contains a hub or subway system of portals to locations all around Dereth.
* Baishi * Eastham * Glenden Wood * Hebian-To * Neydisa Castle * North Direlands * Plateau Village * South Direlands * Tufa * Zaikhal

location.name: Holtburg Collector
location.description: Holtburg's resident collector is always found by the well in Holtburg, willing to buy or trade for the latest in trophies brought forth by adventurers.

location.name: Slithis Pit
location.description: Guarded by groping tendrils - what lies within?

location.name: Moars Laboratory
location.description: Quest(s): The Moars.

location.name: Anadil's Camp
location.description: This is the camp of the Sand King Anadil, the commander of most of the undead forces opposing the release of Bael'Zharon and the bearer of the Staff of the Nomads. The camp is populated with a variety of undead as well as Anadil himself.

location.name: Cathedral at Ithaenc
location.description: The famous cathedral now lies in ruin on the Isle of Ithaenc. Within its walls is a memorial to Lady Adja, a member of the Council of Five, and the tomb of Kelderam, Lord Atlan's squire and the leader of the Adjanite religious order. Adja's Memorial also doubles as an NPK altar. The Cathedral also housed the final soul stone that held the captive Bael'Zharon.

location.name: Undead Skytower
location.description: A tower manned by undead used in the campaign to protect the soul stone. It is populated by Liches and a Dark Leech. It also contains a portal to Chalicmere Castle.

location.name: Chalicmere Castle
location.description: The home of Faladaha the Emmissary and Gateway to Aerlinthe. Bring a C Note if you wish to use his services to gain access to the island. The Castle is guarded by a variety of undead and Diamond Golems.

location.name: Perimeter Portal (Undead Skytower)
location.description: This portal leads to the Undead Skytower, which in turn leads to Chalicmere Castle, home of Faladaha the Emmissary.

location.name: Eternal Flame
location.description:
The Eternal Flame burns in memory of those slain at the Holtburg Redoubt during the Tumerok invasions. A Historical Marker placed nearby reads:
The Old Redoubt:
In the 6th year of our freedom from the Olthoi, the people of Holtburg were besieged and slaughtered here by Tumeroks. Only the children were spared, thanks to the heroism of the mage Celcynd. This eternal flame burns in their memory, and their mortal remains have been left interred here in tribute. Disturb not their rest.
Find out more in the Holtburg Starter quests and the quest for Brogord's Axe.

location.name: Collector (Samsur)
location.description: This collector accepts all manner of trophies in exchange for coin and other rewards.

location.name: Murk Warrens
location.description: One of several such dungeons, populated by various Mosswarts and Banderlings on a rather rapid spawn timer. Be prepared to pick at least one lock to gain access to the most inner areas of this dungeon.

location.name: Al-Arqas to Yanshi
location.description: This portal will take you from a bunker in the desert, to just outside the town of Yanshi.

location.name: Barnar the Tinker
location.description: Living on the upper level of Stonehold's Archery Shop, this skilled craftsman will fashion Wood Hearts into crossbow stocks and mechanisms for those attempting to construct the composite crossbow.

location.name: Fort Nighthawke
location.description:
Very little is known of this lakeside Abandoned Fort.
Mine! Mine!
- Soulitaire, Lady of Nighthawke

location.name: Collector (Shoushi)
location.description: Collector tells you, "I'm interested in monster trophies from many of the monsters that plague Dereth. If you give me such items, I will reward you with money or an item. With regret, I don't deal in hides."

location.name: Zefir Tower
location.description: This empyrean tower is now simply a decaying husk. Has a Sturdy Steel Chest at top Guarded by 7 Enku Zefirs. Submitted by Zen Tek Ken.

location.name: Direland Midlands Portal
location.description: Former location of the Carved Caves. Now just a portal guarded by various monsters and a Runed Chest. Thanks to Zen Tek Ken and Proximon the Strong.
location.monsters: Banderling Antagonists, Banderling Slayers, Banderling Thrasher.

location.name: Stone Platform
location.description: Just a strange platform with four constantly burning braziers.

location.name: Igloo Archmage
location.description: This lonely soul sits in his igloo home on the hilltop. The success of this venture is obvious by the amount of stock he has on hand. Still, if you're in a pinch, he may have what you need. But not likely.

location.name: Hilltop Drudge Tower
location.description: This hill is surrounded by a large group of Drudge Raveners who seem to be guarding a Runed Chest atop the tower.

location.name: Catacombs of Ithaenc
location.description:
Quest(s): The Healer's Heart.
Lockpicking is required to get further in the dungeon and obtain the Ancient Key for the The Healer's Heart Quest.
There are several Stamina Blight, Mana Blight and Dispell Traps in the Dungeon.
The former home of the Shard of the Herald.

location.name: Empyrean Cloister
location.description:
Quest(s): Empyrean Cloister.
This dungeon requires at least a two-person group since you have to throw switches in one sub-dungeon to open doors in the other.
The sister dungeon to the Empyrean Mausoleum. Within its depths may be found a way of aiding those that seek a means to defeat the Hopeslayer.

location.name: Shade Stronghold
location.description:
Quest(s): Shadow Captain's Heaume.
The sister dungeon to the Upper Shade Stronghold. Within its depths may lie a mysterious artifact that may be used to defeat the Hopeslayer.

location.name: Lower Chakron Flux
location.description:
Quest(s): Virindi Servant's Amulet.
The sister dungeon to the Upper Chakron Flux. Within its depths there might be found a way of aiding those that seek a means to defeat the Hopeslayer.

location.name: Upper Chakron Flux
location.description:
Quest(s): Virindi Servant's Amulet.
The sister dungeon to the Lower Chakron Flux. Within its depths may lie a mysterious artifact that may be used to defeat the Hopeslayer.

location.name: Upper Shade Stronghold
location.description:
Quest(s): Shadow Captain's Heaume.
The sister dungeon to the Shade Stronghold. Within its depths may lie a way of aiding those that seek a means to defeat the Hopeslayer.

location.name: Olthoi Hunter
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Queen, Olthoi Shield, Asheron's Raiment Quest, Olthoi Armor, Hunter Quests (Olthoi Nettlers, Nymphs, Drones).
Olthoi Hunter tells you, "Track down and slay 10 Olthoi Nettlers and I will reward you appropriately." Olthoi Hunter tells you, "Track down and slay 20 Olthoi Nymphs and I will reward you appropriately." Olthoi Hunter tells you, "Track down and slay 20 Olthoi Drones and I will reward you appropriately."
Will accept Olthoi trophies and make them into weapons and armor. You can also trade in your old Olthoi helms (the purple buckets) for the newer, more menacing style.

location.name: North Road Watchtower
location.description: A lonely old tower beside the road between the Bandit Castle and Neydisa Castle allows you to keep tabs on who comes and goes between these two ancient structures.

location.name: North Road Lifestone
location.description: The perfect place to catch your breath as your journey between Bandit Castle and Neydisa Castle.

location.name: North Road Vendors
location.description: A wandering Bowyer and his compainion, an Archmage, have set up a modest shop along the road between the Bandit Castle and Neydisa Castle. They only carry the barest supplies, but their door is always open to welcome folks in from the Cold.

location.name: Yi Yo-Jin the Leather Crafter
location.description:
Yi Yo-Jin tells you, Will miracles never cease? The Hoary Mattekar has returned! A beautiful and ferocious creature. And most people looking at it see nothing but a robe. Such a shame.
Give me the hide.
You've earned 10,000 experience.
Yi Yo-Jin gives you Hoary Mattekar Robe.
You give Yi Yo-Jin Hoary Mattekar Hide.
Yi Yo-Jin tells you, Yes, the Hoary Mattekars are now back. Given the strangeness of creature migrations that have occurred over this past year, I would not be surprised were the Hoary to be a more permanent fixture on Dereth.
Here is your robe.
Old Text:
I came here long ago in search of the lengendary Hoary Mattekar. Alas, but I no longer hear its roar in the night. I wonder if it shall ever return to Dereth?
Still, I will tke your creatures' lesser hides and craft them into useful items for you.
