If you give Yi Yo-Jin a large mattekar hide or normal mattekar coat, he will re-work it into a lovely fur variation. This lovely coat is highly valued by the Aluvian ladies.

location.name: Shard Vigil Monument
location.description: This Monument is located exclusively on the Thistledown server and serves as a monument marking the Defense of the Shard of the Herald by the Vigilant.

location.name: Desert March
location.description:
here are two locations for this dungeon. One just south of Danby's Outpost, and the other west of Al-Jalima on the inner sea. It has portals to:
* Bandit Castle * Black Hill * Obsidian Rim (aka VoD Lifestone) * Southern Mt Esper * North Dires * South Dires

location.name: Essence of Strife
location.description:
Quest(s): Harbinger.
This strange creature is willing to trade mages for more powerful magical scrolls that will spread the essence of its being: conflict and strife.

location.name: Alean the Steel Forger
location.description:
Quest(s): Shadow Armor.
Alean the Steel Forger tells you, Nuhmudira has finally restored us to full health! She has also stocked us with some extra supplies that we needed, such that we can provide you with either a version of the original Shadow Armor, or its successor. If you wish to trade on version of your Celdon set for another, simply hand it to me. Please take ou all Atlan Stones from your armor before handing it to me.
Alean the Steel Forger tells you, Also, if you wish to color your new Greater Shadow Armor, you may buy a vat of color from my assistant. If you do not like the color, please give me the armor piece and I will replace it with the standard piece which you may then choose to recolor.

location.name: Dizah ibn Nadqab
location.description:
Quest(s): Impious Staff.
While excavating this site, I inadvertently awakened the undead that rest here. I was able to escape the dungeon with my life, but before doing so I found a large audience chamber with treasure.
Offer me any trade note worth 5000 pyreals and I'll give you access to the dungeon. In return, you can keep anything you find in there. I can use the trade note to further my investigation in this site. From what I was able to uncover so far, I believe this area was once a place used by powerful Gharu'ndim War Mages.
Any relics you find may be difficult or impossible for you to use. Perhaps, if you are skilled in Gharu'ndim War Magic you may be able to understand what I could not. You can't go down there if you're not level 20, in fact I wouldn't go down there if I were you. Just forget the whole thing, you're better off that way.

location.name: Impious Temple
location.description:
Quest(s): Impious Staff.
Hand Dizah ibn Nadqab a L Note to get the doors to the tower with the portal opened.

location.name: Healer Dragando the Leech
location.description:
Sells at 135%, buys at 90%.
Healer Dragando the Leech tells you, "Do your wounds need tending?" Healer Dragando the Leech tells you, "Now even the land has healed a sight I had longed to behold."

location.name: Leather Crafter (Kryst)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Lugian Mines
location.description: Due to the nature of Chorizite, Magic has no effect on the Lugians in this mine. Furthermore, the Laigus and Amploth Lugians have begun to wield Hollow Weapons which cuts through Protective Enchantments.

location.name: Lugian Quarry
location.description:
Quest(s): Hollow Weapons, Chorizite Potions.
Amploth and Obeleth reside in this dungeon, awaiting the unsuspecting mage who does not realize that Magic has no effect on them. Oh and that Hollow Weapon that cuts through enchantment hurts.
Contains the mid-grade Chorizite needed to make Chorizite for spells and dispells potions.

location.name: Faruza ibn Salaq
location.description:
Quest(s): Hollow Weapons, Chorizite Potions.
Creates Refined Chorizite Ore out of Chunks and gives useful spell information for Pyreal Motes, Slivers, Nuggets and Bars.

location.name: Aerlinthe to Northwest Direlands
location.description:
The way home!
image and loc by John H.

location.name: Gervena the Oblique
location.description:
Quest(s): Fenmalain Vestibule, Caulnalain Vestibule, Shendolain Vestibule.
Gervena the Oblique tells you, "I have heard of powerful gems, more powerful than the mediocre gems you bring to those so-called master smiths. If I had such a gem, I could make a powerful spell-casting orb with unique properties."
Gervena the Oblique tells you, "Of course, if you are not a masterful mage, you should speak with one of my younger brothers. If you have one of my old orbs, I will improve it for you."

location.name: Gerloc the Defender
location.description:
Quest(s): Fenmalain Vestibule, Caulnalain Vestibule, Shendolain Vestibule.
Gerloc the Defender tells you, "Greetings. My siblings and I traveled here seeking gems of great power. I hear that there are some master armorers who craft suits of armor from fused gems. Those are beneath my notice. Bring me something even more powerful than a scintillating gem, and I will craft a great and unique shield for you. If you have one of my old shields, I will improve it for you."

location.name: Gersan the Sureshot
location.description:
Quest(s): Fenmalain Vestibule, Caulnalain Vestibule, Shendolain Vestibule.
Gersan the Sureshot tells you, "If you can find a gem more powerful than a mere scintillating gem, I would be interested in it. Give me such a gem and I will use it to craft a magical bow for you. The bow will be so powerful, in fact, that normal ammunition will not work on it. You will have to come to me for arrowheads as well. If you have one my old missile weapons, I will improve it for you."
Gersan the Sureshot tells you, "I am not a crossbow maker, however, so if you need a crossbow you will have to attach a stock to the bow yourself."

location.name: Ridge Citadel
location.description:
Gigas and Lithos Lugians and lots of food... Oh and there's one of those chests inside needing your special item key!
Image by Soulitaire.

location.name: Fort Tethana Tumerok Collector
location.description: I am no friend of tumeroks. If you give me the gold insignia you may find among them, I will reward you well.

location.name: Gillian the Poacher
location.description:
Crafts Wisp Hearts and Large Ursin Head with Hide.
Gillian the Poacher tells you, "Hello, my name's Gillian! Do you know of any good places to hunt creatures? I'm looking for standard leather crafter items, plus some wisp hearts, if you find them. Also, if you bring me the hide of an Ursuin Slasher I can make you a comfy Ursuin hide rug."
Gillian the Poacher tells you, "Did you know that some creatures change along with the seasons? It makes for prime hunting all year round!"
Gillian the Poacher tells you, "It seems like Dereth is going downhill pretty rapidly. That's why I'm up here in the Bandit Castle. After its all over, we'll pick up the pieces."

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: Thanks for the info, Blackfoot of Frostfell

location.name: Hieromancers' Halls
location.description:
Quest(s): Hieromancer's Armor.
The Halls of the Empyrean Hieromancers, a sect dedicated to war magic. Within these halls, magicians report finding stones of great value to those who still practice the arts of war magic today.

location.name: Essence of Artifice
location.description:
Quest(s): Harbinger.
This strange creature seems to distort reality itself. Mages focusing on the enchantment of weapons, armor, and other artificial items report receiving new powers when paying tribute to the Essence.

location.name: North Tumerok Vanguard Outpost
location.description:
Quest(s): Tumerok Vanguard Outposts.
An outpost of the Tumeroks. A variety of tumeroks lay in wait here, protected by their Drudge Slaves and Veteran Reedsharks.

location.name: South Tumerok Vanguard Outpost
location.description:
Quest(s): Tumerok Vanguard Outposts.
An outpost of the Tumeroks. A variety of tumeroks lay in wait here, protected by their Drudge Slaves and Veteran Reedsharks.

location.name: Cragstone Ivory Crafter
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself. See our trophies and treasures section for more information on these and other monster trophies.

location.name: Cragstone Wing Collector
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Strange Humming Crystal
location.description:
Quest(s): Hieromancer's Armor.
This Strange Humming Crystal is only accesible through a randomly spawning portal called the Humming Crystal portal. It requires a key to unlock its secrets. It is said that only the most powerful War Mages may suceed in the Trials that it leads to.
Thanks to Kumo Miyamoto for providing co-ordinates for the Crystal.

location.name: Stone Collector (Qalaba'r)
location.description: I will take any number of trophy stones and Jewels, such as Virindi jewels, swamp stones, iron, copper, and granite golem hearts. I'll also take banderling trophies. But what I really specialize in are the rare black rocks and black stones.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Qalaba'r)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Peddler
location.description:
Another peddler trying to make a living in this remote area.
Thanks go to Compton.

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: Thanks go to Compton.

location.name: Peddler to Baishi
location.description: Submitted by Compton. Thanks!

location.name: Yuan Hanzu
location.description:
Quest(s): Composite Bow, Composite Bow Upgrade.
Yuan Hanzu tells you, "Have you read my work on composite bows?"
Yuan Hanzu gives you Yaun Hanzu's Composite Bow Manual.
Yuan Hanzu tells you, "I can help you by carving pieces of horn to go into the bow's stave. If you are interested in crossbows, talk to my friend, Barnar the Tinker. Later, if your skills have outgrown your Composite Bow I might have a way to upgrade it."
Thanks go to CptDelta.

location.name: Southern Mount Esper Portal
location.description: A portal that lets you out just South of the Crater Pathway.

location.name: Three Stones
location.description:
Three stones... aligned from West to East...
Location and image submitted by Merkan. Thanks!

location.name: Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa
location.description:
Quest(s): Mnemosynes.
Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa will give you a reward of Peerless or Treated Heal Kits in exchange for Mnemosynes.
Hello. Myself and my brothers-in-arms have been assigned to exchange gifts with those that donate undead trophies to the Shagar Zharalim.
The literal translation of my name means daughter of the wind. I adopted it in honor of my mentor, who recently disappeared during a journey to Uziz.
There are healing kits even more potent than the ones dropped mainly by Lugians. The Zharalim have recently uncovered lore that enables them to treat these kits in order to make them more potent. If you trade me a memnosyne [sic] fragment, I will reward you in turn, depending on the quality of the fragment.
You give Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa A Large Mnemosyne.
Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa gives you Treated Healing Kit.

location.name: Anid Al-Fadee
location.description:
Quest(s): Mnemosynes.
Anid Al-Fadee will give you Gems of Cleansing, Purity or Stillness in exchange for Mnemosynes.
Hello. Myself and my brothers-in-arms have been assigned to exchange gifts with those that donate undead trophies to the Shagar Zharalim.
I realize that it is dangerous to hunt the more potent Sand Kings without protection. With the proper gift, I have been authorized to grant you a gem that can disperse such maladies.
There have been many strange occurrences in the desert recently. On occasion, there are sudden sandstorms for no reason. It is very odd...
You give Anid Al-Fadee A Large Mnemosyne.
Anid Al-Fadee tells you, "Thank you. Here is your reward."
Anid Al-Fadee gives you Gem of Stillness.

location.name: Renselm
location.description:
Quest(s): Mnemosynes.
Hand me the Mnemosyne. You will get your just reward.
Within Mnemosyne Collection Site (Large).

location.name: Hahnain
location.description:
Quest(s): Mnemosynes.
Yes? Saelar told me to expect you. Why we need to deal with you...I will accept the Mnemosynes, but Renslem has been tasked with collecting and sorting the largest of the Mnemosynes. He can be found through that portal.
Within Mnemosyne Collection Site (Small).

location.name: Saelar
location.description:
Quest(s): Mnemosynes.
Greetings, outlander. I am Saelar of Menilesh. My master, the great Tennar Portheran perished during the Fourth Sending, along with so many of our people. But before he died, he set in motion a way for our people to preserve our heritage and our memories in the face of the recent catastrophes that have befallen the Dericost. He invented a number of Mnemosynes, devices that allow us to record our stories and lives in these little pyramids.
Tennar commissioned a locksmith from among your kind, whose name I do not know, to make these Mnemosynes lockable and to make keys to the Mnemosynes which only Tennar would possess. Unfortunately, I have no idea what happened to the lockpicker or his keys. The Mnemosynes have been coming in, and I have no way of opening them.
But still, if you come across a Mnemosyne please bring them to me and I will reward you well. The collection for the larger Mnemosynes I have tasked to my assistants whom can be found through the portal.
Within Mnemosyne Collection Site (Tiny).

location.name: Mnemosyne Collection Site
location.description:
Quest(s): Mnemosynes.
This dungeon has three parts separated by portals. The initial landscape portal is unrestricted, the second portal is restricted to characters level 15+, the third portal is restricted to characters level 30+.

location.name: Wing Collector (Yanshi)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Shoushi)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Sawato)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Nanto)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Mayoi)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Ercel
location.description:
Quest(s): Ercel's Lost Book, Lost Distillery, Lytelthorpe Starter Quests.
Ercel tells you, "I'm writing a book on the subject of phyntos wasp wings, but alas, I lost it in the ruins east of here. Now I must start all over again! If you ever find my book please bring it to me."
Ercel tells you, "To get to the ruins, follow the pillars going east. Please hurry before the creatures destroy my book."
Ercel tells you, "Oh, once in the ruins, try to find the trail of rocks."

location.name: Wing Collector (Lytelthorpe)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Lin)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Glenden Wood)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Eastham)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Baishi)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Arwic)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Drudge Camp
location.description: This ring of standing stones has become the home to a small camp of drudges. Have caution when you approach or they may try to add you to their pot.

location.name: Farmer (Arwic)
location.description: This farmer tends the orchards to the west of his small house. He manages to help offset the damage the drudges and shreths in this area do to his crops by selling food to people using the lifestone nearby.

location.name: Ketnan
location.description:
Ketnan is a less then reputable fellow. He's been know to trade folks for a bludgeon sword, hoary robe, and other near useless items.
While I believe that my loyal customers have been pleased with the fine Hoary Mattekar Robe (don't forget the free Bludgeoning Sword!), there has been a rather rude sort who proclaim that I have been cheating them somehow. It is unfortunate that dueling is beneath me, otherwise I would give these curs a well deserved beating.
Since a man in my line of work cannot afford to have all these aspersions cast upon his character, I have decided to temporarily cease production of the Hoory Robe. And anything you hear about my Hoory supplier cutting me off due to lack of payment is just another nasty rumor, I assure you.
I look forward to being able to supply the fine people of Dereth with more quality items in the future. In the meantime, any free pyreals you might have to spare will bring me closer to my ultimate goal of ruling all of Dereth. Ha ha. A joke. What I meant was, bring me closer to opening up my own humble clothing store.

location.name: Panopticon
location.description: This prison facility was located after the Virindi takeover of Ayan Baqur. Guarded by Virindi of various types and their servants -tuskers, drudges, and hollow minions - the prison may contain some clue to the fate of Ayan Baqur's missing residents.

location.name: Linvak Tukal
location.description: A fortress built by the Lugians in the Linvak Range. Adventurers should be wary of the Lugian Raiders that wield hollow weapons who appear to be laying siege to their brethern.

location.name: Aerbax Laboratory
location.description: This Virindi laboratory contains the secrets of Aerbax and his apprentices. Within its halls you will face its guardians - a variety of dolls, marionettes, dark marionettes, and virindi puppets - before reaching Aerbax's central haven.
location.monsters: Prstine Doll, Innocent Doll, Marionette, Dark Marionette, Virindi Puppet, Aerbax's Apprentice

location.name: Hebian-To Advocate/Sentinel Monument
location.description: A memorial to those who served as Advocates and Sentinels from PY 1-PY 11.

location.name: Linvak Tukal Entryway
location.description:
Quest(s): Arm, Mind, Heart.
These tunnels offer access to the fortress city of Linvak Tukal. They are guarded by Lithos, Obeloth, Gigas, and Extas Lugins some of whom wield hollow weapons.

location.name: Lugian Camp
location.description: A camp to hunt laigus, amploth, and obeloth lugians.

location.name: Gredaline Consulate
location.description:
Quest(s): Virindi Spells.
A Virindi installation, containing the Virindi's minions Drudges, Dolls, Tuskers, and 2 Hollow Minions. Recently constructed, the Consulate serves some purpose in the Virindi's current plans. Within its halls may lie clues to unlocking those plans as well as other arcane secrets.

location.name: Zaikhal Advocate/Sentinel Monument
location.description: A monument to those who served as sentinels and advocates from PY 1 - PY 11.

location.name: Cragstone Advocate/Sentinel Monument
location.description: A monument to those who served as sentinels and advocates from PY 1 - PY 11.

location.name: Monty's Den Of Iniquity
location.description:
Monty's Den of Iniquity offers low, medium, and high stakes gambling as well as a shot at the big golden chest.
NPCs
Rare Exchanger Monty the Munificent Boddry the Chancy Pawn Shopkeep Aluvian Low-Stakes Gamemaster Aluvian Mid-Stakes Gamemaster Aluvian High-Stakes Gamemaster

location.name: Arshid's Den Of Iniquity
location.description:
Arshid's Den of Iniquity offers low, medium, and high stakes gambling as well as a shot at the big golden chest.
NPCs
Rare Exchanger Arshid al-Qiyid Ashadi Bint Samaq Pawn Shopkeep Gharu'ndim Low-Stakes Gamemaster Gharu'ndim Mid-Stakes Gamemaster Gharu'ndim High-Stakes Gamemaster

location.name: Gan-Zo's Den Of Iniquity
location.description:
Gan-Zo's Den Of Iniquity offers low, medium, and high stakes gambling as well as a shot at the big golden chest.
NPCs
Rare Exchanger Mi Gan-Zo Haya Su Ka Pawn Shopkeep Sho Low-Stakes Gamemaster Sho Mid-Stakes Gamemaster Sho High-Stakes Gamemaster

location.name: Sand Shallow
location.description: A dungeon in the wastes of the A'mun populated by powerful Reed Sharks and Ancient and Dread Mu Miyah.

location.name: Portal to Rivermouth
location.description: Image and location submitted by Circeus, Harvestgain. Thanks!

location.name: Black Dominion
location.description:
Quest(s): Singularity Weapons.
Upgrade your Singularity weapon!
Thanks to Morgath of Leafcull for updating the patchtree with this information and the Thase Allegiance of Leafcull for the pic.

location.name: Farmer (Dryreach)
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Image and location submitted by Courier de Bois, Wintersebb

location.name: Zaikhal to Danby's Outpost
location.description: A portal near Zaikhal leading to Danby's Outpost. The portal exits just outside of town in a wilderness thick with azure and rust gromnies, mud and water golems, and various kinds of reedsharks.

location.name: Desert March
location.description:
here are two locations for this dungeon. One just south of Danby's Outpost, and the other west of Al-Jalima on the inner sea. It has portals to:
* Bandit Castle * Black Hill * Obsidian Rim (aka VoD Lifestone) * Southern Mt Esper * North Dires * South Dires

location.name: Danby's Outpost
location.description: This outpost in the Northern Direlands was founded by the Chef Danby and his wife Gretta. It contains vendors whose wares include the most basic items of survival on Dereth. The origins of the town are mysterious as Danby states a mysterious man in a mask helped to construct the town.

location.name: Larry the Rabbit Master
location.description:
Quest(s): Bunny Master Title.
Larry the Rabbit Master has more than his hands full of bunnies. He might even be willing to reward someone who helped him out with his work. Perhaps you too could one day earn the title of Bunny Master?

location.name: Rabbit Master Lifestone
location.description: Location submitted by Bansheigh. Thanks!

location.name: Ayan Baqur Lifestone
location.description: Location submitted by Tom J. Thanks!

location.name: Inculcation Cells
location.description: Contains Drudge Raveners, Hollow Minions and Virindi Masters. There is a Virindi called Lacandrillar the Inculcator at the bottom who drops the Inculcation Cells Message and a portal scroll (its apparantly random--I received a portal tie scroll, another guy also got a tie scroll, and one other got a summon portal scroll).

location.name: Essence of Enchantment
location.description:
Quest(s): Harbinger.
This is the where you exchange your level 6 creature scrolls for level 7 spells.
- Atarax (Leafcull)

location.name: Land Bridge Staging Complex
location.description: The dungeon contains Drudge Stalkers and Raveners as well as Virindi Puppets. The Virindi Director's Majordomo seeks an orb of some power to proceed further inside.

location.name: Shimena Keep
location.description:
Shimena Keep was constructed on the northeast islet. Shimena guarded the northern approaches to Ireth Lassel research colony from Pelagian sea-nomads.
Image submitted by Kyn. Thanks!

location.name: Aurlanaa's Aerie
location.description:
The Gromnatross - can you see the little gromnie?
The Blessing of Aerlinthe. A gromnatross makes her aerie on the peaks of Cunara. She is named Aurlanaa by the people of the port.
The rumored nest of a Gromnatross at 89.0N 42.8E on Aerlinthe, overlooking a lava stream. There's a white Empyrean Ruin Meeting Hall Style Building nearby.

location.name: Aerlinthe Souvenir Tent
location.description: A Tent at 84.3N 45.0E on the West Shore of Aerlinthe, with a NPC selling the unique Souvenir T-shirts.

location.name: Relic Town
location.description:
Quest(s): Lady Aerfalle.
Image submitted by Kyn. Thanks!
(This image was taken with NightVision IV cast on the surveyor - the green color is due to a side effect. Thanks for understanding. - Soulitaire).

location.name: Tenkarrdun Foundry
location.description:
Quest(s): Lady Aerfalle.
The Sluice Gate Bar is located half way down on the floor. The Smith Golem only appears after the bar has been given to the Repair Golem at the bottom of Aerlinthe Reservoir. Lockpick is needed. The Smith Golem accepts the Pyreal Forge Bellows (after bar has been given).
Image submitted by Kyn. Thanks!
location.monsters: Diamond Golem, Fire Wisp, Firestorm, Ember, Magma Golem, Nubilous Golem, Relic Bones, Unstable Magma Golem

location.name: Northern Point Lifestone
location.description: Location confirmed by Hannover. Thanks!

location.name: Northern Point Vendors
location.description: An archmage, a healer and a roaming bowyer... Not the beginning of a joke - these intrepid fellows make their sales in one bunker, while the other next door is taken by a mu-miyah. Such competition!

location.name: Ivory Crafter (Eastham)
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself.

location.name: Ivory Crafter (Glenden Wood)
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself.

location.name: Ivory Crafter (Kryst)
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself.

location.name: Ivory Crafter (Uziz)
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself.

location.name: Ivory Crafter (Zaikhal)
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Uziz)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Sawato)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Plateau Village)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Kara)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Fort Tethana)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Baishi)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Danby's Outpost)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Cragstone)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Tou-Tou)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Stone Collector (Zaikhal)
location.description:
I will take a number of tropy stones and jewels, such as virindi jewels, swamp stones, iron, copper, and granite golem hearts. I`ll also take banderling trophies. But what I really specialize in are the rare black rocks and black stones.
Takes Diamond Golem Hearts and gives 3 Diamond Scarabs for them.

location.name: Ivory Crafter (Ayan Baqur)
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself.

location.name: Mountain Shortcut Healer and Peddler
location.description:
Welcome! Welcome to our little outpost! What's your pleasure on this fine day? Perhaps some lockpicks, aye? Finest in the land, so they are!
You keep yourself safe out there. And stay away from the Bandit Castle! Since MacDugal's mob returned, it's been nothing but trouble between them and Tallial of Neydisa.

location.name: Nerezi ibn Risad
location.description:
Quest(s): Bestowers Guild of Dereth.
Nerezi ibn Risad tells you, "I sell instructions and puzzle pieces to applicants here at the Guild of Bestowers."

location.name: Naba Ko-Zin
location.description:
Quest(s): Bestowers Guild of Dereth.
Naba Ko-Zin tells you, "Have you come seeking instructions or puzzle pieces? I sell what you need for your examination at this branch of the Guild of Bestowers."
Naba Ko-Zin tells you, "Good Travels."

location.name: Eluard the Namer
location.description:
Quest(s): Bestowers Guild of Dereth, Gold Hill Ruins.
Welcome to the Aluvian branch of the Bestowers' Guild. We have chartered ourselves to bestow titles upon worthy applicants. My assistant Caranis sells instructions and skill puzzle pieces. On the other side of the room, you can find the base piece for the skill puzzle. But you may only attempt the test once per day, and you may only hold one title at a time.

location.name: Jaizen Tan
location.description:
Quest(s): Bestowers Guild of Dereth.
I am the examiner here at the Sho outpost of the Bestower`s Guild.
Please speak with Naba Ko-Zin if you wish to arrange for an examination.
The base piece of the skill puzzle is available in the other corner of this tent.
Be warned, however, that the test can only be taken once per day, and one may only be called by one title."

location.name: Zombie Cave
location.description: So close to Lin, it's ideal for a young adventurer's first zombie practice...

location.name: Essence of Verdancy
location.description:
Quest(s): Harbinger.
Here you can exchange your level 6 life scrolls for their level 7 counterparts.
Location courtesy of Ripshaw from Leafcull

location.name: Singularity Bore
location.description:
Quest(s): Singularity Caul Flagging.
A dungeon located at the center of the Obsidian Plain. It is home to the Virindi known as the Guardian of the Singularity who holds the secrets of entrance to the island called the Singularity Caul.
location.monsters: Paroxysm Shadow, Assailer, Virindi Executor, Virindi Profatrix, Virindi Adjudicator, Virindi Consul, Ascendant Drudge, Drudge Bloodletter, Drudge Mystic, Telumiat Hollow Minion

location.name: Singularity Caul
location.description:
The mysterious new island of the Virindi. The Caul may hold the secrets of the Singularity, but its denizens will not easily give them up.
Those wishing to reach the Caul will need to kill the Guardian of the Singularity and then travel through the fixed Singularity Caul portal in the northern halls of the Singularity Bore or locate the randomly spawning Singularity Caul portal around the Direlands.

location.name: Virindi Crafters
location.description: These Virindi Crafters have skills in creating a variety of weapons, but to create these weapons they need a Quiddity Ingot.

location.name: Swamp Gardens
location.description:
Quest(s): Little Green Seeds, Dyeing.
The portal into this cave may still be MISSING on some servers.
- Soulitaire, CoD cartographer
Home of Terese the Herbalist who, with a few seeds from a Shreth, may be able to provide a few unusual colored plants.
Thanks to Yashad ibn A'mun and Qu' Nho of Wintersebb for the info. This new and improved image is thanks to Pew the Mottled of Morningthaw. Thanks!

location.name: Tomb of the Dead
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Mechanic.
To reach the Alloy Contraption, a few levers need to be pulled.
location.monsters: Dark Wisp, Risen Soldier, Risen Knight

location.name: Collector (Lytelthorpe)
location.description: I`m particularly interested in the spine of the sandy armoredillo. Get that to me and I`ll give you a health potion. I`ll also pay the same for swamp stones and the scalps of banderlings.

location.name: Nanto Portal to Northern Point
location.description:
Location submitted by Laciel. Thanks!
You'll find the Northern Point vendors and a lifestone near the drop-off point. And you may want to prepare for a welcoming party of armoredilloes... a dozen or two...
One of the longest portal rides I've ever taken on Dereth. It's also one of the oddest looking portals. Green, with a purple hue.
- Yhe of Wintersebb

location.name: Dwynna's Hut
location.description:
...there are apples around it, and there was a bronze armoredillo trapped inside (I let it out, and then it met with a horrible accident... impaled itself on a greater armor piercing arrow, poor thing)
- Dwynna Wildshot

location.name: Flaming Pillars
location.description:
Two flaming pillars with two Lithos Lugians (now deceased) next to them.
Location and image submitted by Dwynna Wildshot. Thanks!

location.name: Riverside Vendors
location.description:
A healer and a mage share this lonely spot
Location and image submitted by Mira Coran. Thanks!

location.name: Riverside Lifestone
location.description: Location submitted by Mira Coran. Thanks!

location.name: Stable Rift
location.description:
Quest(s): Shackles of Obedience.
The now empty prison guarded by the Virindi called Dirrich the Warden, his dolls and several rifts. Vestiges of its former inhabitants can only be heard faintly in its now empty cells.
Only those who have felt a strange "change" occur in themselves when they have killed a rift can enter the Rift.
And no, this stable has nothing to do with horses ;O)

location.name: Jungle Wasp Tower
location.description: Pretty wings... but nasty spells.

location.name: Pookie (the Rabbit of Caerbannog)
location.description:
Quest(s): Slaying Pooky, Bunny Slippers, Son of Pooky.
Not aggressive unless IDed
VERY hard hitting (possibly hollow)
Casts bunny smite ( a spell that instantly kills anyone if they don't resist)
Very high health regeneration
Run speed is 700: 10-to-1 speeds indicate that this creature runs at 70 MPH.
Nicknamed 'Pooky' by the Turbine Developer Jesse "Devilmouse" Kurlancheek.
Original version was added during the beta of Asheron's Call. It was updated after Maggie Jackcat's Campaign to 'buff the bunny' was a success, the campaign proposed that the rabbit should be updated to become a threat once more to the increasingly powerful playerbase
And the Lord spake saying: First thou shalt take out the Holy Pin Then shalt thou count to Three No more, no less Three shall be the number thou shalt count And the number of the counting shall be Three Four shalt thou not count Neither count thou Two Excepting that thou then proceed to Three Five is right out! Once the number Three, being the third number, be reached Then lobbest thou thy Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch towards thy foe Who, being naughty in my sight Shall snuff it.
Maynard: Amen
All:Amen
Arthur: Right
One, Two, Five!
Three, Sir!
Three!
Choir hymn
BOOM.
- text from, of course, Monty Python's movie

location.name: North Camp
location.description: A shelter from rain and misfortune, this camp is totally deserted.

location.name: Dungeon of Corpses
location.description:
A dungeon containing various types of higher level drudges and some virindi. Use caution or you may be swarmed before you know it. Two special chests await within...
Information submitted by Hells Belle of Leafcull and Syr K of Wintersebb. Thanks!
Drudge Lurkers, Stalkers, and Raveners...LOTS OF THEM!!. The occasional Virindi Servant and some SI Chests.
- Hells Belle, Leafcull.

location.name: Jewel Collector (Baishi)
location.description:
In exchange for certain trophies, Jewel Collectors will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.
Jewel Collector tells you, "I collect only the rarest of trophy jewels. I will take gems that have been crafted by other trophy collectors and give you money for them."
Jewel Collector tells you, "But my true specialty lies in the jewels from the strange masked creatures."

location.name: Jewel Collector (Hebian-To)
location.description:
In exchange for certain trophies, Jewel Collectors will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.
Jewel Collector tells you, "I collect only the rarest of trophy jewels. I will take gems that have been crafted by other trophy collectors and give you money for them."
Jewel Collector tells you, "But my true specialty lies in the jewels from the strange masked creatures."
Thanks to Char'Med, WE

location.name: Jewel Collector (Sawato)
location.description:
In exchange for certain trophies, Jewel Collectors will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.
Jewel Collector tells you, "I collect only the rarest of trophy jewels. I will take gems that have been crafted by other trophy collectors and give you money for them."
Jewel Collector tells you, "But my true specialty lies in the jewels from the strange masked creatures."

location.name: Trophy Smith (Plateau Village)
location.description:
Trophy Smith tells you, "I am interested in armoredillo spines and golem hearts of all kinds. If you give me one I will craft an item from it, or give you something else of value."
In exchange for certain trophies, Trophy Smiths will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.

location.name: Trophy Smith (Qalaba'r)
location.description:
Trophy Smith tells you, "I am interested in armoredillo spines and golem hearts of all kinds. If you give me one I will craft an item from it, or give you something else of value."
In exchange for certain trophies, Trophy Smiths will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.

location.name: Trophy Smith (Samsur)
location.description:
Trophy Smith tells you, "I am interested in armoredillo spines and golem hearts of all kinds. If you give me one I will craft an item from it, or give you something else of value."
In exchange for certain trophies, Trophy Smiths will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.

location.name: Trophy Smith (Sawato)
location.description:
Trophy Smith tells you, "I am interested in armoredillo spines and golem hearts of all kinds. If you give me one I will craft an item from it, or give you something else of value."
In exchange for certain trophies, Trophy Smiths will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.

location.name: Tumerok Collector (Dryreach)
location.description:
A collector that specializes only in Tumerok Insignias.
Gold Tumerok Insignia - 500xp - 1000 py.

location.name: Fazyad ibn Raymar
location.description:
Quest(s): Gem of Impulse.
Fazyad ibn Raymar tells you, "Have you come to help us cleanse the lower levels of vermin? As the Bey of Xarabydun, I will reward you greatly for trophies that prove the death of the beasts that prevent our growth."
Fazyad will also collect Rat Tails.

location.name: Wa Shi, Rat Collector
location.description:
Quest(s): Rat Tails.
Wa Shi tells you, "Once upon a time, Dereth was nearly overrun with rats. But through the efforts of many people, most of the rats have been eradicated."
Wa Shi tells you, "They can be hard to kill because one must aim low to hit them. I will take any rat tail trophies you find, but rats are much rarer now."
Wa Shi tells you, "I do know of a small lair of rats southwest of the waterfalls. Do not go if you hate rats."

location.name: Double Ring Ruin
location.description: Location and image submitted by Ms. Dwynna Wildshot. Thanks!

location.name: Black Spawn Den (Fort Tethana)
location.description:
Black Spawn Den was one of three leveling dungeons introduced in the Paths of Destruction event. (The others being Olthoi Horde Nest and Lugian Citadel). A leveling dungeon is a dungeon with a large number of relatively easy to kill, often non magic, creatures worth good experience, on a fast spawn cycle. The Black Spawn Dens were popular leveling areas until supplanted by the Marae Lassel Olthoi dungeons in the Oct 2001 Dark Majesty expansion and finally the Aphus Lassel Tusker Dungeons in Nov 2002.
The portal entry requires level 20+. Entry is neither a safe nor hot drop. Tuskers can and do get into the first room, epsecially if dragged into the room by other players. The first area is comprised of Tusker Slaves. As you go back the dungeon divides into a right and left area with the left area being the larger of the two. About half way into the dungeon Tusker Guards appear. In the right area is a virindi puppet in the last room.
Thanks to Morgan the Stout for pointing out this location.

location.name: Portal to the Northwest Direlands
location.description:
Took me a while to become strong enough to use this portal! On the other side, there's another portal to the Obsidian Rim, one of my favorite adventuring locations.
-Yhe of Wintersebb
Thanks for submitting this location, Yhe!

location.name: South Rim to Direlands Valley
location.description:
On one of my frequent travels around the Obsidian Rim, I came across these two Direlands portals with a Lifestone right in between. A very unusual find!
- Yhe of Wintersebb
Location and image submitted by Yhe. Thanks!

location.name: South Rim to Direlands NW Shore
location.description:
On one of my frequent travels around the Obsidian Rim, I came across these two Direlands portals with a Lifestone right in between. A very unusual find!
- Yhe of Wintersebb
Location and image submitted by Yhe. Thanks!

location.name: Garold's Gully Lifestone
location.description:
To our great surprise, a Lifestone grew out of the ground a few months back, and a Direlands portal opened in our backyard! Suffice to say, I took the hint and began adventuring!
-Yhe of Wintersebb

location.name: Garold's Gully Vendors
location.description:
Here be my late father Garold's old cabin. These days my sister the Archmage and her best friend the Roaming Bowyer (who doesn't seem to roam very much these days) are taking care of the land.
- Yhe of Wintersebb

location.name: Small Banderling Camp
location.description: Here you'll find several Banderlings lead by a Banderling Captain. They are guarding a chest of some sort. - Yhe of Wintersebb

location.name: Zaikhal Advanced Tower
location.description:
A Virindi Tower guarded by Tumerok forces. The death of the leader of those nearby forces will create access to a portal leading inside a camp and then to the tower itself.
Thank you, Pepin of Blackmire!

location.name: Cragstone Advanced Tower
location.description:
A Virindi Tower guarded by Tumerok forces. The death of the leader of those nearby forces will create access to a portal leading inside a camp and then to the tower itself.
Thank you, Pepin of Blackmire!
Note: No Longer Exists. Guinevere Du Avalon TD 11-11-2009

location.name: Hebian-To Advanced Tower
location.description:
A Virindi Tower guarded by Tumerok forces. The death of the leader of those nearby forces will create access to a portal leading inside a camp and then to the tower itself.
Thank you, Pepin of Blackmire!

location.name: Hebian-To Middle Guard Tower
location.description: A Virindi Tower guarded by Tumerok forces. The death of the leader of those nearby forces will create access to a portal leading inside a camp and then to the tower itself.

location.name: Cragstone Middle Guard Tower
location.description:
A Virindi Tower guarded by Tumerok forces. The death of the leader of those nearby forces will create access to a portal leading inside a camp and then to the tower itself.
Note: No Longer Exists. Guinevere Du Avalon TD 11-12-2009

location.name: Zaikhal Middle Guard Tower
location.description: A Virindi Tower guarded by Tumerok forces. The death of the leader of those nearby forces will create access to a portal leading inside a camp and then to the tower itself.

location.name: Zaikhal ReinforcementsTower
location.description: A Virindi Tower guarded by Tumerok forces. The death of the leader of those nearby forces will create access to a portal leading inside a camp and then to the tower itself.

location.name: Cragstone Reinforcements Tower
location.description:
A Virindi Tower guarded by Tumerok forces. The death of the leader of those nearby forces will create access to a portal leading inside a camp and then to the tower itself.
Note: No Longer Exists. Guinevere Du Avalon TD 11-11-2009

location.name: Hebian-To ReinforcementsTower
location.description: A Virindi Tower guarded by Tumerok forces. The death of the leader of those nearby forces will create access to a portal leading inside a camp and then to the tower itself.

location.name: Chosen of Asheron (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Quest(s): Harbinger.
Chosen of Asheron tells you, "My lord conveys his gratitude for the efforts of your people. If you are one of the champions who took part in the defeat of Bael'Zharon, I can take your Soul Crystal Gem and give you a spellcasting staff to commemorate your achievement."
Chosen of Asheron gives you Asheron's Second Missive.
Chosen of Asheron tells you, "Also, I have instructions here that will lead you to the site of the Hopeslayer's defeat, should you wish to visit it."
Chosen of Asheron gives you Instructions.
Thanks to Pax the Terrorsmith and Yoshimitu for the info!

location.name: Lieutenant Kenneth
location.description: Quest(s): Tumerok Assault Weapons. Hello, my name is Kenneth, I`m here to help direct an organized resistance against the Virindi and Tumerok attacks. If you give me a banner, I will gladly reward you, as it is proof of your heroism. Give Lieutenant Kenneth your banner to receive a reward of experience points. Thank you, your heroism is appreciated! Thank you Zsuzsana for the info and the stranger for the picture! You can find more information regarding the Tumerok banner quest by reading our Quest Writeup.

location.name: Halls of Metos (Wai Jhou)
location.description:
Quest(s): Asheron's Departure, Crafting Golems.
Metos was an Empyrean expert in the construction of Golems, and a friend of Asheron. He maintained three workshops, what we know today as the three Halls of Metos. His heritage is unknown. Since he is a contemporary of Asheron, he is likely Yalain. However, the style of the three halls is strikingly Dericost, and the halls themselves are occupied by Dericost undead.
Original Entry:
This one is reached by going to the exit portal at the bottom of the other Halls of Metos in the desert. Seems like maybe the revenants in this one throw slightly more level 6 spells than those in the desert as well, though I could be just reading into it.
Thanks to Jarrod Konner for the information.

location.name: Shosa Kiroji Matanui
location.description:
Quest(s): Tumerok Training Camps (Assault Weapons, Tumerok Banners.
Gives Sho Gems of Worth, xp and Assault Weapons in exchange for Tumerok Banners.
Shosa Kiroji Matanui tells you, "Greetings! My name is Kiroji, and I am a Shosa in the Sho Army. We must rally to deal with the renegade Tumerok alliance. We must not allow Hebian-To to fall!" Shosa Kiroji Matanui tells you, "Queen Elysa has called for volunteers to help investigate the Tumerok training camps near Dryreach. You can pick up a news sheet about this menace from the barkeeper." Shosa Kiroji Matanui tells you, "If you have already investigated the camps, and you have some trophy to prove it, I will gladly reward you. I also accept Tumerok insignia."

location.name: Portal to Hilltop
location.description: Location submitted by Falkon, Field Surveyor. Thanks!

location.name: Portal to Lighthouse
location.description:
This will take you up up up the hill to the lighthouse.
Location submitted by Falkon, Field Surveyor. Thanks!

location.name: Chosen of Asheron (Cragstone)
location.description:
My lord conveys his gratitude for the efforts of your people. If you are one of the champions who took part in the defeat of Bael'Zharon, I can take your Soul Crystal Gem and give you a helmet to commemorate your achievement.
The Chosen of Asheron then gives the player Asheron's Second Missive.
Thanks to Troop, Solclaim!

location.name: Ufet, Prophet of Blades
location.description:
Quest(s): Decrepit Tower, Tumerok Banners.
One of the 3 Isparian military Recruiters looking for information regarding the invading Tumerok forces.
Good Day. My name is Ufet, and I am here to organize the defense of Gharu'ndim from the depredations of the Tumeroks and Virindo. If you grant me any banner, I will reward you for your heroism. The more developed the banner, the of a reward I will provide.

location.name: Portal to Slaughterhouse
location.description:
The portal drops you near a large Tumerok type fortress (which I suppose is the slaughterhouse) which I have never seen before. It is located in a basin in the North Dires, and surrounded by grievvers, gold wasps, shadow spawns, and the Tumeroks in the fortress itself. I have not been able to get inside yet.
- The Ticktock Man (Morningthaw)
Location and image submitted by the Ticktock Man. Thanks!

location.name: Tumerok Slaughterhouse
location.description:
Don't know what else is in there besides Tumeroks, but outside are spawns of various virinidi, golems, grievvers, drudges, shadows, and at least one banderling rugby team (enforcers / thrashers / strikers) and of course Tumeroks of all kinds. There is a gate to get inside, not sure if it is locked or not.
- The Ticktock Man
Location and image submitted by the Ticktock Man. Thanks!
Note: The coordinates are those of the portal arrival spot. - Soulitaire, CoD cartographer

location.name: West Coast Vendors
location.description:
Here, on a remote beach on the west shores of Dereth, these farmers eke out a meager existence. Things have gotten even worse since the September 2001 event, Keep Your Enemies Closer -- the area is surrounded by a wide variety of Dires spawn: Olthoi Soldiers, Harrower Grievers, Panumbris and Umbris Shadows, and other nasties! A nearby portal takes you to Plateau, just a stone's throw from Plateau Village.
Oh, and we may not forget to mention the Cow!

location.name: Janda Sulifiya
location.description:
Quest(s): Mask Makers of Dereth, Heritage Masks.
Janda Sulifa tells you, "Did you know there is a ceremonial mask for each culture? I so long for the day that I can make a ceremonial mask of my own!".

location.name: Alexander the Deft
location.description:
Quest(s): Mask Makers of Dereth, Heritage Masks.
Alexander the Deft tells you, "Hello, I am Alexander the Deft. If you give me a creature's head or facial covering, I may be able to make it into a mask for you."

location.name: Tsua Kagemata
location.description:
Quest(s): Mask Makers of Dereth, Heritage Masks.
Tsua Kagemata tells you, "Greetings to you on this fine day. I am Tsua, mask maker of no small ability. If you provide me with a creature's head or facial covering, I will make it into a mask that will allow you to participate in Oseth's celebration."

location.name: Abandoned Shops Portal
location.description:
Quest(s): Exploration Society Letters, Abandoned Shops.
Home of the Al-Arqas Town Stamp, used in the Explorer Society Quests.

location.name: Jubei's Apprentice
location.description:
Sells at 145%, buys at 90%.
A furniture vendor in Hebian-To.

location.name: Steiner's Apprentice
location.description: A furntiure vendor in Cragstone.

location.name: Jubei Minawoto
location.description:
Hello!
My name is Jubei, and I specialize in random knickknacks that may seem worthwhile to have in your house. Once I get around to making the necessary tools, and you have an item that might be of interest, bring it to me.
Or not...

location.name: Bartholomew Steiner
location.description:
Good day to you! I am Bartholomew, though my friends call me Bart. After I get set up here, I'll start taking certain items and making them into furniture.
There's nothing finer, than wares made by Steiner!

location.name: Leopold
location.description:
Quest(s): Delving into Claude's Mind, Masks.
Hello, my name is Leopold! It is awfully hot out, is it not? Good thing I am wearing short sleeves!
Leopold tells you, "Greetings. I am a member of Claude's pod. It is good to meet you. The environment is pleasing today, agreed..."
Leopold tells you, "Do I seem less exultant than normal? I confront two issues, comrade. Claude has returned, yes, but is now more independent than before. I worry that if the Singularity were to find out, Claude would be reabsorbed or worse."
Leopold tells you, "I also find myself increasingly thinking of myself as separate from the Singularity. How can this be? Do you understand, comrade? How can I have a desire above that of the Singularity? I suppose you might. It is the nature of this place to distance us from the Singularity - to slowly cause us to lose our connection and sanity."
Leopold tells you, "You cannot help me, but perhaps you may function to help Claude."
Leopold tells you, "His consciousness has been closed to me. Please, if you can unlock it and discover the error in his mentality, do so."
Leopold can help you repair a Broken Virindi Mask, should you find one...but can he be trusted?

location.name: Aun Shimauri
location.description:
Quest(s): Palenqual's Living Weapons.
Aun Shimauri tells you, We alone among the Tonk have been blessed by Palenqual. In her wrath against Wharu, she has given us the weapons that live to fight against him. Find one of our totems on the Hea, and I will reward you with the friendship of the Aun.
You allow Aun Shimauri to examine your Hea Totem.
Aun Shimauri tells you, I`m sorry, friend, but this totem is obviously of Hea craftmanship. See its inferior carving? The totems I am seeking to restore to my people are made of greenstone, opal, and obsidian. And further--even though the Hea have demeaned themselves by stealing from us, I cannot accept something that belongs to them. You should take this to Aun Hareltah--our Tah will know what to do with it.

location.name: The Dark Lair
location.description: Quest(s): Olthoi Pincers (Gardener).
location.monsters: Olthoi Gardener, Olthoi Harvester

location.name: Aun Papileona's Shrine to Raeta
location.description: Quest(s): Raeta's Necklace.

location.name: Hea Toneawa
location.description:
Quest(s): An Aun Hea Romance.
Hea Toneawa tells you, Greetings! Could you do me a favor, please? I planned meet my beloved, Aun Mariona, but I am afraid that my Hea brethren have learned of our romance and are watching over me. Could you take her this note? I dare not go meet her myself, lest they slay us together.
You will find her at the base of the Marescent Cliffs, almost directly north from the city your kind calls Redspire. I have written the directions to our meeting place on the note.

location.name: Aun Bernawa
location.description:
Quest(s): An Aun Hea Romance.
Aun Bernawa tells you, I am waiting here for Hea Toneawa. I don't suppose he gave anything to you for my sister, Mariona?

location.name: Palenqual's Cavern
location.description: Quest(s): Palenqual's Living Weapons.

location.name: William Witty
location.description:
Quest(s): Bunny Slippers.
William Witty tells you, "What's with all the carrots, you ask? Why, I'm luring bunnies! See my slippers? Why, I was able to run all the way from the Direlands to here, fast as you can say "Lickety-split!" And I can't tell you how nice it is at the end of the day to curl up by the fire with a good book and these slippers warming my tootsies. And ya know what? I like these so much, I have them in every color of the rainbow...Well, tell ya what. If you bring me a little rabbit carcass, I'll make one for ya--but mind you, only one."

location.name: Sentry
location.description: Sentry tells you, There have been reports of odd portal disruptions in this area. I've been sent to this outpost to keep watch. If you're new to this land, for safety's sake I'd suggest you stay well within the Arcanum's perimeter of Obelisks--at least until you're strong enough to venture out on your own.

location.name: Holtburg to West Holtburg Villas Portal
Arwic to South Beach Pass Villas Portal
Arwic to Far Claw Villas Portal
Aerlinthe Reservoir
location.description:
Quest(s): Lady Aerfalle.
The Sacrificial Dagger is found here behind a locked (402) door. There is a portal to Aerlinthe Lower Reservoir behind a locked (322) door at the bottom.
Thanks to Shrinette of SC for this location.
location.monsters: Diamond Golem, Olthoi Piercer, Olthoi Eviscerator, Olthoi Nymph, Wasteland Rat, Great Skeleton, Great Revenant, Cursed Wisp, Fire Wisp

location.name: Britana
location.description:
Quest(s): Canescent Mattekar Robe.
In the fall of 2005, Viamontians raided Marae Lassal, capturing some of its townsfolk. Britana is now imprisoned in the Viamontian Torture Chamber at 69.6N 62.6W.
Britana tells you, What? Who's there? Ketnan? Mazur? Please, get me out of here!
Britana tells you, Greetings brave adventurer! My name is Britana, perhaps you've heard of my...never mind, he isn't important anyway. What is important is have I got a deal for you! Perhaps you have heard of a small fashion accessory...The Hoary Mattekar Robe? Yes, I am sure you have. Well, unlike some others who seek to perpetuate fraud upon the Isparian public with cheap knockoffs, Britana only provides the real thing.
Britana tells you, I have come to this island upon hearing reports of a great white beast that stalks its northern coasts. Rumor has it this is a Mattekar straight out of legend, come to rid the island of its troublesome denizens. Which denizens, you ask? Legend does not say.
Britana tells you, But what I say is that a Mattekar this large and strong must produce a robe which makes the Hoary robe seem like a bath rug! Bring me this mattekar pelt, and I will craft you a robe fit for a king!
Within Viamontian Torture Chamber.

location.name: Mazur ibn Stounis
location.description:
Quest(s): Canescent Mattekar Robe.
Mazur ibn Stounis tells you, Yes, I have agreed to help Britana in her quest to fashion a new Hoary Mattekar Robe. I don't know where this new Mattekar is rumored to be, you would have to ask Britana. I have to admit, I had never encountered a woman like Britana before back in my home village. She is quite the woman.
After September 2005 Mazur ibn Stounis tells you, Have you any word of Britana? I can barely sleep at night, my heart is sick with worry for her. Varicci's men dragged her off solely because of her brother! And now I am told I must aid this Eliza woman or share Britana's fate! I tell myself that I can do Britana no good imprisoned, but... at any rate, I will still aid you in the crafting of robes.

location.name: Shalon ibn Mayar the Collector
location.description:
Shalon ibn Mayar the Collector tells you, I am looking for Carenzi Burrower pelts, Littoral Siraluun claws, Drudge charms, and Sand Golem hearts. I will pay highly for them!
After September 2005
Shalon ibn Mayar the Collector tells you, I am looking for Carenzi Burrower pelts, Littoral Siraluun claws, Drudge charms, and Sand Golem hearts. I will pay highly for them, despite Varicci's occupation.

location.name: Bluespire to Ahurenga
location.description: This portal cannot be summoned nor linked to. This portal cannot be recalled to.

location.name: Aun Firanauri the Gate Keeper to Timaru
location.description:
Aun Firanauri eyes you warily.
Aun Firanauri the Gate Keeper tells you, So, you seek access to Timaru, Isparian? You have not offended the xuta recently, so I will grant you passage. But do not harry our works against Wharu, or this town will be close to you!
These words are true, for if you take action in aiding the Olthoi (Wharu), you will be barred from the town for a period or until you can set things right again.

location.name: Aun Hareltah
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Queen.
Aun Hareltah looks around his town grimly.
Aun Hareltah glances at you sharply. Aun Hareltah tells you, "I do not know your name, and thanks to your people, Wharu's children have overrun the whole of Palenqual. I do not have the time to chat with tourists. Make your name known to me, and we will talk."
Note:He is in different places and says different things depending on the stage the Queen Quest is in.

location.name: Aun Mareura the Collector
location.description:
Aun Mareura the Collector tells you, I am interested in collecting Olthoi claws, Rabid Carenzi Pelts, and Vapor Golem hearts. I will espescially reward you for yellow Virindi jewels--those floating demons must be purged from our island!
Do not give him Aun Pendants or you will be banned from Timaru for 30 days.

location.name: Aun Papileona
location.description: Quest(s): Raeta's Necklace. Aun Papileona tells you, Greetings, traveler. I have a grave favor to ask you. In his jealousy, the anima Carenzi has infested the beautiful shrine I built for Raeta with his creatures. I tried to route them myself, but the horrid beasts nearly ripped me to pieces and ate the key to my chest! Until my shrine is cleansed of his defiling presence, Raeta will not return! Aun Papileona tells you, I locked my amulet inside my chest--if you bring it to me as proof that you have driven Carenzi away, I will reward you with the title of Carenzi Slayer. Follow Volkama's riverbanks to the north, and you'll find my shrine. (Starting point for the Raeta's Necklace quest.)

location.name: Aun Whethura the Crafter
location.description:
Quest(s): Siraluun Dresses (Strand, Kithless, Untamed, Badlands).
Aun Whethura the Crafter tells you, "How I miss the birds of my home world! My brother Ihipura once taught me to invoke their animas for aid. If you bring me a small bundle of feathers from the Kithless Siraluun that roam the island, I will ask Siraluun to help me make a special headdress for you. Even better, if you combine the five of the smaller bundles into a large one, I will make a lovely dress. Here, add the bundles to this special bag, it will keep them from getting rumpled."
Aun Whethura the Crafter gives you Emproidered Bag.
The Emboidered Bag will allow you to safely store Small Bundles of Kithless Siraluun Feathers to be crafted into a fine Siraluun Dress. He also takes single bundles to craft a Siraluun Headress.

location.name: Bachus Flufens
location.description:
Quest(s): Aun Tanua's War Taiaha.
Bachus Flufens tells you, A visitor! I do not often get many visitors to my modest homestead. Did Micon or Lark tell you that I've been spending time with the Tumeroks? A most fanciful folk, I must say! Why, just the other day one of the Hea told me about a legendary spear they dismantled and enshrined in two separate parts of the island. It once belonged to a warrior from an opposite faction, I believe. He tried to persuade them back to traditional ways, but they would have none of it. Somehow they dispatched him but retained his spear...which is supposed to have some sort of magical, living properties to it. I'm not quite sure what to believe.
Bachus Flufens tells you, Perhaps the answer could be found in the caverns to the northwest along the shore. Try the area around 44 North, 87 West--at least that's where I saw my new Tumerok acquaintences heading last. Beware, friend--it sounded as if they held this artifact in high esteem, and it's quite likely to be well guarded. I'd go myself, but I must catch up on my journal today. If you would like to read it, here are a few pages that I wrote the other day.
Bachus Flufens gives you Bachus Flufen's Journal.
After September 2005
Bachus Flufens tells you, Woe is me! As if it were not bad enough that I was driven out of my farm to the west by the Hea, now Varicci has taken over my town! Fortunately Micon and I are safe, but I must say that it has made it very difficult to continue my work.

location.name: Base of the Cliffs Portal
location.description: This portal cannot be summoned nor linked to. This portal cannot be recalled to.

location.name: Base of the Timaru Plateau Portal
location.description: This portal cannot be summoned nor linked to. This portal cannot be recalled to.

location.name: Behdo Yii
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Pincers.
Behdo Yii tells you, Hello there stranger! I am wondering if you can help me in a bit of a predicament I find myself in. I was busy exploring a wonderfully well-preserved abandoned Tumerok outpost, when I was beset upon by a number of Olthoi!
Behdo Yii tells you, I had never seen these fearsome creatures that close before, and the fact that I escaped with my life leads me to believe that these Olthoi aren't quite so tough as their mainland counterparts. If you could journey to this tumerok outpost and rid it of these troublesome beasts I would be most grateful.
Behdo Yii tells you, If you could bring me back some proof that you have conquered them, such as a pincer, I would reward you well. The portal into the dungeon is straight north of here, the Abandoned Tumerok Site.

location.name: Celcynd the Dour
location.description:
Quest(s): Exploration Society Letters, Oswald's Dirk, Rithwic Starter Quests, Water of Mount Lethe.
Celcynd the Dour tells you, "I have been contracted by the Dereth Exploration Society to help them in their outreach program towards the Isparians who find themselves newly exiled in Dereth. Here is a book that explains their mission. I am also giving you a list describing the locations of the nearest stamp and portals to other towns. If you collect any of the Society's stamped letters, you may bring them back to me for a reward."
Celcynd the Dour gives you A Book of Quests for New Explorers.
Celcynd the Dour gives you Nexus Town Information Guide.
Celcynd the Dour tells you, "By the way -- if you haven't yet done so, you might want to visit Brentsella at the South Outpost, or Mindorla at the East Outpost. They often have tasks for young adventurers."

location.name: Collector (Rithwic)
location.description: Collector tells you, "I`m interested in monster trophies from common rats, red phyntos wasps, armoredillos, drudges, mosswarts and banderlings. If you give me such an item, I will reward you with money or an item. I don`t deal in hides, however."

location.name: Redspire to Greenspire
location.description: This portal goes to the town of Greenspire on the island of Marae Lassal. This is a good town for characters over level 10.

location.name: Hea Arantah
location.description:
Quest(s): Hunting Aun Ralirea.
Young Arantah looks annoyed - which seems to be his natural state.
Hea Arantah tells you, What? Can`t you see I`m busy? I have many responsibilities here!
Hea Arantah tells you, That Aun hunter, for one. What`s his name?
Arantah belches loudly as Nyrinua calls over, Ralirea, my Tah.
Hea Arantah tells you, Ralirea, yes. Don`t CORRECT me, Nyri.
Hea Arantah tells you, Anyway, this old Aun dustongue - Ralirea - poaches the gromnies of my plateau! If someone would kill him, and bring me that figurine he wears within a day as proof...

location.name: Hea Ihipura the Crafter
location.description: Hea Ihipura the Crafter tells you, Siraluun has taught me the art of crafting special items from his talons. Should you bring me one of the claws from the shorebirds along the strand, I will present you with an example of this craft.

location.name: Hea Riketura the Collector
location.description: Hea Riketura the Collector tells you, I will reward you for for Carenzi Stalker pelts, Timber Siraluun claws, and Elaniwood Golem hearts. Also, our Aun brothers must be taught a lesson--if you deliver one of their pendants to me I will reward you handsomely.

location.name: Ling Xiao the Collector
location.description:
Ling Xiao the Collector tells you, If you were to bring me Carenzi Sentry pelts, Tidal Siraluun claws, Drudge charms, or Water Golem hearts, I will reward you with experience.
After September 2005
Ling Xiao the Collector tells you, If you were to bring me Carenzi Sentry pelts, Tidal Siraluun claws, Drudge charms, or Water Golem hearts, I will reward you with experience, despite Varicci's occupation.

location.name: Merlonna Farel the Collector
location.description:
Merlonna Farel the Collector tells you, I am gathering Carenzi Pouchling Pelts, Marsh Siraluun claws, Drudge charms, and Mud Golem Hearts. If you bring me one of these items, I will surely reward you.
After September 2005
Merlonna Farel the Collector tells you, I am gathering Carenzi Pouchling Pelts, Marsh Siraluun claws, Drudge charms, and Mud Golem Hearts. If you bring me one of these items, I will surely reward you, despite Varicci's occupation.

location.name: Northern Manumet Plains Portal
location.description: This portal cannot be summoned nor linked to. This portal cannot be recalled to.

location.name: Sentry
location.description: Sentry tells you, There have been reports of odd portal disruptions in this area. I've been sent to this outpost to keep watch. If you're new to this land, for safety's sake I'd suggest you stay well within the Arcanum's perimeter of Obelisks--at least until you're strong enough to venture out on your own.

location.name: Sentry
location.description: Sentry tells you, There have been reports of odd portal disruptions in this area. I've been sent to this outpost to keep watch. If you're new to this land, for safety's sake I'd suggest you stay well within the Arcanum's perimeter of Obelisks--at least until you're strong enough to venture out on your own.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Ayan Baqur)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Nasun ibn Tifar
location.description:
Quest(s): Note of Congratulation.
Nasun ibn Tifar tells you, I travel from town to town seeking phyntos wasp wings. If you bring me one, I shall reward you.
Nasun ibn Tifar tells you, My friend Mara al-Luq, the flower of Yaraq, has just received some happy news, and I want to congratulate her.
Nasun ibn Tifar gives you Congratulations.
Nasun ibn Tifar tells you, Would you have the time to bring this to Ahyara in the East Yaraq Outpost? She is also a friend of Mara's, and would wish to sign this small note as well.

location.name: Ahyara
location.description:
Quest(s): Note of Congratulation.
Ahyara tells you, Hail, wanderer. I collect drudge charms - if you bring me one, I'll pay you for it.
Ahyara tells you, My friend Mara al-Luq in Yaraq has just received some happy news, and I want to congratulate her. Could you rush this to Nasun in the North Yaraq Outpost? He is a bit smitten with Mara, and would wish to sign it first.
Ahyara gives you Congratulations.

location.name: Ma'yad ibn Ibsar
location.description:
Quest(s): Search for Abmim ibn Ibsar, Mad Star Investigation.
Ma'yad ibn Ibsar tells you, "Hail, traveler. Have you encountered a man named Abmim ibn Ibsar? He is my brother, who foolishly listened to those who whisper of an unsafe freedom to be gained in the Direlands."
Ma'yad ibn Ibsar tells you, "We have not heard from him in several months, and begin to worry. If you bring me news of him, I would reward you as well as I may."
Ma'yad ibn Ibsar tells you, "The last we heard, he had finally accepted some honest work from Akyafi the Translator. Perhaps Akyafi, who resides upstairs, can tell you more."

location.name: Mara al-Luq, Yaraq Society Agent
location.description:
Quest(s): Exploration Society Letters.
Mara al-Luq tells you, "Greetings! Welcome to Yaraq! I am the local representative of the Explorer Society. My job is to help new arrivals in Dereth get settled in and learn their way around."
Mara al-Luq tells you, "If you have just arrived in Dereth, my father Lubziklan could really use your help. And if you can help him, he can help you get a good start on your new life here in Dereth."
Mara al-Luq tells you, "Seek him out at our house just to the south of town, near the beach. If you need help finding it, you can buy directions from Jubal, the barkeeper."

location.name: Corpse of Admim ibn Ibsar
location.description:
Quest(s): Search for Abmim ibn Ibsar and Mad Star Investigation.
The corpse of Admim ibn Ibsar, bobbing gently near the surface of the water.

location.name: Lubziklan al-Luq
location.description:
Quest(s): Lubziklan al-Luq's Stolen Goods.
Lubziklan al-Luq tells you, "Can I help you, traveler? Well, but perhaps you can help me."
Lubziklan al-Luq tells you, "I am the owner of the orchards, and the purveyor of delicious and sundry goods made from the finest Cove apples. Lately, though, I am beleaguered by a pesky band of drudges that has been stealing all my goods! I need someone who is willing to defeat these drudges and recover my goods for me."
Lubziklan al-Luq gives you A List of Items.
Lubziklan al-Luq tells you, "Here is a list of what they have taken. Return these items to me and I will reward you appropriately."
Lubziklan al-Luq tells you, "I believe that these drudges are holed up in the Sea Temple Catacombs, on a plateau at the mouth of the harbor. But rumor has it that there is an easier entrance, through the Rat's Nest just northwest of town."
Lubziklan al-Luq tells you, "If you need more help finding either location, you can buy directions from Jubal at the bar in Yaraq proper."

location.name: Abandoned Mines to Yaraq
location.description: This portal goes to Yaraq, a Gharu'ndim town where many new adventurers enter Dereth. This is a good town for characters of all levels.

location.name: Abandoned Mines to Samsur
location.description: This portal goes to Samsur, a Gharu'ndim town in the hills behind the Yushad Ridge. This is a good town for characters over level 10.

location.name: Abandoned Mines to Zaikhal
location.description: This portal goes to the Gharu'ndim capital, Zaikhal. This is a good town for characters over level 20.

location.name: Abandoned Mines to Rithwic
location.description: This portal goes to Rithwic, an Aluvian town on the shores of Lake Blessed. This is a good town for characters over level 10.

location.name: Abandoned Mines to Holtburg
location.description: This portal goes to Holtburg, an Aluvian town where many new adventurers enter Dereth. This is a good town for characters of all levels.

location.name: Abandoned Mines to Arwic
location.description: This portal goes to Arwic, a walled Aluvian town that has fully recovered from a devastating attack by a Shadow Spire. This is a good town for characters over level 20.

location.name: Abandoned Mines to Cragstone
location.description: This portal goes to the Aluvian capital, Cragstone. This is a good town for characters over level 10.

location.name: Abandoned Mines to Shoushi
location.description: This portal goes to Soushi, a Sho town where many new adventurers enter Dereth. This is a good town for characters of all levels.

location.name: Abandoned Mines to Hebian-To
location.description: This portal goes to the Sho capital, Hebian-To. This is a good town for characters over level 10.

location.name: Sir Rylanan
location.description:
Quest(s): Elysa's Favor.
Sir Rylanan tells you, I've recently been assigned to Holtburg to build a garrison and be on the loogout for suspiscious happenings. There is one fellow on the outskirts of town that I've been keeping my eye on. He's just moved here from Marae Lassal and sometimes comes into town for provisions. He says he's been reformed, but I can spot a bandit when I see one! Townsfolk say they've spotted shady-looking guests coming and going from his house at odd hours. Could you check on him? His house lies to the northwest of town, past the Holtburg West Training Academy.

location.name: Aun Aulakhe
location.description: Quest(s): Buadren, Invoker. Aun Aulakhe tells you, My father, Aun Shimauri, sent me to the mainland to accomplish a great mission for our xuta. At the moment, I must still ponder on how I will fullfill it. For now, perhaps you should speak to Aun Tikakhe--he has a proposition that might interest you greatly. Aun Tumerok NPC, part of the Buadren/Invoker Quest. He summons across the lightning sea opening a portal into portal space itself. Be warned of entering as only death awaits lone adventurers.

location.description: Sotiris Obsidian Shard can be found at the end of the dungeon.

location.name: Underground Passage
location.description:
Quest(s): Elysa's Favor.
This is an old AC dungeon that was updated as part of the Elysa's Favor quest.
Fort Witshire where the original portal is has been barricaded so the dungeon can now only be reached by using the Underground Passage portals located inside an Advocate Tower in the 3 Starter Towns.

location.name: Sanctum Residential Halls
location.description:
This portal leads to a large residential housing complex loaded with apartments.
This is one of three entry portals to these halls. The other two are in Hebian-To and Zaikhal.
Settlement Complexes found in these halls are: Alvan Court Caerna Dwellings Illsin Veranda Marin Court Ruadnar Court Senmai Court Sigil Veranda Sorveya Court Sylvan Dwellings Treyval Veranda

location.name: Sanctum Residential Halls

location.name: Balthazar, Royal Guard
location.description:
Quest(s): The Callous Heart, Ruined Amulets, Nuhmudira's Boon.
Balthazar, Royal Guardian spits at your feet.
Balthazar, Royal Guardian tells you, "How dare you speak to me? You who think yourself above a woman who was willing to sacrifice all, her sanity, her body, her life for all of us. You make me sick. Leave my presence for I will have nothing more to do with you."

location.name: Underground Passage
location.description:
