location.name: Sclavus Temple
location.description:
Quest(s): Search for Gareth Dain.
Where the Book of Memories is found.
A book made of Sclavus skins.
I've escaped from the undead woman that rules the Sclavus here, at least for now. After I awoke, the pain receded enough for me to search the room. I found a dead man in the corner and dressed him in my clothes, leaving him on the stone table where I had awakened. Perhaps she would think me dead, if not I could hopefully escape before she found me. I followed the passage out, but it came to a dead end. That's when I remembered a word she had spoken when leaving, "ahkree". The wall blocking the passage vanished when I spoke the word.
Every move I made hurt and I was sure that her Sclavus would cut me down before I made it to the surface. Strangely, the Sclavus seemed unconcerned with my passing, they merely watched me searching the crypt rooms and passages. They would not let me leave the lower levels. They blocked my attempts to get by them, and I was too weak to overpower them. I continued my search through the crypts rooms and found this hidden room. I found a discarded Sclavus skin that serves now to hold these words. I can only hope the undead woman doesn't know of this room. The pain is returning an I must sleep now. I cannot escape. There are too many Sclavus guarding the exits to these crypts, if a crypt is what this place is. I have seen the Sclavus praying and performing complicated rituals in the room with the bloody altar. The pain in my chest grows worse by the hour; my skin itches and burns. I feel safe in my hidden room here and I have found food of a sort, but I must find a way to get by the guards and escape or I fear I will die. It's difficult to think clearly through the pain. I must concentrate, perhaps I noticed something when I arrived.
I should start at the beginning. My friend Dalius warned me not to go. In talks of his adventures he had mentioned an old temple he had found in the south dires infested with Sclavus. I found the idea of discovering a lost temple and killing some Sclavus in the process irresistible. Dalius told me not to go, that it was too dangerous, I laughed at his caution and told him that I would kill the Sclavus even if he could not. If only I had listened to him.
I found the sandstorm he had talked of and sought its eye. I easily dispatched the Sclavus I encountered before reaching the temple. It was then that the Sclavus ambushed me. They had been lying in wait, as if they knew of my arrival before hand. They overwhelmed me, capturing me easily. They beat me until I stopped struggling and I remember being dragged through a portal as I lost consciousness. When I came to I was stretched out on a cold stone table and could hear someone chanting in a strange language. It felt as if a giant hand pressed down on me, my breath became shallow. Something slid onto my stomach and curled there, then the pain came. Every muscle in my body spasmed in time with the chanting.
As I wrote before, I awoke later and devised a way of escaping the room I had been locked in. I wish I had learned portal magic from my wife. She was always trying to teach me, but I've never been very good at magic. I will rest again and make another attempt to get by the guards tomorrow. My torch burned out and I awoke in the dark curled up in pain. Even without the torch I can see everything in a blinding red light, even though my eyes are clenched shut. My skin burns as if it is on fire and being flayed. I write my last words here in the hope that my wife may learn what happened to me.
I love you Talira, I will always love you and I am sorry that I failed you. I would not risk our life together if I had it to do over. It is better that I die than continue in such agony. Know that my last thoughts were of you my love. I did not expect to ever wake again, my fever is gone and the pain has almost left me. We are so tired. I caught a rat from the cages to eat. I was so hungry that I forgot to cook it. On the way back, I saw my reflection in one of the pools and we see now that it would have been better if I had died. I have become something like the Sclavus and a pale reflection of the human we once were. Somehow I cannot bring myself to loathe my new form, perhaps it is her will that we are happy. I can hear her voice in the back of my mind. I now know that I have been hearing it for many days. She tells us to guard the temple and perform the rites. We are accepting of our new life. We, Gareth, still wishes that we remember him and his love, so we will write our memories down before they slip away. You were once a man named Gareth Dain. You were a brash warrior who loved his wife and his life with her. Her name was Talira Dain and she loved us deeply. Do not forget her, but never let her see us again for we are hideous in her eyes.
I remember a day in the sun with Talira, we loved and life was good. I remember being warm and happy. I am so cold now.
Do not let Talira know my fate. I am dead.
-- Gareth Dain
location.monsters: Aste Sclavus Lord, Ulu Sclavus Lord, Essa Sclavus Lord, Sata Scalvus Lord, Faisi Sclavus Lord, Chomu Sclavus Lord

location.name: Hidden Cavern
location.description:
Quest(s): Hidden Cavern.
In the VoD

location.name: Elemental Caverns
location.description: Quest(s): Elemental Weeping Weapons.

location.name: Undead Mechanic
location.description:
Quest(s): Walking Boots, Machinist's Gloves.
Undead Mechanic tells you, "You should thank us, Isparian! Was our help not instrumental in orchestrating the retreat of the Ancient Olthoi Queen? But I do not expect good manners from your kind."
The undead studies you coldly, then nods. Undead Mechanic tells you, "Regardless, the machine parts that your people have brought to us have been efficacious in our recent efforts to ... in our recent efforts. Therefore, we will continue this program. You no longer require our poison, so we have found other rewards."
Undead Mechanic gives you Missing Mechanisms.
Undead Mechanic tells you, "This text details the parts we will need. At one time there were stores of these parts cached about the land, but now, with the chaos of the times and your meddling, intrusive ways, Isparian, who knows where the parts may lie?"
Undead Mechanic tells you, "But find them, and bring them to me, and I will reward you."
There Is A Reason The Quest Is Called Walking Boots.

location.name: Crystal Mine
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Shield.
At the bottom, A Bar Tab and Hiyp the Toad's pickaxe can be found.
location.monsters: Sandstone, Wood, Copper, and Granite Golems.

location.name: Hiyp the Toad
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Shield, Ancient Olthoi Queen.
Hiyp the Toad tells you, "Yeah, I like the beer here, so what? I'll do some alchemy later. I could mine some crystals if I had my pickaxe..." You give Hiyp the Toad Hiyp the Toad's pickaxe. Hiyp The Toad looks at you with a sodden expression Hiyp the Toad tells you, "Hey, that's my best pickaxe! I must have left it down in the, ummm, where was that... oh yeah there was that mine, I was tryin' to get some of those crystals them's in Zaikhal wanted. Maybe it'll help with the bugs, maybe not. Well, there's nothing in that mine, I'll tell ya. So I said to myself, forget it, go have a drink. You trying to get some too? Hmmm, I just may know someone who can get some. There's a jeweler, name of Djusufa bint Huqis, she's in Zaikhal. I know her a while, she told me something interesting. One night a woman came to her and handed her a strange crystal, wondered if she knew what it was good for. The jeweler, she didn't know, never seen one like that before. She said she'd have to ask around, maybe check with one of Nuhmudira's people. Well, this woman gets all nervous and just leaves. Anyway, that's all I know. Go see Djusufa bint Huqis."

location.name: Dalius Kendmar
location.description:
Quest(s): Search for Gareth Dain.
Dalius Kendmar tells you, Hello friend, did Lady Dain ask you to speak with me?
Located in the Candeth Keep Mage Tower.

location.name: Talira Dain
location.description:
Quest(s): Search for Gareth Dain.
Speak to Talira Dain and Dalius Kendmar of Candeth Keep for initial details.

location.name: Portal Trees
location.description: You think, I was rattled. I found myself unable to find the forest for the trees. I ran my hands along the bark, searching for any type of clue that might help me understand what the Dame wanted. I should have been listening. Now I was out here playing patty-cake with a tree... You think, ...I felt pretty foolish.

location.name: Olthoi Chasm
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Chasm.
The Olthoi Chasm quest is a series of increasingly difficult dungeons each with a note at the end. The goal of the quest is to retrieve a series of notes at the end of each dungeon and turn them in to Xavier, Royal Guard on the surface by the landscape portal into the first dungeon.
Thanks to Zen Tek Ken.

location.name: Frost Haven
location.description:
Snowman Village. On the Mountain nearby there a Portal to Mount Ingot tie able and no lvl restriction.
NPCs
The Mayor Nip Chef Pleist Emma Robert
Thanks to Zen Tek Ken.
location.monsters: Sam

location.name: Mount Ingot
location.description:
Quest(s): Snowman Village.
Kill Scold to get his heart and then return back to the village and give it to Elijah to recieve the Ice Box.
location.monsters: Limestone, Copper, Iron, Granite, and a lvl 85 named golem called Scold.

location.name: Nip
location.description: Nip is a young snowman playing tag with his friend Numb. Nip is on the move so coordinates might fluctuate.

location.name: Numb
location.description: Numb is just playing tag with his friend Nip. Constantly on the move, might not be at exact coordinates, but nearby.

location.name: Sam
location.description:
Quest(s): Assault on Frost Haven.
Sam is the guardian of Frost Haven.
He will not attack unless provoked.

location.name: Elijah
location.description:
Quest(s): Assault on Frost Haven.
Elijah is a great and mighty ice mechanic. He has a prize to keep your beverages cold at night.

location.name: Robert
location.description:
Quest(s): Assault on Frost Haven.
Robert is the great gardener of snowflowers. Each year he roams the land planting them for Isparians to find. He has a mighty weapon of beta-caratine goodness.
Robert tells you, "I once saw a rabbit try to steal a carrot from my garden. Why he was even up here in the first place I don't know. Anyway, he seemed so happy with himself when he dug the carrot out that I didn't have the heart to stop him."
Robert tells you, "You should have seen the look on his little rabbit face when he tried to bite into it. Guess he wasn't used to ice carrots. Funny little critter."

location.name: The Mayor
location.description:
Quest(s): Assault on Frost Haven.
The good and kindly mayor of Frost Haven. Should you help him he will deputize you with a nice frosty badge.
The Mayor tells you, "Hello there, hello there!"
The Mayor tells you, "I'm Mayor of Frost Haven. Welcome to our humble little town."
The Mayor tells you, "Normally it isn't this quiet, but we've been having a bit of a problem."
The Mayor tells you, "Have you seen that mountain peak to the North? That's Mount Ingot, a homicidal Magma Golem named Scold lives up there. Every few weeks he emerges from his cave and marches down the mountain to stomp all over our town. Oh the snomanity, oh, it's awful!"
The Mayor tells you, "On top of all that, there's an Abominable Snowman tromping around the mountains and he doesn't like us non-abominable types."
The Mayor tells you, "Oh! You have to help us. He must be stopped. If you don't help us I'm afraid we may be doomed. Doomed! Doomed!"
The Mayor tells you, "Umm, I'm sure I could dip into the slush fund for a reward if you stop him."

location.name: Emma
location.description:
Quest(s): Assault on Frost Haven.
Emma is an amazing artizen and will craft you the finest snowflake in the land.
Emma tells you, "Nip and Numb are such good boys. I worry how this whole Scold thing is affecting them though. I think Nip is getting a bit angry. Have you ever seen an angry snowman? I don't want that for my son."

location.name: Chef Pleist
location.description:
Quest(s): Assault on Frost Haven.
The finest baker in all of Frost Haven. His pies are world renowned...well among Snowmen anyway.
Chef Pleist tells you, "Eh, if it helps, I'll chill you up somethin' real delicious for after you give Scold his ice-bath. He should lay of the spicy food, it's bad for his disposition."

location.name: Frank (melted snowman)
location.description: Alas poor Frank, Scold melted him well.

location.name: Guard Chandler Hammett
location.description:
Quest(s): Noir Assassination Investigation.
Guard Chandler Hammett tells you, "Hail friend, perhaps you haven't seen the signs in the capital cities. We've been asked to assist in an investigation. Dame Brinna O'Shea is handling the proceedings..." You think, "The guard went on. This was beginning to look like an interesting proposition. The capital cities, eh. Who knows maybe they'd provide me with a little insight. I weighed the possibilities and thought about visiting this Dame. But first I needed to find out where she was hiding. The sign in the capital cities was my only clue."

location.name: Sign
location.description: One of three signs for the quest to help determine who tried to kill the Queen.

location.name: Sign
location.description: One of three signs for the quest to help determine who tried to kill the Queen.

location.name: Sign
location.description: One of three signs for the quest to help determine who tried to kill the Queen.

location.name: Dame Brinna O'Shea
location.description:
Quest(s): Noir Assassination Investigation.
Dame Brinna O'Shea tells you, "You must have seen the sign. Please sit down."
Dame Brinna O'Shea tells you, "I'm so glad you came..."
You think, "They were always glad. It meant that they no longer had to shoulder the weight of what they knew alone. Camaraderie came from such knowledge. She kept talking and I was having trouble listening."
You think, "My mind kept drifting away to other thoughts. She talked fast, like the buzzing of bees around the first flower in spring. I was doing my best to keep up with the conversation but...there was too much. After a moment or two, I didn't care anymore. I got comfortable..."
You think, "The Dame kept going, talking about some man. Maybe in green armor, with a green dagger or something like that; I didn't care anymore. Her voice was grating on my nerves, like cheese drawn over a cheese grater. I shifted and got really comfortable."
You think, "The Dame was worried. I felt like I should stand up, clear my throat, tell her everything would be fine. But that would mean she'd sob."
You think, "Too late. The buzzing sound of her voice gave way to delirious talk about assassination. I pretended to listen and leaned forward..."
You think, "Then it ceased. It was like opening a Singularity Chest to find three perfectly matched dual major armor pieces, each enhancing a skill I possessed. But like every dream, it ended. Reality smacked me in the jaw, like a Peerless Drudge catching me with my faceplate up. The droning pitch of her voice returned. I got comfortable and listened to the rest of the Dame's tale."
Dame Brinna O'Shea tells you, "...and that's why I need you to help me."
You think, "I stood quickly. Better she thought I had heard everything that she had to say, rather than tell her the truth. I crossed my arms and gave her a stern look."
You think, "Before I could think, I said 'I'll do it.'"
You say, "I'll do it."
You think, "She gave me a clean towel..."
Dame Brinna O'Shea gives you Clean Towel.
You think, "...a trade note for my trouble..."
Dame Brinna O'Shea gives you Trade Note (100). You think, "...and a location..."
Dame Brinna O'Shea tells you, "The last spot we knew he could be found was off the road in a copse of trees, north of Nanto."
You think, "I didn't have to ask what to expect there. Like I said before, Dames were always trouble. I was knee deep with this one."
Dame Brinna O'Shea tells you, "Thank you, again."
You think, "The kiss was a nice touch. Though it left me with a sinking feeling. Like getting caught off your guard when the Hopeslayer asks you a question. Never peeve the 24 foot tall Lord of Darkness, you might find yourself falling from the top of the world and believe me, you can't see your house from there."
You think, "I weighed my choices and decided what I needed to do. The entrance to the place would be hidden amongst the trees, but I'd find a way in."

location.name: Tree (Portal)
location.description:
Quest(s): Noir Assassination Investigation.
This is the tree that you need to use to continue on the quest.

location.name: Gentleman Jake Hawkins
location.description:
Quest(s): Noir Assassination Investigation.
Arrrr...this pirate be helpin' ye on yer quest matey.

location.name: La Casa Del Noir
location.description:
Quest(s): Noir Assassination Investigation.
A house where you wake up along the way on the quest to determine who tried to kill the queen. There is an interesting journal inside.

location.name: Alaine the Apprentice
location.description:
Quest(s): Isparian Weapons.
Alaine the Apprentice tells you, Hello! If you are willing, we have a task for you.
Alaine the Apprentice tells you, The Arcanum lost some important research when Martine raided our Research Facility near Al-Jalima. Martine seems to be gone now, but his minions remain, preventing us from retrieving the decanters we need.
Alaine the Apprentice tells you, If you can go there and find the decanters, then you can journey to the Fathomless Chasm, a wellspring of pure mana, and use the decanters to collect the essence there. This essence is required to forge the new pyreal weapons, which we are calling Isparian.
Alaine the Apprentice tells you, Here -- I have literature that explains all this.
Alaine the Apprentice gives you Isparian Arms.
Alaine the Apprentice gives you Treatise on Essence.
Alaine the Apprentice tells you, The locations of the Research Facility and the Fathomless Chasm are written on the flyleaves.

location.name: Aerbax's Holding
location.description:
Quest(s): Preparation for the Ritus (Bracelet of Dark Essence).
Use the Magically Sealed Dais at the end of the dungeon to get the Bracelet of Dark Essence.
Thanks Xenthic for updated location and pic.

location.name: Han Rin-Jo, Jojii Adherent
location.description:
Quest(s): Font of Jojii.
Han Rin-Jo, Jojii Adherent tells you, "Sit, Please."
Han Rin-Jo, Jojii Adherent tells you, "In my life, I have seen a great many wonders that have challenged my beliefs, and driven me near the edge of forsaking all that I had known. But in Jojii, I have found the virtuous path."
Han Rin-Jo, Jojii Adherent tells you, "Not so long ago, another came to me. He was as accomplished as you, more so perhaps. What he had accomplished is not as important as what he had learned."
Han Rin-Jo, Jojii Adherent tells you, "His name is Honshu Takeda, and he has begun to learn about himself and the way of Jojii. He had lost his way, and I have set him back upon his path. He will follow the shrines to Jojii. The first lies within this very town, just beyond those doors between the trees."
Han Rin-Jo, Jojii Adherent tells you, "His journey will end in Kara. Much wisdom can be garnered by following the path and incorporating the lessons of the four stones in your actions."
Han Rin-Jo, Jojii Adherent tells you, "Should you wish to follow in his steps, seek the shrine and pray as I am sure he has done."

location.name: Jojii Shrine and Scrawled Note
location.description:
Quest(s): Font Of Jojii.
A shrine found on the path to enlightenment. This was apparently the first stop made by Honshu Takeda, and he left a note for all to read.

location.name: Ikomi Ra, Jojii Adherent
location.description:
Quest(s): Font of Jojii.
Ikomi Ra, Jojii Adherent tells you, "Grace allows us to walk through life in perfection."
Ikomi Ra, Jojii Adherent tells you, "I have met the man you seek, this Honshu Takeda. He is a good man. He will find his way back to the path of right living. I have sent him to seek grace at the shrine in Sawato. Perhaps if you pray, as he likely did, at the shrine you will see grace as well."

location.name: Jojii Shrine
location.description:
Quest(s): Font of Jojii.
As you sit and pray at the small shrine you see a small note resting on the top. You take the note.

location.name: Unicorn's Grace
location.description:
Quest(s): Font of Jojii.
Deep inside you will find a crystal and a note that will bring you past this step in your journey.

location.name: Miko Li, Jojii Adherent
location.description:
Quest(s): Font of Jojii Quest.
The last of the adherents on your journey.
Miko Li, Jojii Adherent tells you, "Though I try to live my life according to Jojii's path I sometimes find that I lack discipline. I have begun painting, and hope to continue doing so. I have noticed that many who come here seek the armor that is wrought by Koga Hideki and his peers."
Miko Li, Jojii Adherent tells you, "I wish to assist those who wish to bring the colors of the rainbow to the armor he makes. If you hand me vials of Lapyan, Hennacin and Relanim dyes, I will make them into paints that will stay upon the shadow armor that has been enhanced with the new magical shards."
Miko Li, Jojii Adherent tells you, "You seek the power of the dragon, as did Honshu. Very well. I shall tell you were he was sent. In the valley, across the stretch of land, and water. Through the hills that bite, atop the crest where the sun sets, there is a portal into the place where the Dragon's flame smolders in a basin of metal. Honshu went there to find the Dragon's power."
Miko Li, Jojii Adherent tells you, "Go there and find the strength that I hope he found."
Miko Li will also exchange Vials of Dye for Pots to dye Sharded Shadow Armor.

location.name: Shoushi Lifestone
location.description: A lifestone in the center of town.

location.name: Runed Chest
location.description: An unlocked runed chest found in a bunker.
location.monsters: Zefirs.

location.name: Runed Chest
location.description: A runed chest at the old abandoned Sho outpost near the Eastham portal. There used to be a nearby Lifestone, but it was moved into the center of Shoushi.
location.monsters: Gotrok Lugians.

location.name: Jojii Shrine
location.description:
Quest(s): Font of Jojii.
As you sit and pray at the small shrine you see a small note resting on the top. You take the note.

location.restrictions: 35+, Use Shrine in Lin and read Note.
location.name: Firebird's Splendor
location.description:
Quest(s) Font of Jojii.
From drop, go S, down ramp, go left. You come to a more or less circular area (maze), right hand rule till that rule drops you at a dead end (and 2 grated rooms).
Turn 180 degrees and find a room with 2 grates and a non-grated exit to the S, and go S, and right hand rule, till you find a wooden door, behind it a room, another wooden door.
Go right (to your left is a portal), and down the stairs till you hit the lava-hallways, in the pit is the NPC- object Smooth Rocks, double click, you get the Rock of Splendor.

location.restrictions: 35+, Quest Flag: Miko Li, Jojii Adherent.
location.name: Dragon's Power
location.description:
Quest(s): Font of Jojii Quest.
From drop, hug left wall till you find a ramp down to the E. Through a few rooms+ a ramp with an intersection. Go straight, left, head N, till you can go down 2 ramps again. Another room, at the intersection go left.
Double click the Smoldering Brazier, you get the Brazier of Power, which says it looks like a shield.
location.monsters: Revenant, Dark Revenant, Dark Leech, Dark Magus, Great Revenant

location.name: Honshu Takeda
location.description:
Quest(s): Font of Jojii.
Honshu Takeda tells you, "You have done well to find the power of the Dragon."
Honshu Takeda tells you, "You have done well to find the power of the Firebird."
Honshu Takeda tells you, "You have traveled the same path as I, and learned the lessons of the great spirits. Now you must know how they fit together."
Honshu Takeda tells you, "The base is the Dragon's power. The grace of the Unicorn must be spread within. The splendor of the Firebird can be placed atop the combination of strength and grace but...only with pure water that represents the four stones and the path of Jojii can you bring the object to life."
Honshu Takeda tells you, "Here, take this."
Honshu Takeda gives you Pure Water.
Honshu Takeda tells you, "The water can be used to waken the combined spirit of the three, or to awaken the strength of just one. I would advise against waking just one. There is little that can be finished that is not complete."
Honshu Takeda tells you, "You have completed your journey. Allow time for the teachings to be set within your being. If within one month you are still without direction, follow my path again, and I shall teach the steps anew."

location.name: Statue of Bael'Zharon
location.description:
One of the many statues of Bael'Zharon on the Singularity Caul, found at 90.6S, 97.5W.
This statue is rather large, and it has many corpses of its followers/attackers/sacrifices(?) at its feet.

location.name: Razed Tower
location.description:
The tower is similar to the ones found on Marae Lassel except this one has been razed.
Appears to be one of the few safe places to buff, check loot and generally catch your breath on the new Caul Island.

location.name: Abandoned Sho Outpost Lifestone
location.description: A lifestone that was formerly in the heart of the Abandoned Sho Outpost has now been moved further away. Apparently by Lugians.

location.name: Runed Chest
location.description: A runed chest guarded by Mossward Fanatics and their leader.
location.monsters: Mosswart Fanatics, Mossward Chief

location.name: Runed Chest
location.description: A runed chest on a platform, guarded by mosswarts.

location.name: Runed Chest
location.description: A runed chest found in Fort Aimaru. It is heavily guarded by Mosswarts. This chest does produce items with minors.

location.name: Singularity Caul Recall / Singularity Bore Drop Point
location.description:
Drop point for both the singularity caul recall spell, and the exit from the Singularity Caul.
Thanks to Xenthic for this info and pic.

location.name: Aurten Rhell
location.description:
Quest(s): Refulgent Bracelet.
Hmmm...something is amiss on the Marcescent Plateau of Marae Lassel.
Aurten Rhell tells you, Hello there! Can I trust you?
Aurten Rhell tells you, I think so, I think I can. I had to quickly stow my guard uniform when Varicci`s men swept into the city! But I am continuing my investigation. Aurten Rhell tells you, If you can find any information on the strange incidents occurring on the plateau, I will reward you.
Aurten kneels down and opens a nearby pack. He tilts the pack so that you can see what is inside and then quickly pulls back the pack from your sight and closes it. Aurten Rhell tells you, Varicci`s invasion cannot prevent us from doing our necessary work, don`t you agree? Move out!

location.name: Xavier, Royal Guard
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Chasm.
Xavier, Royal Guard tells you, "We've already begun a tertiary examination of the lair beyond and have discovered tunnels that appear to have been used by the Ancient Olthoi Queen."
Xavier, Royal Guard tells you, "We've also discovered that there are undead within these tunnels."
Xavier, Royal Guard tells you, "As of yet, we don't understand their part in these tunnel systems. The High Queen is offering rewards to any that will bring information regarding the motives of the undead, and information of the possibility of the Olthoi Queen's return through these tunnels."
Xavier, Royal Guard tells you, "If you find any such information, you can return to me and I will reward you in kind."
Xavier, Royal Guard tells you, "Additionally, if you received a token from Her Majesty during the time that followed the initial assault on the Olthoi Queen, I will accept those and grant you the title that you have earned.".

location.name: Stone Head Row
location.description: A series of Empyrean figureheads all in a row. One has been toppled over.

location.name: Banderling Camp
location.description: And what are the Banderlings brewing for dinner tonight???

location.name: Lou Ka
location.description:
Quest(s): Lou Ka's Stolen Items.
Lou Ka tells you, "Those thieving mosswarts have made off with my yaoji again! And this time they took several other items belonging to myself and my partner Bai Den as well!"
Lou Ka tells you, "Here is a list of the items that are missing. Will you go to the Braid Mansion Ruin, along the road that leaves town to the southwest, and recover our things for us? We would be very grateful."
Lou Ka gives you A List of Items.
Lou Ka tells you, "If you need more help finding the Braid Mansion Ruin, you can buy directions from Nin Hong at the bar.".

location.name: Shallow Olthoi Chasm
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Chasm.
At the end of this dungeon is an Untranslated Note that can be give to Xavier, Royal Guard (found outside the portal at 0.7N 44.7E) for 250,000 xp, 2 Gem of Stillness, and a M Trade Note (100,000).
By the Note is the portal to the Deep Olthoi Chasm (level 60+).

location.name: Deep Olthoi Chasm
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Chasm.
At the end of this dungeon is an Untranslated Note that can be give to Xavier, Royal Guard (found outside the portal at 0.7N 44.7E) for 1,000,000 xp, 3 Gems of Stillness, and a MD Trade Note (150,000).
By the Note is the portal to the Cavernous Olthoi Chasm (level 80+).

location.name: Abyssal Olthoi Chasm
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Chasm.
Jaenyn, Stone Shaper, an undead NPC, is found at the top of this dungeon. He has no special significance to the quest besides lore. You can hand him the notes you've picked up so far and he will will respond to them.
At the end of this dungeon is an Untranslated Note that can be give to Xavier, Royal Guard (found outside the portal at 0.7N 44.7E) for 4% of the xp towards your next level (Max: 6,645,123), 5 Gems of Stillness, and a MMD Trade Note (250,000).

location.name: Cavernous Olthoi Chasm
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Chasm.
At the end of this dungeon is an Untranslated Note that can be give to Xavier, Royal Guard (found outside the portal at 0.7N 44.7E) for 2,000,000 xp, 4 Gems of Stillness, and an MM Trade Note (200,000).
By the Note is the portal to the Abyssal Olthoi Chasm (level 100+).

location.name: Mystical Floating Bottle
location.description: A mysterious floating bottle in the middle of Nanto.

location.name: Samuel, Former Guardian
location.description:
Quest(s): Black Marrow Tea.
The new Caul has had a devestating effect on this man's morale.
Accepts Broken Black Marrow Keys for 60,000xp and a cup of Black Marrow Tea.
Black Marrow Tea.
A thick, black tea made by Samuel of Eastham. The tea does not look like a very healthy drink.
Use this item to drink it.
Casts the following spells: Black Marrow Bliss (You cast Black Marrow Bliss and drain 635 points of your mana.)
This item cannot be sold.

location.name: Bridge View
location.description: A vantage point on the Caul where you can view the floating tower bridge.

location.name: Caul Temple
location.description: A temple found on the Caul near a tower.

location.name: Caul Tower
location.description: A tower near a temple on the Caul.

location.name: Jalina al-Hajj
location.description:
Quest(s): Homecoming Pennant.
The High Queen has deemed that all citizens of Dereth be awarded a pennant! Make sure that you have free space in your pack and speak to Jalina al-Hajj of Al-Arqas.
Jalina al-Hajj tells you, "The High Queen has commissioned me to create a pennant for all Isparians currently upon Dereth. Asheron himself has provided the device - the heraldry of his family. I am told that this is in honor of our continued bravery and heroics. He and the High Queen have decided that he no longer needs to watch over us, and now Asheron may return to his home."
Jalina al-Hajj tells you, "Take this pennant and display it proudly! But be warned that I am only commissioned to provide you with this once."
Jalina al-Hajj gives you Homecoming Pennant.
Note: Distributed Homecoming Pennants to characters created before the Mirror, Mirror event.

location.restrictions: Must be flagged as a player-killer.
location.name: Small Creepy Statue
location.description:
Quest(s): The Forbidden Catacombs.
A small statue that looks just a little too life-like for comfort.
Thanks to Yun-Fat of TD and Bernard the Fox.

location.restrictions: Must be flagged as a player-killer.
location.name: Small Creepy Statue
location.description:
Quest(s): The Forbidden Catacombs.
A small statue that looks just a little too life-like for comfort.
Thanks to Apollo Gael.

location.restrictions: Must be flagged as a player-killer.
location.name: Small Creepy Statue
location.description:
Quest(s): The Forbidden Catacombs.
A small statue that looks just a little too life-like for comfort.
Thanks to Bran-Li.

location.restrictions: Must be flagged as a player-killer.

location.description:
Quest(s): The Forbidden Catacombs.
A small statue that looks just a little too life-like for comfort.
Thanks to Chaos Reactor-X of Leafcull for the pic.

location.restrictions: Must be flagged as a player-killer.
location.name: Small Creepy Statue
location.description:
Quest(s): The Forbidden Catacombs.
A small statue that looks just a little too life-like for comfort.
Thanks to Bran-Li.

location.restrictions: Must be flagged as a player-killer.

location.description:
Quest(s): The Forbidden Catacombs.
A small statue that looks just a little too life-like for comfort.
Thanks to Bran-Li.

location.restrictions: Must be flagged as a player-killer.
location.name: Small Creepy Statue
location.description:
Quest(s): The Forbidden Catacombs.
A small statue that looks just a little too life-like for comfort.
Thanks to Bran-Li for info, and Yun-Fat of TD for pic.

location.restrictions: Must be flagged as a player-killer.
location.name: Small Creepy Statue
location.description:
Quest(s): The Forbidden Catacombs.
A small statue that looks just a little too life-like for comfort.

location.name: Burun Cathedral
location.description:
Quest(s): Renegade Herbal Kits.
One of the Renegade Chests can be found in this dungeon. You need lockpick skill to access the area with the chest.
Thanks to FlailingSho for pointing this spot out. During the From the Darkness Born event, this place got renamed from Sclavus Cathedral to Burun Cathedral.

location.name: Sclavus Cathedral
location.description: Thanks to FlailingSho for pointing this spot out.

location.name: Mosswart Bunker
location.description:
Quest(s): Ancient Armor, The Temple of Ixir Zi.
A bunker full of corpses of massacred Mosswarts. Inside, behind a hidden wall you will find an Odd Looking Vine that will lead take you to the beginning of the Fellowship Quest introduced during Across the Vast Divide.
Thanks to Ra Rai for pic and info.

location.name: Grearrk, Mosswart Emissary
location.description:
Quest(s): The Homunculus.
The creature speaks in a broken form of Roulean.
Grearrk, Mosswart Emissary tells you, "Grearrk come, no weapons. Want fight, no. Help Grearrk, want. Dead are brothers, isters, friends to Grearrk. Hear he noises in his home, at night. Banderling come to make big Wanga, Grearrk think. Mist rise from beneath feet, Grearrk and others run, new magic bad. When go home, death be all about, evil banderlings must be in, beneath home. Help please won't you, Grearrk?"
The creature speaks in a broken form of Roulean.
Grearrk, Mosswart Emissary tells you, "Grearrk see much sorrow in life. False god rise and hurt and enslave remaining tribe. Grearrk try stay safe with Ahumba here in place dedicated to old gods. Grearrk still think you try kill banderlings in old home, too, but Grearrk not care so much anymore about try go back"
This Mosswart ran out of the swamps and into Sawato in search of help from Humans.
Thanks to Zaerik for the info.

location.name: Yaraq Lifestone
location.description:
The new Yaraq Lifestone.
Thanks to Ra Rai and Alunor.

location.name: Yanshi Refugee Camp
location.description: When Yanshi was destroyed, the town inhabitants set up a refugee camp here near the old outpost, until the town could be rebuilt.

location.name: Drudge Camp
location.description: A small drudge camp with a regular chest.

location.name: Green Mire Camp
location.description:
Quest(s): Green Mire Grave, Ice Tachi?.
Mosswarts are attracted to the swamps of this region. Near the Green Mire Grave dungeon, which is quite a ways north (and a tiny bit west) all the way over the river, there is a mosswart camp. One of them has a tachi that does ice damage. As you know, ice is useless against undead, but good against some other monsters. Don't go if you're new to the world, though. There are enough other dangers for a newcomer!
-- Green Mire Camp Directions
location.monsters: Skeleton, Mosswart, Shreth

location.name: Ulgrim the Unappreciated / Mini-Ulgrim
location.description:
Quest(s): Ulgrim's Casting Stein.
Ulgrim the Unappreciated says, Wipe your feet! Cleaning house takes time away from my life's endeavor.

location.name: Tumerok Camp
location.description:
A circle of Tumeroks guarding their Runed Chest.
Thanks to Dindas Fury TD.

location.name: Corpse with Rumor
location.description:
A corpse holding a rumor in its hand.
Killed by a Red Rat.

location.name: Undead Encampment
location.description:
I heard that a band of Undead with their Sand Golems in tow ambushed a caravan to the southeast of town and took its treasure for their own.
There is a Runed Chest here.

location.name: Outside to Inside Linvak Tukal
location.description:
A direct portal into Linvak Tukal.
Thanks to Uzi-El.

location.name: Adara al-Rajin
location.description:
Quest(s): Realaidain Raiment.
Adara al-Rajin tells you, "High Queen Elysa asked me to create a special raiment for all Isparians who have made Dereth their home. The crest up on the raiment is that of Asheron's own family, the Realaidains. Wear this raiment with pride! But please take care of it - I only have the materials to provide one to each adventurer."
Adara al-Rajin gives you Realaidain Raiment.
Note: Distributed Realaidain Raiment to characters created before the A New Threat event.

location.name: Novedion the Gem Seller (Holtburg)
location.description:
Quest(s): Arm, Mind, and Heart.
Novedion the Gem Seller tells you, "Greetings. I and my two brothers have been sent to some of the Isparian Arrival points to offer our fine wares. While many Isparians have only dealt with our less refined cousins, the Tukal smiths are masters of many arts. These particular gems have been crafted by some of our finest master gem crafters and imbued with helpful magics which I am sure will be useful to the Isparian adventurer. I also am selling Benevolent Calm, a necessary ingredient to fashion the Staff of Clarity."
Sells some special magical gems that will protect you while you're young. And a potion that is part of the Lugian Arm, Heart, and Mind quest.

location.name: Holtburg Lifestone
location.description: A new Lifestone in Holtburg appeared during A New Threat.

location.name: Linvak Tukal Lifestone
location.description: The first Lugian Lifestone, found during A New Threat in Linvak Tukal.

location.name: Al-Jalima Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Arwic Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Baishi Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Cragstone Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Eastham Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Glenden Wood Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Hebian-To Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Lin Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Lytelthorpe Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Nanto Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Qalaba'r Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Rithwic Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Samsur Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances. Thanks Silberlowe.

location.name: Sawato Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Shoushi Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Tou-Tou Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Tufa Bindstone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Uziz Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Yaraq Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Zaikhal Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Holtburg Bind Stone
location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Renegade Fortress
location.description:
Quest(s): Renegade Fortress, Burun Burrow, Noble Weapons.
At the end of the dungeon is A Cluttered Table, use the table to obtain three notes worth 1.5 million xp each and flag you for Burun Burrow. In the same room are two Elite Guards that drop the Renegade Leggings and the Renegade Hauberk. Commander Kamenua drops A Broken Insignia Ring.
Just outside the dungeon, in the Fortress, is the spy Toberik who will give you his report. Give this report to Captain K'rank in Linvak Tukal as part of the Noble Weapons Quest.
The fort is part of the Burun Burrow quest and was introduced in the Mired Hearts event. It is guarded by Tumeroks, Lugians and some traps. Inside are houses and a portal to the Renegade Fortress dungeon.
Thanks RTA_FF.

location.name: Samsur Lifestone
location.description: Added in town during Mired Hearts. Thanks Silberlowe.

location.name: Danby's Outpost Lifestone
location.description: Added during Mired Hearts. Thanks Mr fizz of Leafcull.

location.name: Aun Tiulerea
location.description:
Quest(s): Aun Golem Hunters.
Aun Tiulerea tells you, "Greetings. I am Aun Tiularea. I am the second youngest of the seven who have left Palenqual to hunt! As I am the second youngest, I have chosen the Iron Golem Kingpin as my prey. They are powerful in their own right, but tend to employ the use of underlings in their battles as well." Aun Tiulerea tells you, "Would you like to hunt them as well? Very well, scour this region and others like it and I am sure you will find the golem. Kill five of these golems, return to me and I will see that your battles are rewarded!"
Thanks Baebarri.

location.name: Aun Autuorea
location.description:
Quest(s): Aun Golem Hunters.
Aun Autuorea tells you, Greetings. I am Aun Autuorea. My brothers and I have left Palenqual to hunt! I have chosen to challenge myself by hunting the Magma Golem Exarch as my prey.
Thanks Mr Fizz of Leafcull.

location.name: Aun Aukherea
location.description:
Quest(s): Aun Golem Hunters.
Aun Aukherea tells you, "Greetings. I am Aun Aukherea. My twin, Khekie, and I have come to Ayan Baqur to hunt the Golem Lords. I am not quite as brazen as Khekie, so I have chosen to stalk the western borders of this land in search of the Coral Golem Viceroy."
Aun Aukherea tells you, "Would you like to hunt them as well? Very well, scour this region and others like it and I am sure you will find the golem. Kill five of these golems, return to me and I will see that your battles are rewarded!"
Thanks Azif TD.

location.name: Aun Khekierea
location.description:
Quest(s): Aun Golem Hunters.
Aun Khekierea tells you, Greetings. I am Aun Khekierea. I have come to this city with my twin, Aukhe, to hunt the golem lords! While Aukhe has chosen to seek out the Coral Viceroys, I am hunting the most dangerous of the Golem Lords! The Platinum Golem Mountain King...
Thanks Azif TD.

location.name: Arwic Lifestone
location.description: Added during the Mired Hearts event

location.name: Zaikal Lifestone
location.description: Added during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Qalaba'r Lifestone
location.description: Added during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Chess Board
location.description: A chess board where players can challenge each other to a match.

location.name: Chess Board
location.description: A chess board where players can challenge each other to a match.

location.name: Chess Board
location.description: A chess board where players can challenge each other to a match.

location.name: Chess Board
location.description: A chess board where players can challenge each other to a match.

location.name: Candeth Keep Lifestone
location.description: Added during the Mired Hearts event, this lifestone stands in the middle of Candeth Keep.

location.name: Mayoi Lifestone
location.description: This lifestone was added during the Mired Hearts event

location.name: Hebian-To Lifestone
location.description: This lifestone was added during the Mired Hearts event

location.name: Nanto Lifestone
location.description: This lifestone was added during the Mired Hearts event.

location.name: Lin Lifestone
location.description: This lifestone was added during the Mired Hearts event

location.name: Cragstone Lifestone
location.description: This lifestone was added during the Mired Hearts event

location.name: Burun Burrow
location.description:
Quest(s): Burun Burrow, Renegade Fortress.
To flag for entrance, you must retrieve the three letters from A Cluttered Table at the end of the dungeon Renegade Fortress (60+) and hand them in to Translator Aun Laokhe in the middle tower in Arwic.
The other half of the insignia ring is found on the Tumerok boss at the end of Renegade Fortress.

Quest dungeon for the Bleeargh's Gratitude quest. A Burun Ruuk Scamp drops six A Smelly Keys which your group can use on An Old Chest at the end of the dungeon to get the Necklace of Leerargh for Bleeargh. There is also a Rune Chest in an adjacent room.
Added during the From the Darkness Born event.

location.name: Hidden Entrance
location.description:
Quest(s): Hidden Entrance.
To begin the quest, speak to Ydnew at 12.0S, 42.6E in Yanshi. She will direct you to an old swamp temple that sits around 25s and 46e (25.8S, 46.2E, specifically), to see if you can find explanation for the rise of Burun and Renegade activity. In order to access the Hidden Entrance dungeon, you need to go there and pick up a Blueprints for a Burun Fortress. Two A Missive's can be found in the same area as well.
Floating Rock.

location.name: Numuhdira's Hidden Cottage
location.description:
Quest(s): Soul Stone.
Reading this journal flags for use of the portal to Xi Ru's Island near Ithaenc Cathedral at 83.4S 89.8E on the beach. This also flags you to enter Xi Ru's Chapel on the island.
Nuhmudira's Journal lies open to a page that holds some interesting information. She has found the location of an island that has been hidden for a great many years. She divined the location from scripts that she found in one of the Falatacot temples that has been found in the past few months. She means to build a device that will transport her to this hidden island. She plans to build the device on the beach, in the shadow of Ithaenc Cathedral.
As you finish reading the passage you feel a new awareness enter you.

location.name: Portalling Device
location.description:
Quest(s): Soul Stone.
You must be flagged to access Xi Ru's Island in order to use this portalling device.

location.name: Xi Ru's Chapel
location.description:
Quest(s): Soul Stone, Noble Weapons.
Except for Nuhmudira's student, 3 Empyrean ghosts will ask a lore-related question, which can be answered by clicking the nearby objects.
NPCs
Camryn, Nuhmudira's Student Jif Loz Hevk Loz Kir Loz

location.name: Font Guardian
location.description:
Quest(s): Clutch of Kings (Browerk).
Font Guardian tells you, "The heat released from the cavernous depths will power the gateway for twenty moments, then the way will close and power will need to be returned. Reason guide your action. The gate is unveiled, pass through and do what you must, I pray by the Sun, Stars, Earth and Moons that your path is noble."

location.name: Balmy Font
location.description: Quest(s): Clutch of Kings (Browerk).

location.description: Quest(s): Clutch of Kings (Browerk).

location.name: Muggy Font

location.name: Steamy Font

location.name: Deru Tree Of Xi Ru's Island
location.description:
Quest(s): Knorr Quiddity Seed Ingot Purification.
Introduced in On Bended Knee.
This tree was long believed to be a Deru Tree, which was confirmed in The Beast With Many Heads in the Knorr Quiddity Seed Ingot Purification quest.
This tree grows atop the large cataracts overlooking the Chapel on Xi Ru's Island. To get to the tree, run west from the drop then north along the beach until you get to the Moarsmen Encampment at 60.1S 88.1W. From there, head south up the mountain all the way up to the Great Deru Tree at 89.8S 87.4E. The King's Crown water lily grows at the base of the tree. In The Beast With Many Heads, a dungeon was added that goes underneath the tree, Roots of the Deru Tree.

location.name: Holtburg to Neydisa Castle
location.description: This portal goes to Neydisa Castle, northeast of Mt. Esper. This is a good town for characters over level 40.

location.name: Holtburg to Dryreach
location.description: This portal goes to the Aluvian town of Dryreach, besieged by renegade Tumeroks. Due to its besieged status, Dryreach is only accessible with the appropriate key, This is a good town for characters over level 40.

location.name: Holtburg to Arwic
location.description: This portal goes to Arwic, a walled Aluvian town that has fully recovered from a devastating attack by a Shadow Spire. This is a good town for characters over level 20.

location.name: Holtburg to Cragstone
location.description: This portal goes to the Aluvian capital, Cragstone. This is a good town for characters over level 10.

location.name: Holtburg to Shoushi
location.description: This portal goes to Soushi, a Sho town where many new adventurers enter Dereth. This is a good town for characters of all levels.

location.name: Shoushi to Kryst
location.description: This portal goes to the town of Kryst on the Vesayen archipelago. This is a good town for characters over level 20.

location.name: Shoushi to Kara
location.description: This portal goes to the town of Kara, hidden deep in the Linvak range. This is a good town for characters over level 40.

location.name: Shoushi to Hebian-To
location.description: This portal goes to the Sho capital, Hebian-To. THis is a good town for characters over level 10.

location.name: Shoushi to Yaraq
location.description: This portal goes to Yaraq, a Gharu'ndim town where many new adventurers enter Dereth. This is a good town for characters of all levels.

location.name: Shoushi to Tou-Tou
location.description: This portal goes to the Sho town of Tou-Tou, perched on the tup of the Tou-Tou peninsula. This is a good town for characters over level 20.

location.name: Yaraq to Zaikhal
location.description: This portal goes to the Gharu'ndim capital, Zaikhal. This is a good town for characters over level 20.

location.name: Yaraq to Linvak Tukal
location.description: This portal goes to Linvak Tukal, the fortress bastion of our Lugian allies in the Linvak Range. This is a good town for characters over level 40.

location.name: Yaraq to Khayyaban
location.description: This portal goes to the town of Khayyaban on the Yushad Ridge. This is a good town for characters over level 20.

location.name: Yaraq to Xarabydun
location.description: This portal goes to the town of Xarabydun, in the southern reaches of the A'mun desert. This is a good town for characters over level 10, but be careful -- the surrounding area can be a bit rough.

location.name: Yaraq to Bluespire
location.description: This portal goes to the town of Bluespire on the island of Marae Lassal. This is a good town for characters over level 10.

location.name: Yaraq to Holtburg
location.description: This portal goes to Holtburg, an Aluvian town where many new adventurers enter Dereth. This is a good town for characters of all levels.

location.name: Ishaq's Cellar
location.description:
Quest(s): The Feud of the Natural Philosophers.
The Cellar is a small dungeon full of Singularity Caul creatures.
At the bottom of the Cellar you will find Ishaq's Lost Key which can used to open Ishaq's Storage Chest at the top of the dungeon or be given to Ishaq the Philosopher who resides in the cabin right outside the Cellar.

location.name: Western Power Forge
location.description: Quest(s): Power Forges.

location.name: Southern Power Forge
location.description: Quest(s): Power Forges.

location.name: Northern Power Forge
location.description: Quest(s): Power Forges.

location.name: Sanamar
location.description: This is the Viamontian Capitol city on the Halaetan Islands. Introduced first in Preview then in July 2005.

location.name: Silyun
location.description:
Silyun is a Viamontian town dominated by the rebel faction of viamontians who follow Duke Bellenesse rather than King Varicci II. Though officially a truce exists between the rebels and the loyalists, there is still plenty of tension and intregue to go around!
The town is watched over by the Grand Mother, who will give quests for those wishing to aid the rebels and eventualy seek membership into the Whispering Blade. The first quest is aimed at level 20 characters. Those wishing to join the Ordina Rossu Morta instead should visit the Grand Knight in Sanamar

location.name: Westwatch Outpost
location.description: Westwatch is an outpost of Sanamar located on the western edge of the Halaetan Isles at 72.8N 73.3W (Lotila Island). There is a portal to Westwatch just south of Sanamar at 71.2N 61.3W.

location.name: Eastwatch Outpost
location.description:
An outpost of Sanamar located on the far eastern edge of the Halaetan Isles on the Plains of Ruin at 90.3N 43.1W.
There is a portal to Eastwatch just south of Sanamar at 71.2N 61.3W as well as a portal just west of Ayan Baqur at 59.6S 88.8W.
Special ingredients for beer making are sold here.
A large number of citizens of Eastwatch provide Hunter Kill Tasks.

location.name: Fiun Outpost
location.description: Added with the Throne of Destiny expansion, there is only one known portal to Fiun Outpost, it is located on the beach just northeast of Sanamar at 76.6N 58.6W.

location.name: Castle Corcima
location.description:
Quest(s): Zaikhal Defender.
Corcima Castle is located at 83.2N, 50.4W, on top of an insurmountable mountain. It is divided up into several wards, which are restricted to players of different levels.
Only accessible via a Corcima Castle Platinum Ward Portal Gem, which is obtained via the Zaikhal Defender (100+) quest.

location.name: Drunken Madman to Walled Fort
location.description: Give the Drunken Madman some sake and he'll summon this portal in return.

location.name: Akyafi ibn Sumwar
location.description:
Quest(s): Search for Abmim ibn Ibsar and Mad Star Investigation.
Akyafi the Translator stands on the top of the tavern in Yaraq.
Akyafi ibn Sumwar tells you, "I am a humble scholar from Zaikhal. Of late, we have heard of the unusually large number of Drudges in the hills around the Yaraq Cove."
Akyafi ibn Sumwar tells you, "They seem to gather near the ruin of the Empyrean port on the far side of the cove, where the Mad Star flickers. Perhaps you could investigate, and bring me back something which would explain their presence?"
Akyafi ibn Sumwar tells you, "I recently sent young Abmim to investigate, but he has not yet returned."
Akyafi ibn Sumwar tells you, "If you are having difficulty locating the Mad Star, you may buy directions from the barkeeper, Jubal. He's afraid of the Mad Star; ask him instead how to reach the Pillars of the Inner Sea."

location.name: Barkeep Jubal al-Baljad
location.description:
Barkeep Jubal al-Baljad tells you, Welcome to the Cerulean Cove! Are you thirsty, friend traveler?
Barkeep Jubal al-Baljad tells you, It seems like every other day, some grizzled adventurer comes around asking about an old key in the tunnels to the south.

location.restrictions: 80+, Cannot Tie/Recal/Summon, Quest Flag: Speak to Aludi al-Jaladh in Ayan Baqur
location.name: War Room
location.description: Quest(s): Drudge Aviator.

location.name: Ravaged Cathedral
location.description:
Quest(s): Withered Weapons.
A tumerok at the bottom drops the Insensate Axe. Creatures here are immune to life magic.

location.name: Vile Sanctuary
location.description:
Quest(s): Withered Weapons.
At the end of the dungeon is the Anemic Atlatl. All creatures here are immune to life magic.

location.name: Banished Assembly
location.description:
Quest(s): Withered Weapons.
The monsters in this dungeon are life magic immune. The Sterile Sword can be found at the bottom of the dungeon.

location.name: Amarand Villas
location.description: A settlement of villas.

location.name: Guard Ellyon
location.description:
Quest(s): Clutch Of Kings.
The rewards that I grant are meant for those that have fought through all six of the Burun Kings. When you have done so return to me. If you choose, combine the scraps of flesh that you collect from the Kings and combine them one after the other. When all six are together hand it to me for a fair reward."

location.description:
