Watcher of the Dead tells you, "Rejoice! Absolution is at hand."

location.name: Monouga Feeding Pits
location.description:
Quest(s): Monouga Feeding Pit / Monouga Laboratory.
There are three versions of this quest, based upon which direction you take at the 4-way intersection near the dungeon entrance. Levels are suggested and not required for portals:
South: Monouga Laboratory (80+) - Tusker Experiment Orb East: Monouga Laboratory (120+) - Olthoi Experiment Log North: Monouga Laboratory (150+) - Monouga Experiment Log
It is easy to run solo to the end of the two higher level versions to pick up the log. The lowest level version, however, has dense spawns which makes it difficult to run without getting stuck

location.name: Adrien Swiftblade
location.description:
Quest(s): Paradox-touched Olthoi Egg.
Adrien Swiftblade tells you, "Greetings. If you're of a mind to help in this odd situation, I could certainly use your help."
Adrien Swiftblade tells you, "Along with the rise of these strange new Olthoi, there is a Portal, warded by powerful magics, which formed in the Black Death Catacombs. You may've seen it already, or you may not have."
Adrien Swiftblade tells you, "Anyways, I've found a way to get the wards to drop for a time. There is a Ward Guardian in a cave located in a heavily infested area nearby, around 43.6N, 55.5E. When that thing dies, the wards falter for a time."
Adrien Swiftblade tells you, "Be warned, however, the Ward Guardian has grown dramatically in strength since it first appeared. It is now as strong or stronger than those twisted bugs that wander the inner areas of the infestation, and should not be taken lightly."
Adrien Swiftblade tells you, "Once the Ward Guardian is dead, so you should be able to enter the Deeper Catacombs of the Paradox-touched Olthoi. Once in there, look for anything that may be of use to use in our research and bring it back to me."
Adrien Swiftblade tells you, "If, for some reason, the Portal is closed again when you get there, you should find the Ward Guardian in his cave and kill him again."
Adrien Swiftblade tells you, "I would hurry though, every time the Ward Guardian dies, it's either reborn, recreated, or whatever roughly six hours after its death, and the Wards return with it."

location.name: Corporal Liao Chen
location.description:
Quest(s): Monouga Laboratory.
Corporal Liao Chen tells you, "Greetings, adventurer. I greet you in the name of Queen Elysa, whose command brings me here today."
Corporal Liao Chen gives you Monouga Laboratory Portal Attunement Gem.
Corporal Liao Chen tells you, "We seek intrepid adventurers like yourself, who might be willing to help us investigate a concerning development. It seems that some travelers have discovered a cavern in which drudges have been keeping monougas captive. What is unusual is that the drudges have very sophisticated portal sending enchantments which would seem to be beyond their means. We suspect Virindi involvement of some sort."
Corporal Liao Chen tells you, "Therefore, Prince Borelean led an expedition to investigate this drudge cavern. When he was finished, he had determined a way to reverse the portal sending - to open a portal from that location to the source of the monougas. These portal gems are the result of that determination."
Corporal Liao Chen tells you, "The Queen has commanded that whatever lay on the other side of that portal transit should be explored carefully, with the assumption that whatever is there is hostile. To do so, take the gem I have given you and charge it against the feeding bell. It will reverse the workings of the bell's portal sending magic, and, instead of summoning a drudge and a monouga, will open portals to the source of these monsters."
Corporal Liao Chen tells you, "You are welcome to explore the drudge cave, although many have explored it before now. The Queen seeks adventurers to enter the portal from which the monougas come, and hopefully more fully identify exactly what all of this humanoid activity means to the Isparian inhabitants of Dereth."

location.name: Pau Yajin
location.description:
Quest(s): Tanada Temple Of Black Water.
Pau Yajin tells you, "So you've already helped us investigate the three other Tanada temples! You are both brave and dedicated. I must ask your assistance as well, as my colleagues Sayuji Jina and Meshenq have already done."
Pau Yajin tells you, "I ask you to journey to the Tanada Temple of Black Water, in the swamp at 24.2 S, 57.1 E. There you must find the Tanada assassin known as the Master of the Depths. Slay him and bring me his jade medallion. I will need his medallion to be able to get to the bottom of the corruption of that clan of Tanada."

location.restrictions: 60+, the Paradox-touched Olthoi Ward Guardian located in the Ward Guardian Cave must be dead or the portal will be inactive.
location.name: Deeper Catacombs (Paradox)
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Prodigal Olthoi.
From the drop in BDC, go down the long ramp into a large room, go to the south end of the room and take the south passage to get to the portal (there is another portal with the same name of Deeper Catacombs in BDC, but it goes to a different dungeon).

location.name: Ward Guardian Cave
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Prodigal Olthoi.
The entrance to this dungeon is an open landscape olthoi burrow (no portal) located southwest side of the Paradox-touched Valley. Lag can be extreme due to the large number of olthoi in the area. Some find it easier to jump down from the cliff south of the tent to avoid most of the olthoi.
The high level olthoi inside this burrow drop Coruscating Olthoi Scent Glands and Small Olthoi Venom Sacs. At the end of the dungeon is the Paradox-touched Olthoi Ward Guardian responsible for warding the portal to the Paradox Olthoi Queen. Killing the guardian will cause the Deeper Catacombs (Paradox) portal to be usable for six hours (the guardian will not respawn until the six hour timer expires). Also, the guardian almost always drops a sac or two.

location.name: Ethan Wintermaine
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Prodigal Olthoi.
Ethan Wintermaine tells you, "Greetings citizen."
Ethan Wintermaine tells you, "If you're of a mind to help quell this invasion, I have a mission for you. We've found that, with the increase in the infestation of this area, that the stronger Paradox-touched Olthoi have some capacity to pass beyond the Sealed Olthoi Passage that those aiding the Guard Swiftblade have found."
Ethan Wintermaine tells you, "Those who have hunted them have been able to use these stronger Olthoi to gain passage beyond the door themselves."
Ethan Wintermaine tells you, "Beyond that passage lies my mission for you. It's a simple one, in concept anyways."
Ethan Wintermaine smiles.
Ethan Wintermaine tells you, "Before we get to that, you'll need to bypass the Wards on the Deeper Catacombs Portal. Guard Swiftblade, in the tent behind me, has more information in bypassing the Wards. Speak to him if you need more information on that process."
Ethan Wintermaine tells you, "Go beyond the passage, find the Paradox-touched Olthoi Queen, and kill her. Bring me back proof of her death, and I'll reward you for your part in it. Be warned, however. She's not a creature to be taken lightly, or hunted alone."

location.name: Sealed Olthoi Passage
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Prodigal Olthoi.
Hand a Coruscating Olthoi Scent Gland to the north door of the egg room at the end of the dungeon Deeper Catacombs (Paradox).
All of the olthoi inside this dungeon randomly drop Coruscating Olthoi Scent Glands and Small Olthoi Venom Sacs. At the end of the dungeon is the portal leading to the Paradox Olthoi Queen's Chamber. Each time you hand the gland you are flagged to enter this dungeon for 2 hours (you need only use the door to regain entry instead of handing a new gland until the 2 hours has elapsed).

location.name: Whispering Caverns
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Prodigal Tusker (Dark Bobo).
The entrance to the dungeon is in the side of a rock, hidden behind a bush. The passage leads down to the dungeon portal. Both the entrance and exit can be tied/recalled, but cannot be summoned.

location.name: Malrin
location.description:
Quest(s): Hunter Quests (Coral Golems).
Malrin tells you, "Those detestable coral golems, every time I even go near the water I seem to step on one! Do you know what kind of damage coral does to armor? Those scratches are hard to buff out of your sollerets! It won't make them go away but I'll reward you for every 50 Coral Golems that you kill."

location.name: Solange
location.description:
Quest(s): Hunter Quests (Tenebrous Rifts, Umbral Rifts).
Solange tells you, "I've spent many of my days in the place known as Singularity Caul. It was in my travels that I made an amazing discovery, one that would surely change anyone's life. I've experienced that proximity to a dieing rift has certain effects on the psyche."
Solange tells you, "It's truely amazing. Go out and experience it for yourself. Different rifts seem to have different effects."
Solange tells you, "Kill 30 Umbral Rifts and let me know of your adventures."
Solange tells you, "The experience of hunting Umbral Rifts appears to have a heavy but short lasted effect on the psyche, on the other hand Tenebrous Rifts have a minor but long lasting effect. If you seek to truely explore your own essence I'd suggest you kill 350 or more Tenebrous Rifts, it's truly amazing."

location.name: Zava bint Laurma
location.description:
Quest(s): Hunter Quests (Slithis).
Zava bint Laurma tells you, "So, you wish to prove your hunting prowess? Well then. Track down and slay 150 of those lurking Sishalti Tentacles, Tendrils and Eye Stalks for me and I will reward you appropriately."

location.name: Artifex Collegium
location.description: Quest(s): Aerbax's Prodigal Harbinger, Shadow, Delving Into Claude's Mind.

location.name: Aun Kelauri
location.description:
Quest(s): Delving Into Claude's Mind.
Aun Kelauri tells you, "Peace be with you, buhdi. Welcome to my abode."
Aun Kelauri tells you, "All are welcome to come and meditate upon their own keh, or upon the keh of others."
Aun Kelauri tells you, "I have found that sometimes such visions are aided by the use of atuakeh dust. Form a fellowship and toss your dust into the fire, and your fellowship will be able to see things you were unable to before for a short time."
Aun Kelauri tells you, "Beware - the atuakeh dust will only work upon those who are a member of your fellowship when you toss the dust upon the fire and who remain with your fellowship as they approach the fire."
Aun Kelauri tells you, "The mists will only remain parted for a short time - a half hour at most. Hurry on your task"
Aun Kelauri tells you, "Finally, if you die, the journey to your lifestone will erase what tie you have to the other world. Be careful in how you tread, for that which lurks there can kill as surely as the monsters of this world."

location.name: Guard Alfric
location.description:
Quest(s): Hunter Quests (Shadow-touched Virindi Quidox).
Guard Alfric tells you, "Hail to ye! Would ye like to show the world that ye are a brave warrior? If so, then take yerself ta the Valley o' Death and slay yerself some o' them Shadow-touched Virindi Quidiox."
Guard Alfric tells you, "Poor blighters got themselves tainted by Aerbax, so it's up ta us ta put 'em down. Kill 75 and come back ta me."

location.name: Guard Li
location.description:
Quest(s): Hunter Quests (Shadow-touched Virindi Paradox).
Guard Li tells you, "Greetings, wanderer. I have been stationed in this ill-begotten place to seek those who would aid against one of Aerbax's more recent creations - the Shadow-touched Virindi Paradox. Who could know that the Virindi Paradox could corrupt itself even further..."
Guard Li tells you, "Slay 75 of these things and return to me, and I shall reward you."

location.name: Guard Q'alia
location.description:
Quest(s): Hunter Quests (Virindi Quidoxes).
Guard Q'alia tells you, "Queen Elysa set me here to watch for incursions by Aerbax's Virindi...yet she allows the other Virindi, like that thrice-accursed Claude and Leopold, to remain here."
Guard Q'alia tells you, "Allow me to confide a secret. My name is Q'alia bint Hakim. My father was the Archmage Hakim, one of the bravest and strongest of the land."
Guard Q'alia tells you, "That cowled beast killed him, and left the body out to rot all these years...and no one dared raise a finger! Even still they are allowed to hover smugly in their tents, and the only one who will even hear me out is Ulgrim!"
Guard Q'alia tells you, "What I would have of you? Claude and Leopold are too closely watched. However, their kin in the Valley of Death are not. Go there now, and slay 75 Virindi Quidioxes. That will grant a small amount of vengeance for my father."

location.name: Guard Taziq
location.description:
Quest(s): Hunter Quests (Virindi Paradoxes).
Guard Taziq tells you, "Greetings, brave one. Fate has brought you this way, for Queen Elysa has need of those who would aid her and their homeland. The one known as Aerbax has many servants who trouble the land, and I would seek you aid against those known as Virindi Paradoxes."
Guard Taziq tells you, "If you slay 75 of these strange beings, come to me. You shall be rewarded."

location.name: Hisham al-Evv
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Prodigal Olthoi.
Hisham al-Evv tells you, "Welcome, do you have Small Olthoi Venom sacs to trade with me? I have many things to offer you if you do."
Hisham al-Evv tells you, "Thank you again for bartering with me. The Arcanum will make good use of these venom sacs in our studies of these strange Olthoi."
Hisham will trade players various items in exchange for the Small Olthoi Venom Sacs dropped by the Paradox Olthoi in Olthoi North.
Scroll of 'Infested Area' Recall - 5 Small Olthoi Venom Sacs.

location.name: Candeth Keep to Tufa
location.description: This Portal Goes To The Town of Tufa.

location.name: Nomea ibn Makar
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Prodigal Tumerok.
Nomea ibn Makar tells you, "Ah, you may be suitable for the task I have at hand. We've received reports that the Virindi renegade Aerbax has endowed a Hea Tumerok with increased intelligence and magical power. You can only imagine what danger this creature would pose if it came to unite the Tumeroks, the way Aerbax's other experiments have tried, yes?"
Nomea ibn Makar tells you, "Please venture to the Lonely Fortress on the western edge of Dereth, north of Ayan Baqur, and see to it that this Tumerok poses us no threat."

location.name: Aun Teriona
location.description:
Quest(s): Carenzi Plague.
Aun Teriona appraises you closely.
Aun Teriona tells you, "Greetings, human - hear the kah of the carenzi. While they are fierce creatures and sometimes infest burrows that they should not, by and large they exist in harmony with Palenqual. I have heard a troubling report, though - that the touch of Wharu infests some carenzi and inflicts a terrible disease."
Aun Teriona tells you, "To prevent the plague from overtaking the land, you must seek carenzi which bear plague and destroy both them and others of their kind in that immediate area. Examine their livers to identify whether the carenzi are diseased. If you have culled the diseased carenzi already, show me the liver that I may see the evidence of the infection."
Aun Teriona tells you, "Know that only those carenzi which burrow upward to the light are afflicted. Those which exist forever in the ground are not susceptible to the illness."
Aun Teriona tells you, "You are a great hunter and warrior whose exploits should be sung of far and wide, if they are not already. To you I task the culling of the Mangy Carenzi. I have been told that these creations of the atua ngamaru are found within the place known as the Singularity Caul."
Alternate interaction Aun Teriona appraises you closely.
Aun Teriona tells you, "I can see that you are the paragon of hunters, and so I shall give you the hardest task of all. You must cull the Tainted Carenzi, foul creations of the atua ngamaru. Seek them in the place known as the Singularity Caul."

location.restrictions: 80+, Cannot Tie/Recall/Summon, Quest Flag: Nomea ibn Makar
location.name: Lonely Fortress
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Prodigal Tumerok.
This dungeon is the home of Hea Rheaga. Rheaga was a former Aun Tumerok who served as the town crier at the Aun town of Timaru but was abducted and enhanced by Aerbax.

location.name: Hidden Laboratory
location.description: Quest(s): Aerbax's Prodigal Human.
location.monsters: Blight, Martinate Hollow Minion, Paradox Simulacrum War Mage, Paradox Simulacrum, Tusker Stomper.Virindi Desecrator, Demerax the Sculptor, Lab Guardian

location.name: Aun Aemaua
location.description:
Quest(s): The Ithaenc Quiddity Seed.
Aun Aemaua tells you, "Aha! Another worthy adventurer. You have spoken with Lord Asheron about the threats to the realm, have you? Excellent. I would have you seek out the Quiddity Seed that materialized in Ithaenc Cathedral down in the Vesayen Isles. It is a gateway to a strange realm, both of this world and not... A realm in which memories and dreams acquire tangible form... Aerbax wishes to destroy the realm's memories of the defeat of Bael'Zharon! Such a thing is not to be borne! You must take a group and journey into the Quiddity Seed, the device by which Aerbax manipulates our collective memories, and defeat his designs!"

location.name: Aun Javhalrea, the Game Warden
location.description:
Quest(s): Dire Champions.
Aun Javhalrea, the Game Warden tells you, "Your Queen, Ispar Elysatah, has asked me to help control of the growing threat of certain creatures here in the Direlands."
Aun Javhalrea, the Game Warden tells you, "Atuakawa, or enemy warriors, called Dire Champions have been killing the unwary or unprepared who travel the Direlands. These atuakawa seem well trained and exceptionally difficult to kill."
Aun Javhalrea, the Game Warden tells you, "It is my belief the creatures we fight in the Colosseum grow stronger from those battles, much as we do. These new atuakawa could be the result."
Aun Javhalrea, the Game Warden tells you, "If you are able to kill one of the Dire Champions they usually have a orange coin on them. Bring me this coin as proof of your kill and I will reward your for helping to thin their number."

location.restrictions: 130+, Cannot Tie/Recall/Summon, Quest Flag: Speak To Emissary of Asheron located in Asheron's Tower.
location.name: Ithaenc Quiddity Seed
location.description: Quest(s): The Ithaenc Quiddity Seed.

location.restrictions: 130+, Cannot Tie/Recall/Summon, Quest Flag: Speak To Emissary of Asheron located in Asheron's Tower.
location.name: Collegium Planar Abstraction
location.description:
Quest(s): The Knorr Quiddity Seed.
You must be flagged by the Emissary of Asheron found at Asheron's Castle in order to use the conveyance that portals you into the dungeon.

location.name: Nomendar al-Rakh
location.description:
Quest(s): Northern/Southern Shroud Cabal.
Nomendar al-Rakh tells you, "Greetings! Have you run into any human bandits that belong to a group known as the Shroud Cabal? I represent a group of concerned Geomancers who are afraid that these renegades may pose some kind of threat, or represent a new threat to the people of Dereth... If you come across any of their artifacts, please bring them to me and I shall try to reward you."

location.name: South Gate
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Citadel.
This dungeon is a long linear maze that leads to the NPC that accepts the crystals to begin the Aerbax's Citadel quest. Once your fellow has handed in the crystals and used the harmonic device once, until the hour expires you can use the three portals at the start of the dungeon to skip all of it and go directly to the device again, useful if you die or Aerbax portals you off the platforms.

location.name: North Gate
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Citadel.
Collect 3 unique Harmonic Crystals by killing and looting them from the Virindi Artificer at each of the three gates surrounding the citadel. You only need one set of crystals per fellowship, and they are givable.

location.name: East Gate
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Citadel.
Collect 3 unique Harmonic Crystals by killing and looting them from the Virindi Artificer at each of the three gates surrounding the citadel. You only need one set of crystals per fellowship, and they are givable.

location.name: West Gate
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Citadel.
Collect 3 unique Harmonic Crystals by killing and looting them from the Virindi Artificer at each of the three gates surrounding the citadel. You only need one set of crystals per fellowship, and they are givable.

location.restrictions: 1+, Cannot Be Summoned, Can Be Recalled.
location.name: Olthoi Sanctuary
location.description:
Quest(s): The Black Death Catacombs Quiddity Seed Ingot Purification.
Stick to the left and generally down to find the Vat of Olthoi Jelly to purify the Black Death Catacombs Quiddity Ingot. It is in a huge room with lots of Olthoi Swarm Soldiers.

location.name: Roots Of The Deru Tree
location.description:
Quest(s): The Knorr Quiddity Seed Ingot Purification.
Found on Xi Ru's Island behind Xi Ru's Chapel and beneath the waterfall. The dungeon has one large main room. The Drop point puts you in a hallway which wraps around the main room, going up then down, until you reach the main area. At the end you'll find a Pool of Water and a surface portal. The Pool of Water is used to purify the Knorr Quiddity Ingot.

location.name: Trial Of The Deep
location.description:
Quest(s): The Ithaenc Quiddity Seed Ingot Purification.
This dungeon includes a small jumping puzzle that involves jumping from one small platform to the next in order to cross a lava pit. Also there is a room that has an invisible path over a lava pit.
Remember that jumping is only needed once after that even though it looks like you need to jump across a pit there is actually an invisible winding path. Lastly a mage with tusker fists does wonders for clearing a path through the rooms filled with tentacles.

location.name: Northern Resonating Crystal
location.description:
Quest(s): Northern Shroud Cabal, Menhir Mana Fields # 17.
Hand a Raider Captain's Resonator to the Northern Resonating Crystal to the enter the dungeon. If you die in the dungeon all you have to do to get back it go use the crystal. You don't need another Resonator. How long the flag lasts to enter after you hand a Resonator is unknown.

location.name: Southern Resonating Crystal
location.description:
Quest(s): Southern Shroud Cabal.
Hand a Forager Captain's Resonator to the Southern Resonating Crystal to the enter the dungeon. If you die in the dungeon all you have to do to get back it go use the crystal. You don't need another Resonator. How long the flag lasts to enter after you hand a Resonator is unknown.

location.name: Hoshino Kei
location.description:
Quest(s): Empowered Armor of the Perfect Light, The Black Death Catacombs Quiddity Seed, The Black Death Catacombs Quiddity Seed Ingot Purification, The Ithaenc Quiddity Seed, The Knorr Quiddity Seed.
February 2008: Hoshino Kei moved from Bur Portal Site to Asheron's Castle.

location.name: Danira the Dusty
location.description:
Quest(s): Lord Rytheran's Journal.
Danira the Dusty tells you, "Ah, you may be able to help me. I seek an artifact of the dread undead lord Rytheran. I think the ley line disturbances across the realm have opened up a gate into his personal library. There is some kind of gate that appeared within the old Mage Academy... But I believe, to enter it, you must have a seal of Rytheran's... A seal that my scouts have traced to a crypt in the Empyrean Graveyard in the Direlands. The graveyard can be found at 65 S, 44 W, but I do not know which crypt within its expansive grounds would contain the seal you need."
Danira the Dusty tells you, "Go search the crypts in that graveyard, and try to find Rytheran's lordly seal that will allow you into his Library. Enter the library through the gate near the Mage Academy and search for books. It may be too much to ask that the Book of Eibhil is still in there, but perhaps some journal of Rytheran's would help illuminate the trail to that terrifying artifact. In any case, please bring me whatever books you may find in there."

location.name: Merwart Mundagurg
location.description:
Quest(s): Blightfinger.
Merwart Mundagurg tells you, "You! Yes you can help! I serve the great god Angry Grandfather from that human town nearby. I explore lands for him. But I am stopped now. There is a big stinky fin-face acid-spitter nest north of here! They are crawling out of a hole in the water! Interfering with my exploration! Kill their leader, the biggest and stinkiest one of them all! Bring me hand of Blightfinger, and I give you reward!"

location.name: Blightfinger's Warrens
location.description:
Quest(s): Blightfinger.
The dungeon starts as an open burrow on the beach just north of Ayan Baqur at 56.8S 89.2W. Not too far down there is a 70+ portal to the lower part of the dungeon.

location.name: Francisco The Hunter
location.description:
Quest(s): Moarsmen On The Shores.
Francisco the Hunter tells you, "Hail, traveler. Do you want to know something?"
Francisco the Hunter tells you, "There's moarsmen down on that beach - yes, moarsmen, even in this cold!"
Francisco the Hunter tells you, "They're unnatural, these moarsmen are. I've seen a bit in my time."
Francisco the Hunter tells you, "I'm sure the captain of this outpost wouldn't complain if you went and wiped out the population of that den of moarsmen. Eventually those things are going to get hostile and attack us up here."

location.name: Guard Al'Zira
location.description:
Quest(s): Moarsmen On The Shores.
Guard Al'Zira tells you, "Greetings, valiant one. I would defend this place from harm, but this fort is far from reinforcements, and I cannot leave to fight the monsters upon the beach. Destroy them and bring me a token of your victory."

location.name: Guard Bey
location.description:
Quest(s): Moarsmen On The Shores.
Guard Bey tells you, "Would you like to do us a favor, sir? There is a fortress of moarsmen down near the festival stone. I think they may potentially pose a threat to the town, unless we strike first. If you find anything of interest there, come back and give it to me."

location.name: Guard Liaza
location.description:
Quest(s): Moarsmen On The Shores.
Guard Liaza tells you, "Greetings, traveler. Do you think you could help with a problem we're having?"
Guard Liaza tells you, "Recently, moarsmen have started coming from the ocean and raiding Redspire. I've never seen them be so organized before."
Guard Liaza tells you, "They have built a fortification down in the mud flats. They must be driven back before they threaten Redspire and its people. Slay the moarsmen and bring back a token of your victory."

location.name: Guard Taizo
location.description:
Quest(s): Moarsmen On The Shores.
Guard Taizo tells you, "Traveler - would you kindly help us with a problem we are having?"
Guard Taizo tells you, "Down on the beach, hostile moarsmen have created their own little fort."
Guard Taizo tells you, "If you would go and destroy the inhabitants, it would help the town greatly"

location.name: Joku Shunja
location.description:
Quest(s): Investigate The Factions.
Celestial Hand
Joku Shunja tells you, "I'm sorry, but my orders are not to deal with anyone unless they have a letter of introduction from another member of my faction."

location.name: Jondor Torgren
location.description:
Quest(s): Investigate The Factions.
Jondor Torgren tells you, "Perhaps you could help a simple scholar... I've been told that strange landscape formations have appeared around the Empyrean graveyard, and that scouts from mysterious new secret societies have taken up positions at these sites. There are scouts at these formations to the north, east, and west of the graveyard."
Jondor Torgren tells you, "I would be most indebted to you if you could somehow gain the trust of these scouts and bring me whatever written materials you can about the beliefs that their societies espouse. I would reward you with a bit of practical knowledge for any manifestoes that you could bring me. I have also heard that there are more senior representatives of each society in Ayan Baqur, but I doubt they'll talk to you until you've won the confidence of the scouts by the graveyard. Good luck! And be careful about straying into the graveyard itself!".

location.name: Marcus Danby
location.description: Quest(s): Moarsmen On The Shore, Ritual Of The Blight.

location.name: Qurakh al-Taal
location.description:
Quest(s): Investigate The Factions.
Eldrytch Web
Qurakh al-Taal tells you, "Do I know you? I will not treat with you unless you have a letter of introduction from one of my fellows."

location.name: Vierana du Canamorra
location.description:
Quest(s): Investigate The Factions.
Radiant Blood
Vierana du Canamorra tells you, "Unless you have a letter of introduction from one of my scouts, I don't have any time for you."

location.name: Royal Quartermaster
location.description:
Quest(s): Royal Guard (2008 Compensation).
Give the purchased Order to any Royal Guard for the item.

location.name: Royal Guard
location.description:
Quest(s): Royal Guard (2008 Compensation).
Royal Guard tells you, "Greetings. Due to the instability you have recently experienced within the world of Asheron's Call, we would like to extend our heartfelt apologies. Please accept this as a token of our regret."
Royal Guard gives you Writ of Apology.

location.name: Royal Guard
location.description:
Quest(s): Royal Guard (2008 Compensation).
Royal Guard tells you, "Greetings. Due to the instability you have recently experienced within the world of Asheron's Call, we would like to extend our heartfelt apologies. Please accept this as a token of our regret."
Royal Guard gives you Writ of Apology.

location.name: Royal Guard
location.description:
Quest(s): Royal Guard (2008 Compensation).
Royal Guard tells you, "Greetings. Due to the instability you have recently experienced within the world of Asheron's Call, we would like to extend our heartfelt apologies. Please accept this as a token of our regret."
Royal Guard gives you Writ of Apology.

Royal Guard gives you Writ of Apology.

location.name: Ayan Baqur Moarsman Fort
location.description: Quest(s): Moarsmen On The Shores.

location.name: Beach Fort Moarsman Fort
location.description: Quest(s): Moarsmen On The Shores.

location.name: Danby's Outpost Moarsman Fort
location.description: Quest(s): Moarsmen On The Shores.

location.name: Eastwatch Moarsman Fort
location.description: Quest(s): Moarsmen On The Shores.

location.name: Redspire Moarsman Fort
location.description: Quest(s): Moarsmen On The Shores.

location.name: Tou-Tou Moarsman Fort
location.description: Quest(s): Moarsmen On The Shores.

location.name: Blight Rat Bunker
location.description:
Quest(s): Investigate the Factions.
Introduced during the Introductions event, this is a bunker full of Blight Rats. Located at 64.0S 44.2W on north side of Graveyard. Inside is the Blight Rat Chest which contains the Scepter of Menilesh.

location.name: Congregation of Blight Spirits
location.description:
Quest(s): Investigate the Factions.
Burned area with crystals just west of Graveyard at 66.0S 44.7 with about 30 Blight Spirits.

location.name: Blight Revenant Pit
location.description:
Quest(s): Investigate the Factions.
A pit filled with Blight Revenants and the Blight Lictor. Located at 65.5S 42.2W east of Graveyard. Introduced during the Introductions event. .

location.name: Hiro Ishigame
location.description:
Quest(s): Green Mire Grave.
Hiro Ishigame tells you, "Greetings, I am Hiro Ishigami, a scholar studying the history and artifacts of the Green Mire Warrior."
Hiro Ishigame tells you, "Perhaps you could assist me. When the Green Mire Warrior died, he was set to rest in a large complex used to serve as his grave. Since that time, however, it has been completely overrun with drudges, mosswarts, and all sorts of other horrible things."
Hiro Ishigame tells you, "If you were willing to go retrieve the Yari and Cuirass from those invading creatures, I would gladly reward you for the chance to study them. I can also repair them, if they are too damaged to be used and you wish them returned to you after my studies."
Hiro Ishigame tells you, "I have been told that the pieces no longer reside in the coffin itself, and that the entirety of the Green Mire Grave is separated by locked doors and hidden keys. So, if you go, it may take some exploration to find them both."
Hiro Ishigame tells you, "You will find the Green Mire Grave at 27.8S, 71.6E, northeast of here, upon a small hill to the east side of the river."

location.name: Captain Warner
location.description:
Quest(s): Ritual Of The Blight.
Captain Warner tells you, "Are ye seekin' for something ta do, lad? I might know something ye could stand ta be hearin', if ya don't like these foul, tainted moarsmen no more than I do."
Captain Warner tells you, "On Ispar, I do be a ship's captain, but we do not be havin' navies here on Dereth. Instead, I be reduced to speakin' my understandin' of the lore of the sea - such as these fortresses which be appearin' upon the coast."
Captain Warner tells you, "When the blighteed moarsmen came forth, they be leavin' a way for a cunning dog such as yerself to enter their tunnels."
Captain Warner tells you, "If ya find yer way to the bottom, and ye find anything of interest, be lettin' me know what ye find. I'll be seein' what I can be doin' for ya."

location.name: Laedron the Geomancer
location.description:
Quest(s): Tainted Ley Line Nodes.
Laedron the Geomancer tells you, "Greetings! Are you here to help reclaim the land's ley lines from the corruption of T'thuun? At the behest of our noble Queen Elysa, the mage Asheron has raised six pyramids over the most tainted ley nodes in Dereth, the sites most under the grip of the wicked creature T'thuun. These pyramids must be powered! Certain creatures found in the vicinity of those nodes sometimes bear tiny crystals of concentrated, tainted mana."
Laedron the Geomancer tells you, "Bring these crystals to each of the pyramids! Once a pyramid has been sufficiently stoked by brave Derethians such as yourself, all that will be required to defeat T'thuun's power at that site is to destroy the guardian that T'thuun has stationed there... I have written a book that explains all this. I'll give you one now..."
Laedron the Geomancer gives you A Field Guide to Tainted Nodes.
Laedron the Geomancer tells you, "But be warned, though you may be capable of hunting the creatures near the pyramid sites, the minions that T'thuun has chained there are quite powerful and may be too strong for you to fight. You may want to bring powerful friends."

location.name: Halaetan Node Golem
location.description:
Quest(s): Tainted Ley Line Nodes.
Halaetan Node Golem tells you, "The Master keeps me here to keep the node pure. I am the watcher against the blight of T'thuun. I guard the node of the Halaetan Islands. I require Blighted Mana Crystals to maintain function. If you supply such crystals to me or my fellows at the other nodes of Dereth, you will be recognized and rewarded."

location.name: Blighted Rank Moarsman Tunnels
location.description: Quest(s): Ritual Of The Blight.

location.name: Blighted Disgusting Moarsman Tunnels
location.description: Quest(s): Ritual Of The Blight.

location.description: Quest(s): Ritual Of The Blight.

location.name: Blighted Verdant Moarsman Tunnels
location.description: Quest(s): Ritual Of The Blight.

location.name: Aerlinthe Node Pyramid
location.description: Quest(s): Tainted Ley Line Nodes.

location.name: A'mun Node Pyramid
location.description: Quest(s): Tainted Ley Line Nodes.

location.name: Halaetan Node Pyramid
location.description: Quest(s): Tainted Ley Line Nodes.

location.name: Esper Node Pyramid

location.name: Obsidian Node Pyramid
location.description: Quest(s): Tainted Ley Line Nodes.

location.name: Arcanum Broker
location.description: Mana Forge Vendor. Purchases unwanted loot from the Mana Forge chests

location.name: Arcanum Broker
location.description: Mana Forge Vendor. Purchases unwanted loot from the Mana Forge chests

location.name: Arcanum Broker
location.description: Mana Forge Vendor. Purchases unwanted loot from the Mana Forge chests

location.name: Arcanum Mana-smith
location.description: Pristine Mana Shard Collector. Give him 25 Pristine Mana Shards for a Shard Mana Forge Key that will open one of the two Shard Mana Forge Equipment Chests. There are a set of chests in Cragstone, Hebian-To, and Zaikhal.

location.name: Arcanum Mana-smith
location.description: Pristine Mana Shard Collector. Give him 25 Pristine Mana Shards for a Shard Mana Forge Key that will open one of the two Shard Mana Forge Equipment Chests. There are a set of chests in Cragstone, Hebian-To, and Zaikhal.

location.name: Arcanum Mana-smith
location.description: Pristine Mana Shard Collector. Give him 25 Pristine Mana Shards for a Shard Mana Forge Key that will open one of the two Shard Mana Forge Equipment Chests. There are a set of chests in Cragstone, Hebian-To, and Zaikhal.

location.name: Arturus of the Eldrytch Web
location.description:
Quest(s): Eldrytch Web Initiation.
Society Recruiter for the Eldrytch Web.
Warning: Do not talk to him if you have completed the quest Investigate the Factions and you do not want to join the Eldrytch Web.

location.name: Ayesha of the Radiant Blood
location.description:
Quest(s): Radiant Blood Initiation.
Society Recruiter for the Radiant Blood.
Warning: Do not talk to her if you have completed the quest Investigate the Factions and you do not want to join the Radiant Blood.

location.name: Kirina of the Celestial Hand
location.description:
Quest(s): Celestial Hand Initiation.
Society Recruiter for the Celestial Hand.
Warning: Do not talk to her if you have completed the quest Investigate the Factions and you do not want to join the Celestial Hand.

location.name: Gaston Shadowbound
location.description:
Quest(s): Investigate The Factions.
Gaston Shadowbound tells you, "Shhhhh... Not so loud. What do you think I am, a minstrel?"
Gaston Shadowbound tells you, "If you're talking to me, I guess you're interested in the 'services' I provide for those who wish to sever their ties to the 'Societies' that are so wrapped up in everything these days."
Gaston Shadowbound tells you, "For a fee, I could possibly be persuaded to go in, remove any records of your involvement, and get you a fresh start in said 'Societies'. Let's call that fee, say, 100 MMD Notes."
Gaston Shadowbound tells you, "If you're in a Society and want out, or want a fresh start so you can join another one, bring me 100 MMD notes, and I'll see what I can do."
Gaston Shadowbound tells you, "As a warning though, I won't do this for anyone more than once a month. Too risky to be worth the pay."
NOTE: As of 8/29/2008 you will maintain the number of ribbons turned into the Society and the timers on all Society quests, so it will take you even longer to rank up if you rejoin a society. In addition, you lose all rank in the old society!
When you complete the join Society quest again, you receive the same amount of XP and a society armor writ (3 day timer on chest pulls).

location.restrictions: 150+, 180+ To Flag, Cannot Tie/Recall/Summon, Quest Flag: Begin Knight Test
location.name: Ancient Cloister
location.description:
Quest(s): Knight Test.
To gain entrance to this dungeon you must be at least an Adept in your Faction, qualify for the rank of Knight and have talked to your Inspector of Knights. See Knight Test for details.
The Leatherbound Journal can be found at the end near the portal.
To find the Journal, hang left, and keep going up and generally N.

location.name: Bandit Magma Tubes
location.description:
Quest(s): Defeating Bandit Mana Hunter Boss.
The bandits here use hollow weapons and VIII frost bolts. The sclavus spam Poison Health.

location.name: Catacombs of Tar'Kelyn
location.description:
Quest(s): Master Test.
This dungeon is part of the Master Test quest for the Factions and you must be a Lord that has turned in enough Commendation Ribbons to start the Master Test.

location.name: Freebooter Isle
location.description:
Quest(s): Various.
Freebooter is an island just north of the original Vesayen Isles, continuing the chain. It became available in Ancient Powers, the 100th patch. Pristine Mana Shards can be found on creatures spawning here.
To access the isle, use the Statue of Transport at 82.6S 88.8E near the Ithaenc Cathedral (Sanctuary).
You must be at least level 180+ and be a Knight (Rank 3) in your Faction to access this island.

location.name: Deru Tree of Degar'Alesh
location.description:
Quest(s): None.
This Deru Tree is located on Degar'Alesh, also known as Freebooter Isle. It was already dead when Isparians were first able to reach the island, killed by the Old One T'thuun.

location.name: Ruins of Degar'Alesh
location.description:
Quest(s): None.
A large set of ruins located on Degar'Alesh, also known as Freebooter Isle. The large temple is centered at 62.3S, 96.0E and is the drop point for Freebooter. To the south is a smaller temple at 63.1S, 96.0E which contains a portal to the Ithaenc Archipelago. To the north is the Deru Tree of Degar'Alesh.

location.name: Freebooter Keep
location.description:
Quest(s): The Creeping Blight.
NPCs
Arqubal the Archmage Ilnorra Denasta Janaris bint Bazheer Master Mehkar al-Qalam Mitsuhara Takeo (Land Control) Purser Narissa Pelton Valerian McGreggor

location.name: Freebooter Keep Black Market
location.description:
Quest(s): Land Control.
NPCs
Chiriko (Black Coral Golem Kill Task) Hacha Jien the Archmage Hanzo (Blighted Coral Golem Kill Task) Lormish Littlefinger Master MacTavish Pak Li-Shung Purser Jak Halftoes Valerian McGreggor

location.name: Statue of Transport
location.description: As you touch the statue, you feel the now-familiar tug of Portalspace.

location.restrictions: 180+, Cannot Tie/Recall/Summon, Must Complete Celestial Hand Initiation.

Quest(s): Factions, Eldrytch Web/Radiant Blood Stronghold, Menhir Mana Fields # 15.

Quest(s): Factions, Celestial Hand/Radiant Blood Stronghold, Menhir Mana Fields # 15.
NPCs

location.restrictions: 180+, Cannot Tie/Recall/Summon, Must Complete Radiant Blood Initiation.
location.name: Radiant Blood Stronghold
location.description:
Quest(s): Factions, Celestial Hand/Eldrytch Web Stronghold, Menhir Mana Fields # 15.
NPCs
Agbeart Akahana Aldoro di Belleforte Armand di Bellenesse Atsuko Berrando Piatelli Brizinna du Corcosi Cullum of Celdon Daisei Chirana Elesandra Trembol Gamri Nightshade Ian Foefinder Idaris bint Qumal Kalal ibn Dariz Kotaro Ueda Kylos Hunterson Lunbal Dolicci Marek al-Evv (Rare Island Trophies) Payla bint Dumandi Pia du Cinghalle Promotions Officer Radiant Blood Quartermaster Rafin bin Fezesh Rheda the Watcher Saphine Brauno Shien Genda of the Radiant Blood Shopkeeper Lazlo Society Breastplate Armorsmith Society Gauntlets Armorsmith Society Girth Armorsmith Society Greaves Armorsmith Society Helm Armorsmith Society Pauldrons Armorsmith Society Sollerets Armorsmith Society Tassets Armorsmith Society Vambraces Armorsmith Society Vault Keeper Tactical Officer (N.Wing) Takahara Masikawa Ti'alla bint Ashud Vermilia the Archmage Viviana Fortiore
Portals
Master Statue of 'Freebooter Isle' Transport Master Statue of 'Moarsman City' Transport

location.name: Massilor's Crypt
location.description:
Quest(s): Graveyard Package Delivery (Supplies for Massilor).
To gain entrance to this dungeon you must be at least an Adept in your Faction. See Graveyard Package Delivery for details. Massilor the Withered can be found at the end. This short dungeon has about 10 Grave Rats on a fast spawn and is an ideal location to complete the kill task.

location.name: The Pit Of Heretics
location.description:
Quest(s): Lord Test.
Introduced in Ancient Powers.
This ziggurat is located southeast of Candeth Keep at 88.0S, 55.0W and is referenced by Ulgrim the Unpleasant:
You give Ulgrim the Unpleasant Stout.
Ulgrim the Unpleasant tells you, "Moarsman Island? Yeah, I know how to get there. You run west from here until you reach the coast, then take a left turn, follow the curve until it flattens out, then take a right and swim until you hit the shore of the new island. Watch for the ziggurats. Simple! Why is it so hard for people to figure out?"

location.restrictions: Rank: Lord To Access Moarsman City
location.name: The Pit Of Heretics - East Statue
location.description:
Quest(s): Lord Test.
Red Coral Hollow - This hollow is inscribed with coral numbers that read 150. Green Coral Hollow - This hollow is inscribed with coral numbers that read 112. Blue Coral Hollow - This hollow is inscribed with coral numbers that read 126.
Dawnsong through Warmtide and a half - use the EAST statue Evensong through Foredawn and a half - use the WEST statue.

location.restrictions: Rank: Lord To Access Moarsman City
location.name: The Pit Of Heretics - West Statue
location.description:
Quest(s): Lord Test.
Red Coral Hollow - This hollow is inscribed with coral numbers that read 78. Green Coral Hollow - This hollow is inscribed with coral numbers that read 117. Blue Coral Hollow - This hollow is inscribed with coral numbers that read 42.
Check the In-game Time before you use the statues that portal you to the City. There is a bug with them in which if you use the statues at the wrong time of the day they will portal you to The Pit of Heretics instead of the Moarsman City.
Dawnsong through Warmtide and a half - use the EAST statue Evensong through Foredawn and a half - use the WEST statue.

location.name: Shrine of the Sacred Deep Water
location.description:
Quest(s): Moarsman Shrine Artifacts.
Use to obtain the Sacred Deep Water.

location.name: Shrine of the Blood Pearl
location.description:

This dungeon has no exit portal, so the only way to leave is to portal recall. All levers at the start open a door that takes you down, so it doesn't really matter which one you use.

location.name: Devon the Collector
location.description: Find 10 Blight-encrusted Black Coral Chunks that spawn randomly around the Moarsman City and hand them to Devon with 15 million experience. No timer on turn in.

location.name: Northwatch Castle
location.description:
One of the Land Control areas added during the Ancient Powers event. Northwatch Castle is located in North Osteth not far from Neydisa Castle at 81.5N 25E. In the middle of the castle is a tunnel leading down to a 180+ portal to the Northwatch Castle Black Market. The portal may only be used by members of the Society currently controlling the fort.
NPCs
Mitsuhara Takeo (Land Control) Valerian McGreggor

location.restrictions: 180+, Cannot Tie/Recall/Summon, Quest Flag: Must Be In Currently Controlling Faction.
location.name: Northwatch Castle Black Market
location.description:
Quest(s): Land Control.
NPCs
Arqubal the Archmage Chiriko (Black Coral Golem Kill Task) Hanzo (Blighted Coral Golem Kill Task) Ilnorra Denasta Janaris bint Bazheer Master Mehkar al-Qalam Purser Narissa Pelton

location.name: Rogue Delvings
location.description:
Quest(s): Adept Test.
The surface portal in Mage Academy is tiable and is right next to the dungeon. The Celestial Hand camp is on the west side, the Eldrytch Web camp is on the north side, and the Radiant Blood camp is on the east side.

location.name: Corrupted Catacombs
location.description:
Quest(s): Faction Initiation.
Part of the process of Joining a Faction.

location.name: Wight Barrow
location.description:
Quest(s): Tracing The Stone.
At the bottom of the dungeon is a Mhoire Carved Cenotaph, used in the Tracing The Stone faction quest. The sorcerer that is near the Cenotaph counts towards the Wight Blade Sorcerer Kill Task.

location.name: Arcanum Quota Officer
location.description:
Quest(s): Mana Forge.
Arcanum Quota Officer tells you, "Welcome to the Mana Forge! I am the Arcanum Quota Officer for this Mana Forge."
Arcanum Quota Officer tells you, "The Mana Forge has a quota for Pristine Mana Shards before the forges are working at maximum capacity. I am authorized to offer a better rate for the keys to our Shard Mana Forge Chests to accomplished adventurers such as yourself until our quota is filled."
Arcanum Quota Officer tells you, "To fill that quota, I am prepared to offer you a rate of 10 shards for each key up to 5 times each week. Once I have filled my quota and the forges are working at maximum capacity you will need to talk to the other Mana-smiths to turn in shards for the remainder of the week."

location.name: Arcanum Quota Officer
location.description:
Quest(s): Mana Forge.
Arcanum Quota Officer tells you, "Welcome to the Mana Forge! I am the Arcanum Quota Officer for this Mana Forge."
Arcanum Quota Officer tells you, "The Mana Forge has a quota for Pristine Mana Shards before the forges are working at maximum capacity. I am authorized to offer a better rate for the keys to our Shard Mana Forge Chests to accomplished adventurers such as yourself until our quota is filled."
Arcanum Quota Officer tells you, "To fill that quota, I am prepared to offer you a rate of 10 shards for each key up to 5 times each week. Once I have filled my quota and the forges are working at maximum capacity you will need to talk to the other Mana-smiths to turn in shards for the remainder of the week."

location.name: Arcanum Quota Officer
location.description:
Quest(s): Mana Forge.
Arcanum Quota Officer tells you, "Welcome to the Mana Forge! I am the Arcanum Quota Officer for this Mana Forge."

Once I have filled my quota and the forges are working at maximum capacity you will need to talk to the other Mana-smiths to turn in shards for the remainder of the week."

location.name: Carenzi Race Announcer
location.description:
Quest(s): Carenzi Race Track.
Would the Carenzi racers take their posts please. The race is about to begin!.

location.name: Carenzi Race Bookie
location.description:
Quest(s): Carenzi Race Track.
Sells Carenzi Race Tickets for 5 MMD Notes.
Carenzi Race Bookie tells you, "I take 5 MMDs to buy a ticket. Bring winning tickets to me before the next race and I'll reward you with a Grand Casino Key".

location.name: Tamara du Cinghalle
location.description:
Quest(s): Plucker Of Eyes.
Tamara du Cinghalle tells you, "Greetings."
Tamara du Cinghalle tells you, "I have a task for you, if you are willing to aid us against the beast, T'thuun, who has been harrying the Deru Trees on Marae Lassel. The Tumeroks up on the Plateau have been in an uproar about this T'thuun since the first tentacles appeared."
Tamara du Cinghalle tells you, "Our researchers believe, if we can get one of the eyes from the largest tentacle by the Trees, that we can use it to find a long-term solution to this problem."
Tamara du Cinghalle tells you, "The challenge is, that unless the tentacles are weakened and the large tentacle is distracted, it's impossible to get an eye off of it."
Tamara du Cinghalle tells you, "Killing the smaller tentacles seems to distract the larger one. Killing 50 should be enough to get an eye off of the larger, eye covered one."
Tamara du Cinghalle tells you, "Bring me back an eye, and I'll reward you on behalf of my superiors and the Tumeroks on the Plateau".

location.name: Carenzi Race Track
location.description: Quest(s): Carenzi Race Track.

location.name: Deru Trees of Marae Lassel Plateau
location.description:
Quest(s): Eye of T'thuun Quest, Guardian of the Deru Trees of Marae Lassel.
The wind blows mournfully through the trees.

location.name: Aun Kimintari
location.description:
Quest(s): Guardian of the Deru Trees of Marae Lassel.
Aun Kimintari combines the Royal Olthoi Jelly and the Corrupted Mana Shard with a carved fetish that she pulls from a pouch. As she combines the items, she chants softly in a strange tongue and the Akiekie Fire flares up beside her.

location.name: Royal Scout (T'thuun's Marauders)
location.description:
Quest(s): T'thuun's Marauders.
Retired.

location.name: Asheron's Investigator
location.description:
Quest(s): T'thuun's Marauders.
Asheron's Investigator tells you, "My Master Asheron has been in discussions with your Queen about the Patriarch Raids. She sent Scouts out to collect the same stones the Patriarchs sent their minions to collect. Once we have enough of the stones to test we may be able to discern the Patriarch's reasons for collecting them."
Asheron's Investigator tells you, "Help the Royal Scouts collect the stones and then return to me."

location.name: Night Club Attendant
location.description:
Quest(s): Night Club.
Night Club Attendant tells you, "If you have a Night Club Ticket, give it to me and I will send you directly to the Night Club."
Only Available During The "Halloween" Patch.

location.name: Night Club Attendant
location.description:
Quest(s): Night Club.
Night Club Attendant tells you, "If you have a Night Club Ticket, give it to me and I will send you directly to the Night Club."
Only Available During The "Halloween" Patch.

location.name: Pumpkin Buffer
location.description:
Was originally located only in Glenden Wood, however, during the Dance of the Dead event, a Pumpkin Buffer can also be found in Sanamar, Holtburg, Shoushi, and Yaraq.
Only Available During The "Halloween" Patch.

location.name: Pumpkin Buffer
location.description:
Was originally located only in Glenden Wood, however, during the Dance of the Dead event, a Pumpkin Buffer can also be found in Sanamar, Holtburg, Shoushi, and Yaraq.
Only Available During The "Halloween" Patch.

location.description:
