Tirenia tells you, "These creatures cut off surface access to the vaults. You will have to enter the sewers beneath in order to break in. Access to the sewers can be found in an old temple at 77.2N, 33.0E. Be sure to take reinforcements with you. These beasts assaulted our vaults in great numbers."

location.name: Woodsman
location.description:
Woodsman tells you, "I have some treated wood that should burn extra hot for the winter."
Woodsman tells you, "The woods are really beautiful around here and the wood is of surpassing quality. Oh, you're leaving so soon? Ok then, stop by when you need more wood."
Woodsman tells you, "Wood, it's improving the quality of life in every way. Buy some wood."
Woodsman tells you, "Bet you could make something really nice from that."
Woodsman tells you, "Sorry I don't have anything bigger, but this should do."
Woodsman tells you, "Could I interest you in some firewood?"
Woodsman tells you, "Would you care to see any of my log furniture?"

location.name: Farmer Pogget's Farm
location.description:
A farmhouse and barn near Cragstone. where Farmer Pogget and a Roaming Bowyer reside.
In attic the farmhouse one of many different texts can spawn on the floor. These notes are the old clues for helping people complete the Sword of Lost Light Quest.

location.name: Donatello Linante
location.description:
Quest(s): Augmentation Gems.
Donatello Linante tells you, "I've had the opportunity to study with those who have studied with Asheron himself - and I have decided that Asheron's gifts should be available to all those who can master its power."
Donatello Linante tells you, "You may speak to the Fiun who calls itself Rehlyun in order to find out how to get a blank augmentation gem."
Use this gem and you will create another gem which will always be able to cast Asheron's Lesser Benediction.

location.name: Huntsman Of Silyun
location.description:
Quest(s): Chasing Oswald.
Huntsman of Silyun tells you, "You are new to Silyun, are you? If you are a skilled hunter, you may be of some use for me, in helping me track the most dangerous quarry of all: the assassin, Oswald! Of course, first you must prove your skill. Bring me the jaw of an Abhorrent, Ravenous, or Insatiable Eater, and we will talk of how you may help me."

location.name: Lucari di Bellenesse
location.description:
Quest(s): Sword of Bellenesse.
Lucari di Bellenesse tells you, "Greetings to you, friend."
Lucari di Bellenesse tells you, "I have heard reports that a sword has been stolen from the Vaults of Sanamar, and that the thief is hiding in a cave near 71.1 N, 50.2 W. If the reports are to be believed, the weapon is the very Sword of Bellenesse, lost in our coming to Dereth from Viamont."
Lucari di Bellenesse tells you, "We have not the resources to confirm this rumor, but, if you would be interested in checking out this rumor for Silyun, I can provide something in reward for this."
Lucari di Bellenesse tells you, "Go to the cave, find this thief. If he has the blade on him, and you'll know it if you see it, it is hard to miss, bring it to me. If this is truly the Sword of Bellenesse, all Silyun will be in your debt."
Lucari di Bellenesse tells you, "Be warned, agents of Varicci will also be seeking to return this blade to the Vaults of Sanamar. Also, I have heard rumor that someone in Yaraq also seeks the blade. The blade is the rightful property of the Duke Bellenesse. I hope, if you manage to find it before others do so, that you will return it to Silyun, so it may be returned to its rightful owner."

location.name: Portal Guardian
location.description:
Quest(s): Thrungus Hovels.
Portal Guardian tells you, "I am afraid that a warrior of your strength would not find the task I have very rewarding. I suggest you visit the barkeeper if you are looking for something to do."

location.name: Turien Di Furza
location.description:
Quest(s): Pets, Sword of Bellenesse.
Turien Di Furza tells you, "Greetings"
Turien Di Furza tells you, "I have been authorized to offer rewards to anyone who can return the blade that was stolen from the Vaults of Sanamar. The blade is gold in color, and bears the markings of the Bellenesse family."
Turien Di Furza tells you, "The craven thief was last sighted near a cave at 71.1 N, 50.2 W and is believed to be hiding within. Find the thief, do justice upon him, and return this blade that was wrongly taken from this Kingdom."
Turien Di Furza tells you, "Bring the blade to me, and your loyalty will be rewarded. Be warned, however. I have heard that both Silyun and some Bloodless in Yaraq also seek this blade. They must not be allowed to gain that which is rightfully Sanamar's."

location.name: Giordonni
location.description:
Quest(s): Loyalty Reset Quest.
Giordonni tells you, "Ha! Good try, friend. I can already see you have become a full member of the Whispering Blade. There are some archives that are beyond my reach. I cannot help you."

location.name: Arcanum Refurbisher (Sanamar)
location.description:
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "Greetings, I am an agent of the Sanamar Arcanum specializing in the refurbishment of broken and abused items."
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "Over the years, we find that the elements of this land are often unkind to a number of our prize possessions. The wind and rains erode statues, dampness causes the colors of our prized pack animals to change oddly, and even the magics of the world itself play havok with some of the more.. disturbing... of our decorations."
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "This parchment contains a list of items that we of the Arcanum know to be most severely affected by the climate of this world. Should you find that you are in possession of one of these damaged items, please bring it to me and I'll see what I can do about getting it fixed up for you."
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "While I have the utmost confidence in my ability to repair such things, I have been unable to capture the knack of retaining any personalizations. This means that my repairs will obliterate any inscriptions you, or someone you know, may have etched into the item."
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "If you have any sentimental attachment to those inscriptions, I would recommend that you refrain from using the service I offer."
Arcanum Refurbisher gives you Refurbisher's Tally.."

location.name: Seneschal Dalmour
location.description:
Quest(s): Fledgemaster's Tusk Quest.
Seneschal Dalmour tells you, "Due to the ever increasing encroachment of the Ruschk upon our lands and the unlawful poaching of the king's animals, the king has decreed that a bounty shall be awarded for every Fledgemaster's Tusk."
Seneschal Dalmour tells you, "You! It is your duty to help stave off the Ruschk."
Seneschal Dalmour tells you, "Go forth for king and country!"
Seneschal Dalmour tells you, "Ruschk camps have been spotted on the icy beaches north of here."
Seneschal Dalmour tells you, "Return when you have a Fledgemaster's Tusk and you shall be handsomely rewarded.".

location.name: Branwyn's House
location.description: A house on the road from Arwic to Eastham where Branwyn makes her home.

location.name: Font And Hung Corpse
location.description: A font with a pink gem surrounded by ring of flowers. A corpse hangs from a nearby tree. The fountain is normal and casts Revitalize Other I to restore stamina. The lore significance of this location is unknown.

location.name: Mountain Shortcut House
location.description: A lone, abandoned house with a frequently used portal nearby.

location.name: Shallows Pillars
location.description: 4 large stone pillars and some submerged rocks.
location.monsters: Shallows Shark, Slayer

location.name: Armoredillo Rocks (1)
location.description: Some submerged rocks and a submerged junk loot chest (unlocked).
location.monsters: Shore Armoredillo

location.name: Armoredillo Rocks (2)
location.description: A couple piles of bones.
location.monsters: Shore Armoredillo

location.name: Armoredillo Rocks (3)
location.description: Some submerged rocks.
location.monsters: Shore Armoredillo

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Arwic)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Barkeep Lienne
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Barkeep Lienne tells you, "We're back and doing better than ever. I knew that all would end well and thanks to the High Queen things are back to normal. What can I get for you?"
Barkeep Lienne tells you, "Things couldn't be better. Have yourself a wonderful day."

location.name: Barkeep Mae Lilidag
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Barkeep Mae Lilidag tells you, "Now I know that I have been saying that business was not bad before, and that depression leads people to the tavern. But I must admit that celebration is another great cause for merriment. Thanks be to the High Queen for this gift of a new Arwic!"
Barkeep Mae Lilidag tells you, "No more shadows here. I even hear that Nuhmudira is going to build a school here soon."

location.name: Belthew Shearstone the Jeweler
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Belthew Shearstone the Jeweler tells you, "Bigger and better! Brighter and wider! A relief I say to have such a fine business and such a fine town. High Queen Elysa be praised!"
Belthew Shearstone the Jeweler tells you, "Enjoy the days, the nights and moments in between, the winter snows may blow and howl but in springtime leaves are green. Hee hee! Have a glorious day!"

location.name: Carsith the Weaponsmith
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Carsith the Weaponsmith tells you, "The work was arduous and the wait was long, but we are finally home. Now what can I do for you?"
Carsith the Weaponsmith tells you, "Though my melancholy has yet to leave me completely, I wish you well in your endeavors."

location.name: Cateril Carsmad the Armorer
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Cateril Carsmad the Armorer tells you, "Ketnan is gone and we have Arwic anew, what could possibly be better?"
Cateril Carsmad the Armorer tells you, "May your days be filled with peace."

location.name: Davis the Tailor
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Davis the Tailor tells you, "It's good to be back, that's for sure. But I wonder why the golems moved underground?"
Davis the Tailor tells you, "With all of this business I'll be pressed to keep up with such high quality goods."
Davis the Tailor tells you, "It's nice to be able to afford such a lot again."
Davis the Tailor tells you, "Farewell my friend."

location.name: Grocer Rodega Tyning
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Grocer Rodega Tyning tells you, "Still open only now in a much better place. It's so good to be home. Would you like some cheese?"
Grocer Rodega Tyning tells you, "Have a wonderful day."

location.name: Guard Audrey
location.description:
Quest(s): Soul Stone Quest.
Guard Audrey tells you, "We still need to collect more soul gems to craft into the Noble Weapons. You'll need to get a small bit of information from Nuhmudira's cottage located near Uziz on the rim of the A'mun desert. The location is near twenty-one south and twenty-two east by your compass.
Apparently something in the book makes you aware of how to use her teleportation device. Once that is complete you can make your way to the island that she found. We have reports that Nuhmudira has moved on and left a student in her place, hopefully she will perform the same deeds as her mentor."

location.name: Harald the Fletcher
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Harald the Fletcher tells you, "I'm still not sure about all this. But the High Queen says its safe here and Nuhmudira supposedly thinks well enough of the area to build a school someday. Maybe then it's safe. But I intend to watch my back, you should as well."
Harald the Fletcher tells you, "Keep an arrow nocked, better prepared than sorry."

location.name: Jacob Durastan
location.description:
Quest(s): Jacob's Axe.
Jacob Durstan tells you, "Hail, friend!"
Jacob Durstan tells you, "You look like a hunter on the prowl. If you are in search of adventure, I bid you listen to my tale."
Jacob Durstan tells you, "There is a fort east of here that has been overrun with skeletons. Nasty suckers, those skeletons, and I ought to know. I was contracted by an emissary of the Queen to clear the skeletons out of the fort, and was doing pretty well, too, until I was set upon by a Bone Knight! I slammed my axe into his head, which should have been the end of him. But the axe stuck! So now the foul beast is running around with my axe embedded in his skull!"
Jacob Durstan tells you, "I tried to get it back, but with no weapon, the skels made short work of me. And so here I am at the lifestone again. If you could spare a moment to retrieve my axe, I would be most indebted to you. You can find the fort at 32.5N 66.1E."
Jacob Durstan tells you, "Good luck to you!"

location.name: Laqisha the Scribe
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Laqisha the Scribe tells you, "New walls and floors don't change much. Let us get on with why you are here so I can get back to what I was doing."
Laqisha the Scribe tells you, "Now, please leave."

location.name: Magus Guthima the Wise
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Magus Guthima the Wise tells you, "Hrmph! Once again this den of thieves creeps back in. I thought I was rid of them, and their conniving ways. Just as Ketnan goes and wanders off the rest of the creeps return to make my life miserable. Be quick about your purchases you. I'm not in the best of moods today."
Magus Guthima the Wise tells you, "If you intend on making your way through town you'll be best served by holding your packs closed. Greedy minds and wandering hands have a tendency to lighten purses in hives like this."

location.name: Pevilo ibn Djimin
location.description:
Quest(s): Hero Tokens.
Pevilo ibn Djimin tells you, "Welcome Traveler! I have many wondrous items from the farthest shores and deepest dungeons. Only the best for my patrons. All I require is proof of your heroic deeds. Do you have any Hero Tokens?"
Pevilo ibn Djimin tells you, "Return with more stories of your adventures my friend. I am sure to have more fantastic items in the future."
Doom Hammer Summoning Gem Burning Bow Summoning Gem Assassin's Crossbow Summoning Gem Assassin's Dagger Summoning Gem Club of Undead Bashing Summoning Gem Chorizite Staff Summoning Gem Bloodletter Summoning Gem Commoner's Sword Summoning Gem Lord's Sword Summoning Gem Throwing Daggers of Ice Summoning Gem Vampire's Kiss Summoning Gem Ice Wand Summoning Gem Boxed Mana Forge Key
Cost: 1 Hero Token.

location.name: Scrivener of Creature Magic (Arwic)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV Spells.
Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Scrivener of Item Magic (Arwic)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV Spells.
Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Scrivener of Life Magic (Arwic)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV Spells.
Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Scrivener of War Magic (Arwic)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV Spells.
Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Shopkeep Miranda
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%. White Containers.
Shopkeep Mirinda tells you, "Arwic will soon be back to how it once was."
Shopkeep Mirinda tells you, "High Queen Elysa has performed a wonderful service to us all."

location.name: Translator Aun Laokhe
location.description:
Quest(s): Blackmire Lore, Carved Gemstone Lockpick, King Toad Idol.
Translator Aun Laokhe tells you, "Hail budhi, I come from the council chambers of Ispar Elysatah with a request. She bids that willing souls investigate the origin of the dark magics that spread across Osteth and Palenqual. She has heard that new anima have spread from the place where the kah took place. Should you find anything of note, I would like to see it. I will be calling on the keh of the Nuuani for aid to understand the things you find. Ispar Elysatah wishes to reach a peaceful accord with this new Xuta."
Translator Aun Laokhe tells you, "Should you find any odd writing that the other translators cannot decipher, perhaps the keh of the Nuuani will help decipher those as well."

location.name: Tumerok Priest
location.description:
Quest(s): Overlord's Sword.
Tumerok Priest that carries the Tumerok Priest Key.

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Dryreach)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Binthura the Beggar
location.description:
Quest(s): Gold Hill Ruins.
Binthura the Beggar tells you, "I don't want to beg, but I need money to buy food with."
You give Binthura the Beggar Large Golden Coin.
Binthura the Beggar tells you, "Thank you stranger! I can get a good meal and a hot bath with this!"
The snake sighs and uncoils from the coin.
"You have lifted the curse. Finally, I may rest." The small snake coils in on itself biting its tail.
Binthura the Beggar gives you Serpent Ring.
Binthura the Beggar tells you, "Here, a small token of my gratitude."
Binthura the Beggar gives you Philanthropist Title Token.

location.name: Dinsmal the Beggar
location.description:
Quest(s): Gold Hill Ruins.
Dinsmal the Beggar tells you, "Will you help the poor with some money?"

location.name: Gorak
location.description:
Quest(s): K'rank's Errands.
Gorak tells you, "We've been stationed here to maintain the tenuous peace. We're simply here reinforcing these walls and providing a strong show of support for you and your people. But you and I know, we're warriors. If these Tumeroks ever got organized they could tear these walls down and slaughter all these folk before we could defeat them all. I'm hopeful though that our wayward brothers will find their way back to the right path. If they don't and they press these walls, you can be sure that my men and I will spill much blood, ours and theirs, before this town will fall. Of course, I could spill a lot more if I had remembered to pick up my axe before reporting to my post."

location.name: Journeyman Alchemist (Dryreach)
location.description:
Quest(s): Crafter.
Journeyman Alchemist tells you, "Greetings! I have left my master in Glenden Wood to help the craftsmen of this fine land to hone their crafting skills"
Journeyman Alchemist tells you, "Prove your knowledge by bringing me an Iron Lodestone, and I shall reward you."
ourneyman Alchemist tells you, "What, you say you don't know how to make an Iron Lodestone?! Why, that is what tests of knowledge are for! Get out there and experiment, my young friend!"

location.name: Master Scrivener of Creature Magic (Dryreach)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level V Spells.
Master Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Master Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Master Scrivener of Item Magic (Dryreach)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level V Spells.
Master Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Master Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Master Scrivener of Life Magic (Dryreach)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level V Spells.
Master Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Master Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Master Scrivener of War Magic (Dryreach)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level V Spells.
Master Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Master Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Orcud the Beggar
location.description:
Quest(s): Gold Hill Ruins.
Orcud the Beggar tells you, "Could you spare me some money so I can buy food for my family?"

location.name: Royal Guard Tabbeth
location.description:
Quest(s): ???.
Royal Guard Tabbeth tells you, "Reports of a new temple in the eastern direlands have been filtering in slowly. It seems that the renegades have offered to help the burun discover any remaining hidden temples. If what we have received holds true, the relationship between the two forces is fragile at best."
Royal Guard Tabbeth tells you, "This might be a good opportunity to stall their diplomatic efforts. If you could discover the location of this temple and hinder the renegade effort, perhaps we might just be able to fracture their alliance."
Royal Guard Tabbeth tells you, "I can't help but worry. We sent a group of scholars and miners to that same region of the direlands. We have not received correspondence from them in over a fortnight. If you could bring back information on their whereabouts, I would appreciate it."
Royal Guard Tabbeth tells you, "I hope the best for them, but I will not discount that the worst could have befallen them."

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: News and Trash Can.

location.name: Mudlurk Tower
location.description: A tower populated by Mosswarts. No special items are found here.
location.monsters: Mudlurk Mosswarts

location.name: Abandoned House
location.description: Abandoned House with 2 Locked Chests.

location.name: Archmage's House
location.description: House with an Archmage and 2 Chests.

location.name: Abandoned Village
location.description: Abandoned Village.

location.name: Direland Rat Cave
location.description: A cave near Fort Tethana with 4 Direland Rats and a Pyreal Golem spawn point just behind it..

location.name: Merciless Monogua Cave
location.description: Cave with 6 Merciless Monougas (1 on top). 4 Insidious Monouga spawn around the cave and various other creatures including Grievver and Olthoi also spawn nearby.

location.name: Renegade Encampment
location.description:
Main base for the Renegade forces that are attacking Fort Tethana. The Renegade leaders Renegade Commander Kianar, Renegade Commander Walanawa and General Garsh are stationed here and drop the Renegade Bow, Tumerok Hunting Brace and the Quadruple-bladed Axe respectively.
They are also attempting to tunnel beneath Fort Tethana's fortifications nearby inside the Renegade Incursion.

location.name: Viamontian Camp
location.description: Camp that is part of the Fort Tethana Tug of War quest. There is a chest here on a 7 day timer. Tethana's Response and Fort Tethana Portal Gem can be found on the Viamontian Man-at-Arms near the chest.

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Fort Tethana)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Fort Tethana Sentry
location.description:
Opens The Main Gate.
Fort Tethana Sentry tells you, "You may pass through the gate."
Fort Tethana Sentry says, "Quickly, step inside the gates before the encampment is roused to strike out against us."

location.name: Lieutenant Durgan
location.description:
Quest(s): The Dark Spiral.
Lieutenant Durgan tells you, "Greetings, friend. Though we do not claim independence...yet...we still must look after our own concerns, since Elysa Strathelar won't. At times, we look to outsiders for aid. Are you willing to be that aid we seek?"
The lieutenant shrugs his shoulders.
Lieutenant Durgan tells you, "I am Commander Margyle's intelligence chief, and I have a very vexing problem. It seems that Elysa sent her army in our direction, no doubt to put us directly under her heel again. A Viamontian force also made passage from Marae Lassel, and all projections indicated that they would fight each other north of here, near the coast."
Lieutenant Durgan tells you, "No matter who won, we would have gained an advantage. But what I find odd is this..."
Lieutenant Durgan tells you, "There was also word of a Renegade Tumerok band mobilizing to engage the other two forces. The three armies apparently encamped and parlayed, but there is no word from any of the forces after that. No army can keep themselves so hidden, especially not on our territory."
Lieutenant Durgan tells you, "I want to know what happened to those three armies, and I will reward you to tell me. If you are truly helpful, I may discuss what the future holds for beloved Tethana."

location.name: Soldier (Fort Tethana)
location.description:
Quest(s): Fort Tethana Tug of War.
Soldier tells you, "You seek Commander Kurth? He has been gone for some time. You'll want to speak with Lieutenant Commander Margyle. The Renegades are tunneling beneath the fort. There's a force of men down below to deal with the creatures before they can break through the earth. You can find the entrance to the pit just southwest of here. It's still on the plateau, though."

location.name: Town Crier (Fort Tethana)
location.description: News and Trash.

location.name: Tumerok Collector (Fort Tethana)
location.description:
A collector that specializes only in Tumerok Insignias.
Tumerok Collector tells you, "I am a collector of the golden insignia that can be found with the tumeroks. Bring them to me as proof of your battles against them, and I will reward you."
Gold Tumerok Insignia - 500xp - 1000py.

location.name: Xsao Lann
location.description:
Quest(s): Darling's Collar Quest.
Xsao Lann tells you, "Have you seen my pet? I was walking around 4.6N 89.5W when she disappeared."
Xsao Lann tells you, "Her name is Darling and I would be ever so grateful if you could bring her home to me."
Xsao Lann starts to break down in tears.
Xsao Lann tells you, "*sniff*"
Xsao Lann tells you, "I miss my Darling so much. Please hurry and find her.".

location.name: Shopkeeper Yoshi Deshi
location.description:
Sells at 180%, buys at 80%.
Shopkeeper Yoshi Deshi tells you, "I was afraid we wouldn't get any business way out here, so glad you could come by. The more, the merrier."
Shopkeeper Yoshi Deshi tells you, "Thank you. Fort Tethana thanks you. Tethana would thank you herelf, but she's passed on. That's a joke."
Shopkeeper Yoshi Deshi tells you, "Be careful out there, now; this isn't the safest neighborhood! Hah!"
Shopkeeper Yoshi Deshi tells you, "I buy and sell all sorts of things; you might call me a jack of all trades. Thanks for your business!"

location.name: Road Block (East)
location.description:
Quest(s): Glendon Wood Invaders.
A number of Eaters and Viamontian Knights on a very fast respawn, blocking the road E from Glenden Wood.
The Blockade itself holds the Blockade Guards, for the second part of the Killtask of Glenden Wood Invaders.
The area immediately surrounding it holds the Eaters and Viamontian Knights counting towards the Invader Kill Task (Glenden Wood Invaders).

location.name: Road Block (West)
location.description:
Quest(s): Glendon Wood Invaders.
A number of Eaters and Viamontian Knights on a very fast respawn, blocking the road W from Glenden Wood.
The Blockade itself holds the Blockade Guards, for the second part of the Killtask of Glenden Wood Invaders.
The area immediately surrounding it holds the Eaters and Viamontian Knights counting towards the Invader Kill Task (Glenden Wood Invaders).

location.name: Road Block (North)
location.description:
Quest(s): Glendon Wood Invaders.
A number of Eaters and Viamontian Knights on a very fast respawn, blocking the road N from Glenden Wood.
The Blockade itself holds the Blockade Guards, for the second part of the Killtask of Glenden Wood Invaders.
The area immediately surrounding it holds the Eaters and Viamontian Knights counting towards the Invader Kill Task (Glenden Wood Invaders).

location.name: Sword of Frozen Fury on a Dais
location.description:
Quest(s): Sword Of Frozen Fury.
The Sword of Frozen Fury resting On a Dais.

location.name: Windmill
location.description: Just A Windmill.

location.name: Glenden Wood Lifestone (South)
location.description: Lifestone South Of Town.

location.restrictions: 100+, Cannot Tie/Recall/Summon, Quest Flag: Tomo Genza
location.name: Viamont Staging Portal (Mid)
location.description:
Quest(s): Viamont Staging Area.
To enter the dungeon, first speak to Tomo Genza in Glenden Wood at 29.7N 27.2E. Kill the three pillars by the portal to activate the portal for a brief period. This flags all people in the fellowship to enter.
location.monsters: Viamontian, Eaters

location.restrictions: 80+, Cannot Tie/Recall/Summon, Quest Flag: Tomo Genza
location.name: Viamont Staging Portal (Low)
location.description:
Quest(s): Viamont Staging Area.
To enter the dungeon, first speak to Tomo Genza in Glenden Wood at 29.7N 27.2E. Kill the three pillars by the portal to activate the portal for a brief period. This flags all people in the fellowship to enter.
location.monsters: Viamontian, Eaters

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Glenden Wood)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Apprentice Cook (Glenden Wood)
location.description:
Quest(s): Crafter.
Apprentice Cook tells you, "Hello! My master, Copper Vanurp, has charged me with the mission to encourage the people of Dereth to cultivate their crafting skills.
Apprentice Cook tells you, "If you bring me some Hot Kimchi, I will award you with the funds to further your crafting studies."

location.name: Boyyer Brondig
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Bowyer Brondig tells you, "You needn't go to Peldin. My prices are better!"

location.name: Collector (Glenden Wood)
location.description: Collector tells you, "I'm interested in monster trophies from many of the monsters that plague Dereth. If you give me such items, I will reward you with money or an item. With regret, I don't deal in hides."

location.name: Singud Trell the Archmage
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Singud Trell the Archmage tells you, "I'm glad to be sleeping in a real bed again. It was exciting blasting those Eater creatures, but I prefer Glenden Wood to be the sleepy town in the woods it's always been."
Singud Trell the Archmage tells you, "Thank you for your business. You may want to talk to Tomo Genza in the Blacksmith's Shop. She received some information from the Royal Guard that may allow us to strike back at Varicci's forces."

location.name: Weaponsmith Omaro Nagate
location.description:
Quest(s): Sword of Frozen Fury.
Weaponsmith Omaro Nagate tells you, "Hello. I have some skills with modifying weapons, though I am still learning the craft."

location.name: Captain Anrayl
location.description:
Quest(s): Viamont Staging Area (High).
Captain Anyayl tells you, "We know of three Viamont Portal Platforms in the woods outside of town. I want you to investigate the North East Portal Platform and if possible put it out of commission. Do whatever it takes to prevent the Viamonts from reinforcing their foothold in Glenden Woods."
Captain Anrayl tells you, "I wouldn't advise going on this mission alone though. Find others skilled soldiers to accompany you. Have them talk to me before you leave so I know who is in the field. When your done report back to me."
Captain Anrayl tells you, "You will find the Portal Platform at 27.2N 27.9E"

location.name: Captain Sovano
location.description:
Quest(s): Viamont Staging Area (Mid).
Captain Sovano tells you, "We know of three Viamont Portal Platforms in the woods outside of town. I want you to investigate the North West Portal Platform and if possible put it out of commission. Do whatever it takes to prevent the Viamonts from reinforcing their foothold in Glenden Woods."
Captain Sovano tells you, "I wouldn't advise going on this mission alone though. Find others skilled soldiers to accompany you. Have them talk to me before you leave so I know who is in the field. When your done report back to me."
Captain Sovano tells you, "You will find the Portal Platform at 31.4N 25.8E"

location.name: Arsitha Trell the Grocer
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Arsitha Trell the Grocer tells you, "We are open again for business. Please let me know if you need anything."
Arsitha Trell the Grocer tells you, "That poor, poor man. I have heard that you can pay your respects to Antius in Yanshi. They have been busy rebuilding their town. Thank goodness our town wasn't as badly damaged as Old Yanshi was."

location.name: A Well
location.description:
Just A Well.
Use an empty flask on the fountain to fill it with water.
Casts the following spells: Revitalize Other I.

location.name: Lytelthorpe Keep
location.description: Lytelthorpe Keep.

location.name: William Witty's House
location.description: William Witty's House.

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Lytelthorpe)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Apprentice Cook (Lytelthorpe)
location.description:
Quest(s): Crafter.
Apprentice Cook tells you, "Hello! My master in Glenden Wood, Copper Vanurp, has sent me out into the world to participate in the great Mission - encouraging the young people of Dereth to embrace a life of artistry!"
Apprentice Cook tells you, "If you bring me an example of your craftsmanship - say, a bowl of Chicken Noodle - I will reward you with a token of encouragement."
The apprentice coughs quietly.
Apprentice Cook tells you, "Um, we're not rich yet, though, so I'm afraid I can only reward you once a week."

location.name: Beltslora
location.description:
Quest(s): Beltslora's Pretty Shirt, Lost Distillery.
Beltslora tells you, "Many of us used to live in the caves to the north because this area was full of nasty creatures. But we drove them out and built Lytelthorpe here."
Beltslora tells you, "Now the monsters have retreated into the caves where we once lived. Unfortunately, I accidentally left my favorite shirt there. Maybe you could get it for me."
Beltslora tells you, "To get to the cave we lived in, follow the line of apple trees directly north of here. Be careful if you go there, and follow the line of candles."

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of Creature Magic (Lytelthorpe)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III Spells.
Journeyman Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic (Lytelthorpe)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III Spells.
Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of Life Magic (Lytelthorpe)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III Spells.
Journeyman Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of War Magic (Lytelthorpe)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III Spells.
Journeyman Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Lord Aleval
location.description:
Quest(s): Beltslora's Pretty Shirt, Lost Distillery, Ercel's Lost Book, Lytelthorpe Starter Quests, Exploration Society Letters.
Lord Aleval tells you, "I have been contracted by the Dereth Exploration Society to help them in their outreach program towards the Isparians who find themselves newly exiled in Dereth. Here is a book that explains their mission. I am also giving you a list describing the locations of the nearest stamp and portals to other towns. If you collect any of the Society's stamped letters, you may bring them back to me for a reward."

location.name: Journeyman Fletcher (Plateau Village)
location.description:
Quest(s): Crafter.
Journeyman Fletcher tells you, "Greetings! I have left my master in Glenden Wood to help the craftsmen of this fine land to hone their crafting skills"
Journeyman Fletcher tells you, "Prove your knowledge by bringing me a Hollow Quarrelshaft, and I shall reward you."
Journeyman Fletcher tells you, "What, you say you don't know how to make a Hollow Quarrelshaft?! Why, that is what tests of knowledge are for! Get out there and experiment, my young friend!"

location.name: Jun Sawashima
location.description:
Quest(s): Zaikhal Defender.
Jun Sawashima tells you, "The Viamontian assault on Zaikhal was successfully repelled. However, their fortresses remain. We must continue to assault their strongholds in order to keep them off our lands. My associate, Ardry the Dubious, has scouted out the Viamontians' defenses. Here are his notes."
Jun Sawashima gives you Viamontian Reconnaissance.
Jun Sawashima tells you, "Please go to Zaikhal and show those dogs the might of our Queen!"

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Plateau Village)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Grand Sentinel Tretia
location.description:
Quest(s): Wedding Trials.
Grand Sentinel Tretia tells you, "To begin the marriage ceremony, you must first hand me the Symbol of Marriage. If you are in search of the Symbol, a series of tests await you near Arwic."

location.name: Brentsella
location.description:
Quest(s): The Old Warehouse.
Brentsella tells you, "I used to try to live in a place called the Old Warehouse, a dungeon overrun with monsters now. It's on the hill to the north, toward town. If you go in, you can keep any treasure you find."

location.name: Mindorla
location.description:
Quest(s): Mindorla's Letter.
Mindorla gives you Letter to Celcynd. Mindorla tells you, "Have you been to Rithwic yet? I'd like you to take this letter to Celcynd. He will pay you for it."

location.name: Martine's Study
location.description:
Excerpted From:
Repercussions
by Brent Schmidt Turbine Entertainment Software
Dereth: Leafdawning PY 13 / Earth: July 2002
Deeper in the town, the adventurers found Martine. Attempts to speak to him were met with dead silence, but two of his most loyal vassals stood at his side, providing details on how Martine might be healed. One claimed that reminding him of his lost wife and home would help him shake off his stupor, while the other claimed that only by calling to his mind the power and strength given to him by the Virindi could he be awakened. In searching the town, the newcomers found two chambers, Martine's studies. One study seemed to be an expression of Martine's humanity, and on a desk in this study a letter to his wife was found. The other study appeared to be an expression of his Virindi side, a twisted room filled with the objects of Martine's hate. On the floor in this study, adventurers found a folded Tusker husk, the remnants of the first Tusker Martine had killed using his Virindi-enhanced magic. The newcomers found themselves with a choice, to remind Martine of his past on Ispar, or of his past on Dereth
Letter For Melanay:
Melanay,
Every night I'm convinced I will wake up next to you, that all of this has been a dream. It's easier at night. As I look up at the two moons overhead, how can this be anything but a dream? The two moons are only the beginning of the strangeness.
The mornings...the mornings are cruel, Melanay. How many blessed dawns did I share with you and Aritta? It was our time, a time before the work of a day made me tired and quiet
Hall Of Statues:
Hollow Minion Paradox Olthoi Tumerok Asheron Reldain (With Swords and Throwing Stars stuck in him) Tusker Virindi Mosswart
Within Martine's Retreat.

location.name: Subterranean Farm
location.description:
Quest(s): Sunstone and Opal Gauntlets.
Big spawns of different types of critters are scattered throughout this dungeon.
Within Martine's Retreat.
location.monsters: Olthoi Grub, Servant, Gold, Jungle Phyntos Wasp, Brown Rabbit, Silver Rat, Harker, Subtle Simulacrum

location.name: Martine's Throne Room
location.description:
Quest(s): Sunstone and Opal Gauntlets.
NPCs:
Ambrosia Roe Hibdin Velos
Portals:
Portal To Martine's Retreat Portal To Rithwic
Within Martine's Retreat.

location.name: Crystal Shrine
location.description:
A triple arch with a blue crystal in the middle with three small statues around it.
There are no creatures or anything else associated with this point of interest.

location.name: Kai Mallan
location.description:
Quest(s): Gelidite Library, The Callous Heart.
Kai Mallan, Sho Enchanter says, "Sacrificing Isparians -- for any cause! -- is evil!"
Kai Mallan, Sho Enchanter says, "Damned be the monster."
Kai Mallan, Sho Enchanter tells you, "How did you come to me? You have overstayed your welcome here. Return to your precious cities! My master cares not for those that will let her evil go unpunished."
location.monsters: Flamma, Shiver

location.name: Dojiro Sangi
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Prodigal Human.
Dojiro Sangi tells you, "Help... me..."
Dojiro Sangi tells you, "They're turning me into some kind of monster! I hear... voices... inside my head... telling me to... Enighten? everyone? I don't... understand..."
Dojiro Sangi tells you, "You need, to stop this... for me... I can't... become... this thing."
Dojiro Sangi's eyes come into focus on you, and a look of wild desperation fills his ruined face, beneath the mask.
Dojiro Sangi tells you, "The potion they use on me! It's supposed to be dangerous, if not given slowly! Give it to me! Give me the Bottle! Help me ruin what they are doing to me!!"
Dojiro Sangi's voice changes, taking on a calm, almost metallic quality.
Dojiro Sangi tells you, "You will not harm my Prodigal Child. He is your salvation, your race's chance at Enlightenment. He is one of my beloved vessels, our Future! Leave him be, it is only the pains of rebirth that he feels. He will unify us all!"

location.name: Hidden Dungeon
location.description:
Quest(s): Thorsten Cragstone's Armor and Axe.
Within Underground City.
location.monsters: Sandstone, Copper, Iron, Granite, Obsidian Golem, Lich, Lich Lord

location.name: Abandoned Sho Building
location.description: An abandoned Sho building overrun with mosswarts and drudges. There are two unlocked low quality loot chests inside.

location.name: Abandoned Sho Buildings
location.description: Two abandoned Sho buildings just south of the Shoushi west outpost, and west of the home of Nen Ai. Behind the two houses is an empty bunker, the former location of the Stone Cathedral.

location.name: Advocate Ruins
location.description: These ruins were the secret training grounds and headquarters for Strathelar's Order of Advocates. With the disbanding of the order the dungeon has been removed, but the ruins and lifestone remain.

location.name: Achmage's Tower
location.description: An archmage living in a lone tower in the plains north of Hebian-To. Nearby is Fort Aimaru.

location.name: Castle of Baron Nuvillus
location.description:
Quest(s): Flags, Crown of Bone Quest.
An Empyrean castle Northeast of Shoushi ruled by Baron Nuvillus. The Baron drops the Crown of Bone. The Spinning Wheel is located here. There are many loot chests, including an unlocked Runed Chest.

location.name: Dock
location.description: A wooden dock on the River Prosper near Shoushi in disrepair. Near the Dock is a single cow, and beyond that, small house where a merchant lives.

location.name: Drudge Camp
location.description:
Quest(s): Bleeargh's Gratitude.
A riverside drudge camp. One of the drudge Prowlers 6 Musty Keys which open the Mosswart Chest at the camp. The chest contains 1 Spear of Kreerg.

location.name: Farmer's Herd
location.description: A herd of cows belonging to the nearby Farmer, found next to the road from Shoushi to Baishi.

location.name: Fycheck Outpost
location.description: An abandoned Sho outpost. It was long unoccupied, until renegade Gotrok Lugians took it over. There was a lifestone in the outpost, but when the lugians took over, the lifestone was destroyed or relocated, and there is now one to the north. There is a portal to Eastham at the eastern end of the outpost. The lugians guard a Runed Chest (resistance: 200). Inside one of the buildings, the lugians established a Renegade Stronghold.

location.name: Fycheck Ruins
location.description: A large Empyrean ruin site with wisps, rats, zefirs, and undead. There is an unlocked runed chest in the middle bunker. The ruins are made up of two Empyrean Stone Bunkers, a Meeting Hall Style Building, three Empyrean Statues, numerous Empyrean Pillars, and an Empyrean Stone Tower.

location.name: Healer's House
location.description: The home of a female Sho Healer. Her home is just north of the point where Sho Roadside portals lead to.

location.name: Hilltop Golems
location.description: Several golems always gather around this location southeast of the Fycheck Ruins.
location.monsters: Limestone Golem

location.name: Merchant's House
location.description: A merchant's home north of Shoushi, along the river. Inside you may find some cheese, and outside six apples. There is also a cistern here. Closer to the river is a cow and a broken dock.

location.name: Monster Camp
location.description:
Quest(s): Monster Training Camps.
A meeting of two banderlings and a drudge at the pine tree square just south of Shoushi. Generic Rumors can be found here.

location.name: Mosswart Bunker
location.description: A bunker full of Mosswarts. There is an unlocked runed chest here. You can access the areas behind the hidden doorways, which the mosswarts seem to not know about, as none are found behind them. Nearby is a peddler's house.

location.name: Mosswart Camp
location.description:
Quest(s): Ice Tachi.
A group of mosswarts have set up camp among these Empyrean ruins near the Green Mire Grave, which stretch north to the Dungeon Muddy. The mosswarts have left a few fish which they caught lying in the mud. One of the locations of the Mosswart Mucker, which drops the Ice Tachi.

location.name: Mosswart Platform
location.description: An Empyrean Platform where a tribe of mosswarts have set up camp. There is an unlocked runed chest here.

location.name: Mud Golem Gathering
location.description: Four mud golems gather around an Empyrean Standing Stone here. Two bags of Mugwort appear on the ground.
location.monsters: Mud Golem

location.name: Peddler's House
location.description: The home of a female Sho peddler. There is a lifestone outside. Generic rumors such as An Old Note spawn on the second floor of this mostly empty house. There is a bunker nearby with many mosswarts inside.

location.name: Toppled Stone Head
location.description: A toppled Empyrean Stone Head sunken in the river near Shoushi. The stone head gazes north by northwest, towards the Green Mire Grave. Three reedsharks lurk in the water.

location.name: River Crossing
location.description: A single row of Empyrean Columns stretching SW-NE across the river near Shoushi. Two armoredillos lurk in the water.

location.name: Screened Shrine
location.description: A quite place to meditate just outside Shoushi. There is a floor pillow with two screens on either side of it. Some apples can be found around the shrine, along with generic Rumors.

location.name: Sho Roadside
location.description: The destination of all Sho Roadside Portals. A peddler has established a shop here, and keeps a pet white rat.

location.name: Shreth Gathering
location.description: A gathering of Shreth on top of the hills outside Shoushi.
location.monsters: Blood Shreth

location.name: Undead Encampment
location.description: A group of Undead, presumably Sho, who reside at an abandoned Sho location. There are two Sho style walls opposite each other, a font, and a low table with floor pillows around it. Some low quality loot spawns around the table.

location.name: Renegade Stronghold (Shoushi)
location.description:
Quest(s): Chorizite Veined Shield.
On a table inside you can find a Strong Iron Key that opens the chest at 31.3S 58.9E which contains the Chorizite Veined Shield.

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Shoushi)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Apprentice Alchemist (Shoushi)
location.description:
Quest(s): Crafter.
Apprentice Alchemist tells you, "Hello! My master in Glenden Wood, Tiffany Comfore, has sent me out into the world to participate in the great Mission - encouraging the young people of Dereth to embrace a life of artistry!"
Apprentice Alchemist tells you, "If you bring me an example of your craftsmanship - say, an Acid Infusion - I will reward you with a token of encouragement."
The apprentice coughs quietly.
Apprentice Alchemist tells you, "Um, we're not rich yet, though, so I'm afraid I can only reward you once a week."

location.name: Apprentice Scrivener of Item and War Magic (Shoushi)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level I (1st Floor), Level II (2nd Floor).
Apprentice Scrivener of Item and War Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?" Apprentice Scrivener of Item and War Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Arcanum Refurbisher (Shoushi)
location.description:
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "Greetings, I am an agent of the Shoushi Arcanum specializing in the refurbishment of broken and abused items."
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "Over the years, we find that the elements of this land are often unkind to a number of our prize possessions. The wind and rains erode statues, dampness causes the colors of our prized pack animals to change oddly, and even the magics of the world itself play havok with some of the more.. disturbing... of our decorations."
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "This parchment contains a list of items that we of the Arcanum know to be most severely affected by the climate of this world. Should you find that you are in possession of one of these damaged items, please bring it to me and I'll see what I can do about getting it fixed up for you."
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "While I have the utmost confidence in my ability to repair such things, I have been unable to capture the knack of retaining any personalizations. This means that my repairs will obliterate any inscriptions you, or someone you know, may have etched into the item."
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "If you have any sentimental attachment to those inscriptions, I would recommend that you refrain from using the service I offer."
Arcanum Refurbisher gives you Refurbisher's Tally.."

location.name: Gonjuku Den
location.description:
Quest(s): Trade Alliance Quest.
Gonjoku Den tells you, "Gentle is the breeze that passes through these trees."
Gonjoku Den tells you, "Please excuse the ramblings of an old fool."
Gonjoku Den turns away to listen to the wind.

location.name: Haya Su Ka
location.description:
Quest(s): Gambling.
Haya Su Ka tells you, "Welcome to Gan-Zo's Den of Iniquity. Would you care for a drink? Or do you need to see our rule sheet, or buy some gambling tokens?"

location.name: Mi Gan-Zo
location.description:
Quest(s): Gambling.
Mi Gan-Zo tells you, "Welcome to my house of chance, now in a much more propitious location! Will the Great Lady of Chance and Possibility favor you? Haya Su Ka sells our rulebook and gambling tokens. My Gamemasters will happily assist you in your quest to gamble tokens. If you wish to risk one of your precious Pack Monsters, gamble with me, if you feel lucky."

location.name: Nen Ai
location.description:
Quest(s): Nen Ai's Pet Drudge.
Nen Ai tells you, "I have tended this drudge since it was very young, and he is my friend. But he is still very weak."
Nen Ai tells you, "There are two foods that he particularly likes and which help him grow strong. These are perfectly aged Greenmire Cider, and perfectly aged Greenmire Cheese."
Nen Ai tells you, "Would you retrieve these foods from the dungeon just behind my house, called the Stone Cathedral? My little friend and I would both be very grateful."

location.name: Oi-Tong Ye
location.description:
Quest(s): Four Stones of Jojii, Shoushi Starter Quests, Exploration Society Letters.
Oi-Tong Ye tells you, "Greetings, and welcome to Shoushi. I am the local representative of the Explorer Society. My job is to help new arrivals in Dereth."
Oi-Tong Ye tells you, "If you have just arrived in Dereth, you should talk to my friend Lou Ka, who stands just over there. He is looking for some help with an errand."
Oi-Tong Ye tells you, "Or you might investigate the rumors that the lovely Nin Hong sells upstairs."

location.name: Oneros the Gem Seller
location.description:
Quest(s): Arm, Mind, Heart.
Oneros the Gem Seller tells you, "Greetings. I and my two brothers have been sent to some of the Isparian Arrival points to offer our fine wares. While many Isparians have only dealt with our less refined cousins, the Tukal smiths are masters of many arts. These particular gems have been crafted by some of our finest master gem crafters and imbued with helpful magics which I am sure will be useful to the Isparian adventurer. I also am selling Calm Strength, a necessary ingredient to fashion the Sleeves of Inexhaustibility."
Oneros the Gem Seller tells you, "Remember that the Lugian and Isparian relationship does not need to be awash in blood."

location.name: Pawn Shopkeep (Shoushi)
location.description: Pawn Shopkeep tells you, "You have something that'll interest me?"

location.name: Pawn Shopkeep (Holtburg)
location.description: Pawn Shopkeep tells you, "You have something that'll interest me?"

location.name: Pawn Shopkeep (Yaraq)
location.description: Pawn Shopkeep tells you, "You have something that'll interest me?"

location.name: Sentry
location.description: Sentry tells you, "We are here to guard the people of this town against any future attacks. If you have any questions, you should talk to the Senior Guard assigned to lead our garrison."

location.name: Sentry
location.description: Sentry tells you, "We are here to guard the people of this town against any future attacks. If you have any questions, you should talk to the Senior Guard assigned to lead our garrison."

location.name: Sho High-Stakes Gamesmaster
location.description: Quest(s): Gambling.

location.name: Sho Mid-Stakes Gamesmaster
location.description: Quest(s): Gambling.

location.name: Sho Low-Stakes Gamesmaster
location.description: Quest(s): Gambling.

location.name: Sir Tenshin
location.description: Quest(s): Elysa's Favor.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: Four O'Clock and all is well...

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: If I Had a Million Pyreals... I'd Be Rich.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description:
What did one Olthoi say to the other Olthoi?
Puurpt.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description:
Do you remember when it used to get cloudy and rain?
When we had actual weather?
I miss the rain showers.

location.name: Wedding Planner (Shoushi)
location.description:
Quest(s): Wedding Trials.
Wedding Planner tells you, "Welcome! I have everything that you may need to help plan your wedding."

location.name: Creature Camps
location.description:
Three camps of different creature types all within a few feet of each other.
Golems are gathered around a stone pillar that glows at the top.
Monougas are camped out around some cooking fires.
Drudges are camped out around a single campfire.

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone near an Archmage by Hebian-To.

location.name: Barkeeper Fo Ya-Un
location.description: Sells at 145%, buys at 90%.

location.name: Muozhen Wa the Jeweler
location.description:
Sells at 145%, buys at 90%.
Muozhen Wa the Jeweler tells you, "Welcome! What's your pleasure today?"
Muozhen Wa the Jeweler tells you, "Thank you for your business. Please return soon."

location.name: Trophy Smith (Shoushi)
location.description:
Trophy Smith tells you, "I am interested in armoredillo spines and golem hearts of all kinds. If you give me one I will craft an item from it, or give you something else of value."
In exchange for certain trophies, Trophy Smiths will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Arcanum Researcher (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Arcanum Researcher tells you, "I have the latest reports from the Arcanum with me. Asheron stopped by the Arcanum workshops and gifted the Tinkers with knowledge of Yalaini transmutation magic. Using their new insights, the Tinkers have found the way to penetrate the Foundries from which these statues have come. If you seek out the Arcanum Tinker in the Consortium near Xarabydun, he will be able to tell you more!"
Arcanum Researcher tells you, "Meanwhile, I will still deliver the same rewards for any trophies that you might find on the statues menacing our towns. I will give additional rewards for any interesting items found within the Foundries, for I am sure the Arcanum would be interested in studying them further."

location.name: Trophy Smith (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Trophy Smith tells you, "I am interested in armoredillo spines and golem hearts of all kinds. If you give me one I will craft an item from it, or give you something else of value."
In exchange for certain trophies, Trophy Smiths will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.

location.name: Enli Yuo
location.description:
Quest(s): Augmentation Gems.
Enli Yuo tells you, "By using my special Diving Duo fighting technique you can increase your resistance to electrical attacks, visit Fiun Rehlyun on the Halaetan Islands. Bring a blank augmentation gem to me and I will teach you what I know."

location.name: Ilin Wis
location.description:
Quest(s): Augmentation Gems.
You give Ilin Wis Blank Augmentation Gem.
Ilin Wis tells you, "Using this gem will teach you the Armoredillo Curl defensive technique. Those who master this technique can increase their resistance to slashing."
Ilin Wis tells you, "Be sure to read the gem's inscription before you use it."
Ilin Wis gives you Enhancement of the Blade Turner."

location.name: Kyujo Rujen
location.description:
Quest(s): Augmentation Gems.
Kyujo Rujen tells you, "I am master Rujen. Bring me an augmentation gem and I shall teach you the Drunken Drudge fighting technique which will increase your resistance to piercing attacks. Visit Fiun Rehlyun on the Halaetan Islands if you have not already acquired one of these gems."

location.name: Li Fong
location.description:
Quest(s): Noble Weapons.
Li Fong tells you, "I have been sent by High Queen Elysa to reward those who have assisted Captain K'rank of Linvak Tukal. If you have proof of this assistance give it to me and I will see that you are rewarded."

location.name: Lu Bao
location.description:
Quest(s): Augmentation Gems.
Lu Bao tells you, "I can teach you the ancient Sho mantra for making ones body resistant to frost attacks. Bring me an augmentation gem and I shall inscribe it for you."
Lu Bao tells you, "You might ask Fiun Rehlyun of the Halaetan Islands about augmentation gems if you do not have one."

location.name: Nawamara Dia
location.description:
Quest(s): Augmentation Gems.
Nawamara Dia tells you, "I am the keeper of the Iron Monouga Stance. With it I can increase my resistance to bludgeoning attacks. If you wish I can teach it to you, but I will need an augmentation gem. Visit Fiun Rehlyun on the Halaetan Islands if you have not already acquired one of these gems."

location.name: Rikshen Ri
location.description:
Quest(s): Augmentation Gems.
Rikshen Ri tells you, "I am the master of Reedshark Cover fighting technique. Give me a blank augmentation gem, and I will improve your resistance to fire attacks by teaching you this technique." Rikshen Ri tells you, "Fiun Rehlyun of the Halaetan Islands can tell you how to get one of these gems."

location.name: Shujio Milao
location.description:
Quest(s): Augmentation Gems.
Shujio Milao tells you, "Go to the Halaetan Islands and speak with Fiun Rehlyun. Bring me a blank augmentation gem and I will teach you the Olthoi Whip technique." Shujio Milao tells you, "When hit by acid, this technique will allow you to quickly remove the acid from your person and thus take less damage."

location.name: Fanzen San the Translator
location.description:
Quest(s): Various.
Fanzen San the Translator tells you, "I am a scholar of the Empyrean culture that lived in the ruins found throughout the swamps and even the desert. They were apparently called the Falatacot. If you have a text of that culture, I may be able to help you."

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: This is a stickup. Give me all your Plats!!!! Just Kidding.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: Did you know you can fish in this game?

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: After I die, wherever my spirit goes, I'm going to try to get back and visit my skeleton at least once a year, just to say, "Hey, old buddy, how's it going?"

location.name: Apprentice Scrivener of Item and War Magic (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level I and II (1st Floor).
Apprentice Scrivener of Item and War Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Apprentice Scrivener of Item and War tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Apprentice Scrivener of Life Magic (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level I and II (1st Floor).
Apprentice Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Apprentice Scrivener of Life tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Apprentice Scrivener of Creature Magic (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level I and II (1st Floor).
Apprentice Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Apprentice Scrivener of Creature tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III (3rd Floor).
Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of Life Magic (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III (2nd Floor).
Journeyman Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of Life tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of Creature Magic (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III (3rd Floor).
Journeyman Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of Creature tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of War Magic (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III (2nd Floor).
Journeyman Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of War tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Scrivener of Item Magic (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV (3rd Floor).
Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Scrivener of Life Magic (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV (3rd Floor).
Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Life tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Scrivener of Creature Magic (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV (3rd Floor).
Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Creature tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Scrivener of War Magic (Hebian-To)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV (2nd Floor).
Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of War tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Blacksmith (Merchant Compound)
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Blacksmith tells you, "Welcome! What's your pleasure today?"

location.name: Merchant (Merchant Compound)
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Merchant tells you, "Welcome! What's your pleasure today?"

location.name: Banderling Tower
location.description: This fort lies about halfway between between the towns of Baishi and Khayyaban. It is populated by low level Banderlings and no important quest items or loot chests are found within its walls. However, a random special food item does spawn on the ground in the fort. The time I was there it was Wheat Bread but another time it was a Tart Apple.

location.name: Undead Fort
location.description: A small fort where a group of mid level undead reside. The undead are all clustered in one of the towers rather than spread out around the fort. Two Sturdy Iron Chests are found in the tower with the undead.

location.name: Scrivener of Item Magic (Baishi)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV.
Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Scrivener of Life Magic (Baishi)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV.
Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Life tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Scrivener of Creature Magic (Baishi)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV.
Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Creature tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Scrivener of War Magic (Baishi)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV.
Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of War tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Fergal the Dire
location.description:
Quest(s): Hunter Quests (Dire Mattekar).
Fergal the Dire tells you, "So, you wish to prove your hunting prowess? Well then. Track down and slay 10 of the terrible Dire Mattekars for me, and I will reward you appropriately."

location.name: Isparian Combat Arena Master
location.description:
Quest(s): Isparian Combat Arena.
PvP Arena Master tells you, "Behind me is the entrance to the PvP Arena. This is a dungeon filled with devices to aid in combat."
PvP Arena Master tells you, "Upon entering the dungeon you will receive a Mark. Collect 20 of these Marks to turn in at the statue located in the bottom of the arena to receive a Mana Forge Key."
PvP Arena Master tells you, "However if you die in the dungeon all of your marks will drop allowing another player to reap the reward for all your hard work."
PvP Arena Master tells you, "If you wish to enter this arena give me 2 MMDs and I will attune you to the portal's energy."
PvP Arena Master tells you, "If you have already been in the arena you may turn in any remaining Marks for 2 MMDs each."

location.name: Drunken Madman
location.description:
Quest(s): Casting Stein, Weeping Weapons, Ulgrim's Drinking Contest.
You give Drunken Madman Wah Chon's Winter Lager.
Drunken Madman tells you, "What's this? It doesn't look like sake."
Drunken Madman tells you, "Not Sake!? NOT Sake! YOU!!! I'll g..."
Drunken Madman tells you, "Oh right, you must want to see Ulgrim. He said people might be looking for him. Ok, I'll portal you there this time, but next time you better bring me sake!"
Give the Drunken Madman Sake for a portal to Walled Portals.
Give the Drunken Madman Wah Chon's Winter Lager for a portal to Ulgrim's Island.
Give the Drunken Madman an Apple for a surprise.
---Fond Memories of 1999-2000 from here to the accursed Halls to level on Goldenback Tuskers.---
- Torizo, Pyretta Blaze, and Darkon.

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Baishi)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description:
One of these things is not like the others...
But hand them to me and they all disappear the same.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: Are you looking for buffs? Then go find a buff bot, I am not one.

location.name: Kuhira of Kara
location.description:
Sells at 170%, buys at 80%.
Kuhira of Kara tells you, "Welcome! What's your pleasure today?"

location.name: Journeyman Alchemist (Kara)
location.description:
Quest(s): Crafter.
Journeyman Alchemist tells you, "Greetings! I have left my master in Glenden Wood to help the craftsmen of this fine land to hone their crafting skills"
Journeyman Alchemist tells you, "Prove your knowledge by bringing me a Copper Lodestone, and I shall reward you."
ourneyman Alchemist tells you, "What, you say you don't know how to make a Copper Lodestone?! Why, that is what tests of knowledge are for! Get out there and experiment, my young friend!"

location.name: Corporal Massein
location.description:
Quest(s): Hunter Quests (Mosswart Townsfolk).
Corporal Massein tells you, "Hail, warrior. Have you come to help the defense of Kryst? The sheer number of Mosswarts in the jungle and assaulting the town are overwhelming us."
Corporal Massein tells you, "I have a specific way that you might help. We need warriors who are willing to strike a blow at the heart of the Mosswart holding."
Corporal Massein tells you, "Slay forty of the Mosswart Townsfolk who live in the Mosswart holding, then return back to me. Good luck, warrior".

location.name: Guard Hrothgar
location.description:
Quest(s): Missing Persons Investigation.
Guard Hrothgar tells you, "Friend...I've a confession to make."
Guard Hrothgar tells you, "I've been promoted in the army...but I don't feel like I deserve it. My training of this new unit was not effective."
Guard Hrothgar tells you, "After the loss of so many in the Shadow March, the army was in a shaky state. We were all new and untrained, and...frankly, I didn't know what I was doing."
Guard Hrothgar tells you, "I'd term what I was even two months ago as incompetent. We didn't really know what we were looking for, or how to best defend the people of New Aluvia."
Guard Hrothgar tells you, "It is strictly because of heroes of your ilk who stepped in to help us - and I am grateful."
Guard Hrothgar tells you, "I think I've figured out how to best use the troops assigned to me now, and what we're doing in general. We can keep the town safe, if you can help us by performing a few missions.
During the Ancient Enemies Patch, town criers in different towns, Timaru, Holtburg, Candeth Keep disappeared. Guard Hrothgar was usually found near the former spot of the TC, tasked with investigating the matter. Handing him a randomly spawning Shred of Blue Cloth (on the ground near him) would grant you xp. He now seems to have found a more steady location in the army defending Kryst.
Note: Missing Persons Investigation is a Retired Quest.

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Kryst)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Aluvian Spearman
location.description:
Patrolling The Beach.
Aluvian Spearman tells you, "We'll protect this town to the bitter end. But, honestly, we're pretty well fortified. I think Kryst is safe."

location.name: Gharu'ndim War Mage
location.description:
Patrolling The Beach.
Gharu'ndim War Mage tells you, "We'll protect this town to the bitter end. But, honestly, we're pretty well fortified. I think Kryst is safe."

location.name: Gharu'ndim Warrior
location.description:
Patrolling The Beach.
Gharu'ndim Warrior tells you, "We'll protect this town to the bitter end. But, honestly, we're pretty well fortified. I think Kryst is safe."

location.name: Sho Swordsman
location.description:
Patrolling The Beach.
Sho Swordsman tells you, "We'll protect this town to the bitter end. But, honestly, we're pretty well fortified. I think Kryst is safe."

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: Boom Boom, Ain't It Great To Be Crazy?

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Lin)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Scrivener of Item Magic (Lin)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV.
Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Scrivener of Life Magic (Lin)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV.
Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Life tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Scrivener of Creature Magic (Lin)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV.
Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Creature tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Scrivener of War Magic (Lin)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV.
Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of War tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Town Crier
location.description:
People laugh because I'm different,
I laugh because they're all the same.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description:
Remember...
being a UCM is bad. MMMMMMMkk?

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: Does this outfit make me look fat?

location.name: Collector (Lin)
location.description:
Collector tells you, "I'm interested in monster trophies from many of the monsters that plague Dereth.
If you give me such items, I will reward you with money or an item. With regret, I don't deal in hides."

location.restrictions: 45+, Cannot Tie/Recall/Summon, Quest Flag: Complete the Gelidite Library Quest by saving Nuhmudira.
location.name: Arcanum Storehouse Lower Level
location.description:
Quest(s): Nuhmudira's Boon.
This level of the Arcanum Storehouse stockpiles Unimbued Red Pyreal Gorgets found at the most lower parts of the dungeon.
Within Arcanum Storehouse.

location.restrictions: 30+, Cannot Tie/Recall/Summon, Quest Flag: Complete the Gelidite Library Quest by saving Nuhmudira.
location.name: Arcanum Storehouse Middle Level
location.description:
Quest(s): Nuhmudira's Boon.
This level of the Arcanum Storehouse stockpiles Unimbued Blue Pyreal Gorgets at the upper parts of the dungeon.
Within Arcanum Storehouse.

location.restrictions: 15+, Cannot Tie/Recall/Summon, Quest Flag: Complete the Gelidite Library Quest by saving Nuhmudira.
location.name: Arcanum Storehouse Upper Level
location.description:
Quest(s): Nuhmudira's Boon.
This level of the Arcanum Storehouse stockpiles Unimbued Green Pyreal Gorgets at the lower parts of the dungeon. You can save time by jumping over the bridges just near the drop point.
Within Arcanum Storehouse.

location.name: Fiery Cave
location.description:
Quest(s): Minor Atlan Stones.
Yesterday an adventurer brought me a tale of a strange grotto in the Faranar Hills, about halfway between Uziz and poor Leikotha's terrible tomb. In this grotto reside several of the elusive Fire Elementals, said to be star-spawned creatures which retreated underground after a great cataclysm. They now seem to guard a strange red stone. None know what this stone may be, as all who have attempted to retrieve have been blistered by the fireballs of the Elementals.
-- Unknown
Minor Smoldering Stone.

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Mayoi)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description:
All the world's a stage,
And all the men and women merely players.
They have their exits and their entrances,
And one man in his time plays many parts.

location.description: An Empyrean Column surrounded by several Water Golems.
