location.name: Apprentice Fletcher (Sawato)
location.description:
Quest(s): Crafter.
Apprentice Fletcher tells you, "Hello! My master in Glenden Wood, Wils Morrem, has charged me with the mission to encourage the people of Dereth to cultivate their crafting skills."
Apprentice Fletcher tells you, "If you bring me a Greater Lightning Arrowhead, I will award you with the funds to further your crafting studies."

location.name: Hasin Lin
location.description:
Quest(s): Soul Hunter Quest.
Hasin Lin tells you, "I would ask of you a favor, friend. I have received information that the one who protects us all is in some mortal peril himself. I'd rather not say more now. I'd just ask that you head into Blackmire Swamp and see if there is any strange Falatacot-related activity in the vicinity of 28 S, 56 E. Please go there, seek out a being called the Soul Hunter, and bring me back anything you find."
Hasin Lin tells you, "I've asked you to find the Soul Hunter's Lair and bring me back whatever information you can. Remember, I asked you to search in the area of 28 S, 56 E. Please, go. I think something very important is happening there..."

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Sawato)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Tsua's Apprentice
location.description:
Quest(s): Apprentice Mask Maker.
Tsua's Apprentice tells you, "Hi, I'm Zoe, Tsua's apprentice. He said that I have polished my basic skills enough to move on to more advanced things. So this year I can craft his old designs for mosswart, banderling and hollow minion heads. Additionally if you give me either a skull or a scarecrow head, I will make a thrown weapon from them."

location.name: Town Crier
location.description:
I don't pretend to have all the answers.
I don't pretend to even know what the questions are.
Hey, where am I?

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Tou-Tou)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Ook
location.description:
Quest(s): Bobo's Medicine.
Ook tells you, "Yeah! We save Bobo! Ooo! Ook!"
Ook tells you, "Humans like Tuskers now! I show you how to eat nanners with your feet sometimes, Ook."
Ook tells you, "Only bad thing is Mudmouth get away. You find him and mash him good for the bad things he did, Ook!"
Ook tells you, "Jilna ask me to tell you she in Bobo Town now. She still making potions for Bobo to not be sick. Ook."

location.name: Cow
location.description: Moooooooo!!!

location.name: Fountain
location.description: Fountain in Tou-Tou Bath House and Hot Spring.

location.name: Well
location.description:
Use an empty flask on the fountain to fill it with water.
Casts the following spells: Revitalize Other I.

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Wai Jhou)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

Grand Master Scrivener of War tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Bowyer Xana Bin-Xara
location.description:
Sells at 190%, buys at 70%.
Bowyer Xana Bin-Xara tells you, "You are most welcome here friend. How may I help you?"
Bowyer Xana Bin-Xara tells you, "Please visit our shrine across the way. It's very simple, but a good place to think."
Bowyer Xana Bin-Xara tells you, "Let detachment guard you. Without detachment you will be unable to let go and move forward."

location.name: Goku Bai-Akane the Barkeep
location.description:
Sells at 170%, buys at 80%.
Goku Bai-Akane the Barkeep tells you, "Have a seat and stick your feet up. I'm not much for formality. What do you need?"
Goku Bai-Akane the Barkeep tells you, "Hello, my names Akane, can I interest you in some food or drink?"
Goku Bai-Akane the Barkeep tells you, "May the Dragon protect you from harm, the Unicorn bless you and the Firebird lead you on your path."
Goku Bai-Akane the Barkeep tells you, "May you find your balance in the stones that pave the Path to Paradise."
Goku Bai-Akane the Barkeep tells you, "Ahem! No principle has been truly learned unless it is applied to oneself first. The wise Ken-gou once said that."
Goku Bai-Akane the Barkeep tells you, "May the Unicorn grace you with a compassionate eye, so you may seek those in need and help them."
Goku Bai-Akane the Barkeep tells you, "If your mean to me I'll smack you on the head with a table!"
Goku Bai-Akane the Barkeep tells you, "Awww, leaving so soon! Well, please come back and visit me again."
Goku Bai-Akane the Barkeep tells you, "You come back and visit or I'll get very mad with you!"

location.name: Nakoro Eshii-Shinjo the Provisioner
location.description:
Sells at 180%, buys at 70%.
Nakoro Eshii-Shinjo the Provisioner tells you, "After your done here you should go try some of Akane's cooking she makes a delicious bowl of mushroom rice."
Nakoro Eshii-Shinjo the Provisioner tells you, "Let humility dwell within you. Without humility you will be easily misled and lose your way."
Nakoro Eshii-Shinjo the Provisioner tells you, "Thanks for stopping by, don't forget to write."

location.name: Pang Sin-Xiang the Weaponsmith
location.description:
Sells at 190%, buys at 70%.
Pang Sin-Xiang the Weaponsmith tells you, "I can see you have found the Dragon's Power. Be wise and compassionate in how you use that power lest you become it's slave. Show your discipline and balance your training with the other heavenly virtues as Koji did."
Pang Sin-Xiang the Weaponsmith tells you, "Let compassion be in your every thought and action, as you strive to help others in their paths."
Pang Sin-Xiang the Weaponsmith tells you, "Aun Teverea, the Tumerok collector outside of town told me that they have already collected enough materials to start building Candeth Keep. I went to the crater location he mentioned. They have already done an impressive amount of work. The lugians are amazingly adept at building. I would expect them to have the town mostly built by Verdentine."
Pang Sin-Xiang the Weaponsmith tells you, "Let detachment guard you. Without detachment you will be unable to let go and move forward."

location.name: Aun Teverea
location.description:
Quest(s): Town Founder.
Aun Teverea tells you, "Hello Isparian, my name is Aun Teverea. All Tumeroks in the xuta of Aun Hareltah have been invited to join the new alliance."
Aun Teverea tells you, "We are assigned to this outpost near Wai Jhou, to collect building materials for the continued upkeep of Candeth Keep, the South Direlands stronghold. I will accept all types of cloth and hide that you can afford to donate to the cause. Large or small, your donations will be treated equally."
This quest flags you for access to the Tree Portal in Candeth Keep.

location.name: Caelis Renning
location.description:
Quest(s): Town Founder.
Caelis Renning tells you, "Hail friend, my name is Caelis. The Aluvian, Sho, and Gharun'dim peoples united under Queen Elyssa have joined together to form the Isparian third of the new alliance."
Caelis Renning tells you, "We are assigned to this outpost near Wai Jhou, to collect building materials for the continued upkeep of Candeth Keep. I will accept all types of salvaged metal and wood that you can afford to donate to the cause. Large or small, poor or priceless, your donations will be treated equally."
This quest flags you for access to the Tree Portal in Candeth Keep.

location.name: Kreavon
location.description:
Quest(s): Town Founder.
Kreavon tells you, "Well met Isparian. I am Kreavon, a Linvak Lugian and also a member of the new alliance. All Lugians loyal to Lord Kresovus are sworn members of the alliance."
Kreavon tells you, "We are assigned to this outpost near Wai Jhou, to collect building materials for the continued upkeep of Candeth Keep, the South Direlands stronghold. I will accept all types of salvaged stone and gem that you can afford to donate to the cause. Large or small, your donations will be treated equally."
This quest flags you for access to the Tree Portal in Candeth Keep.

location.name: Nona
location.description:
Quest(s): Hunter Quests (K'nath An'dras).
Nona tells you, "So, you wish to prove your hunting prowess? Well then. Track down and slay 25 of the terrible K'nath An'drases for me, and I will reward you appropriately."

location.name: Xanda Har
location.description:
Quest(s): Bandits of the Creepy Chambers.
Xanda Har tells you, "Hello! Say, I don't suppose you could help me out with a small favor? I've heard that there's this group of bandits out in the wilderness, a bit south of the Obsidian Rim. Rumor has it that they're stockpiling treasure and ... well, doing something strange with creatures. Either breeding them or worshipping them -- no one is quite sure which."
Xanda Har tells you, "But it's the treasure that I'm interested in! And my curiosity is just killing me! I even heard that they might have some sort of super weapon!"
Xanda Har tells you, "Will you go and see what you can find out for me? I think their lair is called the Creepy Chambers. The barkeeper here sells a rumor with better directions than I can give you. And if you can find that super-weapon, bring it back to me! I'll reward you!"

location.name: Empyrean Statue
location.description: Stone statues are a common ruin. following their gaze will often lead you to more ruins or other points of interest.

location.name: Empyrean Statue
location.description: Stone statues are a common ruin. following their gaze will often lead you to more ruins or other points of interest.

location.name: Lich Tower
location.description:
An area located on the western edge of the Obsidian Plains near Wai Jhou. Primarily a waypoint for players wanting to access the Obsidian Plains via a Black Hill portal, or wanting to access the base of the Plains or Wai Jhou via the Small Black Hill portal located on Black Hill.
There is also a tower here, often called the Lich Tower, that is known for being one of the highest accessible points in Dereth.
There's usually a group of various creatures, around the 100-130 level range, surrounding the Small Black Hill portal.

location.name: Empyrean Statue
location.description: Stone statues are a common ruin. following their gaze will often lead you to more ruins or other points of interest.

location.name: Empyrean Statue
location.description: Stone statues are a common ruin. following their gaze will often lead you to more ruins or other points of interest.

location.name: Swamp Gromnies
location.description: A couple of corpses getting gnawed on by a few Swamp Gromnies. The respawn time on the gromnies is pretty long (15 minutes or so) so camping might not beneficial.

location.name: Undead Altar
location.description: A small altar surrounded by low level undead. No special items are found here.

location.name: Undead House
location.description: An abandoned Sho style house that is home to some low level undead. There are three junk loot chests inside.

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic (Yanshi)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III Spells.
Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Ribusha Sennei the Bowyer
location.description: Sells at 135%, buys at 90%.

location.name: Zan Wa-Shabu the Tailor
location.description: Sells at 135%, buys at 90%.

location.name: Ru Chi the Shopkeeper
location.description: Sells at 135%, buys at 90%.

location.name: Bleeargh
location.description:
Quest(s): Bleeargh's Gratitude.
The creature speaks in a broken form of Roulean.
Bleeargh, Mosswart Swamp Lord tells you, "We try make peace. We needs help before we leave and go make war on lost cousins on islands in the south. You help?"
Bleeargh looks you over quickly.
Bleeargh, Mosswart Swamp Lord tells you, "You strong Isparian. You fight in the place where Bleeargh from. Swamps in lands of dire fighters. You make big wanga against mosswart enemies. You help, much you can do."
Bleeargh, Mosswart Swamp Lord tells you, "Drudge gathering near humie town outside blackmire swamp near mosswart home of green mire. There we lose Spear of Kreerg to Drudges. You get back easy. Not far from there, in trees, Banderlings try to take back the hand of Vagurat. You get that easy too."
Bleeargh, Mosswart Swamp Lord tells you, "You can help get necklace of Leerargh away from Burun. They steal old mosswart home and take necklace. Necklace most important to Mosswarts. You get easily. Not far from here in puddle swamp to south."
Bleeargh, Mosswart Swamp Lord tells you, "Eye of Drageerg taken by dark clouded mosswarts who flee to islands where new home be. You can get easy for Bleeargh and his kin. You have tougher time getting cloth of first mire witch. It on islands in the south too. You go get for Bleeargh he give good reward."
Bleeargh, Mosswart Swamp Lord tells you, "Or you could help Bleeargh get first paint of his kin. The war paint taken by Burun usurpers. They in western part of swamp near swamp temple. They might take that home too. You help Bleeargh, bring these back he give you big knowledge of make items stronger. You unleash knowledge when you learn."

location.name: Ookami Kiri
location.description: Quest(s): Tanada House of Earth, Tanada Clan Master's Medallion.

location.name: Collector (Yanshi)
location.description: Collector tells you, "I'm interested in monster trophies from many of the monsters that plague Dereth. If you give me such items, I will reward you with money or an item. With regret, I don't deal in hides."

location.name: Apprentice Fletcher (Yanshi)
location.description:
Quest(s): Crafter.
Apprentice Fletcher tells you, "Hello! My master in Glenden Wood, Wils Morrem, has sent me out into the world to participate in the great Mission - encouraging the young people of Dereth to embrace a life of artistry!"
Apprentice Fletcher tells you, "If you bring me an example of your craftsmanship - say, an Acid Arrowhead - I will reward you with a token of encouragement."
The apprentice coughs quietly.
Apprentice Fletcher tells you, "Um, we're not rich yet, though, so I'm afraid I can only reward you once a week."

location.name: Town Crier (Yanshi)
location.description: Milk, It Does A Body Good.

location.name: Wedding Planner (Yaraq)
location.description:
Quest(s): Wedding Trials.
Wedding Planner tells you, "Welcome! I have everything that you may need to help plan your wedding."

location.name: Apprentice Alchemist (Yaraq)
location.description:
Quest(s): Crafter.
Apprentice Alchemist tells you, "Hello! My master in Glenden Wood, Tiffany Comfore, has sent me out into the world to participate in the great Mission - encouraging the young people of Dereth to embrace a life of artistry!"
Apprentice Alchemist tells you, "If you bring me an example of your craftsmanship - say, a Lightning Infusion - I will reward you with a token of encouragement."
The apprentice coughs quietly.
Apprentice Alchemist tells you, "Um, we're not rich yet, though, so I'm afraid I can only reward you once a week."

location.name: Dame Saya
location.description:
Quest(s): Elysa's Favor.
Dame Tsaya tells you, "To that end, I have a small task for you: We have heard that a newcomer to this town has moved into a villa that has lain abandoned for many years. No one knows where he came from, although it is said he speaks with a Northern accent. Would you stop by his residence, and find out more about him? He lives to the southwest, near Lubziklan al-Luq's apple orchards."

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Yaraq)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Arcanum Refurbisher (Yaraq)
location.description:
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "Greetings, I am an agent of the Yaraq Arcanum specializing in the refurbishment of broken and abused items."
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "Over the years, we find that the elements of this land are often unkind to a number of our prize possessions. The wind and rains erode statues, dampness causes the colors of our prized pack animals to change oddly, and even the magics of the world itself play havok with some of the more.. disturbing... of our decorations."
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "This parchment contains a list of items that we of the Arcanum know to be most severely affected by the climate of this world. Should you find that you are in possession of one of these damaged items, please bring it to me and I'll see what I can do about getting it fixed up for you."
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "While I have the utmost confidence in my ability to repair such things, I have been unable to capture the knack of retaining any personalizations. This means that my repairs will obliterate any inscriptions you, or someone you know, may have etched into the item."
Arcanum Refurbisher tells you, "If you have any sentimental attachment to those inscriptions, I would recommend that you refrain from using the service I offer."
Arcanum Refurbisher gives you Refurbisher's Tally.."

location.name: Empyrean Cloister (Upper)
location.description:
Quest(s): Empyrean Cloister, Sword of Lost Hope.
One of the split-team dungeons related to the Sword of Lost Hope Quest.
One team from the Empyrean Cloister Quest must take this route.
Doors are opened by levers thrown in Empyrean Cloister Lower.
The Skull of Avoren Palacost spawns on the floor in the final room.
Within Empyrean Cloister.

location.name: Empyrean Cloister (Lower)
location.description:
Quest(s): Empyrean Cloister.
One of the split-team dungeons related to the Sword of Lost Hope Quest.
One team from the Empyrean Cloister Quest must take this route.
Within Empyrean Cloister.

location.name: Barkeeper Ghazi al-Barbasin
location.description: Sells at 145%, buys at 90%.

location.description: Sells at 145%, buys at 90%.

location.name: Husoon
location.description:
Quest(s): Augmentation Gems.
Husoon tells you, "I will teach you to withstand the vigors of an overburdened pack. Hand me a blank augmentation gem and I will give you a gem that shall increase your carrying capacity.
Husoon gives you Might of the Seventh Mule.

location.name: Dumida bint Ruminre
location.description:
Quest(s): Augmentation Gems.
Dumida bint Ruminre tells you, "I can teach you to organize your packs more efficiently so that you can carry a bit more than you would normally be able to. But you will have to hand me a blank augmentation gem first.
Dumida bint Ruminre tells you, "Visit Fiun Rehlyun on the Halaetan Islands if you do not already have an augmentation gem."
Dumida bint Ruminre gives you Shadow of the Seventh Mule.

location.name: Devana bint Hamudi
location.description:
Quest(s): Oswald's Dagger, Hamud's Pyreal Katar.
Devana bint Hamudi tells you, "I have slain others for speaking to me without a proper introduction."

location.name: Darhy, Assistant to Nuhmudira
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Shield.
Darhy, Assistant to Nuhmudira tells you, "Hello. I have been tasked by Nuhmudira to continue to collect Whispering Venom crystals. They aided in overcoming the threat of the ancient Olthoi Queen who resided within this lair. It is important to probe this lair lest the Queen should return here and defeat any Olthoi within it! Nuhmudira had determined there is an unknown force that seems to "drown out" mana and suppresses higher forms of magic. This force is particularly powerful in the proximity of this lair and prevents anyone from being portalled successfully there."
Darhy, Assistant to Nuhmudira tells you, "A very rare crystal, Whispering Venom crystal is required to nullify this effect- the wearing of a ring made from this crystal allows a successful journey through portal space to this lair. Alas, Nuhmudira did possess a supply of these crystals however they were stolen once from her warehouse, together with numerous other crystals. While the other crystal types are being replaced through the good efforts of Isparians, a supply of Whispering Venom crystal is lacking."
Darhy, Assistant to Nuhmudira tells you, "There is a mine at desert's edge, west of Khayyaban, which used to be a source of these crystals. It may be somewhat depleted but it is our only hope. Please try to find some and return as soon as you are able!"

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Zaikhal)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Scrivener of War Magic (Tou-Tou)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV.
Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of War tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.description:

Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Life tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

Scrivener of Item tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Scrivener of Creature Magic (Zaikhal)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV.
Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Creature tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Lair of the Ancient Olthoi Queen
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Shield.
Down the ramp by the Olthoi Sentinel are killable Olthoi Eggs.
Olthoi Sentinel:
Level 161
Strength 600 Endurance 600 Coordination 600 Quickness 600 Focus 600 Self 600 Health 100000 Stamina 100000 Mana 600
Drops: 3 Olthoi Abdomen Fragments that can be turned in for an Olthoi Shield (the variant depends on the level of the person handing it in) when given to the Olthoi Hunter south of Arwic.
The Olthoi in this dungeon drop the various parts for the Olthoi Weapons.
location.monsters: Olthoi Drone, Egg, Eviscerator, Mutilator, Noble, Noble Grub, Sentinel, Servant, Soldier, Warrior, Worker, Swarm Eviscerator, Guardian, Nymph, Soldier

location.name: Glowing Pillars
location.description:
Three glowing pillars out in the desert east of Al-Arqas.
A lone corpse lies nearby with a arm outstretched towards the pillars.
There are no creatures or items associated with this point of interest.

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Al-Arqas)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Apprentice Cook (Al-Arqas)
location.description:
Quest(s): Crafter.
Apprentice Cook tells you, "Hello! My master in Glenden Wood, Copper Vanurp, has sent me out into the world to participate in the great Mission - encouraging the young people of Dereth to embrace a life of artistry!"
Apprentice Cook tells you, "If you bring me an example of your craftsmanship - say, a bowl of Mushroom Noodle - I will reward you with a token of encouragement."
The apprentice coughs quietly.
Apprentice Cook tells you, "Um, we're not rich yet, though, so I'm afraid I can only reward you once a week."

location.name: Collector (Al-Arqas)
location.description: Collector tells you, "I'm interested in monster trophies from many of the monsters that plague Dereth. If you give me such items, I will reward you with money or an item. With regret, I don't deal in hides."

location.name: Jilsaya bint Dah
location.description:
Quest(s): Abandoned Shops, Rusted Knife, Drudge Charm, Exploration Society Letters.
Jilsaya bint Dah tells you, "I have been contracted by the Dereth Exploration Society to help them in their outreach program towards the Isparians who find themselves newly exiled in Dereth. Here is a book that explains their mission. I am also giving you a list describing the locations of the nearest stamp and portals to other towns. If you collect any of the Society's stamped letters, you may bring them back to me for a reward."
Jilsaya bint Dah gives you A Book of Quests for New Explorers.
Jilsaya bint Dah gives you Nexus Town Information Guide.
Jilsaya bint Dah tells you, "By the way -- if you haven't yet done so, you might want to visit Sarqah bint Ak at the North Outpost, or Nurbaha bint Dah at the West Outpost. They often have tasks for young adventurers.

location.name: Nurbaha bint Dah
location.description:
Quest(s): Rusted Knife.
Nurbaha bint Dah tells you, "Long ago, on the way to Al-Arqas, my mother and I came upon a ruin and camped there. At night, monsters came upon us, and after holding them off for a while, we fled."
Nurbaha bint Dah tells you, "We left behind my mother's collection of knives, among the first she ever forged. They are not worth very much, but I will help you if you get one for me."
Nurbaha bint Dah tells you, "The Unfinished Temple is to the northwest of here. We fled pretty far into the ruins before we realized we had to leave. I think we were at least two levels down when we lost the knives. Last I was there, I found only one knife."

location.name: Sarqah bint Ak
location.description:
Quest(s): Drudge Charm.
Sarqah bint Ak tells you, "Hello. I have a task that I am just too tired to do myself. There is a crypt near here from which I would like an item."
Sarqah bint Ak tells you, "Yes, you would be great for this task. To the west of here is a crypt in which drudges have taken up residence."
Sarqah bint Ak tells you, "Some drudges are known to carry charms, and I know there is usually one lying around in that crypt. Please get it to me, and I shall help you out."

location.name: Shopkeeper Tirua
location.description:
Sells at 135%, buys at 90%.
Shopkeeper Tirua tells you, "What is happening? Tell me what is happening!"
Shopkeeper Tirua tells you, "What is going to become of my business now that this catastrophe has happened?"

location.name: Shopkeeper Yasiya
location.description:
Sells at 135%, buys at 90%.
Shopkeeper Yasiya tells you, "The attack on the Training Hall came so suddenly...I don't know what could have happened..."
Shopkeeper Yasiya tells you, "What could possibly have borne the strength to cause this much damage to the Advocate tower?"

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: My mind is going... I can feel it...

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: Why is a raven like a writing desk?

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: You're not paranoid... We really ARE out to get you!

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of Life Magic (Al-Arqas)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III Spells.
Journeyman Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of Creature Magic (Al-Arqas)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III Spells.
Journeyman Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.description:

Journeyman Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic (Al-Arqas)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III Spells.
Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Mi Krau Li
location.description:
Quest(s): Mi Krau-Li's Improved Jitte.
Mi Krau-Li tells you, "Do I know you? I find it harder and harder to remember names and faces. To be frank, everyone who visits me these days smells unpleasantly of flesh and sweat. Upsetting the delicate dry atmosphere of my laboratory with all your moisture and heavy breathing. Anyway, if you've got my old jitte, I'd be happy to exchange it for a much improved one. I think I lost my old one in the Catacombs of the Forgotten at 17.3 N, 32.8 E. And if I've already given you my Improved Jitte, hand it over to me for inspection. I think I've developed a new forging technique that will improve upon even the improved design."
You give Mi Krau-Li Mi Krau-Li's Jitte.
Mi Krau-Li tells you, "My old jitte! Thank you! It seems rather inferior now, with the advances I have made in jitte technology. But it has great sentimental value. Take this new jitte I've been working on, see how it works out. If you want something better than that... Well, hand it back to me and we'll talk about truly extreme techniques in jitte crafting."
Mi Krau-Li gives you Mi Krau-Li's Improved Jitte.
Within Krau Li's Labyrinth.

location.name: A Well
location.description:
Use an empty flask on the fountain to fill it with water.
Casts the following spells: Revitalize Other I.

location.name: A Fountain
location.description:
Use an empty flask on the fountain to fill it with water.
Casts the following spells: Revitalize Other I.

location.name: Four Pillars Monument
location.description:
Four pillars beside the road southeast of Al-Jalima where a wisp resides. See the Public Request written by the residents of Al-Jalima.
Recently, many reports have been made by travelers coming to and from the southern Al-Jalima road. It seems that a wisp of some kind has taken up residence at the Four Pillars monument near 6.6N 5E. If you happen to pass along that way, we the residents of Al-Jalima will be very grateful if you could help keep the roadways safe!
-Al-Jalima residents
-- Public Request

location.name: Lonely Archmage Tent
location.description: A tent in the desert outside of Al-Jalima - home to the Lonely Archmage.

location.name: Lonely Merchant Tent
location.description: The Lonely Merchant makes this tent her home.

location.name: Lonely Weaponsmith Shop
location.description: A shop on a hill east of Al-Jalima, where the Lonely Weaponsmith makes her home.

location.name: Skeleton House
location.description: A building located just outside of the town of Al-Jalima, full of skeletons and rats.

location.name: Al-Jalima Lifestone
location.description: East of Town.

location.name: Lonely Archmage
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Lonely Archmage tells you, "Oh, it's so nice to have a customer. I don't get many visitors out this way anymore."
Lonely Archmage tells you, "Must you leave so soon? You just got here!"

location.name: Lonely Merchant
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Lonely Merchant tells you, "Greetings, friend. Welcome to my desert shop."
Lonely Merchant tells you, "Do be careful out there. The desert does not forgive the foolish."

location.name: Lonely Weaponsmith
location.description:
Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.
Lonely Weaponsmith tells you, "Welcome! Perhaps you are in need of a new katar or baigha?"
Lonely Weaponsmith tells you, "Thank you for coming -- please return anytime."
Lonely Weaponsmith tells you, "This is a great item. Perhaps another wayward adventurer will need it."
Lonely Weaponsmith tells you, "A most welcome purchase my friend!"

location.name: Trevor Shunderson
location.description:
Quest(s): Undead Attack on Al-Jalima. (Seasonal NPC and Quest)
Trevor Shunderson says, "I came to shoot zombies and chew monougat."
Trevor Shunderson says, "And I'm all out of monougat."
Trevor Shunderson says, "No one's getting up here without a pack of mana charges and a pulse!"
Trevor Shunderson says, "Ooo! Head Shot!"
Trevor Shunderson says, "I got one!"
Trevor Shunderson says, "Take that you dead bastard!"
Trevor Shunderson says, "That's right! You just got sent back to the grave by Trevor's magic!"
Trevor Shunderson tells you, "Oh, thank goodness! I almost shot you. It's good to see another living face. It feels like it's been days since I've seen anyone. How are the rest of the towns? Has the plague spread?"
Trevor Shunderson tells you, "Just Al-Jalima? That's odd. I presumed they had taken over everywhere. I wonder what's so different about Al-Jalima."
Trevor shiver violently.
Trevor Shunderson tells you, "I can't seem to get away from the undead! First that Orisis in Mayoi and now here..."
Trevor Shunderson tells you, "They must be after me!"
Trevor Shunderson tells you, "Well, I'm not going down without a fight! That's why I'm up here on the roof."
Trevor Shunderson tells you, "You better get out of here before they smell your brains."
Note: Only Available During The "Halloween" Patch.

location.name: The Gatekeepers
location.description:
Quest(s): Gateway to the Deep.
These are four NPC crystals that are part of the Gateway to the Deep quest. They are located at 87.6S 4.4W on a a small mountain ledge on the South Direlands Landbridge. The only way to initially access them is through a portal at the end of either the Devastated Falatacot Temple or the Corrupted Falatacot Temple, both on Aerlinthe. If you speak to Shemza before handing the Yellow Jewel you'll be flagged to use the the portal just west of Ayan Baqur at 60.3S 90.7W that takes you directly to the Gatekeepers (useful for returning once a week to loot the Black Marrow Reliquary chests).
Note: Some people handed in the Yellow Jewel before talking to Shemza and aren't flagged to use the Ayan portal. A few people have had an +Envoy fix it for them, but others have been told they can't be helped. One way around this is to tie to the surface portal in any of the crystal dungeons, alternatively you can keep one of the Shards and show it to either of the Aerlinthe statues and it will also send you straight to the Gatekeepers like the Ayan portal does. The shard is not used up in the process so you can use it again to return the next time.
NPCs:
Shemza Lurza Dmesne Rhujun

location.restrictions: Quest Flag: Whispering Blade Chapterhouse to Enter.
location.name: Whispering Blade Chapterhouse to Cragstone
location.description: Portal to Cragstone Inside Whispering Blade Chapterhouse.

location.restrictions: Quest Flag: Whispering Blade Chapterhouse to Enter.
location.name: Whispering Blade Chapterhouse to Hebian-To
location.description: Portal to Hebian-To Inside Whispering Blade Chapterhouse.

location.restrictions: Quest Flag: Whispering Blade Chapterhouse to Enter.
location.name: Whispering Blade Chapterhouse to Silyun
location.description: Portal to Silyun Inside Whispering Blade Chapterhouse.

location.restrictions: Quest Flag: Whispering Blade Chapterhouse to Enter.
location.name: Whispering Blade Chapterhouse to Qalaba'r
location.description: Portal to Qalaba'r Inside Whispering Blade Chapterhouse.

location.name: A Fountain
location.description:
Use an empty flask on the fountain to fill it with water.
Casts the following spells: Revitalize Other I.

location.name: Aludi al-Jaladh
location.description:
Quest(s): Drudge Aviator.
Aludi al-Jaladh tells you, "I have received reports from adventurers that a great beast has been seen flying across the Direlands. They say it is as big as a house and spits fire and acid."
Aludi al-Jaladh tells you, "This beast must be investigated and catalogued. Go and seek out this beast and bring back proof of your findings."
Aludi al-Jaladh tells you, "The last sighting was south and west of Fort Tethana, along the western coastline of the Direlands.".

location.name: Erik Festus
location.description:
Quest(s): Augmentation Gems.
Erik Festus tells you, "One of my greatest irritations in life is that I lose all beneficial spells cast on me when I die. At least, that used to be one of my greatest irritations. I have since discovered a way past that problem." Erik Festus tells you, "Bring me a blank augmentation gem and I will teach you my secret."
Erik Festus bint Ludun gives you Enduring Enchantment.

location.name: Havala bint Mylos
location.description:
Quest(s): Composite Bow.
Havala bint Mylos tells you, "Have you read my work on composite atlatls?"
Havala bint Mylos gives you Havala's Composite Atlatl Manual.
Havala bint Mylos tells you, "I can help you by carving pieces of horn to go into the atlatl's stave. Later, if your skills have outgrown your Composite Atlatl I might have a way to upgrade it." .

location.name: Lydda
location.description:
Quest(s): Loyalty Reset.
Lydda tells you, "If you have been helping the rebels and Queen Elysa and seek to clear your record to take service with King Varicci, I suggest you speak with my associate, Giordonni, in Sanamar.".

location.name: Rohula bint Ludun
location.description:
Quest(s): Augmentation Gems.
Rohula bint Ludun tells you, "It is true that Asheron has given us the ability to cheat death with these lifestones. But when one has died as much as I have, one begins to wonder, "Why can I not resurrect with ALL of my possessions? Why must I lose my favorite sword EVERY time that I die?""
Rohula bint Ludun tells you, "I can teach you to lose fewer of your possessions when you fall in battle, but you will have to give me a blank augmentation gem in exchange. Speak with Fiun Rehlyun on the Halaetan Islands if you have not done so already."
Rohula bint Ludun gives you Clutch of the Miser.

location.name: Shuthoth
location.description:
Quest(s): Gateway to the Deep.
Shuthoth tells you, "Welcome, friend. I seek warriors in search of great adventure. I represent one who would grant the Isparians of this world much power, much knowledge."
Shuthoth tells you, "She has found something. Something powerful beneath the waves of this world. A city, ancient and doomed. The blue-skinned King did his part to raise it from the deep, but I daresay he could not have done it alone."
Shuthoth tells you, "Now that the island exists, the lady would ask Dereth's hunters and adventurers to explore its mysteries."
Shuthoth tells you, "If you seek such a challenge, I bid you take this gem and place it within the empty eye of one of Aerlinthe's Watchers. The Watchers will tell you what else you must do."
Shuthoth tells you, "You have the spark of adventure within you. Good luck, my friend."
Shuthoth gives you Watcher Token..

location.name: Tanami Kei
location.description:
Quest(s): The Feud of the Natural Philosophers.
Tanami Kei tells you, "Can you help me, friend? I'm a Natural Philosopher. I study the ways and means of Dereth's natural flora and fauna - and her unnatural fauna as well."
Tanami Kei tells you, "I've been making a name for myself lately, with my astute and erudite writings about the mysteries of cross-world speciation. But success breeds jealousy! And a certain man - I will not call him a colleague, nor even a rival, for in truth he is not worthy to be listed among the ranks of Natural Philosophers! - a certain man has stolen from me the notes I was compiling for my next book!"
Tanami Kei tells you, "If you can retrieve any of my notes for me, in any condition, I will reward you with a handsome crossbow I have made!"
Tanami Kei tells you, "Berkholt, in the bar, sells directions to this miscreant's dwelling. Please, friend, help me restore my reputation!".

location.name: Ulgrim the Unpleasant
location.description:
Quest(s): Ulgrim's Recall, Ulgrim's Drinking Contest.
Ulgrim the Unpleasant tells you, "Hey, kid."
Ulgrim the Unpleasant tells you, "Catch."
Ulgrim the Unpleasant gives you Clean, Dry Towel.
Give Ulgrim some Sake to get a portal directly to the Drunken Madman.
Ulgrim also has his own island and occasionally makes visits there, players may visit it by handing the Drunken Madman some Wah Chon's Winter Lager.
Players can obtain Ulgrim's Recall which sends the player to Ulgrim's current location.
By giving an Ulgrim's Contest Mug dropped by the small golems on Ulgrim's Island you can challenge Ulgrim to a drinking game.
Each month, Ulgrim gives out new rumors, gossip and information concerning the goings on of Dereth.

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Ayan Baqur)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description:
Who Let The Dogs Out???
Who?
Who?
Who Let The Dogs Out???

location.name: Qalaba'r to Zaikhal
location.description: Portal to Zaikhal

location.name: Lugian Fortification
location.description:
A couple of fortified walls found in between Qalaba'r and Khayyaban that are populated by low level Gotrok Lugians.
Not much is found here besides some junk loot on the ground. .

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Qalaba'r)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Aun Maerirea
location.description:
Quest(s): Aun Golem Hunters.
Aun Maerirea tells you, "Greetings. I am Aun Maerirea. I am the third youngest of the seven who have left Palenqual to hunt! As I am the third youngest, I have chosen the Glacial Golem Margrave as my prey. They are powerful in their own right, but tend to employ the use of underlings in their battles as well."
Aun Maerirea tells you, "Would you like to hunt them as well? Very well, scour this region and others like it and I am sure you will find the golem. Kill five of these golems, return to me and I will see that your battles are rewarded!"

location.name: Darsida al-Qawa
location.description:
Quest(s): Bestowers Guild of Dereth.
Darsida al-Qawa tells you, "Hail and welcome to the Gharu'ndim branch of the Bestowers' Guild. Have you come to seek a title? Speak with Nerezi, my assistant, to learn about our application process. The base piece for the examination is available in the tent. But beware, you will only be allowed to conduct the examination once per day, and you can only hold one title at a time."

location.name: Healer Windotha Sofyld
location.description:
Sells at 170%, buys at 80%.
Healer Windotha Sofyld tells you, "Good day. How may I serve you?"

location.name: Journeyman Alchemist(Qalaba'r)
location.description:
Quest(s): Crafter.
Journeyman Alchemist tells you, "Greetings! I have left my master in Glenden Wood to help the craftsmen of this fine land to hone their crafting skills"
Journeyman Alchemist tells you, "Prove your knowledge by bringing me an Lead Lodestone, and I shall reward you."
Journeyman Alchemist tells you, "What, you say you don't know how to make an Lead Lodestone?! Why, that is what tests of knowledge are for! Get out there and experiment, my young friend!"

location.name: Master Scrivener of Creature Magic (Qalaba'r)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level V Spells.
Master Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Master Scrivener of Creature Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level V Spells.
Master Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Master Scrivener of Item Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level V Spells.
Master Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Master Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level V Spells.
Master Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Master Scrivener of War Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: Do you have any change for the machines?

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: Willyoupleasehelpmefixmykeyboard?Thespacebarisbroken!

location.name: Agent of the Arcanum (Samsur)
location.description:
Quest(s): Counterfeit Writ, Renegade Mace.
Talk to the agent to get a Agent of Arcanum List of items they accept for writs.

location.name: Aun Akuarea
location.description:
Quest(s): Aun Golem Hunters.
Aun Akuarea tells you, "Greetings. I am Aun Akuarea. I am the youngest of the seven who have left Palenqual to hunt! As I am the youngest, I have chosen the Mud Golem Sludge Lord as my prey. They are slow, but powerful for one such as I."
Aun Akuarea tells you, "Would you like to hunt them as well? Very well, scour this region and others like it and I am sure you will find the golem. Kill five of these golems, return to me and I will see that your battles are rewarded!"

location.name: Nu'nifiba the Shopkeeper
location.description:
Sells at 135%, buys at 90%.
Nu'nifiba the Shopkeeper tells you, "Martine's at the bottom of this...I know it!"
Nu'nifiba the Shopkeeper tells you, "The ghastly sight of all those Hollow Minions swarming over the Training Academy will live again in my nightmares forever..."

location.name: Royal Guard
location.description:
Quest(s): Royal Guard (2008 Compensation).
Royal Guard tells you, "Greetings. Due to the instability you have recently experienced within the world of Asheron's Call, we would like to extend our heartfelt apologies. Please accept this as a token of our regret."
Royal Guard gives you Writ of Apology.

location.name: Rubid al-Jurma
location.description:
Quest(s): Exploration Society Letters, Musansayn's Library.
Rubid al-Jurma tells you, "I have been contracted by the Dereth Exploration Society to help them in their outreach program towards the Isparians who find themselves newly exiled in Dereth. Here is a book that explains their mission. I am also giving you a list describing the locations of the nearest stamp and portals to other towns. If you collect any of the Society's stamped letters, you may bring them back to me for a reward."
Rubid al-Jurma gives you A Book of Quests for New Explorers.
Rubid al-Jurma gives you Nexus Town Information Guide.
Rubid al-Jurma tells you, "Also, have you a moment to help me recover another item? Some years ago, when the Gharu'n were just arriving here, the young noble Musansayn the Great became the first leader of our people in Dereth, and founded Samsur. He later disappeared into the desert."
Rubid al-Jurma gives you Library Key.
Rubid al-Jurma tells you, "This key will open the door to his famed library. Follow the road leading southeast - you will see his house off to your left. If you can find any book remaining there, bring it back to me."

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of Life Magic (Samsur)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level III Spells.
Journeyman Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Journeyman Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: I have a simple philosophy: Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. Scratch where it itches.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: Any idiot can face a crisis - it's day to day living that wears you out.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.

location.name: Fountain of Musansayn
location.description: The Fountain of Musansayn constructed by the town folk after the great leader disappeared into the desert.

location.name: Musansayn's House
location.description: A house just outside of Samsur which surrounds the entrance of Musansayn's Vaults. Two Drudge Slinkers make this their home now, but it is assumed that this is where the great leader Musansayn lived before he disappeared into the desert. The Samsur settlement portals are located just behind the house.

location.name: Samsur Watering Hole
location.description: A watering hole for the town's population of Cows.

location.name: Wasp Well
location.description: A Well out in the desert guarded by three Phyntos Wasps. There is also a Drudge Cave nearby.

location.name: Apprentice Cook (Uziz)
location.description:
Quest(s): Crafter.
Apprentice Cook tells you, "Hello! My master, Copper Vanurp, has charged me with the mission to encourage the people of Dereth to cultivate their crafting skills.
Apprentice Cook tells you, "If you bring me a Spiced Apple Pie, I will award you with the funds to further your crafting studies."

location.name: Janier al-Evv
location.description:
Quest(s): Alchemical Throwing Phials. Sells at 130%, buys at 90%.
Janier al-Evv tells you, "Greetings to you, my friend. If you have come to learn of the new wonders in alchemical versatility, may I recommend you purchase my book, "A Treatise on the Combat Uses of Alchemical Phials.""
Janier al-Evv tells you, "I may have a use for this..."
Janier al-Evv tells you, "Good luck to you, my friend. May the wonders of Alchemy serve and protect you."
Enchanted Iron, Copper, Silver, Gold, Pyreal, Platinum, Mana Phials and Phial Peas.

location.name: Talar the Apprentice
location.description:
Quest(s): Aerbax's Prodigal Harbinger, Prismatic Shadow Armor.
Talar the Apprentice tells you, "The four Essences have sunken into the ground below Old Yanshi. The Menhir rings that once focused and held them have been overpowered by the Harbinger's magic and he now feeds from their power."
Talar the Apprentice tells you, "Yes, you look skilled enough to help me. I require a sample from each of the four Essences below Old Yanshi."
Talar the Apprentice tells you, "All of the Arcanum's attempts at collecting these samples ourselves have failed. Fifteen of our best agents were defeated in a recent attempt on the Essence of Verdancy. Find yourself a group of adventurers at least as powerful as you before you go anywhere near these new Essences."
Talar the Apprentice tells you, "First, you need to retrieve four Enchanted Decanters from the Arcanum Research Facility outside of Al-Jalima. You will use these decanters to collect each Essence's essence. The details are in these instructions."
Talar the Apprentice gives you Instructions for Essence Recovery.
Talar the Apprentice tells you, "Good luck and don't underestimate the power of the Essences. They are raw magic after all."

location.name: Scrivener of Life Magic (Xarabydun)
location.description:
Sells at 4900%, buys at 50%. Level IV.
Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Isn't it wonderful what Asheron and the Arcanum were able to accomplish for us?"
Scrivener of Life Magic tells you, "Good luck in your travels, friend."

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.

location.name: Town Crier
location.description: Look, I don't want to wax philosophic, but I will say that if you're alive you've got to flap your arms and legs, you've got to jump around a lot, for life is the very opposite of death, and therefore you must at very least think noisy and colorfully, or you're not alive.

location.name: Varetha
location.description:
Quest(s): Mukkir Aspect of Grael.
Varetha touches your forehead, sending a dark chill throughout your body.
Varetha tells you, "My Lord, Isin Dule, has sent me to aid you in the containing of the Mukkir Aspect of Grael. Though it will be a difficult thing to accomplish, this can be done. To do so, however, we will need to gather the proper tools."
Varetha tells you, "There is a Shadow Stone, created in Black Ferah's experiments, that should do nicely. I have managed to locate the stone, but so have Grael's followers. Gather this stone for me, and I should be able to modify it to hold Grael's Mukkir Aspect for a time. I will attune you to the defenses of the location..."
Varetha tells you, "You will find the stone at 39.1 S, 60.1 W. Go there and retrieve the stone. While you are gone, I will prepare what I need to modify it."

location.name: Temple of Enlightenment
location.description:
Quest(s): Skill Redistribution.
Bring at least one of the Herbs available at Archmages to gain entrance by the Guardian of the Temple of Enlightenment.
Dungeon for untraining skills and attributes.

location.name: Aruq ibn Balthar
location.description:
Quest(s): Apostate Citadel.
Aruq ibn Balthar tells you, "Aha! A doughty Derethian warrior! You may be just the person to help me here... There is a strange new fortified location in the Direlands, guarded by fearsome Gotrok Lugians! It is quite strange to see renegades outside their normal bailiwick in the southern mountains, and our scouts report that these monsters are even more powerful than the others of their ilk that we have previously surveyed."
Aruq ibn Balthar tells you, "We suspect, based on geomantic emanations from that location, that they are working at the behest of rebel Virindi again, but we need an intrepid adventurer such as yourself to personally infiltrate the installation and gather intelligence. Could you do this for us? Journey to the depths of the new Gotrok fortress in the Direlands at 48.7S, 68.9W and bring back whatever message shards you can find. I would be in your debt, and you would not go unrewarded.".

location.name: Journeyman Scrivener of Item Magic (Sanamar)

Meeting Halls are one of the few locations where privies are found.

location.description: Allegiance monarchs can use this item to set the town recall point for their allegiances.

location.name: Abbess Zik'Lir
location.description:
Quest(s): Shadow Aspect of Grael.
Over level 150:
Abbess Zik'Lir tells you, "Alas, in an attempt to hide from those powerful enough to destroy him, Grael, even in his weakened Aspects, has found means to stop one of your strength from aiding us in this. Seek those hunting the Mukkir aspect, for it contains the greatest part of him, and Grael is too proud to hide himself fully."
Under level 150:
Abbess Zik'Lir tells you, "Yes, you may aid in this. Strong enough to, most likely, survive, but not so strong that the Black Spear's wards will hold you out. I can aid your people in removing the Black Spear from this world, as is the will of my Lord, Nc'thail. To do this, you must gather a thing lost for me."
Abbess Zik'Lir tells you, "There is a thing called a Soul Trap. My people have not used such in ages, but it may find use here. I have managed to locate one, but those who serve the Black Spear have reached the location first. I can enchant you to bypass the magicks on the portal there, so you can gain the Soul Trap."
Abbess Zik'Lir tells you, "Go to the portal you will find at 74.7 S, 98.2 E. Somewhere in that ancient vault, you will find the Soul Trap. Beware those who will try to stop them, and have a care while carrying the device, lest you accidentally activate it..."
Abbess Zik'Lir tells you, "Go, bring the Soul Trap back to me. Remember my warnings."

location.name: Burun Fortress
location.description:
Quest(s): Noble Weapons.
A huge fortress at 25.8S, 46.3E in the Blackmire Swamp near Yanshi, full of Burun. To the south is a killable Fortress Barrier. On the table just outside the Barrier, the Blueprints for a Burun Fortress can be picked up.

location.name: Southern Summoning Stone
location.description:
Quest(s): The Jester, Jester's Lost Marbles.
Jester tells you, "Oho! Rythy doesn't know what he's playing with. But I know. I KNOW! AHahahahahaha!"
The first time doing The Jester quest, the Jester appears as an NPC. When repeating the quest he appears as a creature. Previously the Jester spawned randomly in the Graveyard. During the Dispatch event, two Summoning Stones were added to Graveyard, using the stone causes the Jester to appear for a moment. The north stone is used for the Lalalas in My Head quest, and the south stone is used for the Jester's Lost Marbles quest.

location.name: Master Craftsman Takahume
location.description:
Quest(s): Gear Knight Parts, Gear Knight Construction.
* You can give Master Craftman Takahume any one to the items
* High Level Area (items worth 5 points each)
* Aetherium Power Core * Aetherium Ore * Aetherium-infused Gear
* Low Level Area (items worth 1 point each)
* Gold Aetherium Core Fragment(possibly worth more than 1 point) * Large Gold Aetherium Core Fragment (possibly worth more than 1 point) * Depleted Aetherium Ore * Scratched Gear * Gear Knight Core Fragment
* Once you reach 50 points you get a xp reward. * Once you reach 100 points you get a xp reward. * Once you reach 150 points you get a xp reward. * Once you reach 200 points you get a xp reward and title.

location.name: Facility Hub
location.description:
Designed as a questing hub where new players can find ready access to level appropriate quests that provide generous leveling experience.
To Obtain the Teleportation Device Visit:
Finrala Rynmad in Holtburg's Bar Oi-Yong Te in Shoushi Mara al-Luq in Yaraq Celcynd the Dour in Rithwic's Bar
Portals:
West:
* Banderling Camp 35+ * Bellig Tower Base - 40+ * Blackmire Temple - 45+ * Castle of Baron Nuvillus - 40+ * Dryreach - 1+ * Haunted Mansion - 30+ * Mite Maze - 30+ * Mountain Sewer - 30+ * Skeleton Fort - 35+ * Suntik Village - 35+
East:
* Banderling Conquest Dungeon - 25+ * Catacombs of the Forgotten - 25+ * Colier - 15+ * Dangerous Cave - 20+ * Eastham - 1+ * Fledgemaster's Camp - 25+ * Folthid Estate 10+ * Glendon Wood - 10+ * Green Mire Grave - 15+ * Halls of the Helm - 15+ * Hunter's Leap - 20+ * Mosswart Camp - 10+ * Mosswart Maze - 25+ * Trothyr's Rest - 20+
North (North):
* Tumerok Camps - 40+
North (East):
* Tusker Abode - 20+ * Tusker Burrow - 15+ * Tusker Cave - 15+ * Tusker Cavern - 15+ * Tusker Habitat - 25+ * Tusker Lodge - 15+ * Tusker Quarters - 30+
North (West):
* Abandoned Tumerok Site - 15+ * An Olthoi Soldier Nest - 35+ * Ancient Empyrean Grotto - 40+ * Crumbling Empyrean Mansion - 30+ * The Dark Lair - 20+
NPCs:
Warden (One for each Quest) Steward Curmudgeon the Drudge Master Enchanter

location.name: Facility Hub (E)(L 1 (15) C) to Colier
location.description:
Quest(s): Baron's Amulet of Life, Diemos Flagging.
Colier was an Aluvian mining town ran by the Baron Colier but now the town is overrun by banderlings and drudges and the miners are now all undead including the Baron himself. The town consists of several Aluvian style buildings arranged in a circle around a looping road. The road extends away from the town to a portal to Holtburg. A monolith with a grave warning stands along the side the road. Thanks to the updates to the landscape spawns the monsters in the surrounding area are now far more dangerous than the monsters in the town itself.
The portal into the Colier Mines is in the basement of one of the buildings in the center of the town. A Drudge Prowler found in a house to the Southwest has a cell key which is needed in the mine. Also a Banderling Raider found in the house immediately east of the building with the portal has another key that is needed to unlock a door in the mine.

location.name: Facility Hub (N W) to Crumbling Empyrean Mansion
location.description: Quest(s): Olthoi Pincers.

location.name: Facility Hub (E)(R 2 (20) L) to Dangerous Cave
location.description: Quest(s): Tibri's Fire Spear.

location.name: Facility Hub (W)(L 2 (40) R) to Dryreach
location.description:
Quest(s): Tumerok Training Camps, Gold Hill Ruins, Captain K'rank's Errands, Dansha-Ki's Rescue.
Dryreach is besieged by Tumeroks, and has been since the launch of the game. When Dark Majesty came out, it was revealed that the Hea Tumeroks loyal to the Virindi use Dryreach as a training ground for Hea that have just left Marae Lassel for the mainland. Nearby are several Tumerok training camps belonging to their various clans. Dryreach is the starting point for a few quests, such as the Overlord's Sword, Dryreach Rescue, and the Tumerok Gladiator killtask. It is also the home of one of the two Tumerok Collectors on Dereth, the other being located in Fort Tethana.

location.name: Facility Hub (E)(L 2 (25) C C)to Eastham
location.description:
Quest(s): Mask Maker, Aun Golem Hunters, Bestowers' Guild, Shadow Armor, Mace of the Explorer, Black Marrow Tea.
Eastham is an Aluvian town, near the outermost East Coast of Dereth at 17.5N, 63.4E
Eastham was once a very busy town, with new adventurers crowding the beaches to hunt the gromnies and other beasts that lived there. The stronger warrios even made the long run to Arwic, once the trade hub for all of Dereth.
These days, the town is not so busy. However, there are still some reasons to visit. The Aluvian mask maker lives here in the second floor of the smithy. The Aluvian shadow armor smith lives along the north road. A branch of the Title Bestower's Guild is set up here. Also, many shortcut portals for the Gaerlan quest are located here. And more recently, what seems to be a permanent portal to Asheron's Isle is open next to the town's windmill.

location.name: Facility Hub (E)(R 1 (10) L) to Glendon Wood
location.description:
Quest(s): Viamont Staging Area, Lilitha's Lost Bow, Lady Aerfalle, Sword of Lost Light, Sword of Frozen Fury, Glendon Wood Invaders, Crystal Minds/Shattered Souls, Zombie Butler.
Glenden Wood is an Aluvian town nestled in the Tiofor Woods west of Holtburg. It is a center of crafting and many quests can be found in and around town.
Glenden Wood was also selected by the Viamontian King Varicci II as a beachhead for his invasion of the Osteth mainland. Though a truce now exists between Varicci and High Queen Elysa Strathelar, Glenden Wood remains under siege to this day.

location.name: Atamarr - Gold Gear Primus
location.description:
Quest(s): Atamarr Tasks.
Iron Blade Warmaster
Atamarr tells you, "I have a task in which you may be able to aid me. I have managed to subvert a small number of Gear Knights in the Iron Blade's invasion, and they have identified a Gear Knight in a position of influence within the forces whose loss would slow the expansion of the Iron Blade"
Atamarr tells you, "There is an Iron Blade Warmaster who has recently arrived from our home realm. My spies tell me that he is a gifted tactician, and if his skills were given time to be exercised, it could spell trouble for us." Atamarr tells you, "You will find the Warmaster deep within the excavations that the Iron Blade have made in the heart of the area they control in the Direlands."
Atamarr tells you, "I would expect he will not be easy to kill, so take care in this mission. I have also been told that he stays on the move, speaking with the troops and formulating plans, so he may be difficult to find. Search in the deepest areas of the excavation, and I am sure you'll find him soon enough. Once he is dead, return to me.".
Silver Scope Spymaster
Atamarr tells you, "There is a Silver Scope Spymaster who has recently arrived from our home realm. She is a very skilled Spymaster, and I believe she already suspects that the information being imparted by the Iron Blade may be less accurate than it should be. With a little help, she may be convinced of the truth, and aid us in ending this invasion. I wish you to go and tell her about the Apostate Virindi, their Simulacra, and how they are framing your people in this war."

location.restrictions: 90+, Cannot Summon, Must have completed Portal Space Research.
location.name: Crystaline Portal
location.description:
Quest(s): Crystalline Adventurer, Marker Crystals, Wisp Whipper, Progenitors' Lair.
This is made up of several progressively more difficult dungeons in a series. The level restrictions increase in increments of 20. The first dungeon is 70+ and its entrance is found at 18.1S 56.9W on the Crystalline Crag. At the bottom of each dungeon is a portal to another harder dungeon.
NPCs
Shade Of Ja'qu (in 130+ Section)

location.restrictions: 110+, Cannot Summon, Must have completed Portal Space Research.
location.name: Crystaline Portal
location.description:
Quest(s): Crystalline Adventurer, Marker Crystals, Wisp Whipper, Progenitors' Lair.
This is made up of several progressively more difficult dungeons in a series. The level restrictions increase in increments of 20. The first dungeon is 70+ and its entrance is found at 18.1S 56.9W on the Crystalline Crag. At the bottom of each dungeon is a portal to another harder dungeon.
NPCs
Shade Of Ja'qu (in 130+ Section)

location.name: Frozen Cave
location.description:
Quest(s): Gear Crossbow.
This dungeon is dangerous even for high level characters. (You do not drop death items in this dungeon at all) There are pits of frozen slurry that do significant damage (50+ per second) There are also areas of cold air that does massive damage even with life protections and cantrip wards.
Cold air freezes you for 255 points of damage!
There is no entrance portal, you can tie to the surface portal of the Ruschk Iceberg (96.3N, 60.0W), or the Fiun Outpost (95.6N, 56.8W)
After killing the Gear Knights: The sound of cracking ice fills the air. The large ice golem is moving. The path to the frozen Gearknight is now clear. This golem seems to have been protecting the Gearknight. Its duty apparently complete the golem fractures into shards of ice.
* Please Note: Do not jump over any of the ice slurries. This will cause a bug to activate that causes one to die twice. You will die because of the cold air hitting you, and before you can even exit portal space from your first death you will die again because the game appearently thinks you are still over the ice slurry. I exited portal space from my second death having dropped items and standing on top of a body at the lifestone.
Quest reward is 10 Adventure Tokens, Gear Knight Crossbow, and 150,000,000 experience points
NPCs:
Frozen Gearknight Ordas Nyr
location.monsters: Hoarfrost, Frozen Ice Golem, Frozen Glacial Golem, Freezing Mist Golem, Bronze Gauntlet Knight, Copper Cog Knight, Gold Gear Knight, Iron Blade Knight, Iron Blade Lord, Silver Scope Knight

location.name: Aun Tahuirea
location.description:
Quest(s): Aun Golem Hunters.
Aun Tahuirea tells you, "Greetings. I am Aun Tahuirea. My seven sons have left the land of Palenqual in search of glorious hunts. No doubt trying to impress me. They are each talented hunters in their own right, but none of them are yet ready to hunt what I do."
Aun Tahuirea tells you, "What is it that I hunt, you ask? I keep my harpoon sharp for the rare Crystal Lords. They are a dangerous type of golem for ones such as you, so be sure to bring others of your xuta to aid you in the battle. Should you and your fellows come across and defeat one, please come speak with me. I would enjoy hearing the story of your battles." Aun Tahuirea tells you, "Also, if you and your fellows succeed in defeating one, I will be pleased to share with you the bounties I have recovered from my previous victories."

location.name: Northern Point Bunkers
location.description:
Two bunkers are found at this site on the northern coast of Osteth. One contains a three NPC vendors: a Healer, a Peddler, and an Archmage. The other bunker contains a lone Lesser Mu-miyah.
In addition to the bunkers there is a lifestone and a portal to a random location.

location.name: Northern Point Portal
location.description: Portal to a random location. Often The Floating City, Golem Sanctum, Baishi

location.name: Menhir Ring
location.description: A simple Menhir Ring with a few Wisps.

location.name: Crater Lair House
location.description: A small house with a Merchant, Helaer, and Archmage.

location.name: Lugian Crater
location.description:
Quest(s): Arm, Mind, Heart.
Kill the Lugian Commander here for the Sceptre of the Mind and Kill the Lugian Lieutenant for the Lugian Crest (Shield).

location.name: Cara the Apprentice
location.description:
Quest(s): Menhir Mana Fields.
Cara the Apprentice tells you, "Another adventurer, we can use you."
Cara the Apprentice tells you, "Menhir mana fields have undergone some change."
Cara the Apprentice tells you, "I have created an enchanted mana stone."
Cara the Apprentice gives you Enchanted Mana Stone.
Cara the Apprentice tells you, "Use this stone in the presence of a menhir mana field."
Cara the Apprentice tells you, "You can sense menhir mana fields if you can receive more mana into your body."
Cara the Apprentice tells you, "It will feel like a great swell of power rising from the ground beneath you."
Cara the Apprentice tells you, "The stone will indicate any variations in the mana flow."
Cara the Apprentice tells you, "Enchantments on the stone allow it to detect up to twenty unique mana fields."
Cara the Apprentice tells you, "Collect information on as many unique mana fields as you can and return it to us."
Cara the Apprentice tells you, "You can return the stone to me for a reward after finding five or more mana fields."
Cara the Apprentice tells you, "I'll reward you more for every five unique mana fields you find."
Cara the Apprentice tells you, "An important distinction, not all menhir mana fields have rings around them."

location.name: Gazebo Craftsman
location.description:
Quest(s): Wedding Preparations.
Gazebo Craftsman tells you, "I have come here to show my support of the couple to be. I am in charge of building the most beautiful gazebo ever seen. For this I will need wood, Argenory dye, and Minalim dye. Can you help?"

location.name: Stone Craftsman
location.description:
Quest(s): Wedding Preparations.
Stone Craftsman tells you, "I have come here to show my support of the upcoming marriage, lending a hand with what I know best. I need rocks so that I may form them into benches fit for tiny human forms."
I found a "Tree" in the desert, it looked like a pile of rocks, and its description read "A rock". below is the message I received when handing the "Tree" to the Stone Craftsman.
You allow Stone Craftsman to examine your Tree. You hand over 1 of your Trees. Stone Craftsman tells you, "Thank you human, this will do nicely. Before long we'll have this place filled with little benches to sit on."
Valhalla of Morningthaw

location.name: Tree Craftsman
location.description:
Quest(s): Wedding Preparations.
Tree Craftsman tells you, "I have come here to show my support of the upcoming nuptuals. All of the other jobs were already filled so I decided to collect some small trees. If you find any small trees out in the woods could you please bring them to me so I may shape them into nice decorative shapes?"

location.name: Florist
location.description:
Quest(s): Wedding Preparations.
Florist tells you, "I have come here to look beautiful, don't I look beautiful? Also I am collecting wood to create garden boxes, and tulips to plant in those boxes to make the wedding as beautiful as I am."

location.name: Merkitz ibn'Akadh
location.description:
Merkitz ibn'Akadh tells you, "Good day to you. I have managed to craft a portal spell to the Invasion area in the Direlands."
Merkitz ibn'Akadh tells you, "If you wish, for the small fee of an MMD note, i can summon a portal to that location for you."
Merkitz ibn'Akadh tells you, "Be warned, however, you must be at least 150th level to use the portal I crafted."

location.name: Kaytin
location.description:
Quest(s): Aetherium Collection, Gear Knight Parts Collection, Gear Knight Construction.
Kaytin tells you, "It is an honor to speak with you, small one. I am Kaytin, one of Atamarr's entourage, as well as his acting supply officer."
Kaytin tells you, "In Atamarr's quest to rebuild and maintain the rest of our companions, I have been given the task of collecting parts retrieved from those Gear Knights who are acting against this place and its people."
Kaytin tells you, "To this end, I am rewarding adventurers for the collection of Aetherium Power Cores, Aetherium Ore, and Gears from the invading Gear Knights found in either the Direlands, or along the coast of the eastern shore of the Inner Sea. If they wish to present themselves as enemies to the peoples of this land, they can at least be put to more productive use in deactivation."
Kaytin tells you, "If you wish to assist us, just bring me whatever Aetherium Cores, pieces of Aetherium Ore, or Gear Knight Gears you find, and we will reward you when you've contributed different set amounts of parts."
Kaytin tells you, "Also, if you are willing, I have a secondary task for you. The Iron Blade invasion in the Direlands will have a storage box placed deep in their defenses. It is common for their House to hide updates, orders, etc. in these boxes, where they will go unnoticed by invading forces."
Kaytin tells you, "Acquisition for me one of these boxes, and I will see what we can learn about their plans and reasonings in this invasion.".

location.name: Wedding Chapel
location.description: Quest(s): Wedding Preparations.

location.name: Sir Durnstad
location.description:
Quest(s): Aetherium Ore Destruction.
Sir Durnstad tells you, "Greetings. I have been stationed here by the Queen in order to assist in the slowing of the Gear Knight forces invading Dereth." Sir Durnstad tells you, "To that end, my scouts have identified a stockpile of Aetherium Ore at the bottom of one of the Gear Knights excavations. If you are willing, I am authorized to send adventurers to destroy the stockpile, and reward you if you bring me proof of its destruction." Sir Durnstad tells you, "You will find the tunnels they have dug at 10.4S, 75.2W. They've been reinforcing the location since they created it, so expect defenses in place." Sir Durnstad tells you, "My reports indicate that the resistance in the site is quite high, so you may want to recruit a few of your compatriots to assist in this mission. Just make sure they all come to me first, so I can properly reward them upon your successful completion."

location.name: Mana Siphon
location.description: Quest(s): Empyrean Beacon Destruction.

location.name: Gear Knight Dungeon (Dead-End)
location.description:
Quest(s):
This dungeon is the typical hole-in-the-ground dungeon.

location.description:
Quest(s): Atamarr Tasks.
This dungeon is the typical hole-in-the-ground dungeon.
NPCs
Copper Cog Craftsman Bronze Gauntlet Knight-Commander Silver Scope Spymaster

location.name: Gear Knight Dungeon (Dead-End)
location.description:
Quest(s):
This dungeon is the typical hole-in-the-ground dungeon.

location.name: Gear Hunter Dungeon
location.description:
Quest(s): Atamarr Tasks.
This dungeon is the typical hole-in-the-ground dungeon. The entrance is guarded by several Gear Hunters and Gear Hunter Mages.

location.name: Gear Knight Excavation
location.description:
Quest(s): Dull Aetherium Ore Stockpile Destruction.
This dungeon is the typical hole-in-the-ground dungeon.

location.description:
Quest(s): Dull Aetherium Ore Stockpile Destruction.
Sir Oakley tells you, "Greetings. I have been stationed here by the Queen in order to assist in the slowing of the Gear Knight forces invading Dereth." Sir Oakley tells you, "To that end, my scouts have identified a stockpile of Aetherium Ore at the bottom of one of the Gear Knights excavations. If you are willing, I am authorized to send adventurers to destroy the stockpile, and reward you if you bring me proof of its destruction." Sir Oakley tells you, "You will find the tunnels they have dug at 36.1 S, 7.2 E. They've been reinforcing the location since they created it, so expect defenses in place." Sir Oakley tells you, "My reports indicate that the resistance in the site is quite high, so you may want to recruit a few of your compatriots to assist in this mission. Just make sure they all come to me first, so I can properly reward them upon your successful completion."

location.name: Menhir Ring
location.description:
Quest(s): Menhir Mana Fields # 4.
An old abandoned Menhir Ring.

location.name: Stone Pillars
location.description: Two Lonlely Stone Pillars on top of a mountain.

location.name: Lugians
location.description:
Quest(s): Arm, Mind, Heart.
Cloth of the Heart on Lieutenant.

location.name: Qin Xikit's Island
location.description: Quest(s): Clutch of Kings 6 (Browerk).

location.name: Qin Xikit's Temple
location.description: Quest(s): Clutch of Kings 6 (Browerk).

location.name: Ayaname Kina
location.description:
Quest(s): Quiddity Ingots.
Ayaname Kina tells you, "Greetings. I have come to Asheron's tower to continue my Mistress's studies of the nature of the Quiddity Ingots that Aerbax was using to power the Quiddity Seeds. I believe I have determined something about them. If you hand me the Quiddity Ingots extracted from the trophies you found on your quest, I will identify them for you."
Replaces Hoshino Kei.

location.name: Cypher the Apprentice
location.description:
Quest(s): Aetheria.
Cypher the Apprentice tells you, "With our research into the Menhir Mana Fields we've been able to triangulate the source of the altered mana signatures."
Cypher the Apprentice tells you, "This source appears to be the home to an ancient Empyrean facility used to strengthen their connections with the world's mana flow."
Cypher the Apprentice tells you, "Our use of magics without understanding the proper connection to the ley lines and Dereth has left each of our personal mana fields in disarray."
Cypher the Apprentice tells you, "Research indicates that the only way to access the power of Aetheria, as we believe the ancient Empyreans did, is to align your mana field with that of the world."
Cypher the Apprentice gives you Aligned Mana Stone.
Cypher the Apprentice tells you, "This device is used to form a conduit between yourself and certain pure mana fields. Other mana drawing creatures in the area of a mana field will prevent purity."
Cypher the Apprentice tells you, "Use this modified mana stone when you're in the presence of a cleansed mana field in the facility."
Cypher the Apprentice tells you, "You will need to align yourself with the mana flow of each floor first and then the central mana field of that floor."
Cypher the Apprentice tells you, "The entrance of the facility can be located at 46.2S, 71.8W where recent exploration exposed a previously inert portal.".

location.name: Ealdred
location.description:
Quest(s): Barber.
Ealdred tells you, "Hello and welcome!"
Ealdred tells you, "We have recently established a Barber Shop in each of the four towns where the largest numbers of new adventurers are spotted."
Ealdred tells you, "I wanted to name ourselves the Quartets but the others don't have an enlightened sense of humor like myself."
Ealdred tells you, "If you'd like a haircut, just hand me one MMD note and we can begin."

location.name: Ianto
location.description:
Quest(s): Tailoring.
Ianto tells you, "Welcome. We master tailors have arrived to cure all your fashion ills."
Ianto tells you, "I could tell you how it works, I know everything! And it says how right on the package."

location.name: Tailor's Aprentice (Holtburg)
location.description:
Quest(s): Tailoring.
Tailor's Apprentice tells you, "I've been training with the master tailors."
Tailor's Apprentice tells you, "We've developed and I've been manufacturing a tool used in reducing the coverage of armor."
Tailor's Apprentice tells you, "They're still in limited supply."
Tailor's Apprentice tells you, "Purchase a writ from one of the master tailors and I'll give you one reduction tool for it a month."
